review_body: It is hard to beat this location. The hotel is close to restaurants, shopping and a short walk from the High Line and Hudson Yards. The hotel itself was ok. Not super fancy, but everything you need. Our room was clean, the bed was comfortable and our AC was just fine. So no major hickup with the room. That being said, this is not the Ritz or the 4 season. If you are looking for pampering and fancy, there are better options, but be ready to pay for those options! The rooftop bar was fun and inviting and the food served was good. Never had an issue with the staff, they were all nice and helpful. I can't think of anywhere else I would like to stay, location is everything. I will certainly consider this hotel on my next trip .

review_body: Stayed two nights. AC did not work in lobby or room. Several times called and stopped at front desk. They said they would send maintenance every time. It never happened. It was a cool 81 degrees in the room and staff would not move us or get the AC issue fixed. Room 1000 in case you wonder. Security staff was also rude and unprofessional. I have never been treated so poorly by the staff in a hotel I was staying in. Rooftop bar was average. Weak drinks and overpriced $19 cocktails.

review_body: I used to live in the neighborhood and wanted to stay here on a return trip. I knew the rooms and the hotel itself were nice (and great location) so booked my 6 nights here. I should've known something was up when, on arrival, I walked into the lobby that was warm, humid and stuffy - and they even had fans sitting on the checkin counter pointing towards the staff. But it was typical NYC summer weather - hot and humid - and normally when you walk into a hotel lobby it's like a respite from the heat (and this was at 7pm, not the peak of the day).My room was at 72 degrees but humid & still so I set the A/C down to 65. Nothing happened. Set to 60. Set to 50. Nothing happened. Went out for 2 hours thinking it would be cooler when I got back, and when I got back it was the same. I realized that the A/C just wasn't working or in the very least, wasn't working enough to cool the room. I went to the front desk and asked them to switch me to a room with A/C and they were 100% booked but offered me a fan. A fan. This is the most basic room at $450/night, and... a fan? But I had no choice, it was already approaching midnight and it was too late to find something else, so I took it. They promised to switch me to a room the next day.The next day: they have a room and they promise that the AC is working great. I tell them "I bet it's not - can you please have someone check to confirm" - and the guy says "Even our engineer was up there servicing it, he said it's cranking." So I go up to that room and it's almost 80 degrees according to the thermometer - but they said it was cranking? I went back to the front desk with a photo of the thermometer and they said "it takes a little bit to cool down but should be fine soon." So I went out for a few hours and came back, and barely any change: 77 degrees. Humid, still. Back to the front desk with photo proof and they say they have another room (3rd room within a 24 hour period) that is a slightly upgraded room (space-wise just a tiny couch by the window) and they promise that the AC is working great in this one. I get to the room and it's the same thing: temp stuck at 72 (humid) degrees and I set the thermometer down to 50 and nothing happens. I go back to the front desk and tell them "I'm really not trying to make your lives miserable, I just want the AC to work." The engineer comes up to the room, walks in and says "it's really cold in here" (it's not: when you walk in it's like the humidity and stillness close in around you). He checks the air temp coming out of the vents and it's at 54-58 degrees, but the room is stuck at 72 - this just means that the AC isn't strong enough to cool the (small) room. The manager comes up to check it himself (who was incredibly nice) and found the temperature to be acceptable - not cold, but comfortable and temperate. This was a week in NYC where it was 92 and 90% humidity every day, lows of 80 each night, and I needed normal air conditioning. I couldn't imagine staying here 5 more nights, so I accepted a fan for night two and told them I'd be checking into a different hotel for the remainder of my stay (and lucky enough I was able to find one nearby with room availability). They understood and were kind enough to let me out of my remaining nights' commitment, but I think that's the right thing to do if a room's AC isn't working properly. A luxury hotel should have A/C that chills a room - for example, a nearby hotel allows you to set the thermostat down to 60 and you feel the temp change quickly. In the heat of an NYC summer, 66-68 is a perfect room temperature to be able to sleep in. I was beginning to wonder if it was just me so I took to TripAdvisor and searched old reviews and found a lot of comments about poorly-functioning air conditioning, so it must just be something about their HVAC system. If A/C had been working normally I would've given this hotel a 4-4.5-star review, but minus AC in summertime in NYC, that rating has to drop. But it's balanced out a bit by the hotel realizing it was a problem and letting me cut my stay short. On other more complimentary fronts: very very nice staff here, helpful, friendly.

review_body: WOW! Met my long distance girlfriend for a romantic getaway in NYC. The pictures, location and amenities drew us to Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC but the world-class service (especially Lauren at the front desk) the detail and cleanliness of the room (King Suite), the in-room balcony and the rooftop pool made our stay truly memorable! In fact, we just booked again for July and can’t wait!Everyone was super friendly and offered top-notch hospitality. Really excited to return later this month. review_body: We stayed at this hotel to celebrate our 15th anniversary and went with our friends who were celebrating their 10th. We spent extra for a suite in order to celebrate. Not only was the suite not worth the money, it was in shambles when compared to our friend’s regular room. The air conditioner was broken and couldn’t keep the room at a comfortable temperature for sleeping. A lamp shade was being held together with tape. The USB outlet was not functioning and we only had a USB cord for charging our phones. The furniture was old and worn. Our friend’s regular room was updated and a considerably better environment than our suite. We wished we didn’t spend so much more for what we thought would have been an upgrade.

review_body: This is the perfect hotel if you’re a returning visitor to New York or aren’t looking to do the typical tourist activities. The meatpacking district is a region teeming with quaint coffee houses and upscale eateries; not to mention the world renowned Chelsea market is visible from most rooms. But there is a loud bar downstairs which is open until late if you’re bothered by alcohol. The beds were extremely comfortable for a refuge after rigorous walking all day!

review_body: I have found this review quite difficult to score as there are many good points so have went in the middle as I think ultimately there are a few real negatives.Firstly, fabulous location but wouldn’t recommend for a week as after a few days you find you need to travel everywhere. I think midtown best hotel location and can visit the cool districts like this and spend the day there which would be better.The rooftop pool is beautiful but food is barred. So when sunbathing and get hungry you must get dressed and go inside. Bit annoying.The rooftop bar has a great view but the staff are extremely rude especially the blonde and brunette ladies. There is no chat and they make you feel quite uncomfortable. I think this is outsourced and not actually hotel staff as the hotel staff are lovely at reception and the ground floor bars.The continental breakfast is the worst I have experienced. No ham or cheese. Just pastries and jam. Poor.The bar upstairs is also very expensive at $15 for a small water and draft coke. I don’t mind paying for value but a very basic drink.We had a terrace room with private seating area. But above you are lots of rooms who drop cigarettes down and the cleaners don’t pick up. It also isn’t relaxing sitting at night with hundreds of rooms above you with windows open and you would be a good target for drunk pranks below. Water pouring etc. As the hotel is full of youths. It also becomes almost a nightclub on Friday Saturdays so if not into a lobby full of clubbers maybe avoid.The cleaners ignore the bins in room if you don’t put everything in exact bin. Fairly annoying. Had to leave a $5 tip beside it and then it was emptied.Storage in room non existent. Nowhere to put two cases. Bathroom tiny and the way door works two people really struggled to even brush teeth together.4 star hotel with a smelly damp shower curtain seems odd too.Overall good experience and we had a great time but for having such a brand like Gansevoort I don’t think it was much better than any Hilton Garden Inn.If really want to stay here I would suggest 2 nights max and then switch hotel.

review_body: Had a great stay here for two nights last weekend. Very competent hotel with lovely room and facilities, in a great location. Lots of interest nearby e.g. the high line, walked all the way from hotel down to World Trade site along Hudson, Bubby’s diner. Highly recommended!

review_body: Stayed here 3 nights for work and will keep coming back. Have been to all the nearby hotels (Dream, Maritime, Standard) but this was my first time at Gansevoort and it did not disappoint. The location is adorable and it sits on a cute street with a fun ice cream pop up in front, the service super friendly and helpful. (Special call outs to Charles and Raul that helped me with luggage and Lauren at the front desk, who helped me check in and check out and was super thoughtful to find me a quieter room since she knew I was in town for work, which was in stark contrast from the Dream, where they put me in a room with tons of noise from the pool even though I requested a quiet room when booking) everyone greets you, and the folks at the elevators that press the button for you are really a nice touch. The room was spacious and well-appointed with loccitane toiletries and the cutest slippers and a cute goose on the bed. :) I will definitely continue to book Gansevoort for future visits.

review_body: Just back from this amazing hotel. Great customer service. Staff can’t do enough for you to make your stay pleasurable. Really helpful and will advise on anything regarding the area. Only downside is that it’s expensive especially on the roof top bar. It gets really crowded on a sunny day so get up there early to bag a sofa. They started to play really loud music from 11am which was our time to exit! You wouldn’t want to stay up there all day anyway as there’s too much do outside the hotel. Great location for bars and make sure you take full advantage of the happy hours at Bubbys and Serfino as its makes a massive difference to the wallet as just doesn’t offer half price drinks but delicious bar snacks too!!! Would recommend based on location and amazing staff!

review_body: My family had a wonderful experience at the Gansevoort this past weekend. Kenya in reservations and Lauren at the front desk offered my family three rooms on the same floor, all with a view of the Hudson. In spite of the on again/off again rain, the view was spectacular. A birthday note, wine and chocolates were waiting for me in the room. All staff were super friendly. Beds were very comfortable. Rooms were quiet throughout the night. Loved the rooftop pool which had just re-opened. Water was warm enough for a swim in 45 F degree weather! Only minor complaint is that many items in the room required an extra charge - $2 for a coffee pod, $9 for Fuji water, $9.99 for music on the TV. It seems that a 4 star hotel could afford to offer these amenities at no charge.

review_body: The hotel was amazing and beautiful and everyone was very kind but I have to say that Lauren at the front desk was exceptional. She went out of her way to make us feel welcome and make sure we were aware of all the amenities and best spots around the hotel. One night we were craving sushi and asked her for the best spot around. She not only told us her favorite spot she orders take out from, she took the time to pull up the website menu and look at some pictures of the interior to make sure it had exactly what we wanted since she has only ordered take out and didn’t want to lead us in the wrong direction. Being from the South we expect a high level of hospitality and Lauren made us feel right at home. I cannot recommend Lauren and the hotel enough!! Next trip we will choose the Gansevoort again and hope to see lauren :)

review_body: I had been to the Gansevoort for cocktails in the uber trendy roof bar a few years ago and always wanted to stay there, so booked in with the family from the 21st December to the 24th December last, and what a great choice that was. We were looked after royally from the moment we checked in to the moment we left, nothing as too much trouble, the Ganesvoort team provided us with a haven to return to every day after the Christmas madness of New York We had a 2 bed suite which was absolutely perfect for the kids and ourselves, the rooms were generous in size, super bathroom - the shower in the master also doubled as a steam room. I have stayed in many other NY Hotel’s over the years , particularly further up towards central park and to be very honest I had my best NY sleeps ever in the Gansevoort. The kids too had a ball , with the youngest doing laps of the roof top pool at 8am on Christmas Eve ! We had a schedule of activates when we are in NY and thanks to Lorenzo at the front desk for all the arrangements he made from airport pickups and transfers to restaurant reservations. The Hotel by the way is in a fantastic location , walking distance to the Whitney museum , Chelsea market, the high line etc. If you are vising NY for business or pleasure this is just one super Hotel in a fabulous part of Manhattan,. Thanks to all the Ganesvoort team from Elon and Jennifer to the housekeeping teams and to those of you in the bars and the restaurant. We can to wait to return

review_body: While I don’t claim to be an NYC expert, not have I lived in this city, I’ve visited too many times to count, and stayed in various areas. I really feel that as a tourist, this is the best neighborhood. It’s hip, trendy, vibrant, safe and fun. It also has some great stores, and incredible eateries. From its cobble stoned streets, to the highline, this is a great place to walk around, wonder, and even get a little lost.And in the heart of it all, is a gem of a hotel, the Gansevoort. Located with a perfect river view of the Hudson, and in a prime part of this neighborhood, the hotel is modern, and vibrant, the rooms are hip and yet functional, and it is somewhat reasonably priced all things considered. The rooftop offers a bar scene with a pool deck. While we were visiting the pool area was being remodeled, but everything else was functional.Across the streets and within a stones throw away, are some great places to visit, wonder around, or grab some food on the go, or a high end sit down meal. From Restoration Hardware, to the Highline, to leading restaurants like Catch, Tao, Buddahkhan, Fig and Olive, or coffee and a drink or meal at Starbucks Reserve, or the many eateries at Chelsea Market, the options are almost endless.The hotel can be quite a scene on a weekend and possibly some mid-week nights, but this adds to the ambience and creates an added vibe. And all thing said, it’s also a good hotel for families with kids, so there is certainly balance. The staff were very helpful and even though we had an issue with our room, it was handled quickly and efficiently by the front desk team, and with the level of care that we appreciated. I would definitely come back and stay here again!

review_body: The Gansevoort is a relativelly small (by Manhattan standards) hotel steps from the High Line and the Whitney museum. It's a wonderful location for strolling through the west village, touring the high line, etc. Rooms are very large by NYC standards. They are extremely well appointed with more toiletries and amenities than normal. L'Occitane toiletries, fabulous robes and slippers, and all kinds of little surprise touches (including a stuffed goose on the bed, still not sure about that one). There is a lovely rooftop bar. Views are not the best in the city, but it was still a charming place to end our evening. The gym has peloton bikes and you can get spinning shoes at the front desk. Check out time is generous at noon. Beds were super comfortable. Room was very dark for sleeping but had excellent lighting overall. Very quiet. Highly recommend.

review_body: My stay at the Gansevoort Hotel over the last Thanksgiving holiday was absolutely memorable. From the moment I arrived, I was treated so nicely and respectfully. The hotel room assigned to be was Just lovely, artistic and most elegant. There is a certain “peace of mind” one attains while lodging here. The restaurant has excellent food and the room service is outstanding. I loved my stay here albeit short because I had to be somewhere on the Saturday after Thanksgiving Day but I can not wait to go back. This is an outstanding hotel on every level and you will love it equally if not more than I did. Thanks to the entire staff for all the incredible work they do to accommodate their hotel guests every single day. I most appreciated all that was done for me while I stayed here. Jeff M.

review_body: Let's face it--NYC is a place with a million hotels but not many you actually want to stay in. Most of the choices are old, look onto brick walls, or have rooms the size of closets. Gansevoort is in one of the best neighborhoods in town, is accessible to everything, has a hip vibe, and rooms you actually want to relax in while looking west over the Hudson River and the High Line. It would be a great choice anywhere, but in NYC it's one of the best.

review_body: We decided to be "tourists" every year for our anniversary in January. We live so close to the city and never take advantage of all that it has to offer. We stayed this year in the Meatpacking District (which I think is a section of Chelsea but don't quote me on that) and it is THE PLACE TO STAY! It is within walking distance to everything. EVERYTHING!!! The hotel is very pretty and the security is A-1! At check-in, however, we encountered a not-so-nice agent who was determined to tell me that I booked a double-bedded room for my anniversary! REALLY!? You're telling the customer she's wrong? Well, as it turns out, the upgrade that I paid for in a package ONLY had double-bedded rooms that Erica (yes, the Erica that everyone is reading about and lauds because she's tremendously helpful) explained that the king rooms were sold out but PROMPTLY set us up for the next night and nights to follow with a king room with an extraordinary view! The other ladies and gentlemen were exceptional as well. Even upon check out, that initial agent had an issue with us. SMH She is THE ONLY DOWNFALL!! She, and she alone and for me only, was the reason the Gansevoort Hotel lost a star! Bad taste in my mouth kind of thing. Not accommodating AT ALL!! (pun intended) Don't get me wrong, any room is nice but the king grand deluxe is sweet! Roomy, clean and grand. And for those who tried - you DID my us very happy! Thank you.We pick a different area of NYC each year, but this place is worth another visit.

review_body: We were attending a business meeting close by and chose this hotel due to the proximity to that venue. We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is nicely decorated, new and clean, with an air of edginess. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated and the service is good. The bar at the top is nice and has an amazing view of the surrounding area and a nice selection of drinks, wine and beer. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of the Chelsea Market, Greenwich Village and lots of interesting sites, shops and restaurants. You can even walk from here to Times Square if you are up for a long walk. The prices are lower than in most more centrally located hotels; the only drawback is that the restaurants and bars close at 11:00 PM, a bit early for NYC. Probably will go back when returning to the city.

review_body: The Gansevoort was unexpectedly charming with a retro euro flair. I arrived very early and Lauren at the front desk was very accommodating, friendly and her customer service was exceptional. Lauren assisted me with directions, restaurant recommendations and so much more! The rooftop bar (The Plunge Bar) is loungie & relaxing with breathtaking views and an incredible barrista who is an awesome mixologist! The on-site restaurant (The Chester) has a delicious French breakfast...just ask for Anthony (he is the best!). I enjoyed my stay and I even playing a game of billiards in the lobby lounge area. My only disappointments were the Salon/ Spa was closed and the coffee in the room was not free. Otherwise, the location/ food/ accommodations/ service and staff were excellent.

review_body: This is a no nonsense and solid 4 star hotel in a terrific location right in the heart of the re-enlivened Meatpacking District. No restaurant in house to speak of but there are heaps of great restaurants within 500 meters, including both the heavily touristed Chelsea Market and the less obvious but great cheap eats at Gansevoort Market. For the ultimate coffee “experience”, try the Starbucks Reserve restaurant across the road. For the best coffee, Kobricks next door is best. The hotel itself has a brilliant rooftop bar. There is a ‘higher’ rooftop bar over at the Standard Hotel, but much more pretentious. All staff were impeccable. We’d return.

review_body: My second time to this Hotel and was there last year for the New Year’s Eve party. When arriving to front desk we were amazingly remember by surname by the admirable Lauren with her bright smile!! Wow !.....was shocked... she remembered our names. She dealt with the changes adeptly and accommodated us with a front view due room being delay for check in. Furthermore before checkout we had our Recovery Brunch at the Chester Restaurant and was met by Mercedes the Manager was so nice to come over and ask us our opinion and if we were ok? I mention to her that the Brunch was impeccable! I was so impressed with the food. Mercedes said she would mention it the chef. Had a better time this year with the Brunch Recovery meal. Hope the Hotel keeps this going.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So, I just got back from my trip to NYC for a girls trip with my mom and my pup, Karl and a girlfriend and honestly, I loved the hotel! Everything was great! Great location, rooftop bar was so fun and everyone in the hotel was extremely friendly and efficient - only complaints (and I hate to do this but I have to be honest ) was the bed was a tad bit uncomfortable. Also, someone by the name of Julia answered the phone one time when I tried to connect to concierge (she was not concierge because I did ask) but she answered the phone and MY GOD! Her responses were “yeah” one time too many. She was very rude . I recommend her not answering the phones anymore or possibly taking a class in phone etiquette . Other than that, everyone was FANTASTIC! Melvin is the NICEST person they have working there!!! He is just so friendly and accommodating . Even allowed us a late checkout ! The staff was great with my pupper, they were always welcoming us with smiles and salutations whenever we walked into the hotel. They had a bed and bowls (and even a squeaky toy) set up for Karl! Also, if you’re traveling with your furry companion and they are on the “service dog registry” they do get to stay for FREE ! Just bring your documentation !!!! Love that!!! I will definitely be back!!! Great location, great atmosphere!!! 1000% happy we took a trip up to NYC!
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is swanky, the service was fantastic, and the location was terrific. I especially loved the fact that the rooms had flat irons in addition to hair dryers. There was a button near the bed that allowed me to open and close the curtains without having to get up. The bathroom was spacious. The only thing I would have improved in the room was the actual bed. It wasn't comfortable, but the pillows were. I'd like to return in warmer weather so I can take advantage of the rooftop pool.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last week we my college roommates and I met in the city to celebrate a birthday and have a proper girls' night out. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with a smile by Lauren and Charles who both went above and beyond and helped accommodate our every request. We were able to check in early to gorgeous room, enjoy the spectacular view, relax at the bar before dinner, and then even played pool on our return late night with some lovely people visiting the city. Lauren and Charles: thank you for your warmth and hospitality! See you next year.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is absolutely nothing bad I can say about this place. Everything from the prompt valet out front on ninth Avenue to the endless room amenities, this is the place to stay. I dealt with Sonia and I must say she is one of the most accommodating young ladies I’ve ever dealt with in any resort. There are truly no apologies to be made about this place. The room was perfect, it was spotless and extremely comfortable. You are a short walk from a number of reputable and star-studded restaurants. There is a gorgeous roof top which I promise you will find exciting. If it’s within your means try to get yourself a Manhattan suite. The Chester downstairs is very convenient and delicious as well. If you favor Mexican food definitely walk next-door to Dos Caminos, they never disappoint. Do yourself a favor and make this your weekend destination the next time you are downtown.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel for a special birthday treat. Booked 2 rooms so not a cheap trip. Nice rooms, lovely roof top pool but staff just so indifferent to guests. Had a few issues which were eventually dealt with but just got the overall impression we were a nuisance.Have emailed hotel twice since returning to question extra charges on bill and nobody has had the courtesy to reply. This hotel needs to decide whether it is an upmarket hotel or a party venue. The bar downstairs was always packed with non residents, sports was on the tv, it was over poweringly loud. There were lots of non residents going up to the roof of a night which compromised security within the building. Just felt that the hotel guests were an after thought, Perfectly located but would never stay here again.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for Marathon weekend with my husband and college-aged son. We also had a room for my parents' birthday gift. We were warmly welcomed by Charles the doorman who took care of us all whenever we arrived or left. He was very attentive getting a taxi and helping me with an umbrella or giving us water bottles before we went to watch the marathon. At the desk Melvin was also very accommodating. He was able to upgrade our rooms and made sure my parents were taken care of. The rooms were well appointed and spacious with a great view. My only complaint was that since the hotel is in such a popular area, there was a lot of noise from the rooftop bars and traffic until 3 am. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here last month with a group of friends and we absolutely loved everything about the Gansevoort. Booked through a travel director (Passport to Friday) and we got a welcome champagne and food credit! Our room had an amazing view of the Meatpacking District and everything was super clean. Wish the beds were a tad comfier, but it's a small complaint considering it was an overall wonderful property.The hotel bar is the PLACE TO BE at night, so many people watching college football and just hanging out. Great atmosphere if you're looking for something more "local" and not touristy.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Surrounded by the exciting Meatpacking district, a stay at the Gansevoort lets you walk to wonderful restaurants and enjoyable shopping. The Rooftop Bar offers hours of breathtaking views any time of the day. Sunset over the Hudson River makes for a very special cocktail experience.Surprisingly, the one downside is that the service is spotty at best. One moment you have a very helpful server, going the extra mile, but the next moment a staff member is too busy performing administrative tasks to take your order. Also, the hotel was experiencing difficulties with its HVAC system which made for one very uncomfortable night in a room which was way too hot. Those things happen, but when we reported the issue to the front desk I was told that "an engineer will be sent up to fix the situation". When I inquired as to status a couple of hours later that same front desk person said they forgot to send the engineer up! When I inquired yet again later that evening I was then told that the entire system was down. All in all, very disappointing treatment.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for an experience that will keep you coming back over and over...THIS IS IT! Everything was sooooo perfect from check in to check out! We LOVED the ambiance, the HUGE-for-NYC room, the attention to detail and lighting and just the entire "street" scene! WHAT a fun neighborhood with excellent subway access, delicious dining, markets and the feel of homey comfort! FORGET Times Square! Pack your bags and head for the Meatpacking District! :-)
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at the Gansevoort. The location is excellent. The staff in the hotel is very friendly. We had afternoon drinks at the rooftop bar. It is a comfortable space with excellent views, but the staff seemed to be bothered by us. Our room was very comfortable and clean and I am picky. One thing that really bothered me about our room was how the "extras" that were in our room had a price tag on them. Now, I know the mini bar and Fiji water will cost, but why put a goose Beanie Baby on my bed with a $10 price tag? $15.00 for Shaving kit, package of panties in the bathroom for a fee??!! Also, the in room coffee maker was $2.00 per Kcup! It just makes me feel like a money tree, not a guest when hotels do greedy things like this. Also, the entire Meatpacking District is very trendy. The Gansevoort caters to the young, hip crowd. We are an older middle aged couple with a 14 year old daughter and we felt out of place there. Overall our experience was positive, but I will be staying elsewhere next time.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i've recently left new york after living here for 6 years and will always have fond memories of the meatpacking district. The gansevoort is among 3 of my favorite hotels in the area, as well as the city. The staff - particularly Yulia, at the front desk was so welcoming on my single night's stay. The lobby bar stays cozy, the rooftop bar is enclosed so you can still enjoy that autumn sun, but avoid the autumn wind. drinks are tasty, bartenders on both levels are helpful and kind and bellhops are prompt. Even with the construction that's currently blocking the 9th ave entrance, they were helpful in getting me and my items curbside and loaded up BEFORE the crack of dawn. the suite is well equipped and well laid out for privacy, but almost a little too inviting for visitors to dwell in the living room area ;). You're 10 minutes or less walking distance from some delicious restaurants - at all price points - and barely blocks away from shopping and fun.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Malik welcomes us with a kind, warm and genuine greeting. Our stay for one night was incredibly fun with drinks on the rooftop followed by a morning swim overlooking the city. The Gansevoort is trendy, cool & in the best neighbourhood. Huge thanks to Malik, Elon. X
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Made the mistake of staying here for a one night business trip. This hotel is about a 3/5. I am currently in my room, and hear construction and other noise outside. Came back to my room after a long day of traveling since 4am and working, and it took 5 phone calls to room service and 2 calls to the front desk to place an in room dining order, where I asked for a glass of tap water with my meal and received a $10 bottle of Fiji instead (definitely was charged for it too). Not my typical stay during a business trip, also tried to entertain a colleague at downstairs bar, they didn’t have either drink we ordered at first. Would definitely not recommend for business.
hotelName:
0    Gansevoort Meatpacking NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For our first time in NYC, this was a great place to stay. It is a reasonable walking distance from everything we wanted to see and we loved having breakfast at the restaurant every day. The waiter was kind and the food was good (waiter Tofael). We would stay here again!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, currently my family of 4 is staying here for 5 nights with the city view of Time square, Corner view. Guest assistance was so fast to accommodate our needs. The only thing they forget is I requested a special thing for my daughter for her birthday in our room ( a simple cupcake or baloon)when we get to our room but unfortunately nothing was done. The room was a good size and bed was very comfortable. The housekeeper today that clean our room 3102 was so kind to return my wallet that was left unattended. It was so nice of her/him. We we're also given a military discount.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a long drive from Florida, upon arrival we had an issue with valet parking, the manager on duty fixed that problem, and we were introduced to Evelyn to complete our check-in. Evelyn was very kind, which helped ease my frustration with valet, and made our check-in a very smooth process. We stay here often, and the service has always been good, but today with Evelyn, service was exceptional.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I travel 6 times a year, 3 internationally. Our experience with IHG has varied from excellent to disappointing. We rented two adjoining rooms with granddaughters on June 19, 20 and 21 at the Crown Plaza Times with points and cash. I had called and e-mailed at least two times to secure adjoining rooms with children. They assured me there would be no problem. The receptionist was short and rather curt indicating no quarantee of adjoining rooms although she did give it to us. Points cost 60,000 (a lot) per night, plus $23 property fee and $40 destination fee per room per night. That is equivalent to about $550 per night. The lights went on and off, faulty bulbs, in both rooms, the shower was either very hot or very cold, carpet was dingy. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. No room refrigerator or make-up mirror. We will continue to make every attempt to stay at Hyatt (our favorite) and Hilton when possible after this experience.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the CPTS with my two daughters from July 2-6th, 2019. From start to finish, this hotel gets 5 stars from us!! Check in was a breeze, and they had our room ready even though we arrived before noon. The check in staff were very friendly and answered all of my questions with a smile.Our room was clean and surprisingly spacious for NYC!! Our bathroom light stopped working on our first day and after notifying the front desk it was fixed within minutes.You are truly within steps to everything here, you cannot find a better location!! We ate a few times at the hotel and the food was delicious and the service was impeccable.Thank you Crowne Plaza for making my daughters first trip to NYC so memorable. 5 stars all the way!!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights, having booked a package of a Cunard cruise and this hotel. Before we even travelled I had a bad expereince; as my wife is diabetic and needs a small fridge in a hotel room to store insulin, I e-mailed the hotel to ask if rooms already contained a fridge; they couldn't even be bothered to reply. On arrival at the hotel we had to wait an age for our room to be ready, when it finally was I phoned down requesting a small fridge; they promised to bring one ""in a few minutes"; it actually took nearly 3 hours! Then I discovered that the safe in the room didn't work; I followed the instructions faithfully but nothing doing; on phoning down for "service" I was told in a very condescending way that I must have swiped my card the wrong way round; when after yet another long wait - an hour and a half - someone came to our room to look at it, he spotted straight away that it was broken and sent me down to the reception to ask for a safe deposit box at that level - hugely inconvenient. On the second day they removed all the large towels from the bathroom, even though we had not placed them on the floor and were perfectly happy to re-use them; this took well over 2 hours to sort out. The restaurant - an absolute embarrassment given the charges. The evening menu is seriously limited, they showed no understanding or concern when I pointed out that my wife as a diabetic had to be extremely careful with food; some of the waiters were absolutely incompetent. Ask for a milky coffee and they fill the cup with coffee to the brim, leaving no space for milk; when I asked them to bring me a piece of cake together with my coffee so that I could enjoy them together, that proved to be too difficult. I despair. I am used to 4-star Swiss hotels, so I expect high standards, but given how expensive the Crowne Plaza is this should not be a problem. I wouid never return to this hotel even if I were given free accommodation - it is absolutely shambolic, a complete rip-off.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the CPTS for my birthday again and was lucky to have Donald check me in! He’s always the caring professional and allocates my room preference - this time a wonderful corner room on a higher floor. It is greatly appreciated. After arriving in the room, Grant rang to make sure everything was okay and a Birthday amenity was delivered from Christine. This property has the location but these employees make the difference and make you want to return! Thank you again for an incredible stay and your hospitality and kindness!!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Top location and all staff are very professional and nice all the time. I am quite impressed by their service. I want to give them 5 star but I cannot due to that they charged double that comes $18k for 9 nights with two rooms. I found this strange charging issue while I stayed in Crowne Plaza Times Square, so I visited the counter to discuss about it and the gentleman spend several minutes to resolve the issue. He told me the charging issue has been resolved but actually it has not been resolved. Now, I get $18k charge on my credit card. WHY?I returned to my country and I found $18k is still there. So, what I am not happy is about the credit card payment issue that has killed my credit card usage due to double charge, $18k, and it has cause limit issue. Now I am unable to use credit card anymore due to limit issue even though I should have enough room to use credit card if Crowne Plaza Times Square did not charge twice. I received full payment on my card on both 2nd and 3rd July, and my check out was on 4th July. This must be caused by time difference between NZ and NYC. I need to pay some other important payments but unable to use my credit card anymore that made me very upset. I called Crowne Plaza as soon as I returned NZ but I was told I need to contact Billing department of Crowne Plaza Times Square; however, it was Friday night in NYC at the time due to time difference between New Zealand and NYC. Due to long holiday in USA and weekend in NZ, I cannot use my credit card for 3 days at least that has been causing major problems on me seriously.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for one night after arriving from London, access from the airport (JFK) is fairly straightforward on public transport and with the traffic in NYC I chose the subway as a fairly painless way to get to the heart of NYC.The hotel is currently undergoing renovation and the access is off a side street which isn’t that easy to spot, I appreciate there were lots of billboards on the temporary hoardings around the building which would have been easily visible from across the street but if you are on the same side of the street they are almost impossible to spot and eye level sighs would have been helpful!Once I found the entrance although busy the hotel was very calm and relaxing, a welcome change to the streets outside! Checking in was fast and efficient and the staff were very welcoming. My room was on one of the highest floors in the building with limited views of the Hudson River and some of the city. Perfectly acceptable for my needs as after a long flight I just wanted to sleep! I would suggest requesting a room that isn’t next to the lifts though as the noise which is almost constant 24hr a day was somewhat annoying but not enough for me to complain and I slept to I guess not that bad! The room itself was very nice, large very comfortable bed, nice furniture and gear en suite bathroom, I have added an image below. The room was very clean and had plenty of space for what I believe was just a standard double room. Breakfast was served overlooking Times Square and was a very good buffet with superb service from very friendly staff. It was also very good value for money! If you want to be in central NYC then you won’t go far wrong with this hotel, I would certainly stay again if visiting New York.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tofael was great and made breakfast a pleasure! He was always willing to do anything he could to make our experience even better! The breakfast was great and we will come again. Thank you Tofael! You made it a better experience.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in Crowne plaza and were a family of 8. Our check in experience was not too good even though the reception was quite and all receptionist were by themselves. They were not welcoming at all and didn’t really provide any information of the hotel or it’s facilities the staff’s attitude is very unpleasant. We booked a strip view room and when we checked in our room had views of building garages with literally no view at all I contacted reception and the manager on duty advised there is no other room than what we had and if we are to change rooms it wouldn’t make much difference hence we decided to stay in the given room.The rooms are really old and tiny.The gym is pretty big with lots of machines but again very old the only good we liked about staying here was the location and nothing else really is appealing and if anyone’s looking to stay in Times Square there’s much better options with better price options.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I asked for a mini bar and they brought me with a medicine that another guest had left. I called the room service and complained to her and she said she was sending me a farm to clean my room. A guy came to me only with a bathing cap and told me he would take it over. What he saw to his manager ... I wait and we still see how long I will have to wait ..
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My kids and I stayed at Crowne Plaza Time Square for a couple of days. The hotel was good until someone decided to help themselves to a package that was delivered there for me. I made several enquiries but I kept being transferred from one person to another. Eventually my issue was never resolved and I got tired of making the long distance calls to find out what happened.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed at a number of Crowne Plazas over the years and I remember them almost always being a good experience. And while the location truly can’t be beat for wanting to be in Times Square, this one feels stuck in a time warp. While the lobby feels very dark and dreary in stark contrast to the bright lights and excitement of Times Square, the real fail was the room. Paint chipping around the windows; every piece of furniture gashed, chipped, scratched, and worn; bathtub glaze severely chipped (I felt like showering in my flip flops); tub took forever to drain and shower difficult to fully turn off; and the ceiling showed the scars of every piece of patchwork and repair that had been done over the years. Another minor, yet telling, sign of the age of this hotel is that the desk in the rooms do have power supply but not straight USB ports...a true sign the hotel is dated.Oh, and the elevator call light button on our floor was out so you were never really sure if the elevator was coming to get you when you pushed it.C’mon Crowne Plaza! This should be a showcase property for you and it’s sorry and depressing. Sink some money into the place and show some pride. I expect more from your brand.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to stay close to Times Square this is a pretty good choice. We reserved a King bed city view in mid-June 2019 and was given a corner room at the top floor (46th floor - Northeast corner). This corner room gives you nearly a wraparound view of the city. In other words, the windows wrap from the north side continuing to the east side of the room. This was pretty nice for staring out into the city from up high. Noise was about what you'd expect in the middle of Times Square. Even from the 46th floor you can hear sirens and car horns. If you're a light sleeper, might I suggest not staying in Times Square, maybe consider not even staying in Manhattan. It didn't bother us much at all, what was annoying was the bright blue Barclays building sign at night. Luckily the room has curtains to block out most of the outside lights. Other than that, for the most part everything was in order. The bathroom is a bit on the smaller side than I'm used to and the closet basically shares that space as well. Plenty of room for 2 people. For the price you pay a simple continental breakfast would've been nice. We did not get to try their restaurant/bar. (Why bother when you're in Times Square?) Elevators were pretty quick most of the time. Not much waiting or stops except for the mornings. Subways are 1-2 blocks away depending on the station. One small gripe, if any staff from the hotel reads this, might I suggest reversing the toilet paper holder. It's mounted in such a way that when you pull the toilet paper out the whole roll starts to come off the holder. If the holder were installed in reverse, that would solve the problem.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel because of location and room quality is great for the price. There are a few things that very much annoyed me enough to write about it. So here is my story. I reserved my room on the 27th of this month and due to issues with my flight I got to this hotel around 2 or 3am the next morning. When I made it to the front desk to checkin I realized I forgot my wallet in the shuttle that dropped me off and ontop of that my phone was dead. The front desk agent was very nice and told me where I could charge my phone to call the shuttle service to get my wallet back. She saw that I was an IHG member and knew I had a reservation but I still needed my credit card and my ID. While waiting for the shuttle service to come back i wanted to let her know that i would have my wallet in 30 to 40 minutes and to thank her for her help. Unfortunately she was not there but her supervisor was. I decided to let him know about my situation since the woman u was speaking with earlier was gone. I was also going to see if a picture of my ID and credit card would be enough to get me in my room until the shuttle driver arrived with. Y wallet. While e playing my situtation to the Supervisor he got a very nasty attitude with me and very rudely cut me off while I was talking and told me to wait down stairs next to the bellman. Then he just ignored me and went about his business. I wanted to get his name but he had his name tag covered by a jacket. At that point I decided not to make a big deal out of his attitude and continued to wait for the shuttle driver. I had gotten. My wallet about 30 minutes later and went to checkin. The same Supervisor's attitude was very short and impolite. I felt like he thought I was below him or I did not deserve to stay at this resort. After he gave me my room key I proceeded to my assigned room and the keys did not work. I had to go back to the front desk which was over 30 floors down and get new keys. The same Supervisor was there and seemed shocked that the keys didn't work. So for some reason he told security to check the room and he also called the room to see if anyone was in there. That seemed strange to me because any other hotel or resort I have stayed in would just give me a new key. That is how i knew that he already knew something was wrong and was trying to hide it. After he called the room he said someone picked up and had to assign me a new room. He did not even apologize to me for the mistake. After I got the key to the new room I proceeded to it and when I got in there was cloths and bags all over the place (picture is attached to this post). I went back to the front desk which now was over 20 floors down. The same Supervisor was there again and i told him and showed him the picture I took and now he was shocked. He called out the person assigning the rooms to take care if it and offered me a free breakfast voucher. The person assigning the rooms came out and was very nice. He apologized to me and told me that the day was a little hectic and that he would take care of thg e problem. The Front Desk Supervisor seemed to catch an atti5with him as well eventhough he was doing his best to fix the problem. While the room assignment person was off making sure a room he found was clean and empty, the Front Desk Supervisor handed me 3 more breakfast vouchers and finally apologized to me. The room assignment person came back and told me every5was good now but the room type I had reserved was not available. I overlooked that and told him it was ok since I saw how hard he looked for a room for me. He then offered me dinner for the inconvenience and I accepted. AS I WAS WALKING AWAY THE FRONT DESK SUPERVISOR TOLD THE ROOM ASSIGNMENT PERON HE JUST GAVE ME BREAKFAST VOUCHERS AND WHY DID HE GIVE ME A COMPED DINNER? Very nasty and rudely to the room assignment person. I could also tell he had made a few more comments but could not hear everything because I was walking away. Bottomline, the Front Desk Supervisor working overnight from June 27th to the 28th had a very nasty attitude and made me feel uncomfortable about staying there. The room assignment person was awesome and had a fantastic attitude when under pressure and dealing with the negative attitude of the Front Desk Supervisor. The rest if the hotel staff was great.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked two double beds for our stay however upon arrival they did not have a room available and so they upgraded us to a room with a king size bed and a sofa bed for the kids with views of Times Square as well as free breakfast which was greatly appreciated. The location is central to everything however we did have trouble getting to sleep so I would recommend ear plugs.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for five days and four nights during a recent trip to New York. The best thing about this hotel is the location - it's right at the heart of Times Square where all the action is.The room was clean, modern, and actually spacious by New York standards. There were plenty of sockets and USB ports for us to plug in our devices, and WiFi was pretty good. Our rooms were cleaned daily and toiletries were regularly restocked. However, the room did not have a minibar or even a refrigerator, which is odd for a hotel at this price range. The hotel's facade along Broadway was being renovated, so there was a bit of a confusion locating the hotel entrance when we first arrived. Although there was a sign directing people where to go, it was too small to easily notice. Also, given the hotel's location and popularity among large groups (like student tour groups and large families), the elevators can get a bit busy at times.Overall, this is a very good hotel and highly recommended!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New York is one of the cities I love to visit. I decided to stay in the Crowne Plaza this time to see how things are here. Let’s start off by saying excellent excellent customer service by the receptionist Sandra. I travel a lot for work and stayed in a lot of hotels across the US but never had such service like I did today with Sandra.she made my daughters day and my day and all I can say is thank you and hopefully management will notice this and do something special for her. The hotel is conveniently located to Times Square and restaurants. The rooms are clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rahi not only offered great bartending services, but he also gave us useful information, helped us get the most out of our vacation, and booked us a reservation close to the venue of our evening activities
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rahi served us in the lounge every night we stayed at the hotel. He was very friendly and suggested what to do on our trip. Rahi was very helpful and even made us a dinner reservation for one night of our trip!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Crowne Plaza was an ideal location. We walked to so many things. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and CLEAN! Some of the staff were less than friendly but our overall visit was fantastic. The breakfast buffet was average. The lounge/bar area was nice.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The check in was quick. This was important after a very busy day. The room was clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel is near everything, dining, shopping and the downtown area. There is a mall right next to the hotel. The parking lot can be accessed without difficulty in inclement weather, which was the case during my stay. I would stay again when in the area.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When was checking out of the hotel sandra esp of the hotel she was excellent agent very kind and helpful, I enjoyed in the hotel thank you all and have a great day , Ahmed from saudi arabia nice to meet you .
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a room for four of us on the 33rd floor overlooking the Hudson River. No noise, we all slept very well following our busy days in NYC.Good sized room with 2 comfortable double beds, lovely clean fresh bedding.Room furniture was dated but didn’t bother us.Bathroom was clean with a bath/shower which worked really well.Fresh towels provided daily.Some bottled water in the room would have been a welcome touch and some biscuits to go with the coffee!Reception staff were very professional but didn’t feel that personal, had to ask where to find the swimming pool/gym.Didn’t eat in the hotel restaurant. Great location for exploring the city of New York and enjoy all the local restaurants! Be prepared to walk loads.....
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable room with a great central location in Times Square The bed almost made you not want to get up and everything was clean and spotlessBreakfast buffet was good and staff were always happy to help
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family stayed here when visiting NYC. A very pleasant stay and so close to everything. We walked everywhere because it was close to all we wanted to do. Staff was nice and friendly, rooms were clean and comfortable. Price was high due to graduation week so we only stayed for 2 nights.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a corner room on 41st floor and rarely heard any noise from others in hotel. Outside street noise was minimal. I asked for a couple of things regarding housekeeping and was supplied with them very quickly. - Water from faucet in bath is great. Tastes good and I drank it.- Mocha from Cafe by elevators was not. I’ve had better from circle k. - sports club is nice; I swam once while there. It is a lap pool - not an indoor play for kids pool- location is near multiple subway stations and theaters- they will kindly hold your luggage before checkin if you arrive early - the elevator doors close quickly; be forewarned :)
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is the USP of this place! Located right on Times square overlooking the M&M's world and walking distance into the best shopping and most happening places of downtown NYC, it is also near to most of the Broadway theatres, so one can do the late night shows without having to worry much about commute and others. The Central terminus is also within 100 metres. The rooms are decent, amenities useful and adequate, breakfast spread very satisfying. The breakfast location is wonderful overlooking the times square and its neons! You cannot ask for more in that budget in NYC. My stay was quite comfortable.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there for a business trip. Location is awesome right in the thick of the manhattan. Rooms are comfortable and decently sized. Breakfast served at the brasserie is a bit expensive but the spread is decent. Overall service is excellent at the hotel. Would definitely recommend
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband bought me tickets for a Broadway show for my birthday so The Crowne was the perfect spot for all of the planned events! It was easy to get to Penn Station, the Empire State Building, and Central Park! The hotel was clean and everything was well kept! We had a great city view and a comfortable bed!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in Time Square on Broadway. Perfect location for sightseeing and seeing Broadway Shows. Hop on Hop off bus picks up right in front of hotel. Great customer service. Clean and comfortable rooms.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very disappointed on arrival. For such a prominent hotel, the room looked like it hadn't been decorated in over 20 years! Furniture all scrapped and dirty cupboard. The carpet was disgusting!! Dirty tissue on bedside table on arrival. Temperamental shower had no pressure. Up side. Bed was OK. Towels and sheets were clean. Bell hops very helpful and friendly. However reception staff could use more training, especially concierge on people skills. Was a shame as a great location but I think for what people pay the hotel needs to seriously up their game. Unless their aim is to overcharge and under deliver!!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service at this hotel is impeccable! Every single employee I came into contact with exhibited genuine care and consistent great hospitality! Traveling alone, I wasn’t interested in checking out the local food unless the hotel food wasn’t up to par. I NEVER once ate a meal outside of this hotel! The fool was incredible!!! My server, Tofael went above and beyond. Offering to take a group picture of one of his tables. Cleaning other tables when not busy serving. What a blessing he is to CPTS I’m sure!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent two nights with family in May at this hotel. The location is wonderful you can walk to everywhere and the subway is close by. The room was clean and felt updated. The beds were comfy. I did not use the lounge or other amenities while there so I cannot comment on them. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The lobby and other public spaces of this hotel are dated, shabby and need an overhaul. There is construction on the outside of the hotel, so maybe that is in the works. There is really no lobby, just a lounge, so nowhere really to sit while waiting for others. The main entrance is through the car drive-through. Some of the front desk staff were brusk, while others were very nice. The room was clean, good size and pretty nice, with a comfortable bed and linens. When we entered the room, the maid had not removed 2 opened bottles of water that the previous guest had used.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived from Delhi after a 20hrs.Flight, Immigration and New York traffic at the Hotel, which is located bang in the heart of the famous Time Square. they have a nice private Porch for pick up & drop off in this, busy district. Rude shock starts now, nobody 'welcomes' you, Here, and the guy manning the entrance doesn't bother to explain, that the front desk is two levels up, nor does he offer any help for it, when he saw us with three big Suitcases ( not Business Travellers). After figuring out the whole thing one reaches front desk. Here Mr. Gerry informs me wrongly that we have a room on triple Sharing but the Breakfast is Only for Two. For this I again have to request him to confirm from his office, which he reluctantly does, but doesn't admit that it was a mistake on their part. We found it was an average room, with just manageable facilities. Back home I would not pay so much for "such" an average accommodation & rude treatment. Is this the Price one pays for staying at Time Square.  Final assault was at Check Out, they charged me $40:00, per day,(Total $200:00) extra as Service Charge for (non Existing service ) which they never informed me at Check In, nor was I told if these charges were mandatory or optional.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was full size, not tiny like some NY hotels. It was nicely furnished, with comfortable beds and it was very clean. The view from the 30th floor was nice, and we were within easy walking distance of many restaurants, subway stops and the Jumbotrons of Times Square. Freddy checked us in and he was delightful! He provided several breakfast vouchers and restaurant vouchers for bar or evening dining. I was traveling with two kids under the age of 10 and appreciated the lower prices for kids meals. All in all, I’ll go back again.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay Report - 5/31 - 6/2Location: Seemingly every hotel between 33rd and 51st, 10th Avenue to 6th Avenue claims to be "Times Square" so that's a meaningless term.  Specifically, this hotel is located on Broadway between 48th and 49th (the hotel takes up the whole block and has entrances on both 48th and 49th).  48th Street has an entrance to the 49th Street N/R/W Station, 49th has an entrance to the 50th Street 1 Station and a block away on 8th Avenue is the 50th Street C/E Station.  There are a number of theaters nearby and plenty of restaurants and the like.  LGA is about a $40 Uber away in no trafficHotel: The hotel itself is a massive high rise.  I was happy to find they have separated the elevator banks into serving the lower half and upper half of floors which means shorter waits than at other high rises.  The lobby is one floor up from the entrance and has a large restaurant which does a buffet breakfast, a coffee shop and a bar as well as a lot of meeting space another floor up.Check In: As a Spire Elite I was given a coupon for the buffet breakfast for just $16 instead of $40.  Room: Much, much larger than many Manhattan rooms I've stayed in.  While it was nothing all that special, having the space for me and my travel companion was really nice. The bathroom was also big enough and the shower got really, REALLY hot if you wanted it to.  Wifi worked well as well.I was just here for a Points and Cash Accelerate rate but I found myself pleasantly surprised.  I'd be happy to return.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan provided a solid hotel experience. Nice corner room, excellent bed, and conference facilities. Overall, the staff were nice but service was a bit mixed. A great location. Thanks for an excellent stay!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jewellery was stolen from bedside table. Reported with no response. Went in to discuss with security and was told an investigation would take place. This did not happen. Followed up again - no response. Emailed head office - twice NO RESPONSE. Avoid this place. And the rooms smell putrid.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, very busy and a bit faceless but nice rooms with very comfy beds. Great views from our room. Helpful staff but the best thing about this hotel is its position right at the heart of Times square.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love NY ! Such a cool place so many things to do. The city never sleeps. Didn’t really get much sunlight though. Benihana‘s was really good had to wait an hour even when we made a reservation ‍♀️
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first time review for a hotel. The whole staff at the hotel was so helpful, polite and the best service. Rahi at the bar area was the nicest person in the hotel, I had a cold and he recommended an Indian tea "Bombay Chai" which helped me to recover. The best service ever! The location is excellent to stay at Manhattan for tourism. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy every minute at the big apple, you will not waist time in transportation, you can walk almost everywhere and if you want to take the subway there is an station just cross street.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve stayed here several times over the past several years and will continue to do so. Comfortable rooms. Friendly staff at front desk and breakfast buffet. Great breakfast buffet. Special thanks and compliments to the breakfast staff, especially Samantha, Tofael and Peel. Can’t say enough about their friendliness and service to guests!!!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The corner rooms are nice the others are pretty average on par with most 4 star hotels. The bedding is very comfortable but the windows are not soundproof so you do get some street noise (I was on the 16th floor). Just FYI the king rooms only have showers (no tub) so if that is important be sure to reserve a room with two doubles. The lobby area is small in comparison to other large resort hotels in the area. It is mostly made up of a bar area. There is a nice coffee/snack counter on the same level, with amazing pastries and lunch items. The real selling point to this hotel is it's smack in the the middle of time square location. Fantastic if you plan on taking in some broadway shows. It is also a easy walk to Rockefeller center (NBC, Top of the rock, Radio City etc.)
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a quick overnight stay. Room was above average. It was pretty clean. Shower was great and service at the concierge desk was superb! We had a great corner room over looking Times Square. I would stay here again!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel via a package with BA Holidays and so resort fees etc were all included in the price. We chose this hotel because of its location and we were able to book a room overlooking TS. On our previous visits we have stayed just off 8th Avenue and TS but this was definitely a great choice, especially since I have mobility problems this hotel is right in the centre which for me was ideal and the room overlooking TS allows me to rest and at the same time have a view. We ate in the lounge a few times and the food was excellent although not a big menu the food on it satisfied both of us as vegetarians and our son who is a meat eater. This a busy hotel but we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a lift. There is also a coffee shop selling good coffee and fresh bakery items, cheese plates, and hot breakfast sandwiches only 1 day was there a bit queue but they put extra staff on and we were quickly served - the corn muffins and almond croissants are delicious. Would I stay there again yes in the blink of an eye and we are certainly looking to book again
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beware of the additional hidden fee, the resort fee $40/night. When you search this hotel it will show you a lower price, then at the very bottom small section you will see that the resort fee is $40/night. For us, who are staying 11 nights at this hotel. This is totally ridiculous. However, the managers are helpful. The manager is very helpful and great in providing solutions. The front desk is also a nice lady who is also very helpful in accommodating my needs. They also have a customer service to handle your matter quickly by phone. Basically, they have a great team here. If you want to use the pool a shower cap is needed, they don't sell it. but at the shop downstairs they sell it for $10. It is unfortunate that the hotel still practicing the hidden resort fee $40 charges/night. They have hidden charges for other things too. $7 for accepting a mail. $5 for using the computer for 5 minutes. It makes the hotels looks sneaky and tricky. Thus, I would not come back here again.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We moved here for our last night in New York.We had a great corner room on the 32nd Floor with views of Times Square.The room was spacious, very clean, well appointed and had the most comfortable of beds. However it’s worth noting that the bed was quite high and might not suit everyone.The room included a coffee machine, iron & ironing board and great blackout curtains (especially good given the light from Times Square). The room was well insulated from noise too.Although on the smaller size the bathroom had all that we needed but no bath but we didn’t want one.The only things the room could have benefited from was a long mirror for dressing in the bedroom / hallway and additional charging points.We would definitely stay at the Crowne Plaza again and can recommend it.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was great everything was top notch, felt like it was 1st class. Michelle at check in was very helpful at getting us a early check in for me and wife. She gave us the 5 star service plus. Hotel is close to everything!
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled to NYC to celebrate a friend's special birthday so a central location with a brand name was selected, the Crowne Plaza Times Square.Upon arrival the check in was swift and efficient and my credit card taken as a guarantee with a holding amount that would be released at the time we checked out.The room we had wasn't overlooking Times Square which we were happy about as when we went to our friend's room (that did overlook the square) the outside noise was apparent. I don't think you'll need to worry too much about noise keeping you awake (unless you're a REALLY light sleeper) as I didn't struggle at all - the alarm woke me every morning!The room was as expected of a Crowne Plaza; decent size, large king size bed, clean bathroom, TV, in-room safe, coffee maker, hangers in the wardrobe, iron with ironing board and bathroom amenities. There wasn't anything wrong with the room however I wasn't wowed either. I think this is because it's older decor; warmer browns/creams in colour rather than the fashionable silver/greys. I would say that the hotel could benefit from some TLC throughout as rooms and public areas are beginning to show signs of wear and tear.The location is what sells this hotel - literally step outside the hotel and you're in the centre of Times Square, overlooking the M & M's store. The front entrance is currently undergoing refurbishment so all access is via the rear doors where the cars/taxis drop off customers.When we checked out the bill showed the resort fee as $5 more than we were expecting. I pointed this out to the reception staff who rectified the bill. Our friends were also incorrectly charged and hadn't noticed the difference until we mentioned it.The only source of disappointment was the amount of time it took for the funds to be released back to my card - almost 2 weeks. This I find unreasonable as well as unexpected.All in all I would recommend this hotel however you'll pay a premium due to it's location.
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are IHG reward members from inception & using our points for reward stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan is our perfect choice & use of our points. for shows. Excellent location on Broadway between 48th & 49th -walking distance to Broadway Shows/Restaurants & Shopping. Our room on the 30th floor w/well appointed furnishings,spacious by NYC standards,corner room,perfect city views. Front Desk managerJuliet C. Helped us plan our Anniversary stay. We stay every year.In house restaurants are excellent fr breakfast/lunch-brunch to afternoon cocktails/lite or small bites to evening cocktails dinner/ after dinnerdrinks or just Grab & Go Highly recommend.Alwsys look forward to our next stay
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel. Great location in the city all the theaters were only a few blocks away. The hotel room is very clean and roomy. Very safe hotel security in hotel lobby. I would go back and recommend
hotelName:
1    Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our 2nd time at this hotel. First off, it is the perfect location to be able to walk to Broadway Shows. We also walked to the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, and Times Square is very close. There are so many restaurants and it is just a very easy location to get around. Subway stops are very convenient as well.The room was clean, though nothing special. The sink space in the bathroom is small as are the regular rooms, but that seems the case in NYC.We did have two minor issues, both resolved well by the hotel. One night we had put out our order to have breakfast served in our room, and we had it out by 9 p.m. and they say you have until 2 a.m. But, when our food did not arrive on time, we called and they had not picked up our order......and we had a time constraint....fortunately the manager allowed us to grab some food quickly in the breakfast buffet area without charge. The second problem was we had many items billed to us from the minibar. However, we never use the minibar and had not taken out any items. They somehow showed that we had used them, but did not charge us. While I don't understand the system because we did NOT use or take any of the items, I appreciated the removal of these things from our bill.We will definitely go back to this hotel and strongly encourage others to stay here!
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The AC was broken and rattled. It was fixed then broke an hour later. The internet did not work either. I can suffice to say in all my years on trip advisior and all my stays it was one of the most horrible experiences I have ever had with a hotel. I asked to change rooms. They refused. I called hotwire.. They then changed their story at the front desk. It was overpriced , dirty and awful.I had to sleep in 80 degree temps and I caught pneumonia and was hospitalized two days later. A dirty disapppointment and a huge let down. DO NOT STAY HERE !
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
