review_body: Used our Anniversary Free Night and also points to stay here in NYC over the 4th of July weekend and had a wonderful time. This hotel was in a super convenient location for heading up the street to a Broadway production one night, which was a first for me. Lots of fun! Street market nearby with dozens of vendors made for an exciting Saturday shopping expedition. Hotel itself had very helpful and accommodating staff, letting us check in several hours early and even gave us an upgraded corner room with views leading all the way to the Hudson river. What a clean lovely hotel, quiet and comfortable. We will definitely keep this one on our "Go again" list!!!! Thanks for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this hotel many times before and loved it. I even wrote a review a few years ago. I was traveling with 2 teenagers and we checked into the room around 8:00pm. I was tired so went to sleep and woke up in the morning to find they only gave us 1 bottle of shampoo and 1 bottle of conditioner. This I cannot understand. You have 3 people in a room why would you only give 1 bottle. The next day after they cleaned the room they only left towels for 2. I stopped at the main desk and asked for more and they sent someone up right away. I should not have to ask for this. I had booked a package that included breakfast. The first morning we went to the restaurant and it was very crowded waited about 15 mins for a table. Went to the buffet and much of the food was empty and all the fruit was gone. When returned to my table I flagged down a waiter to get coffee, that was the only time I saw him. We did make a second trip to the buffet and when we returned to the table they never cleared any plates. I never got a second cup of coffee. When I received the bill it stated parties of 5 or more 18% tip is automatically added. I was about to leave a 10% tip which I thought was generous for the level of service and I noticed they already added an 18% tip and I had no way to reverse it. Needless to say we did not go there for breakfast the next day. The location of the hotel is great, the rooms are spacious but the service this weekend was not good. I love this hotel so I hope they do something about the service level or I will be looking for a new go to hotel in NYC.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a layover and spent the night at IC Time Square. We had a king sky corner room. The hotel itself wasn't bad, but it was definitely not up to typical Intercontinental standard. Location: It's a block from Time Square, which obviously is super touristic area. It's convenient if you plan to catch a broadway show. But other than that it's not really a location to experience New York, and most locals avoid that area. For catching show: 5/5, for everything else 3/5.Room: Our Sky corner room was definitely very small, it's no where near the 325 square feet that it advertised as. More like under 200 sq ft. The view wasn't bad, but also nothing to brag about. The hall way and the room actually has a Holiday Inn feel rather than an Intercontinental Hotel feel. There's really nothing luxurious about the hotel. And the hotel provided only one robe and one slipper despite its a room for two and our reservation clear stated two people. Overall room is what expect from Holiday Inn, 3/5.Amenities: There's the lobby bar. I didn't use the fitness center. But there are fairly limited amenities offered. 3/5Service: Not terrible, but not warm either. Nothing Intercontinental about the service. Just mediocre. 3/5Overall it was a very average hotel. It's not awful, but it not great either. And the sky corner view room was definitely under whelming. There are many good hotels in NYC, I don't think this is one I would return.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: customers has to check out at 11am, can only check in after 3pm. So I assume they have 4 hours to clean the room. It doesn't seems four hours are enough for them because I saw someone's socks in the corner. so obvious that everyone can see it..so I really doubt if they really clean the room.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was great with good facilities but clothes storage was an issue. as we ended up leaving most of our clothes in the suitcases.Excellent for Broadway and general access to the city. the metro is the way to navigate the city.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’re staying at this hotel through next week and I just had the worst service at the hotel bar. I sat without a drink for 25 minutes. Then, when it arrived, the beer was frozen. I then waited 10-15 minutes for a replacement. The bar is very disorganized and poorly managed. Lots of staff, but nobody doing anything. I include the bar service in my overall hotel experience, so I can’t imagine myself, or my company, ever using this hotel again. It’s sad when management appears not to car. Unfortunately, I’m stuck here for awhile.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was perfect. The beds were amazingly comfortable ( I prefer and have a memory foam mattress at home and this was just as comfortable as home). The only complaint I have is that the air conditioner had an issue and the Internet was spotty. Overnight, me and my traveling companions, like the room kept very cool. With the AC set on 69 degrees Fahrenheit, the room temp would creep upwards. One night I was so warm I went and checked it to make sure it was set properly. It was - AC on set at 69 degrees. However the room temp was 74 degrees and the fan was not running! I decreased the temp setting to 67 to get the fan to kick back on and went back to bed. In the morning the room was freezing (which I didn't mind). The internet (free WiFi) was spotty and had connection issues some of the time, but there was a HUGE event going on in town that weekend as to possibly have overrun the system. So, be that as it may, everything else was so far above par that I couldn't even be upset. Especially we LOVED the restaurant and bar area. Nick was our waiter and he was FANTASTIC! I loved getting to know him and after seeing him for 5 straight days I now have him as a lifelong Facebook friend. When I come back to NYC, I will definitely be staying at this hotel and will check in on my buddy NICK!!!
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were staying for four nights as a family. When we arrived at the hotel around. 23.00 it was obviously a busy night for them. Our room had a humming noise, and we got upgraded immediately because they didnt have any other rooms left. We were met with great kindness and help, even though there were many rude guests there. Thanks to the amazing manager. We also got a new room the day after with a beautiful view and complimentary breakfast. All inn all the service was fantastic, would definately reccomend this hotel and be back
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel. Staff all very helpful and friendly. Some wifi problems and in room film didn't work but everything else is 5 star. Food excellent but a little pricey. Room service fantastic. Highly recommended
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found the hotel convenient and very nice, the air conditioning in my room did not work well and the inside handle to the bathroom door was missing, but the room was very nice, bed was super comfortable and the staff and house keeping were wonderful.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a hotelier by experience and was very impressed with the attention level of the staff to any issue from check in to check out. The property is located close enough to Times Square to allow you to enjoy all that geography has to offer but just far enough away to allow you to sleep without the light "noise" of that famous intersection. Tip of the hat to Hotel Manager Tim Rangi.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Originally we checked into a hotel several blocks away that was sold to us as a 4 star+ on a well know hotel deal website. It was smelly, dirty and rundown past the lobby. While fighting for a refund I called the InterContinental knowing they would be quality. I was so thankful to get their last room, spectacular service, clean comfy beds and decent restaurant with great drinks. I would stay here again if visiting NYC/Times Square/Broadway.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this hotel! They are always so accommodating and the hotel is always such a relaxing place to be. The entrance to the E train is right outside the door, and you are just a few blocks away from Times Square and most theaters, as well as some of the best restaurants. This is always my go-to place when visiting NYC.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a decent place to stay when traveling to NYC. Great location make it convent when hanging around Broadway. Just be prepared to encounter lots of foot traffic around the hotel.Clean room and friendly staff make it a pleasant stay. Not the cheapest but one of the nicest.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well placed hotel probably a bit more expensive due to location but big rooms with good sized picture window. Nice large comfey beds, good shower helpful staff. If your looking for a bit of luxury this is the place.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location in Times Square is convenient. View was amazing, and room was reasonably comfortable.However, a couple of things marred our visit. First, my wife had to work for a couple of days and was doing so from the room. One day an IT tech walked right in, without knocking, to "change a modem" or something. That was pretty disconcerting, to say the least.Also, they seem to have forgotten to provide me with my folio on checkout. The staff member in the lobby took my room key and assured me that it was being emailed, but it never came. I had to spend half an hour on the phone, being bounced from call center to call center (the hotel front office never picked up) and still don't know that I accomplished what I need to to get the details of what I'm being charged.Not the best business practice.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Intercontinental in the theater district for two nights and never needed a car. The hotel is clean, quiet, and very comfortable. Our bathroom had a huge shower that was handicapped accessible. We dealt with very friendly helpful staff. The breakfast buffet was a little pricey but everything else was great. We walked to two theaters and all our meals and took the subway to walk the High Line. Easy.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was excellent, the staff helped out with a special check-in request. Fantastic!The hotel is in a great location for those that want to enjoy midtown and the theater district.Food was good, room very clean and all amenities were top notch.Be sure to shop for price, it is not inexpensive$$$
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed 2 nights. The room was cozy and pleasant. We would recommend this hotel to others. It is in walking distance to Times Square and many stores and restaurants. The front desk attendants were polite and helpful.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was spacious and very lovely. The bed was extremely comfortable. Great view of several theaters and much of midtown. Excellent service and amenities. The room was nice and cool on a very hot, humid day
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted to be in the theater district and the Intercontinental was well located. Our king room was 350 sqft which was nice and larger than many hotel rooms in Mid-Town New York. We were on the 36th floor and and it was very quiet. From the front desk, to the maids to the bell men, the service was wonderful and delivered with a cheery disposition. Service to the room was quick and efficient. Cleanliness excellent. Comfortable bed. Like in most hotels in New York, the prices for the mini-bar, daily service fee, room service and all the amenities are high. I had a pair of pants dry cleaned for a business meeting at a tab $35 although it was on a weekend to be fair. We would go back to the InterContinental and recommend it to others.We were there on a business and theater trip combined.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first stay at the InterContinental New York Times Square and it was a great experience. The room product is very nice and comfortable. The entire facility was very clean. It has a nicely equipped gym with dumb-bells, a few weight machines, plus cardio equipment. The only complaint I have which is insignificant, was the card reader in the elevators was difficult to work and the breakfast buffet is very expensive. Neither of these will preclude me staying again. Overall a great experience.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would suggest adding mirrors for women going out on the town. It was impossible to see whole outfit in bathroom mirror. Also, important to make sure staff restocks mini bar daily. Rooms where clean and well appointed.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well placed hotel a stone’s throw from the craziness of Time Square and the groovy ambience and eateries of Hell’s Kitchen. Very friendly and attentive staff. Nothing seemed too much trouble. Room well appointed and impeccably clean. All expectations met and exceeded!
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family trip to NYC. Great location 1 block from Times Square. Right next to subway station. Our room had a great view of 8th avenue, but did have traffic noise even on the 26th floor. Hotel was very nice and I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: IC Times Square excellent location for Theater goers and Hells Kitchen foodie crowd. Busy hotel, yet no wait at elevators. The breakfast buffet is varied and includes thick bacon, delicious vegetable Asian Dumplings and luscioua fresh berries and melon. Excellent choice.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location in New York, with ready access to Broadway and the Theater District. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The bellmen are always ready to help with luggage or getting a cab. The staff at the Ambassador Check In desk are also very friendly and helpful. We have stayed at this hotel many times and always enjoy our stays!
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I always thought the Intercontinental was an upmarket luxury experience. Sadly this is the worst experience I’ve had this year with a hotel chain. The list of woes:- No rooms avail at checkin early is fine, but forgetting to call me when the room is ready isn’t cool. - if you breathe on an item in the mini bar such as a small Fiji water they charge you. By the way that small Fiji is $10.45 which is about $2 per sip. - there is no lobby to speak of as the only place to sit is there restaurant/drinks area. If you happen to bring a bagel for you daughter to eat then they’ll shoo you out. - phone calls are $10 per minute. Don’t use the in room phone. - bathtub doesn’t drain - full of hair. - the view of the backyard mold garden is pretty epic. The front deck did remove all the breathing charges and phone calls, but an indelible impression of unwantedness pervades this shocking bad nyc hotel.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very professional service. Nice to have a bar and restaurant in the hotel. It’s a very crowded neighborhood. Room was very comfortable. Good light and big shower! Bed was very comfortable. All the amenities including coffee in room!
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not only is this a very great location in Times Square. But we found the staff goes above and beyond in guest satisfaction. The room we had was good sized for most rooms in NYC. It was clean and well serviced every day by a very attentive housekeeping staff. Along with a nightly tun down . Also Charles a Bellman went out of his way to help us with directions, and even took us to the subway to help us get our subway card. Kudos to him and the entire staff.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: IHG is my first choice for overseas hotel. But, the standards aren’t the same! Prior to this, my last stay was at IHG Osaka. It was simply great! Here at New York, you don’t get the same kind of politeness and friendliness you would expect as a tourist. Rooms were alright, clean. The service bell guys outside were much more cheerful and friendly as compared to the staffs inside the hotel! Check-in and out were swift. I think they should have the room doors that are slow to close. You would hear loud slamming of the doors if you did not hold on to it! I would loved to see more smiles and hello made! Hotel is within Time Square, therefore, it’s super convenient.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel for exploring New York. It was close to the subway if you don’t like walking but really easy to get up or down town from here. The rooms were a good size and clean. There was a minor issue at check-in about payment method but was resolved by check-out. The concierge was great providing some good recommendations for places to eat. The gym was also well equipped with no difficulty getting a machine, even in peak hours! The intercontinental was a great value for money hotel.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very nice and the rooms had everything we needed throughout our stay. The location was great since it was just a couple blocks from Times Square. The rooms were very clean and well kept.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is very convenient albeit noisy. However, the front desk staff is unfriendly and not helpful. I ordered in-room breakfast and the toast is burnt! For a 5-star hotel, this is more than unacceptable.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was very nice. View of the city out my window was spectacular. Front desk personnel very courteous. Breakfast was very good (this is the only meal I ate at the hotel). My only complaint, if you can call it that, is that there is very little seating in your lobby. As a group tour leader, your lobby was our meeting place for our outings, and it was difficult to wait as a group without adequate seating.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel for 7 days with a upgraded room which was nice.Our room was on the 4th floor facing the front of the hotel the noise level was terrible from midnight onwards you had garbage trucks people shouting and fighting then you had the blasting of car horns.There was also a school staying the last weekend and you had banging of doors running along corridors and shouting at midnight and 7am when they got their wake up call,we couldn’t even move in the lobby for all the teenagers sitting with their lunch waiting on their bus spoiled the holiday
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a quick walk from Penn Station to the hotel. Staff was warm and gracious and willing to help in any way. Rooms are spacious and clean and bedding was lovely and I'm a sheet snob! Would stay there again!
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have s pent a week in april in this hotel. Ithas a pretty good location next to Times Square and Broadway. The rooms are clean,quiet and well equipped, Breakfast is good, but expensive. Subway station is next to the hotel right on the corner, and the Porth authority terminal is 2 minutes away. Times Square is within 5 minutes accessable by walk.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased at the room sizes,cleanliness, and the Staff. Not being from NYC and having no idea where to stay, we researched where to stay and were concerned about areas to stay and room sizes and cleanliness. The Intercontinental was great on all concerns. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the Intercontinental and got a great rate. It is well located, spacious modern room, helpful staff. The beds are very very comfortable. The only negative I experienced was that my room rate included an amenities fee of $30 per day which afforded a $20 credit. We used the credit at breakfast and inadvertently ran up an $80 breakfast bill. A buffet was the only option but if you take certain items it upcharges significantly from continental to full breakfast charge. Be sure to read the menu carefully and ask questions. Also, not all rates seem to include this amenities fee. So check it it out as you compare rates and choices.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean and recently renovated. Daily Destination fee was $30 and REQUIRED-really was just a way for the hotel to cost an additional $30 more per day than the rate we booked. We tried to use at least $20 worth of the food in the room but just a ploy. Very close to the subway & Port Authority bus terminal so lots of scary homeless people around but we didn’t use those services so not a plus for us.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We don't get to the City often, but when we do, it's go, go, go. All the more reason to have a comfortable place to unwind and sleep. I can honestly say my bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 1 night on business. It’s an excellent centrally locates hotel in Mid Town West a block from Times Square and right next to the ACE metro lines as well as 10 other lines within a block. There is a direct Newark airport bus that leaves from the Port Authority. Check in was efficient although check out was a bit crowded. There is a resort fee with each night that allows for $20 towards dining among others.Room service is efficient and the breakfast service (full buffet) was fair for $35 pp.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very bad services. room dirty and not filling with all equipments. the staff very rude and not helpful. charging extra amounts. very old and cleft bath stuff. take very long time to serving you. the worst intercontinental hotel I lived in.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I tend to judge hotels by their workout facilities. There are weight machines,free weights, several treadmills, three ellipticals, three stationary bikes (1 recumbent), a spin bike, and towels, water, sanitizing cloths. This is a clean, comfortable hotel with nice staff.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the rooms are very comfortable, one cannot help but get the impression that the hotel is nothing more than a building with comfortable rooms in the middle of Times Square and an absolute lack of hospitality. And I’m calling out the reception staff who always seem to be either bored of their jobs or beyond the customer... I mean honestly the porters are doing a much much better job than you guys. No ‘can do’ attitude that one expects from a hotel at this price point and supposed reputation. But what was really surprising to me was how an international hotel chain such as intercontinental does not cater what so ever to people like myself who have food intolerances. Come on management, it’s 2019.. the buffet breakfast is reminiscent of a three star hotel from the 1980’s. Options are very limited to say the least. No alternatives to dairy. No gluten free options. No vegan options other than fruits. No variation from day to day. But what really ticked me off is the unsanitary situation where they have a small fridge with smoked salmon, hard boiled eggs and chicken/beef cold-cuts and butter all together in the same place with only one serving spoon for everything. Pretty gross. The fridge had lots of fallen bits and pieces from the days before. More care can be taken in terms of hygiene in that area.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in the intercontinental time square hotel recently. We booked the hotel based on its location and the number of reviews it had. I must say we were thrilled, the location is a perfect distance from the different tourist attractions which NYC has to offer. The staff are extremely helpful. The hotel is beautifully presented, clean and tidy at all times. An added benefit to this hotel was the comfort of the beds, after long days walking around the city, and shopping on 5th Avenue, it was perfect coming back to the hotel room and relaxing in the comfiest bed around. My husband and I would both recommend this hotel and will be booking again here for our next visit.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were lucky to get a last minute flight and a last minute deal at the Intercontinental. We travel to NYC a few times a year for business but this was a sudden 30th anniversary celebration. The front desk is beautiful and our greeter gave us room 2205 which was just lovely. The food in the bar, and the drinks, are a bit pricey but everything we ate was excellent. The front door staff, rooms, hotel maids, everyone we met made us feel welcome. It was a lovely experience and our first time at this hotel as we are gold members at other chains. We would definitely go back!
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front lobby, Stinger restaurant pretty average. Service people especially banquet staff were excellent; food was very good. Concierge staff helpful but lacking that "can-do" attitude prevalent in the Midwest, West Coast, Orient.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fine hotel located very close to Times Square, yet on a reasonably quiet though busy street. My room was large and comfortable, with plenty of outlets and a strong WiFi signal. If you need to be in Midtown West, this is a very good choice.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was made to feel most welcome from curbside on my arrival all the way through to check in, and was treated like royalty my entire stay.... and untill checkout and again curbside upon leaving.Rained heavily and the umbrella loan was a special touch!Loved the decor: modern chic. Location was fantastic. I shall return ASAP.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is so clean and nice. The view from our room (35th FL) was so beautiful, especially in the night time. I love their delicious breakfast.- so many delicious choice for you to enjoy the first thing in the morning. Great services and nice stay. I definitely will stay at this hotel for my next NYC trip. Thanks.
hotelName:
2    InterContinental New York Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this property because we were using Marriott points AND because it was one of the few hotels that has two queen beds in a room. We couldn't reserve the two queens when making the reservation, but we called 24 hours before we arrived and they were able to secure us a room with 2 Queens and a beautiful view of the Empire States Building and on the 15th floor which was quiet. I've stayed in NYC before, and this room was so much quieter than a room that was much more expensive. We were pleased with our room. The bathroom was very small but the shower was very good size. I appreciated how clean the bathroom was and didn't show signs of wear. Housekeeping did a pretty good job. We had one day where the room was cleaned, she took all the towels and didn't replace them. No big deal. I didn't care for the frosted glass bathroom door. But we made it work with wrapping paper to cover it. Location was great! We found the 34th Street/Herald Sq subway to be the closest. But overall it was a very central location. We felt very safe walking at all hours. We were surprised though that security wasn't too tight. I expected a doorman or even that we'd have to use our key in the evening hours to go up the elevator to our room. Not sure what keeps people off the street from coming in. At least we didn't have any issues. Also, elevators were fast and never a problem. Breakfast was fine. We've stayed at many other Marriott properties that have signs that say if you're gluten free they have other cereal or bread options, just ask. All in all, I'd definitely recommend this property and would stay here again.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a family of six in two rooms. The hotel was very convenient and central to all of the locations we wanted to visit while in NYC. The rooms were very clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Only negatives were minor... rooms could have been bigger, e.g. at the price of nearly $320/night we could have been on a nice cruise ship and meals and entertainment included. The breakfast, which was included was O.K., nothing elaborate, but the size of the dining area was too small for the hotel and the hours during the week could have been longer than just 9 a.m. Other than tat, we were not really disappointed.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked late and stayed on points so didn’t have great expectations, but we really couldn’t find fault. A friendly welcome, with lollies, a clean and good sized room and a decent free breakfast. A real plus was how quiet the room was too. Having stayed in 20+ hotels in NYC this was definitely the quietest room. Thoroughly recommended therefore.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this property twice with my most recent stay in from May. I chose this hotel for the location understanding that it is a limited service hotel. But it's a good value with the complimentary breakfast. Some of the in room amenities include mini refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave. Great for keeping drinks cold and re-heating food from take out. The breakfast is a great value for leisure and business travelers. The staff during my recent stay were very friendly and accommodating, even assisted to store my bag over night. This is a limited service hotel with no frills; rooms are basic but comfortable and clean. Can't beat the location.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room and beds were clean and fine. The free breakfast and coffee were good too. Helpful front desk and convenient midtown location are also positives. Criticisms: 1. The frosted glass bathroom door doesn't afford enough privacy. If somebody is in there sitting or toweling off - the person in the main room will know. 2. There isn't enough lighting. 3. There's no closet (in my room) and the armoire was not sufficient to put our bags and stuff in.But good value for money and I would stay again for that.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is situated in a great location in Manhattan. our hotel room looked over the Empire State Building which was an amazing view. The hotel itself was extremely clean and the maid service was good. The rooms are a little basic looking but have everything you need ; Safe, mini-fridge and microwave. The breakfast buffet was not very good as there was not much choice. The customer service and reception were extremely helpful and kinda with our queries and even gave our free lollipops!
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No frills is right. Yes, you can get a good deal here and the location is OK depending where you want to go. Trains are all a 5-10 minute walk, no subway really close. You can walk to Macy’s and the Empire State Building easily. Times Square is about a mile plus. The rooms are small which is expected in NYC, they are also clean and relatively up to date. The full length mirror is inside of the closet/armoire door. My real problem is with some of the basics they do not offer like umbrellas (important in the Spring), just tiny ones to buy, and water in the lobby. I can’t remember a hotel that hasn’t offered free water bottles or a bubbler of some sort in the lobby. Nothing. And there’s really no lobby to speak of, a few seats and end tables, no New York feel, nowhere to lounge and gather. Probably because most of the lobby is taken up with the breakfast space. I did appreciate the free WiFi. Key issues, they didn’t have any when we arrived, had to wait several hours. Plumbing not great.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I believe that this hotel was a good value for our money. I’d done my homework so I had an idea what to expect. I know the rooms would be on the smaller side and the bathroom would be small (they were) and that the bathroom might be not far from the end of the bed and might have a frosted glass door (it did). For me, traveling with a 16-year-old son, having a breakfast included was a requirement. While not a ton of variety, we found the breakfast adequate for our needs. All items were fully stocked and the area was kept clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. One day I went down to get breakfast to take back up. I asked if they had trays for this purpose. I was told no but that there was a tray in the room I could use. I decide to try and take food up anyway. While gathering food, the staff brought me a makeshift cardboard box tray to use and even gave me tips on how to best fit my items. The location was great as we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The only downside was one morning one of the elevators was down. The elevator was working again by that afternoon. Since there were just two of us, this hotel worked well for us. If I were bringing the whole family, I’d upgrade to a nearby hotel that had larger rooms.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Customer trip - great location right by penn station and the garden. Great view of the Empire Stare building. Great breakfast spread. Very friendly staff. parking next door and a great discount from the hotel.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Free breakfast, excellent location! Friendly staff. Rooms aren't very big but probably bigger than a lot of them in NYC. Price was fair as well. You could easily walk to all the tourist locations. Only a few blocks from time square. Macy's is right around the corner. Subway spots close at 34 and 42st.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is pretty basic but was perfect for our stay in New York. Location is great for getting around and the rooms were comfortable. Breakfast was ok nothing flashy. If you like a fancy plush hotel this probably isnt the place for you but if you dont spend a massive amount of time in you room and want somewhere clean and comfortable to use a base you will like this hotel.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Looking for a new venue after our Airbnb cancelled meant we were frantically trying to find somewhereLuckily this place turned up on our search and what a stroke of luckWith the Empire State Building 2 blocks away the location is perfect for everything - you’ve got subway connections within walking distance and broadway is just round the cornerThe beds are immense! You just sink into them and drift off, the bathrooms well equipped and clean and even a little sofa you can relax on with the large TV swivelling round to any angleThe breakfast options give you a great start to the day - so all in all recommend this to anyone!
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked in and it was really pleasant. My room was freezing, so I called down for some blankets. After about a half hour, I got one, but it was not very thick, so I called down for another one, and they brought me a comforter and another blanket. Finally I was warm, so I called down to thank them, and the person at the front desk said it was a one minute fix in terms of resetting the air con unit. So they fixed that. Loved the cleaning lady this am who offered to do my room while I was at the gym. Then i get back from work, and there was no shampoo in my room. No one answered the phones, so I went down and met a VERY RUDE AND AGGRESSIVE man in the "off room" not the front desk who said they were very busy and he would have to radio my request. I don't care if you are having a bad day, you don't act like that. The front entrance is out of commission and one elevator doesn't work. Probably for maintenance. I stay here a LOT for work travel and this is the first time so many things have gone pear shaped. To the extent that someone just randomly said to me "nothing seems to work in this hotel". I love this place and hope this was just a random occurrence.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amenities not up to Marriott standards. Breakfast was OK but left unattended. Rude Staff that does not know the meaning of hospitality. Location 3 blocks from subway station. We enjoyed NYC but wouldn't recommend this hotel when there are so many to choose from.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Here for a night. Checkin very friendly, quick, plus easy care of car thro' valet parking. Nice clean rooms, comfortable beds and precise temp control. Breakfast was average, given they seemed to be running out of stuff on a busy saturday morning. Very friendly staff overall
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with our family of 4. The rooms are a great size for 2 people but just a bit tight for a family of four (2 teenagers). The room was quite, beds comfortable, and everything was clean! Breakfast was yummy! Be sure to go early to breakfast because the dining area gets crowded. As others have stated, the elevators were slow, not really a problem. The staff we encountered including front desk, maintenance, and housekeeping were all very friendly and polite! Big plus! Nice seating outside but it was too cold for us to enjoy. We loved this location. Very close to Bryant Park, which we love, and within close proximity to Times Square. We are platinum members and travel extensively. This is a comfortable Springhill Suites level hotel that is priced right! We will be staying here again!
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a double queen. View is the best thing about this hotel. Room is ok size for nyc. Good heat/ac you control yourself. Good noise insulation from other rooms. Bathroom set up was poor. Frosted door meant anytime someone went to use the bathroom at night the entire room would light up. Tub did not drain well, rough towels (only 3 provided). Only shampoo and conditioner supplies (no body wash or cream). The worst part about this hotel is the elevators. One wasn’t working during my stay so my choices were walk up several flights of stairs or wait 20 min. This is not acceptable. Breakfast was good. Lots of choices. Overall I would not stay here again.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough good things about this place and it staff. One small story. I left my purse in the lobby area one night around 11:00 PM. It was in a public area and many guests and staff would have walked past it. We discovered it was missing early the next morning and feared it was stolen from our room. Turns out, one of the early arriving staff people, Crystal, saw it and turned it in. In addition, this hotel is within walking distance to Rockefeller Center and some theaters. The front desk folks are kind and professional.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Great locagion shoft walk to Broadway and fifth aveStaff very friendly and professional when we arrived. Room had great beds and pillows. Shower good rooms clean and the size expected for a city centre hotel.Breakfast was bonus again good staff working within
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This turned out to be perfectly situated for us off of 5th Avenue. We were able to get to many of our destinations walking or a short walk to the subway. The rooms are a little larger than most NYC hotels in this price segment. The staff was very friendly. Delaney who checked us in was informative about the area and efficient with transactions. The breakfast crew kept the food stocked and space clean. Highly recommend this property.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where should I start? The staff at this location made my long term stay as comfortable as possible. They knew my name,took care of my packages and took care of any issues immediately. The rooms are a little smaller than what I'm used to, but it's located near 34th street and a quick walk from Times Square, so it was doable. They are plenty of restaurants nearby and you will get plenty of exercise. Thank you again to all the staff. You guys rock!!
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came over from UK just before Christmas as we were getting married in NYC. They were very accommodating and moved us to a room with a view of the Empire State Building. The room had 2 queen beds in and comfortable. On our wedding day the receptionist took some nice photos of us in reception. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel as there is so much to see in the city. The breakfast was adequate to get us going but the amount of single use plastic and other material, which was disposed of in recycling bins, I doubt it is recycled as it is covered in food. Proper crockery and cutlery would have been better. But on the whole a very pleasant stay
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel right near Herald Square. The rooms are a little small but they are designed so well they feel much bigger and have everything you could need for your stay. Our room was so quiet we did not hear anything all night . Everybody who works here was very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is perfect - it is about a 10-15 walk to just about anything in Midtown. The included breakfast is good but crowded. Our room was nice. Two double beds with an awesome view of the Empire State Building. We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed at this hotel each December for the past three years. The location is perfect for most activities – Macy’s is two blocks south, Times Square is about 5 blocks north, Bryant Park (with the Holiday market and ice skating rink) is only 3 blocks away and Rockefeller Center is about 12 blocks away. Also, the subway station at Harold Square (2 blocks) allows easy access to the B/D/F/M and N/Q/R/W lines. Penn Stations is about 4 blocks away.The hotel is a relatively new property – rooms are small but efficient with a separate desk area. Rooms include a small refrigerator and microwave.Breakfast is included and includes eggs and a protein (seems to alternate between sausage and bacon) and includes various juices and breads.The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful – maid was wonderful and always checked to see if we needed anything.Will definitely stay again next year.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed 1 night this past Saturday for a Christmas visit. Cannot beat the location since it's short walk to Macy's (to see Santa), Time Sq, and Bryant Park. Being right on 5th Ave, we took subway up to Central Park and walked our way back down, checking out all the window displays and decorations. One can get here easily from all airports via Train (from Newark) or Subway (from JFK or LGA) for cheap. I took 3 nieces with me and the free breakfast definitely saved time, money and headache in the morning. We were in Room 1605 and the view of Empire State Building was smack in front of us!Front desk staffs were nice even when swamped with people. We were able to store our bags since rooms weren't available for early check in.Room size is above average for a big city hotel. There is a mini fridge and a microwave which is great for leftovers. One thing I like to point out, and I know it sounds a little silly: the bathroom door is a barn style slide door with a frosted glass in the middle. You wouldn't think much of it until you have 3 kids who giggled and laughed because if you look hard enough, you can see the silhouette of the person inside the bathroom. Meaning if you are traveling with someone you don't know well, or if you really like total privacy while using bathroom and you are sharing room, considered yourself warned. We ended up buying Christmas wrapping paper and taped it over the door since one of the girls were having anxiety knowing others can "see" her using the toilet. As a Category 5 hotel, it's 35K points to redeem for a night. Or in my case I used my annual free night from Marriott credit card for this stay. Definitely worth the free night since room was going for over $300 a night during this time of the year.Great stay. In fact I think I stayed here before with my mom. Definitely will stay here again!
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice mid priced hotel in New York City. Within walking distance to Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Empire State Building and restaurants. Small room but clean and comfortable. Good breakfast and friendly service. Recommend Billy Joel concert at the Garden...he still rocking
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent mid priced hotel in midtown, just off 5th Avenue. Close to many attractions. Rooms are very clean and quiet. Staff very friendly. Hot and cold breakfast included..always very busy. Can't fault the hotel.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty good for the price, no major complaints but nothing was great either. Location is convenient; The hotel is new and clean; rooms are tight but have a work area/desk, small fridge and microwave. I’ve stayed at two other SpringHills, however, in California and this one was so cramped that calling it “all-suite” is simply a misnomer. It’s an averaged sized room for nyc at best.Why 4 stars? The downstairs main area also feels tight and cramped. There are lots of boxes behind the check-in station, and the walkways and tv watching area feel like they are shoehorned in.Staff was fine - but there didn’t appear to be anything extra provided to Marriott platinum guests - and they didn’t seem particularly cheerful and welcoming like many Courtyards by Marriott (who always seem to have exceptionally good people for some reason)Breakfast is average for a courtyard/Spring Hill type hotel, although they did have scrambled eggs and bacon or sausage every morning. All in all, it’s fine and you’ll be fine staying here. The main reason to do so is price : Renaissance Midtown, Marriott Marquis are better if price is close. I do like it better than Residence Inn Midtown which needs renovation. Next time I am going to look at Marriott Vacation Club Pulse next door as well.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Springhill Suites Midtown is located minutes from the Empire State Building, Times Square and Penn Station. It is not a huge hotel and is missing things like a restaurant that you would typically find in a larger hotel but it is very comfortable and very well located. The staff was friendly and helpful, giving us directions and dining suggestions, and the hotel has wifi, computer access, a small gym and a good-enough FREE breakfast. In New York, that will save you $25 per for sure!There are lots of restaurants nearby of all types and price levels. The room was clean, well supplied and bigger than one you might usually expect in a mid-range New York hotel. All in all, we had a great stay and would recommend the Springhill Suites to anyone.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for seven nights and were very pleased with our stay. The location was great. Easy walking distance to Herald Square, Empire State Building, Bryant Park. Also walkable to Broadway and Times Square. Excellent housekeeping and professional front desk. Included a full complement of breakfast items but very crowded.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at this hotel while attending the New York City Wine and Food Tasting Festival the weekend of October 13 and 14, 2018. This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel for this event. We arrived at the hotel shortly after noon, and we were greeted by the very polite front desk staff. We were assigned Room 1901, an Executive Suite facing the Empire State Building. This is the same room we stayed in on our last visit. My wife and I had no problems sleeping that night, as the bed was very comfortable and the noise level was non existent. The hotel is not located on a busy thoroughfare, so this contributes to the low noise level. The location of the hotel is ideal, as it is within easy walking distance of New York's main attractions. For example, Rockefeller Center and Saint Patrick's Cathedral are a 15 minutes walk from the hotel. Times Square is a 10 minutes walk, and Herald Square is only a 5 minute walk. A free breakfast is included in the lobby area, and there is an ample amount of food to pick from. Our only complaint is the basic internet speed, which is very slow. Therefore, it is recommended visitors upgrade to the high speed internet, which is free for Marriott Rewards members. The hotel allowed us to store our luggage free of charge after we checked out, so we attend the Wine and Food Festival. My wife and I will be returning to New York City on Christmas Day, and we have already reserved the same room at this hotel.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights in early Oct.Check in was quick (by Michael). We used mobile app, and Michael was very friendly / helpful.Room was average size, by Manhattan standards. Weird bathroom door -- sliding door with translucent panel (not for families/companions that are "forma").Lots of noise in room from elevator (kept us up much of the night), but we saw elevator repair person on Sunday, so hopefully that fixed the problem).Breakfast was average.Location was very good -- close to times square, subways, etc.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With the need of a hypoallergenic rooms, I always call ahead and 9 times out of 10 the hotel is clueless when we get there and have so scramble to prepare the room on the spot. When we arrived in New York and checked in, they actually had the note in their system and already had our room set up to fit our needs. The room was a decent size for New York. Had a king bed, glass enclosed shower and everything was clean. You can tell it’s been renovated. All the staff was really friendly and ready to help whenever needed. Location was great - walking distance from Times Square and to a subway station. We chose to walk to most places and it was great to find some local gems. Next time we go to New York we will definitely stay at this location again.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at this NYC hotel and slept well here. However, I did call ahead and also put into my profile that there were to be no feathers in the room due to allergies. When I arrived there were feather pillows on the bed. This was corrected but it would have been better if they were never there to begin with. The modern updated room is very small and compact and there isn't much room to move in the bathroom with little counter space. This was fine for a solo traveler but would have been tight with more guests staying in the room. No body lotion was provided. The A/C worked well during very hot weather. The staff was very friendly. The complimentary breakfast was in a small space and always had a line. I may consider staying here again if the price is right. The location was great and I was able to walk to and from Penn Station and the Times Square area.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed a great stay. Attractive, clean, well maintained hotel. Comfortable beds. Good shower pressure. Plentiful complementary breakfast. Valet parking. Great rooftop bar next door facing Empire State Bldg. Convenient location. Trevor, at the front desk, was spot-on with all his dining recommendations- very helpful! Friendly service from everyone.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Springhill Suites Midtown Manhattan from 09/01-09/05 and had a great stay. The staff is super friendly, even at midnight when we were checking in. The complimentary breakfast buffet had basic breakfast food items, eggs, sausage, bread, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, juices, milk and coffee. It was good and plentiful, and saves you money! The buffet staff was also very friendly greeting us with a cheerful "good morning" when we arrived to eat. There's not an abundance of seating at the breakfast area but we never had trouble finding seats. The room was clean and a decent size, the bed and pillows were comfy. We did use the self laundry, there is just one washer and 2 dryers, we were given complimentary laundry soap when we exchanged dollars for quarters at the front desk. The location of this hotel cannot be beat if you are a tourist, close to Times Square, subway stations and great restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to be back again someday.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two blocks north of the Empire State Building. Our room was the cool 12 floor green bump out window. Plenty of room and beautiful decorations. The front desk folks were friendly. Big breakfast area to play games and meet with friends in the evening. Loved the valet parking!
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to town for a concert at MSG so this hotel was a perfect headquarters for us.Located on 37th between 5th and 6th, it's about 8 blocks from Penn Station/MSG so super easy to get around.The room was comfortable and well furnished, albeit comparatively small compared to other places, but it is NYC. We were just sleeping there after all.The included breakfast was essentially standard issue for a Springhill; so, good food, plenty of choices, and a comfortable place to sit.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to say the room is tiny, the bathroom as well. Very clean with comfy beds. The elevators were slow and usually packed when you do get it. However this hotel served its purpose to me as I wanted to be within walking distance of all the major attractions. From my room I could see the Empire State Building ... photo attached. Staff were very helpful; knowing we were tourists, they recommended restaurants and helped us to plan our walking tour.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros1. Breakfast is "free" or complimentary2. Clean room3. Bed is comfortable 4. Gym is clean and equipment is in good conditionCons1. Bathroom is so tiny I dont even know where to put my toiletries. It's essentially a half bath with a shower. 2. Elevators take forever! There are only 2 to service the building. You're better off taking the stairs....you'll wait for a good 5 to 10 minutes during high peak elevator times.3. Breakfast options are ok. Not much variety for a healthy eater.4. What I didnt like is they purposely dont give you body lotion when they clean your room...CHEAP! You have to request it. Never been to a marriott that actively tries to save and cut corners like this. Makes me wonder what else they are cutting on...Anyways I wouldnt stay here again their are better options.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean rooms comfoetable beds friendly and very helpful staff and a good variety for breakfastNice place to stay when in Manhatten within walking distance to so many places of interest Would definity would recommend this hotel to my friends
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was tricked by the word Suites in the name. These were not Suites. These were tiny rooms with small double beds. No place for luggage, no drawers and ate your bathroom. They say it’s a room for four but we were two normals sized people and it was tight. Our air conditioning never worked despite multiple attempts to fix it and it was uncomfortably hot in the room (the hotel was booked, no other rooms available), and the air conditioning leaked water so the rug was wet. We did get small compensation for the problem, Marriott Points, but it didn’t make up for the hot, sleepless nights. The included Breakfast was always too crowded to get a table or to even get to the food so we gave up and ate down the street. The staff was always very nice and helpful, especially the electrician who worked on the air conditioning. And we had a spectacular view of the Empire State Building. I don’t think I’d stay here again or recommend it to friends.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My son and I stayed here first week of August. Location is great with a 5 minute walk to the 34th St-Herald Square subway station where you can easily get to anywhere in the city. Our room was clean and surprisingly quiet but small but that is expected in NYC. We stayed in room 1509 and had a view of the Empire State Building which was awesome! Breakfast is included but is only served until 9am. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in Manhattan but at a reasonable rate with a convenient location. Front desk staff was extremely helpful with directions on how to get places in NYC.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 2 nights mid-week in July. Great location, can walk from Penn Station or Grand Central with bags. Lobby staff helpful with subway questions and check in. Room large (for NYC) and clean. Bathroom great. Breakfast also good. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked and paid ( in full and in advance) for 5 nights at this hotel in mid June (via Expedia). We received an email confirmation the day before that arrival at around 8pm was fine. On arrival ( from Cancun ) were were told the hotel was overbooked and could not accommodate us. No explanation and no sympathy . We were directed to a phone to contact Expedia to arrange alternative accommodation. Expedia blamed the hotel and the hotel Expedia. After more than 3 hours standing at the front desk talking to the Expedia call centre in Asia we finally got a booking ( at Expedia's expense ) at the Hilton Times Square. Fortunately, the front desk staff there were extremely helpful ( it took another hour on the phone to Expedia to confirm arrangements ) and their professional attitude was a complete contrast to the indifference shown by the Spring hill suites staff. Overbooking seems to be a problem in Manhattan mid week as there were 2 other guests in the queue at the Hilton who suffered the same fate. So no idea what the rooms are like at this hotel as, despite paying in advance and receiving written confirmation, we were not allowed to stay.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time visited this hotel in the past 10 months and this visit was even better than the first. Comfy, clean rooms and friendly staff. There isn't a thing I can complain about when it comes to this hotel. A lot of people complain about the size and say the rooms aren't suites, however it is NYC. The rooms are a decent size (my husband and I got the king suite). We did lots of shopping and since there is only a small amoir you have to be creative about how you use the storage space. Other than that space is definitely not at issue. We stayed in late May and at the time the roads were being paved and despite the fact that heavy machinery was being used late night/early morning we didn't hear a thing. Also front desk was able to arrange a great car service for us to get back to JFK if taxis aren't your thing be sure to ask about the hotel's preferred car service as they make the reservations and everything.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to stay in the city following a matinee to see Macy’s 4th of July fireworks. Because of the price and it’s great central location, we choose this Marriott. While the rooms are small, they’re immaculately clean and offer a small frig, microwave, coffee and a safe. A complementary breakfast is included which is always a welcome addition in a big, pricey city. The staff was wonderful.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the City View studio with 2 queen beds. The room accommodated my party of 4 and the rate was fairly reasonable. The hotel is a few blocks from Broadway/Time Square area. Quite a few restaurants within walking distance.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They do not waste square footage in Manhattan! This hotel was a great location for us - easy to get to Grand Central Station, close to a couple of other subway stops and bus lines. Some good restaurants close by - a Chick-Fil-A right on our corner. We took advantage of their parking option and paid to have our van parked off site for the four nights we stayed. Our room was compact but had plenty of space for our family - two queen size beds, a night stand between them and then a large desk area with a small wardrobe/ closet in the corner. Wifi worked fine even with all four of us on our own devices. I prefer bathroom sinks that have a counter, but this did have a small shelf next to it that worked for toothbrushes and toothpaste. The bathroom had plenty of space but the shower had no edge and so the floor in front of the toilet was often wet for a few hours after the shower was used. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job for us each day. The corridors are tight, barely wide enough to maneuver a luggage cart, but it worked. We were happy we were on the third floor because that made use of the stairs very practical for us as we came in and out. Breakfast was fine - pretty much what we expected for a complimentary buffet. There was congestion in the seating area during breakfast, long lines and people sitting on anything flat. We were able to take advantage of the small patio space and escape to eat outside.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother and I stayed 5 nights the staff was excellent from check in to check out. The breakfast buffet had a decent selection of food, though the dining area was crowded. Overall our experience was very good. Big Bus tours has a stop nearby on 5th Ave. Empire State Building, Macy's, and Times Square are all an easy walk away. I would recommend this hotel for someone who wants a trusted brand at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My review is a little biased since we were traveling with 2 small kids. The room was well appointed, but obviously small since it’s in the city. The location is phenomenal. Close to everything. The free hotel breakfast is nice, but very crowded and can be hard to find seats. Service from all hotel staff was amazing. Gym was small, but still got in a great workout. Would return.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As always this is an account of my personal experience with this hotel and may not reflect every traveller's experience.We arrived at JFK in good time from Manchester after a problem free flight with Virgin Altantic. The queues at immigration are long and slow moving so be prepared for a long wait especially (as in our case) another large airliner arrives at the same time. Pleasingly once through customs our bags were waiting and finding a taxi (prices fixed to Manhattan) was simple and well organised.The hotel is approximately 40mins from JFK by taxi and is superbly located in the Midtown district. Reception was efficient, business like and swift. The hotel seems modern and well maintained throughout. Our room was to the back of the hotel overlooking what is soon to be another hotel! We could see the Empire State Building reflected in the glass of adjacent buildings. Some rooms to the front do look out to the building itself. Our room was a good size and was equipped with a fridge, microwave, nicely appointed shower room and a comfortable bed. There was a TV, desk, phones and all the usual necessities (iron, hairdryer, storage etc) and coffee making facilities.If your room doesnt look out over the ESB take a trip up to the top floor and although you cant access the roof terracing you get a great view through the locked glass access doors!!Breakfast is typically American with a wide selection of pastries and cereals as well as bacon and eggs. There is also a choice of fruit, yoghurts and juices. The meal is served in the smallish dining area next to reception and although there are plenty of seats it does become a little busy at times. Don't let this put you off though - the food is tasty and plentiful and you just need to judge your timings to ensure a comfortable meal!The hotel is great for exploring being in range of Times Square, ESB, Grand Central Station and other highlights of city. Next door is the Top of the Strand rooftop bar which has excellent views directly onto the ESB. Locally there are shops, bars and restaurants (all within 5mins walk). Cabs regularly pass the entrance for those who need them. Staff at the hotel are friendly and welcoming and typically keen to ensure that the customers experience is positive. They will look after your baggage should you have a later flight post-check out.There is a basement gym on site.For the price and location this hotel is great and thoroughly recommended for the tourist traveller especially couples.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location to midtown happenings. Staff was friendly & efficient. Room was adequate size and clean. I didn’t try the breakfast but it looked like the offerings were par for this brand. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. I think it’s all about location and security here. I’d stay here again for those reasons.
hotelName:
3    SpringHill Suites New York Midtown Manhattan/F...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not enough value for my money since there was no breakfast included, no room service options, horrible toilet setup in the room (no vent). The staff did not respond to my emails up to 2 days after I sent it, neither my chat.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the facilities in the hotel were not the problem, interacting with the staff there proved difficult. They appear to have no communication with the staff at the door of the hotel downstairs, which means deliveries and BIRTHDAY PRESENTS simply vanish and everyone claims it is someone else's problem.They have now also pulled 2000nok (approx £200) extra off my credit card, 3 months after our visit, claiming that we have not paid some tax. This is a significant % of what we paid in the first place for a week at the hotel.Also, that awesome robot that is in all the publicity photos? That didn't work a moment we were there.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Suited for a younger couple. Not as big as I thought, but I should have known and did a little more research. Would have liked an updated TV, it was really slow. Bed was comfortable and the shower was great. Didn't like the non-privacy as much. View was good and location down from 42nd was good.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not very pleased. The photos do not match the experience itself. The lack of amenities for All people staying there is disappointing, wish I had known before booking. Staying in a room that doesn't even have a coffee maker or fridge, not for me, you cant even get a free cup of coffee downstairs...And the fact that you couldn't sit on the terrace without making a purchase squashed my desire to sit out there. It is not that I can't afford to pay for a drink, it's just that if I am a paid guest of the hotelI shouldn't be required to buy anything to sit on the terrace. Issues with AC had me move to a new room that needed upkeep and had a stained mattress.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a modern hotel that has many features not found in traditional hotels, this is the place for you. Great location, cool robot luggage storage, very nice employees, adjustable bed/sofa, very clean hotel. Highly recommend, great value.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cool hotel, near downtown, very good price and perfect for a quick business trip. All the automation gadgets make it interesting although not particularly practical. Anyway it is a great option for a short stay in couple or by yourself.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location area near Times Square, a great restaurant area, near the bus terminal and train stations. wonderful sightseeing area and shopping area. Price was within NYC prices, a great gathering place for friends and family
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was very apprehensive staying at this hotel after reading negative reviews. I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Location was great. Rooms where compact but had everything you needed and enough space for storage. Enjoyed the food on the terrace. Our trip was booked through travel agent and we didn’t have to pay resort fee on check out which was bonus! Overall great stay
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very cool Hotel with friendly staff, great location within walking distance from Times Square, bars, restaurants, theaters, and many attractions. I loved my cabin style room on the 25th Floor, very clean and a very comfortable mattress. I slept like a baby There is a Bar open late at night and a restaurant too for your convenience. My wife and I really loved this hotel and we will make our first and only choice for every upcoming trip to New York. I strongly recommend it.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Trendy hotel a few blocks outside of Times Square. Staff and service are fantastic. Bed is comfortably firm with position adjustment. Cabins are tight and storage is minimal. Room was clean and cleaning staff was thorough.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The cost of the room was a bit high after the resort fee, but that's typical for Manhattan, especially in this part of town.Everything worked and was relatively clean EXCEPT that when I went to turn the bed down for the night, I accidentally pulled back the fitted sheet, and a handful of brown paper napkins fell out. Like Taco Bell napkins. Unless a staff member dropped the napkins and made them into the bed, I don't think the fitted sheet was changed before we slept there. Though, I don't know why another guest would put napkins in there either. Bizarre and gross.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Money earning. Have lots of hidden charges. Not money friendly. Will charge alot after you check out. Traumatic for us costumers. Its was a good hotel but will charge you with facility fee of $80 and you have to pay if your want to leave your luggage for few hours after you check out. They will charge you $2 per bag.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this location because Mr. Leslie Jordan was performing in the Green Room 42 located within the hotel (excellent show!!) and we went to NYC specifically to see his show. Parking is below the hotel. Our room was Premium Queen View on the 20th floor. Kiosk check-in did not work but we had friendly check-in on the 4th floor at 2:30 pm with no problems. The room was very clean! It is small but very efficient. The bed is similar to a hospital bed in that the head portion elevates. As the head comes up, the bed slides up allowing for more leg room in the room. When you lay the head down (electric button) the bed slides into the room. The shower is small and efficient with body/face wash, shampoo and conditioner bottles on the wall. Water flow is acceptable but it is a gentle rain shower head (no hand wand) and less forceful than I prefer. Temperature was easy to adjust and responsive.The location is excellent! It is right in the theater district and an easy walk to Time's Square but not on one of the busy, noisy main roads. If you are coming to NY for a short stay and just want a clean, safe place to sleep this is it. There is also safe luggage storage with a cool robot doing the work but we did not use it this time.Except for the ice maker not working on our floor (or any floor we checked) we had no significant issues. We had dinner at the Green Fig (in the hotel) and it was very good.
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice option, nice location, good service, nice views, good price, I really recommended this hotel, is more than the another regular and traditional hotel, is cool and nice at the same time, very clean
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: WARNING!!Yotel's prices don't include the "Resort Fee". For me this was over $40 per day which made what seemed like an acceptable price end being over $200 extra. This completely defeated the purpose of paying for a smaller and less luxurious room compared to other hotels. It's a sneaky and deceptive ploy that will stop me from ever staying with them!
hotelName:
4    YOTEL New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The bill amount and the amount YOTEL charged on our Credit Card do NOT match; the invoice stated that it’s US$80.32 for 2 nights, but YOTEL charged US$100 on our Credit Card.
