The street noise is pretty low except when trash day comes. There is no room service but there are many delis that deliver in the area. They have a small gym and laundry drop off. There is a coffee store right next door and off to the side of American cut. Prices can vary greatly depending on when you book. They have an older and friendly staff too.
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was exceptionally quiet and quite large. The beds and pillows were comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. From checkin to checkout all the staff were friendly, helpful, and professional. We paid $459 a night before taxes. I found this a bit pricey, but with large, clean, quiet rooms it was money well spent. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the first time we have stayed at The Lombardy and were extremely pleased....from our accommodations to the staff to the food....all 1st rate and reasonably priced! Everything is within walking distance to Mid Town. Will definitely stay here from now on!
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Lombardy for five nights during our visit to NYC for my wife's birthday. I had stayed here before and remembered it for it's great location, large individual rooms. The hotel was much as I remembered it, the location is excellent for walking to many of the mid town attractions such as 5th Avenue, Central Park, Empire State Rockerfeller, and Times Square. There are also convenient restaurants bars, cafes and convenience stores. The room we had was large but not as individual as I remembered from previous visits, but there bathroom and shower was excellent. the room came with a fridge, and mini kitchen if you wanted to prepare a bit of food for yourself. High quality linens and a really comfortable king size bed. A real additional plus was the free breakfast with a good selection of food, excellent bacon! They need to improve the toasters though. It wasn't a bargain at around £280 per night but certainly competitive with other upper range mid town hotels, I like the fact that it's not a chain and has an individual quality to it. I would recommend this hotel, the staff were efficient and professional and this hotel certainly contributed to the enjoyment of our trip.
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would come back because close to the fair I have to work. The lobby is not as grand as you might think but the room was okay. just okay? Well a bit more then that but not awesome. I guess it depends a bit on the price. Up to the 250$ it is okay for what you get. Above that you might want to orientate yourself, what more there is on the market!
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While our room no way resembled the photos online, we decided it was charming. It was dated but comfortable and quiet.It was easy to get to all of our destinations from Soho to The Cloisters from this location.The staff was amazing! All members of the staff were courteous and helpful especially all of the gentlemen who had to spend time outdoors in the ridiculous heat.The breakfast was fine. Just enough choices to make everyone happy. We’ll be back!
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, good hotel but the rooms were a bit old and random.. we had a good nights sleep and it central to everything. It is pricey for the quality of the room. No closet and iron in the room. All in all it was good
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is good - in proximity to central park and to 55th Avewe came here two times during our total trip - the first time we were upgraded and the apartment was amazing!! - with two rooms and a kitchen everything was newthe second time - we got just a very basic small room (New York standard )The Breakfast - is ok, not really tasty and no boiled eggs (which I think is basic) but the staff were kind enough to make a special order for usThe reception staff are very helpful and nice, we came with a toddler and immediately received a teddy bear which my boy loves :-)So in conclusion - get the upgraded room and don't expect much of the breakfast
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a family we spent 5 night at Lombardy Hotel, hiring 5x king size suites and we were not disappointed at all. Each room was spacious at 500 sqm accommodating a huge bed, dinning area, as well as a very well equipped with a kitchenette which included fridge, microwave, plates, cups, cutlery etc. microwave & sink. Great storage with a walk in wardrobes & chest of drawers in the room. Big bathroom with toiletries provided.Upon arrival and during our stay the staff were very friendly & accommodating as we were travelling with 9 adults, including my father in law who is 70 and 2 children. Breakfast was a good set up, buffet style between 07:00 - 09:45. The hotel also has a great bar & restaurant.Lombardy is in a great location on East 56th between Times Square and Central Park. Many of the tourist attractions were a short cab ride away, if you wanted to walk to the Rockefeller Centre or Times Square this would take approx 20 mins. We also used the subway to travel around. Bloomingdale's was a 5 min walk with the financial district close by also.I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for couples, friends or family! we have a great time and thank you for an amazing experience!
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and professional staff. The room and the facilities very comfortable. Very good location. The price is good in relation to the location of the hotel and no surprises for extra charges. In general it has been a pleasant experience.
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very pleased with the hotel. It is attractive and the staff were very pleasant and professional. After my stay, I thought I was overcharged and contacted the front desk a couple of times. They were quite patient and professional in their interactions with me. As it turned out, I was wrong and was not overcharged. I really appreciated their patience and professionalism. I believe that in itself speaks volumes about how much this hotel cares about their guests.The only downside is that I don't believe the hotel has room service. There is a restaurant next door but I am not aware of it serving room service. On the upside, when I ordered take-out from a nearby restaurant, the front desk notified me when it had arrived and did not allow the take-out person to come to my room. Instead, one of the staff delivered my take out.
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in the prime center, next to did h avenue and Central Park.The hotel does not have too many amenities, however very clean and well kept. The rooms are spacious and we always enjoy our stay at this hotel.The rates are quite reasonable for what you are getting. We he staff is friendly and accommodating.This is like a second home for us.We truly enjoy this hotel and will be back
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has large comfortable rooms and suites at affordable prices. Great location if you are on business. Excellent service. This will be our hotel of choice for the future. Trip advisor is making me write more to get up to 200 characters. ithought brevity is the sole of wit.
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an excellent experience staying in The Lombardy, hotel located in 56th St east of Park Av. Good location. We had been there before with a not so good stay because we were given a suite not large enough for three people, since we had an adult daughter wit us. This time we were in a spacious suite and we could spend 14 days very comfortable. Now they have a breakfast buffet very convenient. Only I would recommend to extend the service hours since people who travel for pleasure does not need the pressure of having to get up early to enjoy breakfast. And they charged a very reasonable rate compared wit other offer we had.
hotelName:
6    The Lombardy
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our third time staying at the park central hotel. Our experience is always amazing! The rooms are always very clean. Thank you so much Ana, Kemi, Karim— you made our stay worth it. The location is also very convenient, it’s only a few blocks from time square and Central Park!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Park Central is just simply amazing. Very polite and professional and eager to assist every step of the way. They go above and beyond the normal and has been the best experience out of a stay at a hotel. Location was better than I had anticipated as well. Will definitely stay here next time we are in town.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As soon as we arrived on the floor where our room was located, it reeked of beach towels exposed to ocean water. The area behind the table lamp was dusty and the radio/alarm was broken. Called the front desk to have it replaced but they never did. The elevators to the rooms were crowded at most times and had broken down during peak period. We had to take the stairs down twelve flights to the lobby. I’m not even sure why we pay a daily “resort fee” perhaps for the beach-like pungent reek. I would not recommend this hotel unless you cherish its location. I’m appalled that this hotel is rated four-star.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty nice, updated hotel in the heart of NYC tourist area. I was taken aback by the fact that they added $35 to each day of my stay--a facility fee (or something to that effect). Apparently that's common in New York. Pretty slimy IMHO. The front desk seemed a little embarrassed when I called them on it and asked them to waive it, which they didn't. Other hotel details: Great room, super-comfy beds. Could hear the noise from the street (I was on the 4th floor) but still slept like a baby. The lobby bar had weird hours. Always seemed to have to wait for an elevator as the other 2 elevators were taken over by the Manhattan club, whatever that is. The location is great (near theaters and Central Park) and awful (it's a very high density of tourists, meaning you're constantly getting brochures shoved in your face as you leave the building). Not sure I'll stay there again. That facility fee is pretty unnerving.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best things of this hotel are the location and Nancy and Q, who work here. They were lovely to us and tried to help in everything! It is not easy to find people like this. Thanks guys! Bad side of it : i missed a lot of light in the room, it is quite dark. Although we got a room changing and the second room was lighter.... but even. I missed light.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely the best stay I’ve had in NYC. The location is perfect...just a couple blocks from Central Park as well as Times Square. Easy access to the subway. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. The rooms are more spacious than any hotel I’ve stayed in in the City. It is very clean and all of the staff go out of their way to greet you and make sure you are happy. I will definitely book again for all my trips back to the City!!!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came for a 1 night stay in July. Hotel is clean, staff was nice. However, they need to address the AC system in the rooms. We walked in to a hot stuffy room. Despite trying several times to reprogram the system to blow cool air, it kept reverting to an auto setting and switching off. Even when we were able to get the AC on full blast it was barely a whisp of cool air. It made for a very uncomfortable night. Also, elevators were slow, often not running. Many guests we came across said the elevators had gotten stuck many times, luckily this didn’t happen for us.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great. The location is a winner, within walking distance of many a wish list; including 5th Avenue, Time Square, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, etc. The decor as you come in is immaculate, and the staff at check are good. There is a concierge on between 8-6. On arrival there was a mix up with the room. We ordered a twin accessible room and were assured by our agent that the hotel had arranged this. The room was a king and we were told by the member of staff that took our bags up that all accessible rooms were king. There were no accessible twins so they wouldnt have told the agency this so seems fault lies with agency. He went out of his way to help and arranged for a roll away bed to be brought up, for which we were not charged. The room didn't have a view but made up for by the room itself. Massive compared to other hotel rooms, a large TV, a lovely arm chair with foot rest. The accessible bathroom is great, with a choice of two different showers. There is a small step in to the bathroom, its tiny but as my dad has trouble walking he found this difficult. There is a safe and ironing board in the cupboard. The bar has some lost potential. We never found it busy and was dead on some occasions. If they were to do food here I think it would do a roaring trade.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the second stay at the Park Central Hotel in New York. We had stayed at other hotels but came back to the Park Central because it is the perfect hotel for a visit to NYC. The location in midtown has easy access to the subway, Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and more. We walked most places, easily, and enjoy being close enough to be part of the Times Square vibe, or the peaceful beauty of Central Park. The staff, especially Guest Services and Concierge, are very helpful and friendly. When heading out for a day of exploring the city I would ask concierge for subway directions - and have them written on a "cheat sheet" so I could navigate the transit system without looking like a total tourist. I would suggest when making a reservation, request a room with a view - some on the rooms one side of the hotel look out to a brick wall. While there is no restaurant on the property - its New York City - there is always a diner or shop open close by.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service in this hotel is fantastic. When we explained we needed our room and fridge till 4pm on check out day for our sons medical condition Sokha immediately sorted it. We’ve had a great stay with all our needs sorted, staff are so accommodating and friendly. Will always stay here when we’re in New York
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous location in midtown. Caring, friendly staff. Rooms are clean and spacious. I’d recommend this hotel for a great stay. Benny from security did an amazing job locating a piece of our lost luggage and went WELL ABOVE and BEYOND to help us out. He’s a true asset to Park Central.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ana at the front desk truly went above and beyond to make my stay great! She helped make my stay in this busy city like home. I was able to check in early and leave a little late. Made my stay here great!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is my 6th time visiting New York City and this was the worst yet. Yesterday, me and my family had a flight to New York from Chicago. After a 2 hour flight we wanted to check-in our hotel. When we got to the hotel it was so noisy in the lobby. They said the hotel check-in time would be around 16.00, we waited for 2 hours to finally check-in to our room. We waited the housekeepers to “clean” our room and they said we will call you when your room is ready. (Which they never did.) After 2 hours we FINALLY checked-in and we went to our room. When we opened the door everthing seemed fine until my mom screamed. There was a lady in our bathroom, alone and without any cleaning equipments, so that made us scared a little bit. We waited for about 45 mins for our luggages. They never arrived. And after waiting 5 more minutes we decided to go downstairs to check our bags. The woman in the reception tried her best but she couldn’t manage to help us. Eventually we got our luggage (after around an hour) and because we were tired, we decided to sleep. Because the windows were not thick enough we heard every single sound in the street and New York could be the nosiest city in the whole world but It was like sleeping on the street. (My mom couldn’t sleep) All in all if you are coming to New York please don’t select this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let's start off by saying, the one and only single positive experience was the 2 ladies at check-in!!! They were great... awesome personalities and very welcoming/helpful.... Where to begin? I guess it'll be simpler to just list them out- Room was a single/king with a shower/tub bathroom- The room was extremely dated and worn, i do mean extremely worn- Bathroom, is dated, extremely cramped, worn but functional- Bathroom, be careful with the hot water.. it is extremely HOT- No coffee/tea maker- Rooms are not very sound proof- Seems no communication between departments, requested late check out; knock on the door early asking if i was checking out; then security came by later and asked if i was checking out... all of this was prior to the 1:00 p.m. check out- Wasn't notified of the construction; woke up to drilling/cutting/grinding next door... - Heating/Cooling - the A/C unit was finicky; set them temp then set the fan to High, it'd reset after a few seconds.. did the multiple times... before it actually locked in and actually worked; adjusted temp then started the whole process againOverall first impression, definitely not great.... then again.. it could be a one off bad experience....
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First off the hotel charges a ridiculous “Facility Fee”. I stayed there for 6 nights and the Facility Fee was nearly $250. That then pushes the cost of the hotel into another price tier and it just doesn’t offer enough amenities to warrant being in that tier. After a conversation with Elizabeth and Nancy at the front desk they agreed to waive it. Thank you to them both. The good: when you take the fee out of the equation there is great value for the money here. The basic room is adequate size for 1-2 people with an average hotel size bathroom. It’s nothing noteworthy but it’s very reasonable for Manhattan at the price point (excluding the fee of course). There’s a lounge area and a gym but not a restaurant or much else in the way of amenities (for instance no in room fridge) but again compared to what other nearby hotels are charging, I’m ok with those not being there. The location is perfect for exploring midtown. A 10 minute walk will get you to Times Square, Columbus Circle, Central Park or 5th Ave. There’s a good mix of restaurants within walking distance, both in terms of price range and cuisine. Carnegie Hall, Broadway, Radio City are all within walking or short cab ride distance. Were it not for the Facility Fee I’d probably give them a 5 star rating but I’m taking a star off because when you factor in the cost of the fee, the amenities and size of the room are sorely lacking for what it ends up costing. No fee: 5 star. With fee: 3 star, so I’ve split the difference and given it a 4.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is amazing, super well centered. Absolutely loved the location! The staff also, but having the chance to contact ELIZABETH to help us out with our staying was SO LUCKY. She made our NY experience great again! She helped us so much, I’m so grateful! We had to book our rooms in a rush because of an unexpected, last minute emergency. She did everything she could to ease our situation, and she even helped/guided us to solve our personal issues.Elizabeth, thank you so much! You are an amazing professional and an amazing PERSON. People like you make a diference!!!!! Park Central Hotel is lucky to have someone like you working for them and actually making their guests feeling really special. Thank you! Best Wishes,Marcela Braganca
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We opted to spend a little more on accommodation during our trip to NYC to avoid any nasty surprises, and this one did the trick. It's well located, easy walk from Central Park and Time Square and with lots of diners around. The room was large and clean. No extras though, and the only breakfast on offer in the hotel is a small coffee counter so plan to spend money on all three meals. Also, note the extra fee of 35$ per night at the end of your stay.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel was perfect for this trip. It is right across from Carnegie Hall and a short walk to Time Square. I have visited NYC numerous times and stayed in a lot of different hotels. The rooms at this hotel are larger than normal which makes it better for multiple people in one room. There were a lot of groups staying at this hotel. Mostly attending Carnegie Hall events. That made check in and out a little more congested and the elevator too but nothing to complain about. There is not a fridge or a coffee maker in the rooms. So if that is important to you, choose something else. The staff was not anything extra ordinary but nothing to complain about either. Overall, if you are looking for a clean room, in a great location, that offers a larger room, than this is a good option.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at the Park Central Hotel! The location is amazing—seriously, we lucked out on that—had no idea how good! The subway is on the corner, Starbucks is just a few doors down, Times Square is a few blocks one way and Central Park is a few blocks the other. The staff was polite and prompt to get anything we requested to our room. I gave it a 5-star review, but there were a couple things I wasn’t crazy about (definitely NOT deal breakers!). First, there were only two operating elevators to get us to our room on the 8th floor, and they were extremely small. It wasn’t a huge deal but got to be difficult a few times getting to our room; they were very crowded and not always able to get everyone on. The room was great—we did the standard with two double beds—but the bathroom didn’t have a fan and got very hot and steamy after showers—wasn’t crazy about that, either. Speaking of showers, I LOVED the bath products (C.O. Bigelow—full-size bottles of shampoo and conditioner and body wash in the shower, travel-sized bottles of lotion in the bathroom—new ones everyday!) and the housekeeping staff did a great job keeping us clean!Our stay was better than I expected, and I will definitely stay there when I go back to NYC!! Thanks, Park Central!!!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For me the location was ideal. Couple of min walk away from Central Park and Times Square. Subway station for both down town and updated it uptown right out side the hotel. The hotel itself was clean and modern. Staff were friendly and even helped find a jazz band worth watching. Good size room. Having a bath instead of a shower in the room was nice. Only down side was the view looking onto the side of buildings.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When going to New York and if you need to stay in a hotel, why not consider this one? Good location, very clean, very quiet, very friendly, great service and reasonable prices ( for New York ) But $11 for a sandwich?
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recommend. Modernized hotel with great rooms, excellent bed, impeccable cleanliness. Very close to Central Park, Times Be of and to major attractions in New York. We stayed a week and we were happy awui. The only point of attention, to be prepared is with regard to daily rates, but it is the practice of the city, you just have to prepare.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Groupon made a mistake with our booking dates. Quimby Hightower told us we were on vacation and to go up to the privacy of the room to call Groupon. After more than a frustrating hour of being on the phone with them and Mr. Hightower intervening, it was to no avail. It was not a pleasant start at the hotel, but Mr. Hightower did his best to save the day. He gave us a coupon for coffee and a drink and secured us another night’s stay at a better rate. His genuine warmth and compassion helped ease a difficult situation, all the while telling us, “enjoy yourselves because you’re on vacation”. Quimby Hightower, you are a breath of fresh air and a real asset to Park Central. We look forward to coming back because of you. Thank you!!Chris/Patti-Jo
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here for 8 nights and we really enjoyed it. The hotel has perfect location, is clean and has great service. Elisabeth in the Guest Relations was extremely helpful and provided some great tips (e.g. the best bagels in the neighborhood). In this category of hotels you can’t really ask for much more. Arek & Dorota
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came into town for work and a little leisure (thanks to Emanuel). He told us about all the local areas. Vida verde was excellent. I recommend it all the way. The hotels service was impeccable. More like a home away from home.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy check in and check out. Clean room Emanuel was very helpful with the check out. Great location to some local spots in times square. I really enjoyed my time and will definitely recommend this hotel to more friends
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a lovely hotel at a reasonable price, nearly filled with other evacuees.Never making you feel like you are asking for too much and dealing with complaints rapidly. Looking really glad to see you Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with great people especially Elsa and Darren Great costumer service! Central Park is right up the street to, we had a good time. The trip through the airports, and flight canceled were the downer
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here and used the valet parking. When I got my car back they had stolen an old cell phone and a box of cigars that had been in my center console. They had visibly gone through my glove compartment and center console. When I called the hotel to complain I was hung up on. The second time I tried to call I was told someone would call me back but I am still waiting. I paid $150 for 2 nights of parking and expected that my items would be safe. Obviously I will not get my items back, but I would expect the hotel staff to at least pretend they care.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very glad to stay in this beautiful hotel. It looks really nice, the rooms are great and the location is superb! Near Central Park, very close to the subway system and very near Times Square! Only drawback were the very steep prices for a glass of wine.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite the primary elevators going out, the stay has been fantastic. Guest relations, especially Quinby, have been super helpful including an umbrella to help deal with the rain. I’ve gotten multiple solid recommendations for places to eat within walking distance. It’s perfectly between Central Park and Times Square. The beds are ridiculously comfy and the cleaning staff does their job well. I’ve really enjoyed my time here and I couldn’t be happier. On top of it, the staff spoke at least 4 languages from what I observed (English, French, Italian and Spanish). Some of the things are a little aged, but I’d swing back by here again.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Stay was awesome. I checked in with my wife and 1 year old. The rooms were comfortable and the beds were nice and clean as well. Just a couple blocks away from Central Park where we had dinner at Tavern on the Green. Highly recommend this Restaurant located in the middle of central park. Make reservations close to sunset so you can enjoy the magic under the lights. Visit the Zoo and catch a ride on the Horse and Carriage that are waiting to take you on a nice 45 minute stroll through the park. So far our experience at Park Central hotel is 4.5 stars. I would have gave it a 5 star review but the elevators were so slow they were almost non functioning, so we took the stairs. Good thing we were on the 4th floor! Otherwise overall great experience and excellent location.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We Came to nyc to perform in Carnegie Hall. its was an amazing memory for us all. the hotel staff were very accomadating. Emanuel at the desk has great information to give. Only thing i ask is that carpets be cleaned better.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time I ever stayed in this hotel. It’s a very convenient hotel. Close to everything. The staff in this hotel is great. Especially Emanuel at the front desk. He was very accommodating and pleasant.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chose Park Central based on proximity to Carnegie Hall (just a 1-2 block easy walk). Very friendly guest service staff, and helpful concierge. Very nice sitting area that becomes a night lounge on the main floor behind guest services. Had a deluxe 2 queen. No "view" with scaffolding outside our window, but premier rooms avail if you want a "view". Our room faced CPark (north?) and was not noisy with a good shade. Very pleased with bed comfort and cleanliness (the bathroom was spotless). Rooms are as depicted in website pics. On line reservations and express check out easy. Great location for walking to CPark, Rockefeller Center, St Patrick's Church, Times Square and parts of Broadway. Curb side hotel staff conscientious of loading / unloading zones and pleasant. Facilities fee seems overpriced, but fitness room was nice. It was on the third floor if you want to the convenience of being on the same floor. Right by hotel same side of street / same block is a nice Deli (good omelets but one staff / owner a bit rude), Starbuck's (usually busy), Coffee Shop (less busy and great items), and Fancy Apple for bike rentals. Would definitely recommend. 4 of 5 rating based on: 1) Long elevator lines so need to plan your departure times for anything in advance; stairs were well lit as a second option for those who could; 2) Would be nice to have more option for filling water bottles but the tap water in the room tasted okay to us. Thanks for a nice stay!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second stay at this hotel. Located across the street from Carnegie Hall, 2 blocks from Central Park, 1 block from Broadway and about 6 blocks to Times Square. This great location saves a lot of taxi fares. Many restaurants nearby. Starbucks next door. The only real complaint that we have is there are only 2 elevators per wing and they are very slow. Rooms are a good size and very comfortable. Bathrooms a bit small.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right at the beginning we were welcomed by this great, charismatic guy called Quimby, he checked us in and proceeded to recommend the best locations to visit. Due to it’s well placed location, you can get to The Central Park and Times Square in less than five minutes.Higly recommended.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks. We chose the classic 2 double bed room as we are a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids). The beds were nice and spacious. Room size is adequate. However, I must say for the price we were paying (more or less $350/day all taxes and fees included) the rooms were not well maintained. The drawers on the TV console table were all broken at the hinges, very troublesome to use. No free bottled water for daily consumption. Aside from the usual hand soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner, no other toiletries were privided. No electric kettle in the room, we had to request for one. No chiller in the room also. Another thing I must add is that there were not enough elevators! This is a very busy hotel due to its location. There is a constant line at the elevators. Also due to the fact that the elevators can fit only a few people at a time. And most times only 1 elevator is functioning per wing. Other than its excellent location, this hotel is just mediocre when it comes to quality and service.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the mid-way between Central Park and Hollywood...not to quiet nor to busy... clean, modern and kind of modern. 10 blocks away from theaters and 5 from Cental Park. 30 min walks to American Natural Museum !! Alícia
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with the hotel from the moment we walked in the door. Angela was the name of the friendly young woman behind the desk. We were very early and she told us about the opportunity to check in our luggage so we could begin our time in New York City. I told her it was our anniversary and she offered a free upgrade in our room as well as a coupon for two free drinks. She provided excellent customer service. When we finally checked in our room, it was a good size, had a view and was very clean. We loved everything about our stay. One day we had trouble with the TV remote not working and someone was there in less than five minutes to give us a new remote. We would definitely stay here again because of the hotel as well as the convenient location to Central Park as well as Time Square.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my family for 6 nights over the Easter break. We chose this hotel because of its excellent midtown location close to Central Park. It didn’t disappoint!I have to say that I’m not a fan of the NYC practice of hotels charging daily fees. It’s far simpler to include them in the room rate, paid up front. I understand it’s not just this hotel, but all NYC hotels, but nevertheless it’s extremely irritating. Park Central did include some extras though, such as a discount at the hotel bar, which was nice. The fittings are in good condition, albeit somewhat dated. If I could point out something, it’s that the shower curtain in the bathroom was too short. We enjoyed our stay in a family room with 2 double beds. The staff were pleasant and friendly, and went out of their way to make our stay easier. There are no coffee and tea facilities in room, but there is a Starbucks on the ground floor, and the hotel lobby also has a small coffee shop. The best thing about our stay was location - Central Park is 5 minutes walk away, the major museums like the American Museum of Natural History and the Metropolitan Museum of Art are reasonably walkable distances away too. So is Times Square. For anything else, the subway entrance is practically on the same block. There’s no real reason to stay in the hotel, so we didn’t really make use of any in house facilities. Nevertheless they seemed alright.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was staying at the hotel and the two manager ladies -Sokha & Kemi- told me that since its my first time at the Park Central, I get an upgrade to a suite!!! I was extremely grateful and happy. Super nice staff! Thank you very much, Park Central!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Emanuel at the front desk made sure that we were taken care of at all times. We loved our stay due to his hospitality. It was more of a home away from home. Thanks to him we celebrated a birthday to remember.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located to Times Square and Central Park, yet just far enough from Times Square to avoid some of the intensity of that location. It is very convenient to the Theater District.The property is an older property but has been very well maintained and it did not feel like an older property. The rooms were clean, quiet, and more than adequate.There is no on-site restaurant, but there are many restaurants within a block or two for breakfast or lunch.The Bar area is very upscale and comfortable. The bar hostess, Nancy, made us feel very much at-home and treated us like family. Meeting her was one of the highlights of our trip!The only real negative to the property is the elevator situation. At one time it appeared that this property had a total of 8 elevators, 4 for each side. There are now only two elevators per side. One side serves the higher floors, one the lower floors. This works OK when the elevators are all working. During our visit one of the two elevators serving our floors was out of service for about a day and a half. This caused major queues to access the remaining elevator.The outside of the building is also under some sort of refurbishment, so our outside view was somewhat blocked by scaffolding and safety screening. We were not in the room much so this was not a major issue.This was our third visit to NYC and our third hotel. If this hotel is available, we will likely stay here on our next trip!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing I can say - it was some what clean. The internet was HORRIBLE. The staff was beyond UNHELPFUL and rude. Bar doesn’t serve any warm drinks (like tea or coffee). I will not stay there again.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first time ever in New York and I love this hotel. Great location and beautiful on the inside. I was helped by the Guest clerk by the name of Quimby and he is awesome! He gave PHENOMENAL CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!!! He made sure our rooms were ready and made sure were satisfied with our stay! My sisters and I are beyond thankful and I will only stay at the Park Central whenever we are in New York!!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in the heart of the City - Easy walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. Hotel staff very helpful - Big thanks to Elizabeth Cacovic - Guest Relations - She was particularly helpful. Bar very peaceful
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good view n forsight. Nice food and accommodation. Would like to visit places like this and more. Goods roads and several tourist sites to explore. Good people to communicate and hang around with. Good food and drinks to go round
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the Park Central a number of times and would not hesitate to book it again. It is a beautiful, well-kept hotel in a great location. You are minutes from Times Square without being in the middle of the chaos. A few blocks in the other direction is Central Park. The rooms are spacious, the beds comfortable and many of the rooms have great views. I love that the bathrooms have tubs and are already stocked with really nice products in large containers. If I have ever needed anything I have found the staff responds quickly and are always very pleasant to deal with. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I traveled to Park Central with a large, somethings demanding, group and they have been absolutely wonderful! I cannot say enough GREAT things about the guest services team, especially Quimby. He has gone above and beyond to take care of our group. The hotel itself is modern, well decorated and clean. I will be returning!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights on a holiday.The rooms are modern, clean and well appointed.I see some guests have complained that the view was restricted by scaffold due to external maintenance, but to see New York is best to leave your roomThe services and restaurant are fine.We would stay again. The subway and NYC attractions are all within reach.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the time Judy & I walked in until the time we left The Park Central was definitely Central to say the least.The GREATEST location at the terrific all in one price including valet parking.Room was absolutely the best and cleanest.We would only stay there from now on no matter what the price!!We were treated as if we where the only ones there.Judy & Rch Levy
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at Park Central Hotel in past years and it never disappoints. Literally minutes after check-in on my last stay in April, I received both an email and a phone call from Guest Relations asking if everything was good with my room - it was - quiet clean, comfortable and well appointed! Director of Guest Relations Quimby Hightower helped me out with a couple small special requests that made my day! Conveniently located midtown/west, Park Central Hotel is kitty corner from Carnegie Hall, easy walking distance to Broadway, shopping and beautiful Central Park. The N&R subway stop is located at the end of the block to get you anywhere you want to go. Seventh Avenue is busy day and night so I always feel safe walking by myself. Park Central has a very international flair with an excellent restaurant lounge on the main floor and there was even live music on one of the nights I was there!
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a standard room well in advance and having been there last year we were looking forward to our visit. We opted to upgrade to a suite. The suite was lovely, sitting room, bedroom and 2 massive bathrooms but sadly only about a foot of usable closet space, jacket/shirt/blouse length. So we moved back to a standard room,433. This was not a good room, apart from it had a closet. The area near the basin in the bathroom was peppered with other people's toothpaste yuk. The edge of the carpet has not been vacuumed for a long time. The 'fluff' was at least a centimetre thick. Noise from the fans in the atrium was loud early morning. We went to the customer service desk but people were being told the hotel was full and no chance of a move until that changed. We didn't bother to queue to complain, better things to do so we sucked it up and went and had a couple of cocktails in the bar. The hotel is in a great location being between Central Parka and Times Sq. The Consierge was a gem in helping us navigate our way around the city. The staff in general were pleasant and helpful. The bar staff made brilliant cocktails. I just wish we hadn't opted to upgrade as I feel we lost a better standard room in doing so. Hey ho you live and learn.
hotelName:
7    Park Central Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 7 nights at this hotel but in fact forfeited one nights fee by not staying at all.The room described as a suite was tiny with kitchen facilities squeezed in.The lift to get to our room was very slow.First time ever I’ve turned tail on a booking
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They gave us a horrible room first day and after a long debate they agreed to change it next day. The rooms are outdated and you need to wait for around 20 minutes to take an elevator. They made several mistake in room charges as I was overcharged several times and had to pass by the reception almost daily to correct the charges and every time around 30 minutes wasted. Won’t stay there again. The only good thing was complementary dinner finger buffet during week days and free laundry.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the hotel was passable especially for NYC, our trip was almost ruined by the long lines waiting to use the elevator. It took up to 20 minutes if your room was on a upper floor. One elevator out of three was out completely and when it was repaired someone was stuck the next morning and the fire department was called(I happen to be sitting downstairs when they showed up). The same day elevator #1 lurched and scary to ride. I moved the second day to a lower floor because originally I was on floor 32 and feared that the elevator situation would get worse. The rooms were clean, however the air conditioning in my second room was inadequate. (In my first room the air conditioner was great, but the tv did not work, even after asking someone to fix it)
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We check in this past Saturday not thinking anything and excited to spend a day exploring the city with the family. We get into the room start getting ready to leave and our kids are explorers like all children. I come out of the bathroom to see my son hanging out the window from the 27th floor. I couldn't believe what I was seeing at first scared and didn't want his to get him nervous and move any further. I approached him and got him out of harm's way. When I went to go talk to management they told me that was the law for windows to open. I stay in many hotels during the year and that's obviously not the case he had no idea what he was talking about. But in fact just probably didn't want to deal with it and walked away..... There were no child protective locks anywhere on the window how could thay be. If I didn't come out of the bathroom when I did. It could have ended much different. Shame on you and an even bigger shame on you for not being understanding of my fear and anxiety. I almost lost my son. This is not the experience I expected to have. There was no mention of windows opening upon checkin even though they seen we had two toddlers. If you are planning on staying at this hotel and have children be aware so you dont have to experience what me and my wife just went through.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are clean. Breakfast is decent and plentiful. The hitel staff - including front desk and housekeeping- are all helpful and kind. Jamie was playing guitar in the lobby, and he serenaded my parents for their wedding anniversary.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We where on the top level of the Staybridge hotel which was the 32nd floor, & we had 2 queen size beds, 2 chairs a nice bathroom & a little kitchen! The view was lovely but we couldn’t believe we had this room as I had booked it 3 days ago through Bookings.com!The receptionist, called Jovi, suggested that as I had a cane, it maybe a good idea to borrow/hire a wheelchair for the 7 days as my friend has been here before & wanted me to see all these places & all these things of New York. Jovi the receptionist, said it would be better if it gets too hectic here it would be much better in a wheelchair! So after a little breakfast, of course including coffee or tea for us each morning at Staybridge Suites we would set out each day with me in my wheelchair.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite big rooms. It’s all getting a bit tired but not threadbare or anything and that’s reflected in the price. Yes the lifts are a problem at busy times. The included breakfast was really good. Staff were really friendly and helpful.The location is about as central as you can get. Like the Disney-fied Tine Square two blocks up I imagine it was a bit colourful a few years back. Now the block is almost entirely similar hotels, there is one ‘interesting’ liquor store- but I wonder if that’s more of a living museum now. Then the world’s biggest subway station has an entrance 50 m a away- although you can walk right to the other side of Time Square underground should you do wish. I’d stay there again.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is easy to get too if you are driving into the City. The location makes it easy to walk over the city. Breakfast was good, staff is very friendly but elevators are hard to catch in the morning and evening. I would recommend staying if you are wanting to be close to Times Square and broadway shows!
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed in many hotels all over the world. This must be one of the worst hotels we ever stayed in and how this hotel got a 4.5 rating we very unsure of. We travelled the USA for 4 weeks and this was the most disappointing hotel by far and was our biggest mistake on our 4 week tour.The only 2 positive things we can say about this hotel was the check-inn late night by a very helpful gentleman Paul and the fact that he organised to get our valuables out of the safe that we forgot. The rest was just depressing. The breakfast was included and ok, just very ok. Besides Paul, we were not impressed with the rest of the staff. Very unhelpful. Stayed in NYC previously and this hotel for us was situated in a rundown horrible part of the city with tons of homeless people and scaly characters. It’s 100% not soundproof and we had extreme difficulty in sleeping. It is a very dirty run down place. The carpets in the lifts were filthy. They hardly cleaned up after someone left their table at breakfast. Our curtains were halfway broken and the table lamp hanged all skew. We waited forever for the lift. Not on one occasion, but every single day. Our mugs were not washed, although we payed for cleaning services. I won't recommend this hotel even to my biggest enemy. We were extremely disappointed. There are so many other great hotels in NYC, don’t bother to look at this one.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes, there are so many places you could stay in New York City. In fact, it could give you a headache researching all of them to find just the right one. Or, you could try a different one every visit. But this one was well worth returning to again knowing it was pretty good. While I may, I probably will not try a different IHG Hotel in the Times Square area; I always try to stay at IHG properties when possible.This hotel was in the middle of it all. We arrived in the early afternoon and although they were very busy, we were greeted immediately by a friendly staff. The check in process was quick and easy and we were greeted as being loyal guests. We were offered information regarding things to do in the area and asked where we were coming from and headin to. When we indicated we were flying home the next day we were offered the choice of speaking to someone about transportation to the airport, which we took advantage of. We were able to have them arrange a private car and driver for almost the same price as a taxi.Our special requests made in advance were honored. Our room was very clean and modern. Everything worked fine I wish there was better water pressure in the shower but we were on the top floor and that may have made a difference. They also only put one bar of soap by the bathroom sink because they have shower gel but that is my preference to have two bars. The wifi worked great. The breakfast was just okay. If you are on a high floor you should allow yourself enough time to leave the building because you may have to wait a few extra minutes for an elevator with enough room.I did NOT like the bed! Some sort of memory foam that made it difficult to roll over during the night and it raised up between us in the middle like a mountain from the sea.Overall, especially considering the price, it is a place I will stay at again.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a King Suite, as it appeared from the website to be a nice, well equipped room with enough space to chill out on the period between chasing around New York and going out for dinner. The ‘suite’ is just a regular hotel room with a small cooker, dish washer (for some reasons) and a fridge. One chair that you cannot sit at because it is under the air conditioner. The bed is the only place in which to chill, which is not what I usually expect in a suite, even in New York.(see picture)The rooms are extremely tired and it doesn’t feel at all clean.Breakfast is dreadful and we have waited until we could find somewhere to eat out on all but the first two days. Despite being ‘free’, it isn’t worth doing.The street is very sketchy and the hotel is a couple of doors down from a parole office, and it shows by the crowds of people in the streets harassing tourists, selling drugs and smoking weed, when they are not panhandling you.There are only three lifts, and during peak periods you can easily wait over half hour, which if you are on the 25th floor, is the only option.I genuinely cannot find anything in the hotel to recommend it, and I feel bad about that. Sure, it is only a couple of blocks from Times Square, but that just adds to the volume of hustlers trying to separate you from your money.We paid $350 a night, which isn’t bargain basement, even for New York.My advice is to look elsewhere, it is truly a place that is weeks away from being torn down.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay at the Staybridge Suites Time Square, New York. Booked a room with double twin beds. The room is very small which is typical for NYC but the room was clean, free breakfast every morning which was great. The breakfast had variety and available until 10:00 a.m. Saved us time and money. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The location was great. Central to just about everything. The price was reasonable considering the location. Three nights for under $700 is pretty good for this area. The elevator situation is the only negative. Very slow and always packed.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a nice surprise! Very conveniently located to Times Square and Subway entrance is right across the street. Breakfast is well put together and plentiful. Plenty of staff on hand to keep food available and tables cleaned off as soon as someone gets up. Room was small but most importantly, clean!!! Bathroom was spacious but shower was tiny and ours had a broken seal so water got all over outside the shower. The bed and pillow were AMAZING. I felt like I was falling into a cloud every night. I would bag them up and bring them home as my NY keepsake if I could have. Earlier post mentioned that down the street towards Times Square is seedy. The Department of Correctional Custody day program didn't bother me as much as the liquor store and the half dozen men sitting around it getting more sloshed as the day wore on. We learned to just walk on the other side of the street and then just cross over in front of the hotel. The only reason I didn't give this hotel a 5 is because of the elevators - they are tiny, ancient and slow. And in the mornings you share them with the housekeepers with their arms full of bedding and towels. Otherwise, it is a well located, very reasonably priced hotel that is CLEAN!
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went with 39 other people, 34 teenagers. The staff were courteous and respectful. Even though the kids were well behaved, we took up a lot of room at the lobby and they were patient with us. The rooms were very comfortable. Would have given them 5 star but the maid service leaves a lot to be desired. They came in to clean but didn’t replenish supplies. Had to ask for toilet paper, shampoo, etc - and I always tip! Oh well.. it’s a minor complaint. The location was convenient but had to passBy a pretty seedy area (parole office), etc.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the staybridge suites for ur trip to new york.this is ur 3rd time hereGreat hotel.great staff... very polite and friendly .the restaurant staff are very helpful and very cheery as breakfast starts at 630 nice and early to make to most of your day in new york city.Thanks to shelly who sorted out our room to a higher floor.great service my lovely..hope i have spelt your name correctly.Hotel clean and very tidy.you get coffee available all day which is a nice touch.There is a bar too we never used it this time.Definitely will return
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a convenient location to stay but the hotel has seen better days. The rooms are clean and spacious but the decor could do with an refresh. Not sure which is slowest, the service at reception or the elevators but both are equally frustrating.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is ideally located, 10 minutes walk from Times Square. Rooms are comfortable, ask for high floor but be patient in the morning to get an elevator...Manager has been responsive to our demand (king size bed and high floor) despite a bad start. This was really appreciated and I m thankful for this. Concierge service is good.However, the breakfast is just average and the breakfast room too small. you tend to eat in your neighbour's plate. Airport shuttle is very convenient and price is competitive :)Hotel is offering some 'socialising time' which is nice.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night for business travel. The staff at this hotel are excellent, very welcoming and helpful. The newness of the rooms and beds seem to be reasonable for a hotel at this price and at this location. I thought it was nice that they offered a social hour. I took advantage of the free breakfast which was good. I also used the private car service they have to go to the La Guardia airport, which has the advantage of a flat rate (whereas rideshare and taxi rates can vary). My driver was Raul, and he was great. The car was very nice, and clean as well.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was very clean and good location. Walk to subway and times square with in minutes. I was surprised how large the kitchen area was in the room. Would recomend and stay again next time. Only bad thing was the elevator situation. Only 3 elevators for 30 floors? Very long wait in the mornings. Breakfast was a assortment of hot and cold foods.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just come back from a stay here we were very happy all the staff we encountered were very friendly and attentive it is a great location with a subway right at the end of the street and next to the port authority bus station so if you are flying into ny and want to save some money just catch the bus to the station and its a short walk to the hotel. It's close to times square and the theatres so you are right in the heart of New York if we go back this will be high on my list to stay agsin.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband & I stayed at Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City 4/18 - 4/23 (5 nights). We paid $1,676.26. Our review:ARRIVAL/CHECK-IN: We arrived between 7-8p on a Thursday & were greeted by a very friendly representative (Monae?). She mentioned our wedding anniversary & surprised us with a goodie bag. She explained the costs very clearly, including the refundable deposit ($50/day) & housekeeping charges ($5/day). I'd say check-in took < 5 minutes.ROOM• Bath: Small, but modern. Hot water every day, water pressure varied. My only suggestion would be for the hotel to add one or two more towel hooks to the wall.• Bed: King-sized, very comfortable like other IHG properties I've stayed at!• Heating/cooling: Room stayed at a comfortable temp, but the unit is quite noisy if you're watching TV.• Housekeeping: Satisfactory. Not sure why they charge (is this a common practice with all NYC hotels?). We requested housekeeping 2 days = $10 & had to verify the charges w/ the hotel at check-out (we were charged 1 extra day).• Kitchenette: Surprisingly well-stocked, i.e. cups, ice tray, plates. Very nice to have a refrigerator & microwave during our stay.• Safe: Very useful amenity.• Sound: It's NYC, so be prepared for noise. Even on floor # 29 we could hear honking, sirens, & even the occasional person hollering outside. As well as other guests slamming doors & a baby crying. None of the noise interrupted my sleep though.• TV: Mostly news & sports stations. Unfortunately, several stations had spotty or no signals.• View: Prior to arrival, we requested a room on a high floor facing the Empire State Building. We were assigned room 2909 & the view was fabulous! Photo attached. In retrospect, I would give up the view for a lower floor so we could take the stairs vs waiting for an elevator.HOTEL• Breakfast: Selection is so so compared to other IHG properties. Very busy at all hours of service. I would not choose this hotel based on breakfast alone.• Customer service: Top notch! Monae(?) & the bartender on Monday 4/22 evening were incredibly friendly!• Elevator: As other reviews have stated, the wait times are long & the elevators very, very crowded. However, we did not want to walk down 29 flights of stairs so we waited.• Laundry facilities: 3 washers & 3 dryers available to use for free. Be warned: several guests use the machines to wash 1-3 items at a time (I kid you not). And they do not keep an eye on their laundry, so you'll need to switch out other guest's laundry if you hope to get your items washed.LOCATION: Convenient for visitors planning to see a play, but awful if you need to catch a Lyft/Uber.• Tips? Request a room on a lower level so you can avoid using the elevator. • Would we recommend? Yes• Would we stay again? Perhaps. We'd likely stay in lower Manhattan if we ever visit again.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a great fan of the ICHG group and stay 90% of the time in their hotels but never in this one again.In defence of the hotel this is a busy Easter weekend but that is no excuse for some of what we faced.For what we paid I have used before a nice hotel near central station but decided with a title ‘suites’ it might be a little functional but we might get a bit more room and a small kitchenette. Well we got the kitchenette but it was shoehorned into a standard small room.Staying on a high floor the elevators are a disaster- I appreciate they are stuck with the no. of lifts they have got but you can while away the hours awaiting your carriage or walk 20+ flights! They thoughtfully provide televisions outside the lift door and this Sunday morning I almost joined in the broadcast church service in hope that prayer would bring an elevator.But the worst experience was breakfast. Don’t blame the workers- blame the management. Not enough tables- not enough staff-tables were full of other people’s detritus and were not cleared, the few staff on duty could not keep up. We ran out of coffee, milk, bowls, knives etc etc. The girl on the next table was diligently trying to spread cheese with a spoon. The staff were disorganised -literally clearing a plate or two at a time- for heavens sake give them a tray so they can clear a whole table at a time and someone to watch over to see things run smoothly.As I said at the top - never again.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are thoroughly enjoying our stay (7 nights) and cannot thank nor recommend Jamie enough for his time, entertainment and interaction with our children in the lobby during this time. Just amazing! We would love to return as we enjoyed his music so much. Such a great addition to our stay. Thanks Jamie!
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 8 nights of a 6 week family holiday to the United States. Great location, fantastic hotel with all the comforts of home. Elevators a problem, but can’t be fixed. Don’t let it ruin your stay. Front office staff could be a little more attentive to guests needs. David and Jamie who are the guest relations guys are great. Personable and helpful with helping with local attractions. Not to mention Jamie being a great guitar player. Will be staying here again. Thanks for a great time. We will miss you all.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just left the 32 storey Staybridge Suites near Times Square. For 3 days of our 3 day stay one of the elevators did not work. They did not call anyone into fix it! We walked along with many others.. down stairs 27 floors to breakfast!The rooms are super tiny and are not big enough for families. A lot of space is taken up with the kitchen and a full refrigerator and dishwasher! Although the hotel pantry has very little food or is there a grocery near by!The location is not bad close to a subway and 8th Avenue.There are many more better options nearby for this overpriced hotel! Don’t bother!
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel and got two twin beds that were plenty enough for us each to have our own bed conveniently located to everything they had a all you can eat breakfast in the morning and fresh coffee… Close to all of the shows and convenient to everything.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated just off the main Times Square area but is a short and convenient walk to most attractions. The bus terminal across the road provides easy access to other NY districts including buses to the Woodbury Outlet mall.Hotel itself is a bit old and the rooms are a little bit small compared to most other hotel suites that I am used to. However, this being in the heart of New York City, that is to be expected.The major problem with this hotel are the elevators that seem to be slow and always full. We stayed on the upper floors and had to sometime wait up to 15 minutes before we can get into an elevator. Bear this in mind if you need to rush out for an appointment especially during the peak morning hours.Unlike most hotels I stayed in before, the housekeeping is optional and there is a fee (I think US$5 per day) if you want the room to be cleaned daily.The breakfast offered is very basic but sufficient.The counter staff are not very friendly (maybe due to the hectic activity in the small reception area most of the time).
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here before and loved it. This time there were a few glitches, but overall I would still recommend. First the positives: you get a free breakfast, you have a full kitchen, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable. Now the glitches: the kitchen sink in our unit stunk, the bathroom has a glass door and is right next to the bed making it difficult to use the bathroom if the other person is sleeping. They also charge a $5 a night fee if you want housekeeping services. We said on checkin that we did not want this service, but we still had to put the "do not disturb" sign on the door or they came knocking to clean every day. One last note, the elevator is noisy, try to get a room as far from it as possible.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved having the kitchenette with full size fridge. Had every utensil you could think of. The bed and shower were amazing. The location was great. Walking distance to Times Square and $1 pizza very close by!
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My teenage daughter and I stayed at this location during a quick trip to the city to see some shows and take in sites. It was a wonderful location to base camp out of. The theaters and Central Park area were all within walking distance. Rooms are clean and well supplied. The staff at the hotel were welcoming and went above and beyond to provide a high level of customer service. Jove at the front desk was awesome and very helpful. Jose, the security guard, went out of his way to help my daughter and I get to a rooftop area at another hotel so we could get some. Igor pictures of the city. He not only got us into the hotel and to the rooftop but also showed us where the best pictures would be and stood talking to us telling us about the various things we were seeing. That all happened on a night it was raining. His help to us was completely outside of his job description, but his kindness was appreciated. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit NYC.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Rooms were clean and comfortable, beds were very comfortable, breakfast was good, location was excellent and not too noisy. Staff in the hotel were very helpful and welcoming. Would recommend as good value for money.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel for it's proximity to Times Square. It is an easy 5 minute walk to get to all of the action. It's a little sketchy feeling on the block near the liquor store, but we never encountered any issues. The hotel room is a standard size room with 2 double beds. The kitchenette was nice - including microwave, stove-top, dishwasher and full sized fridge. We didn't cook in the room, but it was a nice option. We took full advantage of the continental breakfast, which was better than usual. Hot breakfast items, as well as a variety of fruit, yogart, cereals, baked goods. The staff were friendly and helpful. We enjoyed chatting with Candice in the bar! Would definitely go back! Cons: As other reviewers have commented on...the elevator service is SLOW. The walls are very thin. We could hear a cough next door.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Delilah at the front desk was so quick, knowledgeable, and helpful. She gave a wonderful first impression and made us feel welcome. On top of that, all of the staff were helpful with a great sense of humor. The rooms were nice, and if we had a problem (broken coffee pot, backed up sink) someone would fix it in a timely manner. The beds were very comfortable. The only downside was that the hot breakfast wasn’t that great, however, they had other options (bagels, toast, fruit, yogurt) and we ordered grocery delivery to have stuff in our room. We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in Times Square across from Port Authority for easy walking to any shows and easy access to subways for everything else. Rooms have nice kitchenettes with apartment size large frig, stove and microwave. Warm breakfast and nice little gym. Very friendly and helpful staff. Only draw back is the slow elevators at peak times.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not only their roooms are all you need to rest in a city that never rests, but also it's people makes the difference. They are out out of this world. Starting from Jame-Monet who when he's not taking care of any detail is playing drums and guitar at the lobby, improvising songs with your name and activities, to the contagious smile of Ricardo and Gill at the reception. If you're looking for a place with soul, Staybridge is the right place.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would I stay here again? YESThe good things, nice outlook from room, great to have the full size fridge to stock up on things, comfortable bed. Great location near all the restaurants on 9th Avenue. Walk to everywhere from this central location. Great housekeeping. Good WiFiThe not-so good things, noisy hall ways, woken up at 5am every morning by staff out side the room with loud walkies talkies on full volume. The lifts....... the lifts are very slow and tight of a morning. On a 13 night stay I was charged a late checkout fee for a few hours extra, you'd think after 13 nights there would be some give and take.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are clean and bonus have a small kitchen which is handy the laundry is great and although the elevator is slow it didn’t bother usThe breakfast had a good selection and the waiter Andy always had a welcome smile as did all the staff Location is very good near Hell’s Kitchen plenty of restaurants close to Time Square and easy walk to most tourist attractionsHighly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing much to recommend this hotel other than its location. Reasonable price considering but it was a big booking for a business trip for several people. The lobby area is usually full of people, mostly waiting for the 3 incredibly slow elevators. Service is mediocre and sometimes it feels as if you are a nuisance staying there. Bar better at the hotel next door.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very bad Reception and Concierge/doorman. Need to focus on Customers in front of them. Not helpful to me at all...Three lifts but long wait at the lobby as it can be crowded. Walkway is dark.Only Plus is Free Laundry for Guests. 5 washers and 5 dryers available in the basement. Soap is USD1. Room is a bit crampy with the fridge, sink, cooker.Good wifi, shower area.Good bed, big pillow, armchair.Good channel spread.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: awesome hotel great location . near all the attractions . parking in area safe but pricey. room clean and well appointed. beds comfy and clean. The price is good and staff is great, Room service is fast and great.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception people not professional at all with attitude specially front desk manager Karim .Not helpful at all.I would like to thanks them for the way they treated me while I had a problem no sense of humour at all.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right location in the heart of the intresting areas. Friendly staff, well equipped quite room. This is a really well managed hotel apartment and hotel. The breakfast was very nice and rich. Even the elevators were fast enough. The laundry in the ground level is really useful
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing trip to New York at the end of January. We booked to stay for 8 nights and the overall stay was really good, friendly staff, clean and functional. I had read the reviews before leaving and was a bit concerned, however I needn’t have worried as the hotel was great. Yes there is a wait for lifts but it wasn’t long and you got to chat to other guests. We had booked a disabled room and this was well set up for a wheelchair user. We also found that New York is extremely disabled friendly and had no problems getting around in my chair. All in all a brilliant trip.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I know the title? Wots this got to do with a hotel?Well when it’s a trip for ur Boss, Ooops wife to go mad shopping in the Big Apple u better have the rite hotel!We have stayed before and to say it’s a little tired is about rite, BUT and it’s a big but with the amount of traffic and guests staying who can blame it... staff where spot on and more than pleasant, breakfast just what u want. I know some would complain but hey it’s easy to moan rant and wave, take pics of stains etc etc when things are free!! Room was % and warm, hey it’s a holiday for her and nothing would ruin it, so stay and enjoy, buy ur Puma gear or whatever u get cheap go home and put a smile on ur face
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
