review_body: Room looked run down.TV channels were not working.Very poor staff:Lack of knowledge and simply rude.Amounts deducted from credit card which I don't know for what.I cannot recommend this establishment.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arriving at the hotel literally dripping like drowned rats, my husband and I had not even checked in yet and were already cranky when our kids at home called to announce the house was flooding. That could have set the tone for the weekend, but for the outstanding staff working at this hotel. Literally every single employee had a smile, a helpful attitude, a professional understanding of their job, and a desire to make me feel welcome. Whether it was the desk staff dealing with computer issues, the management checking on the waiting guests, the cleaning staff who put everything to rights each day, or the positively outstanding speed and warmth of the young men clearing the breakfast dishes, literally every single employee I encountered was NICE to me. It really flipped the switch on my attitude. Our studio on the 13th floor was lovely, comfortable, spacious enough for us to move around freely and tricked out with every possible amenity. Since we stayed the end of January the rates were absurdly low, literally $600 for three nights with scrambled eggs, bacon and bagels for breakfast. I mean, seriously? As former NYr's we come into the city often but this was our first time at Staybridge and it won't be the last.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is extremely clean and the rooms are well-designed. We got a great deal for a January trip and it is in a great location, walking distance from the bus terminal, Times Square, and subway stop. I take off 1 star for the elevator wait times, as others have mentioned, and the strange attitude of staff members. There’s a $5 charge for housekeeping each day, and we only did it once to avoid paying the fees. For $5 we got the trash taken out, fresh towels, and a made bed. Coffee and bath products were not refilled as is typical in a hotel, and I couldn’t get through to the front desk at all for over an hour to request more, and ended up coming by in the morning. The employee at that time said “we have coffee?” and seemed generally clueless. We also got the bill on our final day and had been charged for daily housekeeping, so I had to go dispute that with the front desk. It seems the front desk staff don’t really know what they’re doing. We did not eat the free breakfast as there are no gluten free options and I have celiac so need separate food. Overall though, a good deal and great location.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found all the Front Desk staff very friendly and professional. Ricardo and Shereen were very pleasant and most helpful. Andy from the Breakfast area was very pleasant and helpful. The Elevators/ lifts took a long time to arrive as there were issues. My first room had heating issues so I had to change rooms. I had to call the Front Desk to send the Engineer to attend to the heater in both rooms. I found this stressful.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I have just returned from a long weekend in New York and stayed at this hotel. I booked this hotel due to its good reviews, but since that point had noticed a few negative reviews which concerned me. I needn't have worried, everything was just as expected. The hotel itself is nice, and is what you pay for it. The room was just what we needed - not sure how people are moaning about rooms when you are staying in New York! If it has a bed and bathroom you're good to go!!The location is incredible, about a 5 minute walk from Times Square and a subway station at the end of the street. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only just got around to writing this review. Stayed here 14th till 20th dec and I cannot believe the negative reviews I’ve read about lifts , food, rooms, bathrooms, air con, etc etc. Our stay was first class, rooms were adequate bonus being the little kitchen. Handy if you’ve got kids. Never had an issue with the lifts even though hotel was full with it being Christmas. Managers social nights Monday to Wednesday were great with free beer, wine and food 5 till 7, with Stella on draught ( my fave). Breakfast was top notch food hot and plentiful. Overall would I stay here again defo and I would recommend it to family and friends if they were coming to New York.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very basic but we were just looking for a moderately priced hotel for a large group with a good location. Calling this hotel “Times Square” is stretching it, Hell’s Kitchen is more accurate. It was a decent walk to Times Square. We had 3 rooms 6 adults and 2 children. We called ahead and were able to get rooms on the same floor which worked out great. Rooms are small but it is very nice to have a kitchenette in the room. Unfortunately this is not a normal Staybridge that has a fold out couch. Expect long long waits for the elevators every time you try to leave your room. Every elevator going down is full and you will have to let quite a few go by before finding one with space. Breakfast was good but very busy. They luckily have multiple places to sit so that helps. We did have a difficult time getting our rooms cleaned. We left our rooms before 9 each day so there should not have been any problem with them getting into our rooms. One day we got back to the rooms before going out to dinner and housekeeping was still cleaning one of the rooms. One room had been cleaned but the third had not been touched. It was 7:00!! So we gathered in the one room that was finished expecting her to clean the other two rooms. We could hear her grumbling while she rushed through that room. The third room she threw clean towels on the bed and left.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel compared to all others in New York was cheap and included a great breakfast and was very central.I stayed here with my 10 year old daughter HOTEL: hotel is centrally located , near time square and 2 different metro stations that we found very useful. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating to any request you may have. Check in is at 4 and they gracefully check us in at 12h00 which was welcoming after a long journey.ROOM: The room is a fair size , has a fully equipped kitchen and a bathroom with a shower only. The beds are extremely comfortable with good linen.The ice machine in the freezer worked like magic and the air con in the room to control your own temperature was great for us who hate being extremely hot.VIEW: we had a room with a view . which was of another hotel directly opposite us.NOISE; All the rooms are located around a lift , so you will without doubt be affected by this. wear earplugs and you'll be fine....The walls are thin and we had very noisy neighbours one night that disturbed us terribly. The fridge has got be the worst and I would recommend you unplug this immediately if you are not using it.BREAKFAST: this was amazing! there was hot oats, cereals. yogurts, breads/bagels, fresh fruits, scrambled eggs, fried eggs, fresh tomatoes, variety of cheeses.TRANSPORT: the hotel offered us a taxi from hotel to airport at USD70 for 2 of us, we took a shared taxi for USD40 (recommend only if not in a rush).This is not a 5 star hotel but the service is great, rooms are clean and i would recommend.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: -The rooms are not soundproof we were able to hear clearly someone speaking on the phone in another room or people passing by in the corridor and we were on the 16th floor yet we could hear the noise on the street. -when you wash your hands in the toilet the water gets stuck and don't drain. -The TV had several channels but most didn't have a clear screen, flickering. -Breakfast was so poor, and not inviting. The seating area is so small you won't find a seating place and the waitress was SHOUTING the info saying milk is not available anymore and if you need any help tell me...!!-There are 3 elevators but for some reason you wait 20 mins if not more to get it, we guessed it s because the cleaning staff kept pressing it to move from floor to floor.-They charge you 5usd extra to clean your room or they ask you to put the do not disturb card on the door so they don't get in to clean. On the day we checked out they charged us 5usd cleaning, than i asked them what is it for and without any explanation they simply said:" Oh don't worry we will remove that for you". So what i understand is that if i didn't ask about it i would have paid it! -The whole vibe in this hotel seemed off like an aged, dusty, dirty place. Not pleasant. For the price we paid per night we expected a much better hotel and service. For 150usd a night any other hotel would have offered a better service, including the cleaning and a better breakfast.. -For an InterContinental Hotels Group i was shocked and for sure will not book in this hotel again
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at this hotel because of reading the wonderful reviews. Also, Hotels.com had a fantastic rate. I regret ever choosing this place. It was so bad that I had to make a list:Here goes:We reserved a Studio Suite with 1 King bed. To call this a suite is laughable at best. This room was so tiny that you could consider a stay at Motel 6 a suite. There is NOTHING that I could see that would make this a suite except say the "kitchen" which was a flat top 2 burner with a sink and fridge as well as a microwave.When we checked in it was a bit of a wait. I didn't mind this because I felt that meant that the location was popular. We asked for a lower room and that was accommodated. When we tried to use the elevators they were frequently on the upper floors exclusively and the wait was outrageously long. By the time you got an elevator it was frequently stuffed with people so you had to wait even longer. So we opted to just carry our luggage up the stairs.When I entered the room I discovered that it was decorated with peeling wall paper and there were stains on it! No biggie, but after a long travel day we decided to just relax a few minutes. So I turned on the TV in the room. Let me tell you this is NO EXAGGERATION, we got FOUR CHANNELS. That's it!! FOUR CHANNELS. The rest either were fuzzy or said no signal. Again, I wasn't going to complain so figured I would access the internet and watch something on my iPad, the wi-fi wouldn't connect!So down to the front desk I went. I was told that they would send someone to check on the room. Great! Fantastic!! But nothing changed. We found that throughout our stay we were told on THREE SEPARATE OCCASIONS that the internet and tv would be fixed..it NEVER WAS. They didn't even come to the room at all to talk to us. The only evidence we had of anybody coming was while we were gone. We returned from one of our outings and found that the TV was on and there were snippets of wires on our table. Great job cleaning up. After complaining AGAIN they opted to give us a late check out. Not really an issue for us but we took it (check out at 1230 rather than 11). Other issues:ANYTIME you used ANYTHING water related in the room a loud squealing would come from the bathroom (I recorded this on my phone). It would sometimes go on for SEVERAL MINUTES and was maddening. Next, location. Is it close to Times Square, Yes. However, with some drawbacks. There is a liquor store about 3 buildings down on the same side of the street as the hotel. You have to walk by this to get to Times Square on foot. Our first day we walked by and about witnessed a fight. It is frequented by drunks and undesirable characters that beg for money or fight/argue amongst each other. We found that we would frequently try to cross the street before coming to that spot but found same issue on the opposite side, we finally just started using cabs. Now for the view, the reason you come to NYC. Our view was of a wonderful canopy of the building next door! It was COVERED with dirty diapers and garbage. This also littered the area just outside of our room. So that was another strike.When we were walking on the floor we were staying on it had the feel of a run down apartment complex. They also encourage smoking in front of the main entrance doors so you constantly get to enjoy the smell of smoke.It wasn't all COMPLETELY bad. The complimentary breakfast was decent. However, be prepared to eat in your room because there is NO seating. The area you dine in is extremely SMALL!!All in all, YMMV in this location, as I have seen several positive reviews as well. Would I ever stay there again?? DEFINITELY NOT!!I feel that the staff doesn't particularly care about issues. Especially when it comes to room issues. To complain 3 times and not have anything fixed is ridiculous. The solution for the issues? They offered us 20% refund (comical) or 20,000 points for a program we were not in to begin with. Oh and as I said earlier, I was given a LATE checkout by the front desk. At almost EXACTLY 1100 there comes a knock on the door. I was met by a rather rude female worker asking, "when are you leaving". I looked at her and said I was given a late checkout and she just walked away. Unbelievable. So do yourself a favor, pay a little more and get a better option.
hotelName:
8    Staybridge Suites Times Square - New York City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for one night with my family in mid-June and will not go back. My kids (6 & 3) were traumatized when the smoke alarm in our room went off in the middle of the night while we were sleeping causing us to escape our room (we thought it was the hotel fire alarm). The night manager was unapologetic to the situation and offered us a facilities fee refund for the defective smoke alarm. We ended up changing rooms. Finally the day manager refunded the entire room. Additionally I had a pair of sunglasses that was given to them for their lost and found. However despite repeated calls as well as talking to the front desk in person, I am unable to get them since their maintenance manager (who apparently is the only person to have access to the lost and found) is never present. I left my address and phone number so that they can send them back to me but I doubt I will ever get them.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been staying at this property since I was a young teenager. Then, it was called the Southgate hotel. It was old and a bit dark, but spacious - a rare and sought-after amenity in NYC. In recent years, the hotel was Affinia Manhattan - under this management, the hotel undertook a major renovation, modernizing the rooms and brightening up the place. It made staying here even better. Most recently, the hotel has become The Stewart Hotel. The rooms appear to have been converted from apartments at some point - as they vary in size. Many of the rooms have a full kitchen and some are quite spacious. When I traveled with 13 girl scouts and 5 chaperones to NYC in June, one of the suites was big enough to accommodate 5 girls in the living room alone - with a fairly large king bedroom for two of the chaperones. I just returned today from a mother-daughter NYC getaway with my 13-year old. It was a trip to expose her to all of the greatness, art, and diversity of NYC. We booked the breakfast package - which included vouchers for $15 per person at a nearby bagel shop (which was wonderful). The $15 was more than enough to cover breakfast - and even a snack for the rood. When we checked in, I noticed our room was quite small - smaller than any of the rooms I have ever stayed in at this property. Eventually, I checked my reservation and learned we had not been assigned the right room type. I contacted the front desk and Margaret, a truly kind and accommodating front desk guru, was able to remove the amount we paid for an upgrade to an upper floor and the fees associated with our reservation. This made a huge difference!As the US National Women's Soccer Team was coming to NYC for a World Cup victory parade the day we were originally slated to leave, Andrew, the front desk manager (who was working from 11 p.m. to 7 a.m.), worked with me to extend our stay so my soccer-loving daughter and I could go to the parade. We paid more than we would have liked, but Andrew worked to the best of his ability to make sure it was as affordable as possible. All told - I find the Stewart to be an exceptional place to stay. I don't review many properties - and I only do so when I feel compelled to extol the virtues of a hotel and its staff. The Stewart may not be perfect - or the most modern of hotels - but it is pretty amazing in all of the aspects that count - central location, clean and generous accommodations, and empathetic and kind staff - especially Andrew and Margaret.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed here for about a week upon check in was welcome by lucy at the desk, we arrived very early and knows we won’t be able to check in but lucy did the impossible she checked us in because we had our young baby with us and my mom so she wanted us to settle in and start enjoying the city! thank you lucy!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lucy who works at the front desk for the Stewart Hotel was wonderful. She is very kind and pleasant to talk to. Lucy was very accommodating to my needs upon arrival. As a customer I was treated with respect and I appreciate Lucy's kindness.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel screams old New York City. The hotel decor reminds me of how hotels look in the movies set in the roaring 20’s. The hotel is very charming. The rooms are small but comfortable. Great for a short stay in Manhattan. Hotel is in walking distance to many sights or you can just hop on the subway to get around. Staff is very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is nice. We got a 1 bedroom 2 bathroom suite. The suite is quite large for a New York apartment. The bathrooms are tiny, though. Andrew will help you out. The hotel is older, but the furnishings are nice. Location is quite good.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located at ideal place right in front of pen station. The rooms were spacious and beautiful. The beds were very comfortable and we had very nice sleep on it. Overall staff was very courteous and services were up to the mark. Lobby was spacious. Only thing which disturbed us was size of rest rooms which were very small. Overall a very good experience. Price could have been little less.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I visited NY for the first time in June.On contacting the hotel in advance and explaining I don't like elevators Lucy kindly organised a free upgrade to a lower floor room for us. We were on the third floor in a corner room. It was huge! Great comfortable bed, bathroom with shower and bathroom and we also had a sofa and kitchenette. Fab views from the window of the street below and MSG. The room was spotlessly clean and maid service each day was great.The staff were all lovely and friendly. Special mention and thanks to Lucy for organizing the room and the wonderful, patient and friendly security guards!On knowing my fear of elevators they kindly opened the back staircase each night on our return so I could get to our room via stairs and not elevator!! Thank you chaps! We had a wonderful first trip to NY and it was made even more wonderful because of this fantastic hotel. Would love to stay with you again one day.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decided to stay here for a last min meeting need booked from hotel tonight the rate was unbeatable. Was checked in by Lucy at the desk, everything was painless and super quick, without me asking for any types of upgrade she went ahead and upgraded my room with a kitchen and a king bed. Very nice hotel comfortable bed will be back again.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to Jenny and Omar at the front desk of The Stewart Hotel for always making sure I’m enjoying my stay during business trips. They go above and beyond each time I’m there. I truly appreciate them. Cam S.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at 11 AM. The room was not supposed to be ready until 4 PM. However, we were assisted by Omar. He immediately arranged a room for us. We are the first time in New York. He guided us on how to explore the city. He also gave a breakfast voucher. On the next day, he also helped us on how to explore the statue of liberty. Altogether, this is a wonderful service.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at 1pm and our room wasn't supposed to be ready until 4pm but the hotel staff found one that was ready and upgraded us! Everyone was so nice and accommodating during our entire stay. The room was spacious and more than I imagined for our family of 4. We will definitely stay at The Stewart Hotel the next time we're in New York!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel to New York on business six to eight times a year, and each time one of the things I look forward to is my visit at the Stewart. Andrew and his staff always greet me with a gracious welcome, remembering who I am since virtually my first visit. Pretty amazing when you consider all the people that come through this hotel. The rooms are frumpy cool clean, and comfortable (see if you can spot the weird little face in the wallpaper). I think what is most charming is the personal touches. When I return to my room each day, my toiletries are all neatly arranged on the sink. The restaurant is very good too (I just discovered it). The only disappointment is when they are full and I have to use a different Hotel.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would never stay anywhere else I love the Stewart I alway get taken care of by the manager Andrew and his staff Lucy at the desk are all wonderful people! This will be my now go to hotel at all time!!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So far our stay at the Stewart hotel has been great! We showed up early in the morning and were able to store our luggage while we explored the city. When coming back for check-in at 4:00 our room was ready and Lucy was so nice when checking us in and making sure that our room was the correct one that we had booked over the phone when we spoke with Khan. Khan helped us to find the perfect room for our girls weekend away to the big apple. Our balcony suite is the best view in the city! You can see Madison square garden and a little glimpse of time square from our very large balcony. Thanks so much to the friendly staff and we will definitely be returning to the Stewart hotel.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was great, the service was amazing.Gregory, the manager, took care of us really well through out our stay. It was our anniversary and he upgraded our room.The location was good and it was a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Less than 10 mins after checking in to this hotel I was joined by a cockroach on my bed (photo). We checked out immediately.The room was small (for a premium double), the a/c unit was ancient and extremely noisy. The bathroom was terrible the countertop to the vanity sink was decrepit (photo) and lots of wear and tear. View of a brick wall.The staff seemed fair and pleasant. But there was no assistance or compensoffered in finding a new room at 10pm at night after travelling for 12 hours. It really messed up our holiday for first couple of days.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review for the hotel would have been a one star review if Gregory hadn’t saved the weekend!We had an absolutely horrible first day during check in and even afterwards. Several of the front desk staff were rude and, quite frankly, incompetent. It was really bumpy. At that point we thought our trip was ruined.The next morning we met with Gregory and it was night and day. So, this review is for him alone. His customer service is unparalleled. He more than made up for the disaster of the previous day. He went out of his way to ensure we were happy and well taken care of. We really felt he went above and beyond. I have to say that the two bedroom suite we had booked and finally actually received only after Gregory stepped in, was pretty great for the price and location.Gregory - we are sending all our friends to you to make sure they have an awesome stay! Thanks again for saving our long awaited girls weekend.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were new to the city taking a family vacation.. had a hotel booked & the one we booked didn’t work out for us so we came here & Andrew was very friendly & A great help. Thank you Andrew!! The hotel is very nice & clean. It was a great place to stay.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Andrew checked us in and was very professional yet very congenial. He and Ash were very welcoming to air-delayed, tired travelers. The historical lobby is beautiful and the hotel room was clean and roomy. The view from our room was beautiful!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came to NYC for a w/e w/ my 2 daughters. We are having a wonderful time. Location is great, room is clean and comfortable, staff is pleasant. Emily at the front desk very professional, nice and helpful.Will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An older hotel with some updates, moderately priced. Room was surprisingly spacious, shower was snug, bed and pillows comfortable. Valet parking available for $75. Staff were friendly. A good value. Would stay again.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mom, daughter and I came to visit NY for a couple of days. Andrew, one of the staff, upgraded our room complimentary and called us later to make sure we were happy with the room. Pleased with the service and room! Plan to come back.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hospitality and very accommodating. Lucy and Andrew helped get us the best first time experience here at Stewart hotel and New York City! We have a great view down the street and across from Madison Square Garden.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is awesome quality for money. I wouldn’t have felt ripped off if I had paid double what I paid. The room was cleaned and made up everyday. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. And we were given a free room upgrade on arrival as it was my partners birthday. Bonus!!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was promising but the rooms weren't as clean as we would have liked. There was mould growing in one of the drawers of the desk. The service was a bit slow when it came to the front desk, but otherwise it was pretty good.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girl friends and I LOVE this hotel. Especially because of the staff, Desiree, Curtis and Andrew. They made sure we enjoyed our 5 nights here. We will be returning to The Stewart.Clean and convenient.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay, across from the MSG and PENN Station!! So central! The rooms were awesome, roomy and well appointed! We love the Stewart!!! We had access to the entire hotel and the late night snack bar was great
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time at the Stewart Hotel. The hospitality and the customer service is excellent. Andrew Dailey and his hotel staff know how to treat their guests to make sure they have the best experience at the Stewart Hotel. I highly recommend to anyone looking to stay in the busy midtown area if it’s for a business trip, couples, or events at the Garden. I will definitely be returning back to the Stewart Hotel.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just stayed here for 2 weeks in a studio with kitchen. The positives are my room was not available for my whole trip but I upgraded my room and they kept me in my same room instead of having to change (not sure how that changed from booking to staying). Niles bar was nice and the barmen were lovely. Go to mustang Harry’s across the road if you get a chance the bar staff are amazing.Amazing proximity to penn station and 34th street path station (to get to Hoboken).Not sure where everyone’s getting these amazing staff from, everyone I spoke to apart from one Asian guy who’s name I didn’t catch made me feel like they wanted to get rid of me. Not great for a young British girl visiting America alone.I had 3 suitcases and was helped up the stairs with them then ignored and nobody helped when I left either.The room itself is very large and very handy to have the kitchen (especially considering how expensive New York is for food) target and whole foods are not far so I cooked pasta and stuff a lot. Be aware if you leave food in the pan (for the next night or something) the cleaner WILL throw it away. She will also throw away any wine you leave out to breathe. And will leave her hairs in the bath (black hairs, not my blond hair) and if you’re not out of your room by midday she will knock, shout, call and try to open the door even if you have a do not disturb sign out. When I first got into the room someone else’s bra was in the drawer next to the bed. I told the front desk and the girl apologised and said it would be sorted but when I got back to my room hours later it was still there and the cleaner said she took it away (god knows what she did take then). My sheets were not changed once in my whole 2 week stay and there was a large red stain on the corner of the duvet, similar to the red coming through the wallpaper (?). I was so surprised that there was no robe or slippers provided and the thing that bugged me the most was the shower curtain (gross) who even uses shower curtains any more? Never ever seen that in a hotel.On about my 3rd day I came down at 4pm and asked if it was too late to have my room serviced and the girl said no they have people cleaning rooms all day so I was shocked when I came down once at 6pm and asked for my room to be serviced and there was a discussion behind the desk and I was told ‘we’ll see what we can do but you might not get a full service’ .. they literally took the bin out and that was it. That’s what I’m paying $3,500 for? In the room description they tell you ‘iHome docking station’ .. it’s for an iPhone 4, not the smaller lightening jack for the iPhones every person has now. The window sills and lamps are very dusty and when I got to my room there was a squashed mosquito on the window sill, and another one appeared that I didn’t squash either? The bed was comfy enough but I literally woke up about 4 times a night because of the air con. The air con, as everyone has said, is extremely loud and has been put through a hole in the window so it literally sounds like there’s a window open and you can hear everything.  A guy I met in a bar told me he stays here quite often for work and he once found a USED condom UNDER the sheets. He wasn’t surprised about the bra situation in my room.I probably would stay here again purely for convenience and one of my friends has booked a stay here, I just will lower my expectations next time.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I reserved through hotels.com a room for $170- it looked great and the hotel had pictures off a balcony which I thought would be great to see the city night lights. When I checked in, I realized that some rooms have a balcony and some did not. Mine did not, but on hearing my disappointment, Emily and Carly worked it out and gave me a room with our own private balcony and it was wonderful!! The bedding was excellent, we had a little kitchen and a real living room and a bedroom. I can't recommend it enough! And within sight of Penn Station no less!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not for the faint hearted . Get your walking shoes on and prepare for several miles a day . If you get taxis there expensive and slow when traffic is really busy.We found the standard of Hygiene in 90% of cafes and eating places not clean enough standard really low. The city Hotel we stopped in booked by our travel agent sub standard see photos
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First room had water all over bathroom floor. 2nd room had wall air conditioner falling apart and terrible mildew smell. 3rd room was functional but all rooms demonstrated signs of disrepair. Paint peeling, caulk over caulk over caulk to fill defects in bathrooms. No exhaust fan or vent in 3 out of the 4 bathrooms I examined (hence the damp, mildew smell). I got a nice "suite" with separate kitchenette which was spacious, but the bathrooms are all terribly cramped. Rooms could be configured to create much more usable space but I suspect asbestos from old construction preclude renovations. I will not stay here again. NY is expensive but there are better options for $300 per night.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an issue with the previous hotel we booked so I needed to find another place to stay last minute. I'm so grateful I found Stewart Hotel and from now on it's always going to be my first choice. Andrew, at the front desk, was outstanding! He helped us get the best room for our group and I felt so well taken care of. The hotel is really clean and in an ideal location. Everyone is so friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed at the Hotel Stewart 6+ times, and it never disappoints. Everything about this hotel is 10 out of 10. Doormen are friendly and helpful. The desk staff rocks. They're professional problem-solvers. Anything you need help with, ask them! Rooms are spacious and clean. Housekeeping is friendly.Hotel is centrally located, so you can walk all around Manhattan, or just hop an easy Subway train in just a few steps out of the hotel.And it's Pet Friendly! So bring your fur-babies!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Stewart continues to be my go-to hotel in NYC, in large part because of the staff. On my last trip, Andrew and Khan at the front desk were particularly helpful in straightening out my reservation.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is amazing!!! The staff welcomes you like family and the location can’t be beat. Even more so, this time I met the manager (Andrew Daly) who provided a personal touch that you just don’t find at most (if any) hotels. Definitely takes the sting out of a long trip when your destination is so nice. Thanks again and see you soon!SeanO
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Andrew at the front was great. Helped us out with a great corner room. Being a historical building, the room had interesting features. Conveniently located, and shockingly -- we didn't hear much residual noise from the city. Maybe that was our room and floor, but either way -- impressive for a downtown location.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Currently staying at The Stewart Hotel in a one bedroom suite. Great location, we have walked most places and Penn Station is just across the road.Check in was fast and simple after a long flight from Brisbane/Melbourne. Room as expected a little dated but clean and all we need as we wanted a place to sleep after exploring. Room serviced everyday and couple of requests for minor things have been acted on quickly and with friendliness. Eg additional coat hangers. Really happy with room and price. We also used the washing machine which was great. Restaurant/bar downstairs looks really good. We are yet to try as we have had a list of places to eat. As our feet tire we will definitely be giving it a go one evening.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent customer service and very proffesional staff. Andrew checked us in at the front desk and he was very pleasant!!! I will Deffinitly come back!!!The hotel room was very clean too and it just made the trip more comfortable.....
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel and amazing staff! Lucy and her coworkers were amazing and super helpful! I would reccommend it to anyone! Unbeatable rates. Also the location is right downtown manhattan a walk away from everything
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment I arrived, Jenny at reception was incredibly kind and helpful. After arriving on a red eye they gave me the first room available to get some quick rest and clean up before meetings. The room was surprisingly large for NYC standards. I extended my stay the next day.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed overnight for the Pink Concert at MSG right across the street & super convenient. While our room wasn't the room we chose online we went to the front desk and was so happy to meet Christina who made sure that our stay was the one we hoped for. She was amazing and it fixed everything for us!!!! Thank you Christina!!!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my stay at the Stewart hotel was mixed. I was already skeptical as I found out just before my stay that the reviews on their Tripadvisor website were fake. I travelled with my family and we booked a room with 2 beds for originally 7 nights. after 2 freezing nights of noise we could't bear it and had to change hotels. the rooms did not meet our expectations and were extremely small and cramped. you felt like you were in a cold dungeon. the decor was tired and old and overall the rooms bought my stay down for me. as we stayed during Christmas time I did enjoy the decorations in the lobby but there was vents that came from outside straight into each bedroom which let out the constant noise of loud sirens and nightlife as well as the freezing cold air. it was like they had just done a cheap and bad renovation to the rooms. my family and I did not sleep for 2 nights and it felt like we were sleeping on the streets. therefore we changed hotels.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed twice in the last couple of months for a week each time working at the boxing at MSG, taken care of brilliantly by Andrew and the staff. Hotel is perfectly located, easy to get around, and MASSIVE rooms by Manhattan standards. Thank you
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff with early check in and late check out. Max was especially attentive and willing to assist in anyway possible. Thanks Max! This hotel is in a great location and the rooms and big and spacious!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Without doubt one of the best hotels in NY Andrew the hotel manger and his colleagues couldn’t of made this trip any better. The hotel is opposite Maddison Sq Grdn which for us fight fans makes it ideal but also very close to everything 10 mins walk to the Empire State Building, Times Sq 5 mins walk. This trip was for the boxing but I’ll bring my kids next time to catch a show on Broadway and stay here as the suite was perfectSee you soon T
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel a lot for business in this hotel was a great experience great staff great hotel great location If you want the best place to stay go here Andrew the Managet goes out of his way to help you Highly recommend it
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Coming to New York for the first time can be hard especially if nobody has recommended places for to stay for you. However I’m here to recommend this hotel for you. The Stewart hotel is around a 20 minute walk from time square and 30 from the Empire State Building. In a busy city you don’t need to hire a car just walk. The hotel is a great place to come and relax after a busy day sightseeing. The beds are very comfortable and the staff are friendly.I 100% RECOMMEND STAYING HERE.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are in a 2 bedroom suite as a family and I love this place. Omar was so wonderful during the day and at check in and Emily at night is incredible. My sons are so happy with the size of our room and I am so pleased with how nice everyone is. Omar and Emily went above and beyond and made us feel at home :) This place is central to everything and I will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our 6th time staying at the Stewart hotel- Andrew and his staff are one the biggest reasons we will continue coming back!Stayed at the Stewart hotel and loved the hotel and was so impressed with their manager Andrew Daley. He was so kind and arranged for us to get into our room earlier with our three kids. Can’t say enough for the hotel, staff, location and overall experience. Thanks a lot from Canada
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this place, opposite the Madison Square Garden. Andrew, Jessica and Nancy are great I travel lots, wished all hotels had an Andrew Always around to help and sort out anything needed Thanks
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rented 2 rooms with family and some friends. The hotel is located across the street from Madison Square Gardens, with easy access to all subway stations. If you are not familiar with the subway system, download their app and all you need to remember is to get off at Penn Station :)This is not a 5 star hotel but its well kept, clean and location cannot be beaten. The rooms are spacious, beds are comfortable and the ones we rented had kitchenettes. Super Target is within walking distance so we went shopping and made breakfast in the room every day. Giving it 4 stars as I believe the hotel in general needs some updating. other than that, I would fully recommended.
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We come to NYC often for boxing event. This is without a doubt our favourite one. Even when promoters make arrangements elsewhere, we switch it up and stay here. Right across from the Gatden. Insane balconies. This is the biggest one I’ve seen BUT it’s not the only one. Huge rooms. But above all, impeccable service from Andrew, Guest Services Manager and Nancy. They are the reason we keep coming back. It’s NOT the newest property, but for me it’s THE best. They understand our needs. NEVER any issues. Thank you!MJ
hotelName:
9    Stewart Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can't go wrong with the location of this place, 5-10 mins walk to Central Park, Time's Square, and all that go with it. Of course the rooms are tiny, but this is New York. My only beef was with the service at the hotel, no one really wanted to offer any service, or if you asked it felt like you were making them do something they didn't want to do. If you have any questions, or need some tips, just speak to the guys at the door, they actually helped and offer service, thanks fellas! Bar on the roof is cool, but doesn't open to 4 or 5 pm, what is that? There should be certain hours just for guest before corp parties come or the after work crowd. Diner across the street is good, along with the .99$ pizza place next to it. With proper service this could be a great hotel, until then 2-3 stars. 85$ resort fee also added at checkout, with no resort perks.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel last year when I came, and I love it again this year. The location is incredible, the rooms are cozy (some maybe a little too cozy lol but that's just NYC), and the rooftop bar is a blast. But the best part is the staff. Last year I met a whole group of friendly faces, and it was the same this year. Winnard, Gustavo and Adrian all helped make this stay a great one. Thank you, Dream!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived to the hotel on a Friday morning, several hours before check in, and not only did they have a room ready for us, but we were given a complimentary upgrade! This was a great start to our trip. The room was compact, but generous by NYC standards. The bed was super soft (in a good way) which led to me having one of the best sleeps I've ever had while on vacation. The hotel is located in a great area: very close to one of the main subway lines, Central Park, Times Square, Broadway, and many restaurants, cars, and cafes. The hotel's cocktail lounge, The Rickey, is a must try!Downside: We were on the 11th floor and could hear the music being blasted from the rooftop bar until very late on Friday & Saturday nights. Although I was very annoyed the first night, I expected/got used to it by the second night. The other only downside to this hotel is the resort/facility fee. It's nothing more than just a cash grab...nothing extra is offered with it. In fact, our room wasn't even cleaned one of the days we were there.We would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel looks amazing in the hotel reception. A really nice, modern feel to it. The room was decorated nicely and was clean. However there were small flys in the bathroom and all around the shower area. We didn’t have a window open so I’m not sure where they came from. When I took the plug out of the sink it was covered in hair. The toilet seat was also wonky and moved when you sat on it. Amenities were fine, but not many. Just shower gel, condition and shampoo - we had a lot more in our hotels in Los Angeles and San Francisco. Daily water which is a nice touch. We stayed Saturday - Tuesday and we could very hear loud music from the hotels bar until 4am in the morning on the Saturday night. Sort of understandable, but 4am is very late! The cleaners were friendly and the room was always cleaned well. We barely saw the other staff of the hotel which felt a bit strange and some of them came across as a bit rude - we didn’t feel very appreciated for staying at their hotel. We also had a really late flight home and they late us check out at 1pm instead of 12 at no extra cost which is nice, but we wanted to get changed and had to walk through the hotels restaurant to use their toilets to do so which were not very clean! Hotel in a great location. Don’t be put off my review and not book, it definitely did the job and was overall clean with a comfy bed which is the main priority!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent sized rooms, cool lobby lounge, nice staff. Winnard, Gustavo, and Adrian stood out especially (Winnard told me a joke I am still laughing about). Fish tank in the lobby is a nice touch. The elevators are a little slow, but whatever.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We live in the tri-state area and occasionally like to stay in the city instead of driving home after a night out. We looked at the ratings for the Dream Midtown and decided to book a room since the location was good and the rate was reasonable. We used the app Hotel Tonight. Upon checking in they gave us what must have been the worst room in the hotel. It was a very small, oddly configured room on the 13th floor that was next to the express elevator to the rooftop bar, The room was also was right below the rooftop bar and just down the hall from the employee lounge where staff members would congregate and create a lot of noise. I defy management to explain how any of their rooms are worse than the one they gave us. We didn’t say anything at first because we planned on being out for the evening and want to see how it was when we returned. Upon our return when we stepped off the elevation on the 13th floor it sounded like the DJ from the Penthouse bar was in our room. The music was coming through the elevator shaft and through the walls and ceiling. It was so incredibly loud! So we went down to reception and told them they we were unable to stay in the room because of all the problems (especially the noise). David, at the front desk, (who was reasonably polite) first said that they were fully booked (which just wasn't true - we went on line and found rooms available). When we repeated that we were not going to stay in that room he went into the room next to reception (presumably to speak with someone) and when he returned he reluctantly gave us a room on the 6th floor away from the elevators (I guess they were not fully booked after all). He asked us how we booked our room and when we said Hotel Tonight he explained that when you book through one of the discount sites the hotel will likely give you “whatever room is available without focusing on the quality of the room" (we interpreted that to mean the worst room in the hotel).” Even on the 6th floor the music was blaring through the elevator shaft but it was quieter away from the elevator shafts. Our new room was not without issues but they were minor in comparison. If you want to party until 4AM this may be a place to consider. For sleep there are many better alternatives.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Some friends from out of town surprised me for my birthday and booked a room here. I had heard of the brand from their more popular downtown location, and was surprised at how awesome this place is. The location is great, so is the rooftop bar. Adrian, Gustavo and Winard were super friendly. I live in NYC, so it might be a little hard to justify booking again anytime soon, but rest assured I am trying hard to think of an excuse lol.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We always stay here time we go to NYC . It is close to the plays , restaurants and Central Park . We always booked the platinum suite very spacious and comfortable which allows us for a lot privacy . The staffAlways been very pleasant specially Gustavo and Winard great service ....
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great experience at the Dream Midtown Hotel. At check-in, I arrived at 6:30am and didn't expect a room to be ready for me but was pleasantly surprised that they were able to get me in a room! The room was beautiful and big, not like a lot of NY hotels. I had a fabulous experience with Winard the night guy. He was so kind. He hailed a taxi for me and lifted my super heavy bag with a smile on his face. He left me smiling and was a pleasant way to end my trip.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have always stayed at another hotel a block off Times Square, but wanted to save a ton of money and took a gamble on booking two rooms for me and my son at the Dream Midtown. Overall, I was very happy. The location is amazing. Short 5 minute walk to Central Park and short 10 minute stroll to Times Square. Relatively quiet location. Staff are very professional and helpful. Rooms are small and bright and on the modern side. There is a rooftop patio/lounge that was incredibly popular with a line up down the street on Saturday evening. I didn't have a chance to check it out, but the young crowd lined up suggested it was a big hit. No noticeable noise or trouble from those accessing the rooftop lounge. Our rooms were on the 7th floor. Bed was very comfortable 8/10. Bedding was great 8/10. i thought the pillows weren't great 6/10 (they were tiny). Washroom was nice 8/10. Soap was odd - tiny little square that crumbled easily 5/10. TV was great 8/10. View from my room was minimal - but that is par for the course for a smaller building in Manhattan. Room rates were Excellent! I saved a ton staying here. This hotel would have a solid 5 star rating if they fixed one very major problem: noise from the hall (which could come from the hall or from other rooms) because the DOORS DON'T FIT PROPERLY AND ARE TERRIBLE. For what it's worth - I would expect most everyone to give this place a 5 star rating if they changed all of the doors. I figure they could increase the room rates by $10 per night for every room and recover the expense (within 6 months) of a new properly fitting, soundproof door, on every room. $10/night won't scare away any new guest - and this property will be booked up for months to come. I would make sure you do not get a room near the elevator! If you can sleep through anything, then this is not an issue for you. If you bring a loud white noise maker, then you can get by. If you are a very light sleeper - you won't be happy. The doors presently have the same soundproofing as a curtain.Overall, if you are not bothered by hallway noise, this place is a gem. Sorry to be so harsh about the doors. But both of our rooms were exactly the same.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay at the Dream midtown. The room was comfortable and above all the location is amazing. All the staff we interacted with were great, especially Arben at the concierge who was welcoming and extremely helpful. I’ll definitely be back
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an incredible stay at the dream midtown! The location was great. The room was super clean & the handsome concierge, Arben was very accommodating and nice. I will definitely be back to stay again! :) 10/10 recommend.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had the most enjoyable time at this hotel. The concierge was extremely courteous and professional. Would absolutely stay again!! Arben Gjonbalaj in particular demonstrated perfect service and made our stay the most enjoyable ever. Keep it up!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing really special about the King "Bronze" room 8th floor, I had a Broadway "views" but the windows were small and dirty not much of view, I could also hear all the sounds of NY. I stayed at the Hotel because it's in a perfect walking distance to the Broadway theater (1 year Anniversary date). The room only had a mini bar which was motion censored so we didn't even breathe near it, we had to order room service for ice, and cups- that was at no charge. It was a bit disappointing for the price, the location was the only reason I gave them a 3 star, also because the rooftop bar PHD was nice.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a bit of trouble parking but after that it was great! Winard was very friendly and helpful. Room was nice, stayed in a king on 12th floor. Noise wasn’t bad. Concierge Arben was also helpful getting show tickets. Ate at the bar and had good service one night and bad the next. Overall great experience and enjoyed the location.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Dream Hotel was an ideal location. We walked to so many things. The rooms are spacious , comfortable and clean. Adrian , Anthony and Winard we're super friendly making the visit fantastic. The breakfast at Serafina was average. The lounge PHD was nice.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Drove down from Charlestown with the crew and we couldn’t haven been more impressed with Dream and the staff! Adrian the bellboy and Arvin the concierge made sure we were taken care of from the second we pulled in! These guys go above and beyond for their guests! Special shoutout to Gustavo and Winard at the front desk for making sure our room was the best in the house. All around classy guys and a classy hotel. Thanks Dream! Will be back 100%
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked at the dream hotel for my aunties 60th birthday was to be our first stay in New York. Staff were friendly winard and Gustavo were awesome help us a lot overall the recommended us the roof top to go celebrated our auntie 60th birthday,we had a great time up there and definitely appreciated it for the recommendation .My aunt was upgrade it in her room type. We enjoyed this trip so much highly recommend the hotel great location amazing staff thank you for the hospitality .
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was at the dream a couples months before and I came back with my husband love the location the hotel is very close to Times Square and the service is amazing Gustavo is very kind I felt very welcome once again beds are comfortable definitely love staying here all the time .
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel was great for first timers to New York. Our room was minute, but the bed was extremely comfortable. Unfortunately, the bar fridge was stocked to the brim with hotel supplies which worked on an electronic system, resulting in us being unable to use it for any items we purchased outside the hotel. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room either.The location was great for us though. It was close to subway stations, and an easy walk down to Times Square as well as the theatre district. Although the traffic was extremely heavy at all times of the day and night, in hindsight, we wish we had purchased a Hop On/Hop Off Bus ticket to get an overview of all the sights.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Eclectic rooms in midtown at a great value. Convenient to everything. Have stayed here several times now and it is always a great experience. The staff was especially helpful, especially Adrian who made sure we got settled in promptly and easily.Will definitely return.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a little put off when we first pulled up to the hotel — there was a long line of people in line to get into the bar, and I found myself second guessing if this was the right hotel for my girl and I. Upon meeting Adrian and Abi five seconds later, my fears were immediately assuaged. This hotel has the kindest staff I’ve ever seen. Winnard, Gustavo and Arrben were other standouts. The funny thing is, when we went up to the roof bar, it ended up being awesome as well:)
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great experience at the hotel. Ani, Adrian, and Shawn were all awesome at the front door. Wynyard at the desk was a sweetheart as well. Loved the fish tank in the lobby and the bowling alley downstairs. The room was a little small, but that's NYC lol
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First and foremost, thank you! My time at Dream Midtown was amazing! I came in on business from San Francisco not expecting much from New York in the sense of hospitality. Time to time I hear the people there are rude etc. but I was mistaken! Upon arrival I had the pleasure of meeting Adrian whom was very helpful with my belongings. From there I had met Winard and Gustavo, these gentlemen would be the reason why Dream Midtown will see me again. Gustavo in particular was very kind and informative, as I had mentioned I was a bit leary of New Yorkers but these guys sure proved me wrong. I was given the perfect room, everything I needed and inquired about was granted at the drop of a hat. Dream Midtown enhanced my business trip leaving me with the urge to schedule another one! Thank you guys!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was excellent! The people were very accommodating, especially Gustavo the attendant at the front desk. Winard the receptionist also was very pleasant. The bellman was very helpful with our luggage’s I believe his name is Adrian, any who these gentlemen were very helpful toward my wife and I. Highly recommended!!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel to NYC for business every few weeks and tried The Dream in midtown this time. The hotel was basic and fine for the rates though the extremely small room and no real amenities. The room didn’t even have lotion, just shampoo and conditioner and one time shower gel. Room was extremely basic for the price. Another nyc hotel where the lobby is much nicer than the rooms. So you pay more money for the nice lobby with loud music that you are never in.What will make me not stay at this hotel again though as it is part of a growing trend of hotels charging a resort or facilities fee for NOTHING, just because they feel they can because other hotels started to. In this case, they charged a $25/night resort fee per night and told me it was for the gym - a gym they didn’t even have, they give passes to a dirty Crunch gym a few blocks away - And WiFi, basic services that even if they had other hotels in the area offer with NO resort fee (including the Cassa and Park Terrace).What’s more, another hotel (like The Royalton) that doesn’t even offer coffee in the morning anywhere or even a coffee maker in the room. Instead, they direct you to a Starbucks a few blocks away.I feel totally ripped off by the resort fee and will not stay there again, nor will I stay at any hotel who continues to rip customers off by charging these fees for nothing. I suggest you call ahead and make sure any hotel you stay in does not charge these fees as there are plenty of hotels that still don’t charge them and have nicer facilities, actual gyms in the hotel, and coffee - something even a basic La Quinta Inn or Courtyard Marriott has anywhere else.Of course because the customer service is generally bad in NYC the front desk didn’t care when I lodged this complaint. I definitely won’t stay at The Dream again until they do some basic upgrades and remove the resort fee. It seems to only pay for the fish tank in the lobby.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Dream Midtown Hotel in April and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is perfectly located, rooms were clean and the service excellent! Adrian and Holden helped us out and set the tone for a pleasant hotel stay. They was knowledgeable, personable and professional.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Dream Midtown and had a great experience!!! There was a slight mix up with our room the first night,but made up for it the next 3 nights by upgrading us to a huge suite (712). This hotel has the best staff I have ever met!! The desk staff, bellmen and all the housekeeping were totally awesome! David, Winard , Gustavo and Adrian were especially great! I have been to New York City many times and I have never had such great service as I did at the Dream . I can't wait to come back!!”
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super cute rooms. Clean. Comfortable. Great bars in the hotel and the coolest prohibition style bar/restaurant next door. 3 blocks from Central Park! The staff was friendly and when it was raining they loaned us umbrellas.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my partner were visiting the city and staying in The Dream Midtown to pamper myself for my 33rd birthday. The receptionist found out we were there specifically for my celebration so he upgraded us to a bigger room and thanked us numerous times for choosing the Dream on my special dat to make my dreams come true. I’m almost sure his name is Gustavo though I’m pretty bad with names, but of the whole experience and staff interactions he was the one that made everything feel much more special and memorable!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Winard and Gustavo were great on the front desk. Sean and Adrian ran the bell desk like a five star concierge service. So friendly and professional. Great representatives of a hotel whose entire staff really cares. Tiny issue with the elevator and the PHD bar. Otherwise great room, great services. Loved it.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One block off Broadway Avenue, a short walk from Times Square, Central Park and Lincoln for the Performing Art Center, this is the perfect place for a visit to the "City that Never Sleeps": quite noisy for rooms facing 55th St. Reception desk and all staff are very pleasant to deal with (surprising for some NYC establishments) and ready to provide help making the stay more comfortable. Room is quite large, airy, clean with a huge modern type bathroom. Surrounded by innumerable restaurants and quick eateries. Highly recommend....
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this place adrian the bell hop was amazon iv stayed there before an had adrian as my bell hop then also very fraindly an perfesional the hotels great comfortable good location , an am actually planning on returning in a month or 2 agean
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay at Midtown Dream hotel in NYC. Everyone who works there very helpful. Close to shopping the main reason I went to NYC. Very good Italian food for dinner at the hotel restaurant. Want to thank Adrian the bellman who recommended the restaurant “Catch” for an amazing brunch on Sunday.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was great, everything went perfectly well included the great breakfast they served us every morning with pure respect. Great location near the Theatre district, everything was close and was able to walk around
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Winard was just awesome!! Made us feel super welcome, gave us suggestions on things to do and see. He seemed like he genuinely loved his job and he absolutely deserves a huge raise!!! He helped us without hesitation!!! Thank you for an amazing stay. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. It was probably the quietest rooms I’ve stayed in. Couldn’t hear any street noise or any guests in other rooms. I can’t wait to go back
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location near Times Square and the Theatre District. Excellent selection of restaurants near by like Redeye grill and Patsys. Winard and Natalia was very friendly and the rooms where clean & nice. We had a wonderful experience and would return again.”
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a difference a day makes. Yesterday, I wrote a critical review of our experience here, but after an incredible response from DREAM Midtown, I am writing an updated assessment.Our stay unfortunately started off poorly, mostly due to noise-related issues in our first-floor room. However, after discussing our concerns with the night manager (whose name escapes me now), when we woke up this morning, plans were already underway to move us to a larger, quieter room on a higher floor. Not only that, but when I met with the day manager, Michael, he further provided complimentary breakfasts, wine, and a discount. Michael also continued following up with us through the day to ensure that the issues we had experienced were rectified. I cannot remember a time when an individual has done so much to help turn around what would have otherwise been a bad experience. DREAM Midtown is exceptionally fortunate to have someone with Michael's genuine courtesy and commitment to making things right for their guests.We will certainly consider staying at DREAM Midtown again next time we visit New York, and encourage others to as well - the customer service alone warrants taking a look. Be sure, though, to avoid first floor rooms unless you are a partier or heavy sleeper!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Welcoming, clean hotel based on 55th Street just ten minutes walk from Broadway and Times Square. Ideal location for access to most popular attractions such as 911 Memorial, Top of the Rock and MoMA. Can highly recommend the cocktail bar on the roof too for great views down Broadway
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At check in the welcoming was very friendly Gustavo made our stay very comfortable also winard was very attentive and helpful definitely our experience at the dream hotel was wonderful thank your hospitality I will recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives ....
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I much enjoyed our stay. The Dream is top notch.. Great staff. Holden and Gustavo and Adrian were very welcoming and always eager to please. The large aquarium sets the right vibe of the hotel. The rooms are great with marble bathrooms...They even have a rooftop lounge...overall the Dream is a High End Experience but not at high end price......Experience the Dream
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and customer service. Upgrade easy. The room was clean, comfortable, and pretty. Great location off Broadway with a friendly staff. I did not notice a gift shop, though. I asked for a late checkout and it was accommodated. Gustavo, Adrian and Holden were great.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an outstanding stay at the Dream Midtown Hotel New York. Phenomenal staff (thank you Adrian, Holden, and Gustavo for your welcoming personality), roomy rooms, incredible location, terrific amenities, fantastic breakfast at Serafina restaurant .
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to stayed at the Dream hotel midtown and it was an amazing decision. Adrian was amazing since day one and so helpful in everything we needed. We needed to go to a near hotel with all of our luggage and he helped is all the way. I would definitely stay there again just because of the great customer service. Amazing!!!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 nights at the Dream Midtown as part of my 60th birthday treat. We arrived before our room was ready so had a couple of drinks in Tanner Smiths, a cool bar right next door. On our return, our room was ready so we were soon settling in. We were on the 9th floor and had a great view of Broadway below. The room was of average size, air conditioned, and clean. Modern bathroom, consisting of a walk-in shower sink and wc. The room could have maybe done with a bit of freshening up but was clean. One small wardrobe that was just the right size for what we wanted to store ( clothes for 5 days ) .Soundproofing of noise from the outside was not good but I understand that this is quite usual when staying in New York. We did get used to the sounds of the streets after the first 2 nights. I would recommend this hotel for the excellent location, clean facilities and friendly helpful staff.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another over-the-top stay at The Dream (midtown) - Amazing staff, fabulous rooms, and unmatched location!Serafina was spectacular (as always) ...don’t order from the menu - just ask the kitchen to prepare something special and you will be blown-away!pHD in the evening is simply a one of a kind roof-top night club with outdoor spaces looking down onto Times Square ...the energy and views are best in the city!Our only wish was for just 24 more hours ...we will be back again in the fall!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a pleasant surprise to see the upgrades made at the Dream Hotel. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms were large with nice decorations. I have always enjoyed staying at the Dream Hotel and look forward to returning soon. Adrian, Gustavo and Winard were amazing hotel staffers. However, I was surprised and very disappointed that there wasn’t 24 hour room service available. Congratulations on a beautifully renovated hotel ! I am already wanting to return.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros-comfortable beds-quiet rooms- great shower pressure. Cons- the front desk could be a hit or miss. -Time I stayed before this one, I had issues where they charge my credit card twice. Long process to remove. Giving them a second chance with staying this time around because overall a nice place to stay. Overall, stay- its a nice hotel- just be weary of the bill afterwards.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at your hotel this passed weekend and I wanted to thank you for a wonderful stay . We are new parents and was our first time away from the baby and Gustavo your front desk agent made us feel so welcomed. We greatly appreciate it.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown

review_body: Great location at the dream midtown , close to Central Park, Times Square , Rockefeller center. Rooms are very comfortable with all the basic amenities , at night there’s noisy the windows are not with sound proof , it’s a good option in New York City , the staff are the hotel are very helpful and nice. Could be an option in NY.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A special thank you to Michael Louie and David at the Dream Midtown Hotel - they ensure that I was reunited with my lost wallet!! While I haven't had a chance to stay at the hotel, their staff is clearly thoughtful and attentive as they both went above and beyond to help me.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was staffed with helpful employees and was very clean and neat. Our room was a good size and we enjoyed our stay. As a morning coffee drinker though, I would have been happier if I could have waked to a good cup of hot coffee before beginning my day. Ah well, I guess you can't have it all.
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for the second time recently, I was there on business but brought my wife this time. Right on Broadway, Stephan Colbert show right across the street, 4 blocks to Central Park, about 12 blocks to Times Square. If you know how to ride the subway (it’s very safe and not that hard, read a tutorial online) you can go anywhere you want in the 5 boroughs for just $2.75, we went to see the Statue of Liberty and the World Trade Center that way. The staff was great, very helpful and friendly, we got there too early for check in but they locked up our bags and we walked around the park. The room was not large, but for NYC that is expected and it was not small either. We had a comfy bed and how much time are you going to spend in the room while in Manhattan? We were out and about almost every minute we were awake. Safe neighborhood, my wife felt comfortable out by herself while I was working. All in all a great trip, I will definitely stay here again next time I am in the city. K. Peterson
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a long weekend reunion with the girls and decided to stay here after a friend recommended it. I am giving my friend a high five next time I see her — this place is awesome! Adrian the bellman was the best part; he actually went out in the pouring rain to buy us a bottle of Prosecco. The first night we went down to the Fishbowl and rolled a few frames (this place has a bowling alley!), then went up to the rooftop for a night cap. Right then and there the girls and i decided this would be our yearly reunion spot. Thank you Dream Hotel!!
hotelName:
10    Dream Midtown
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: People working here are great. They have been attentive and helpful. Shanekia in the breakfast bar has been awesome. Always trying to make our day start well. Rooms are small but comfortable. I wish they had a laundry on site for us to use. Located right in the thick of the theater district. Very convenient for trains, several different stations close by.
