review_body: Really impressed with check in staff (in particular Kevin Julren). Super accommodating and friendly. Whole team was that way! I’ll be back. Liked the location as well. Clean and large rooms. Great visit
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was perfect the staff were excellent especially Charles would recommend this hotel The room was cleaned every DayBreakfast was good really central to Times SquareHop on and off Bus service was outside Hotel which has Downtown and up town tours
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hilton Garden Inn Times Square served as home base during our recent week long family vacation. Times Square is one block away and numerous restaurants and theaters within an easy walk. There are several subway train stations within a few blocks. The property is clean and quiet. All of the employees were friendly and willing to help in anyway. The lobby staff always had a joke or riddle for our kids anytime we entered the lobby. We chose a room on the back of the hotel near 48th Avenue and had a small view of Times Square. Our room was a two queen deluxe and included breakfast each morning. Seems that double queen beds are hard to come by in NYC. We had a microwave, mini refrigerator, Keurig coffeemaker, 42” tv, desk and chair with WiFi that worked excellent. The room was always clean and bath items restocked when we returned from the days adventures. The breakfast area is clean and inviting. Breakfast consists of grab and go type items. It is not the usual continental type you may be accustomed too. Sometimes the choices were limited, but it worked well and the items were hot, fresh, and tasty. We used the hotel pantry to purchase some food items. Be aware, the prices are kinda high. Soft drink machines are available, in the hotel, and the prices are about half of those in the pantry. I would recommend Hilton Garden Inn Times Square to anyone that is looking for a hotel that has everything and is in a great location. We would certainly stay here again if we return to NYC. Thank you to HIlton for consistently providing a clean family oriented environment that we have come to expect.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location could not have been better. 1 block to Times Sq1 block to Hell's Kitchen.1 block to Metro Rooms were a great size for 2Bed & pillows very comfortable. We will definitely stay here again
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow - fab location on 8th Avenue. Less than 5 minute walk to the centre of Times Square. Subway was also so close by as well as many theatres! We stayed on the 8th floor of this hotel in a king corner suite - this was a huge room by Manhattan standards and the bathroom was also a decent size. There was some traffic noise but it neither distracted us or kept us awake. The room was kept spotlessly clean by the fantastic and friendly maid service - fresh towels daily and the coffee machine was kept stacked for us. There is also a fridge and microwave to use. We didn’t use the microwave but the fridge was a godsend!Charles at reception was super! Very friendly,helpful and knowledgeable when we had questions. Pick-a-bagel was just up the road towards Central Park what an amazing place for an on-the-go breakfast and there was a reasonably priced supermarket next to the hotel. All in all a fantastic hotel experience! We will be back!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place to stay when visiting New York City. Location is a big plus. Located one block from Times Square and also one block from subway station. This is our third time here and would recommend for any one visiting New York City. Rooms are large for a city hotel.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location to Times Square, Broadway Shows and 5th Avenue. Rooms were decent size. This was our first visit to New York and liked how close we were to Times Square, Central Park, Today Show and Broadway.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We Would certainly stay here again. It is close to Central Park and it’s just around the corner from Times Square. The room was very nice and clean. Guest services was helpful. Lots of restaurants close by.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights and were pleasantly surprised by the warm treatment. The mid-sized room was clean and equipped with TV, refrigerator, coffee maker and very comfortable king size bed. The hotel is conveniently located to a lot of theaters and restaurants.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this on Hilton Honors points - perhaps that's why my experience was what it was.First the good:1) Within easy walks to subway stations going anywhere2) Charles the doorman was excellent3) Within tolerable walks (given 90 degree heat) of a number of points of interest4) Air conditioning worked flawlessly!5) Quiet6) Elevators were reasonably responsive - no long waits for up to 15 floors.Disappointments:1) I am accustomed to having HGI's have their own restaurant with reasonably good food. This one had apparently done a deal with a local coffee company and the breakfasts were mindful of something one would pick up at McDonalds, only not that good. The highlight of the week there was when people didn't show up to staff breakfast and we got a freebie at the Times Square Diner and Grill across the street.2) Room cleaning was spotty. Sometimes the room was pristine when we got back; other times there was stuff from the day before that had not been cleaned out.3) The immediate area is just plain ugly; lots of scaffolding and construction. 4) There were times (principally early evenings, when getting an answer at the front desk was pretty hard.5) Getting a taxi on 8th avenue is pretty hard - if the doorman offers you a car service to the airport, TAKE IT. It is more expensive, but it is worth every penny.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to Times Square and other attractions in NYC. Friendly and courteous staff. Close to metro stations for ease of access. There are several restaurants close by and there is parking available (albeit at a premium).
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location to walk to Broadway shows, Times Square and very close to a subway stop. Location was the best thing about this hotel. Front desk staff were civil at check in, not warm nor welcoming. The person who checked us in was Adobya ( spelling?) a woman with dark hair and glasses. When I asked about complimentary breakfast as a Diamond member. She asked incredulously “You want breakfast instead of points?” We thought it strange at the time but found out the next morning. We are used to a cooked breakfast at every Hilton Garden Inn we have ever stayed. This hotel does not have a restaurant. There is one person behind a counter that will give you either a microwaved breakfast sandwich OR a pastry OR a waffle OR cereal. You are given breakfast coupons and you circle which option you want. You can also choose between 1 piece of fruit and either orange juice OR milk and Coffee or tea. There are about 6 choices of hot microwaved sandwiches on the coupon but each of the 3 mornings only 2-3 were actually available. If breakfast is important to you then you should stay at the Hampton Inn a block away. When we arrived our room was not ready. The hotel held our luggage and said that they would call us as soon as our room was ready. We never got a call. We returned to the hotel at 3 pm. The front desk was flippant with an “ oh sorry” that they did not call us as they promised. The hotel staff and breakfast does not match up to the standard at other Hilton Garden Inns
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent the night at the Hilton Garden Inn at Times Square. Perfect location, but our bellman, CHARLES was incredible! He was attentive, prompt and very helpful. He went above and beyond to help us with our luggage and my mom’s scooter. I can’t express enough how thoughtful he was.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a Lifetime Diamond Member with Hilton which means I have spent over four years of my life in a Hilton property. In all my years, I have never been in any HGI where you are served a garbage, pre-made sandwich and a small coffee...with NO REFILLS. While the location is cool, access and parking are a nightmare. Parking is $64 per DAY. The only shining star was Donald, the valet who provided excellent service, a friendly demeanor and attentive to helping us navigate this mess. It pains me to say, but stay somewhere else. I only gave this place three stars because of Donald.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have booked a family room at your hotel through Booking.com eight months in advance for my family's summer holidays in NYC in late June. I had reconfirmed directly with Booking just few days before my traveling through email and I had the obligation to pay directly to the hotel at my arrival there. But when we arrived, we were informed by the manager that our reservation was cancelled few hours before our arrival when we were on the plane to NYC. She claimed that they tried to check my credit card and they found it invalid and because of this, according to hotel's policy, they cancelled my reservation and sold my room to other customers. I explained to the manager Mrs Alexandra Franklin that this was a mistake, because my credit card was valid. Moreover, nobody had informed me for the cancellation in order to have the opportunity to react. I was standing at the hotel's lobby with my family after 15 hours of travelling through two different flights, we were all exhausted, especially my children and we asked Mrs Frankin to help us to find a solution. She was totally rude, sarcastic, and she did not try at all to suggest an alternative proposal. Probably found the situation fun because she was constantly laughing. My family and I have been shocked by both the unjustified cancellation of our reservation and the unpredictable behavior of this employee. With no excuse, the management oh your hotel according to LAST MINUTE CANCELLATION POLICY destroyed my family's holidays, which were scheduled eight months ago. For this reason I will make this event known everywhere for everyone to know the unbelievable way you treat your customers !!!!!!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights at this location, primarily for proximity to the shows we wanted to see. The location was fantastic. With 1 block you have several restaurants, a Starbucks, and a grocery store. We quickly found the Food Emporium (full grocery store) on the corner of 8th and 49th had and bought a some fruit, coffee creamer, and extra coffee pods to cover the breakfast. The room has a Keurig, a refrigerator, and a microwave, so if you on a budget, this helps. Nearby is Lilly's Victorian (great for lunch/high tea) and Patzeria Pizza (good pizza/italian). The area felt safe for walking back after a show. The staff was very friendly and it was very easy to make transportation arrangements back to the airport. I would stay here again without hesitation. Every employee we interacted with was hospitable, helpful, friendly, and welcoming. It's a great place to stay for seeing shows without blowing the budget.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and our 2 teenage boys took a quick weekend trip to NYC from Atlanta this summer. We had been out most of the day enjoying the beautiful day in the city and came back to our room to rest a bit before heading to the Braves vs. Mets game. My 13 year-old son was looking for his headphones (that he had left on the floor) and couldn’t find them. After we all searched the room for a few minutes, we were beginning to think the worst (they were stolen) when we heard a knock at our door. The manager of the hotel stood there with my son’s broken headphones, a brand new pair of the exact same headphonesand a handwritten note apologizing for them accidentally getting broken by a member of the housekeeping team. This went above and beyond for the hotel manager to do this and I was very impressed and humbled. If your family is looking for a clean, safe, centrally- located hotel in NYC ....this should be in the mix. Everyone was exceptionally friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place has very nice rooms, great Ac, and the staff was pretty friendly. The room size is good for NYC. The area is very busy, a few blocks from Time Square. Neighborhood is a bit loud and the gym is small, but would stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for one night. My daughter got sick and I couldn’t leave the room. Mabel brought our breakfast to us even though that is not an offered service. She checked on us as we were leaving and gave my daughter water and a hug!! Mabel is fantastic!! When we were ready to leave Jules got us car to Newark at a better rate! We will definitely be back for the great service!!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in NYC for my wife's birthday and her first trip to the City. The location was AWESOME. It was close to all the Broadway shows, Times Square and the subway. It was so easy to get to all the places we wanted to go.The room was a very good size and clean. The front desk staff was all great and went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. We really enjoyed our 4 days there and if we come back will try to stay there again.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this location and our rooms were nice, the staff friendly, and knowledgeable. Street entrance is not the main lobby. Lobby is upstairs accessed via the elevator. We stayed on the 28th floor and it was not noisy. It was an easy walk to the theatre district and subway entrances are on both corners.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Took the subway in from JFK and the hotel was only a few blocks away. Even though we arrived a bit before check-in time we were still able to get our room!! Wonderful! Charles and Kenneth at the Bell desk are fantastic and helpful with places to go and Mabel - one of the supervisors - was also great. Rooms were a bit worn but comfortable and somewhat spacious considering the usual "shoe box" one gets in NYC. Overall a nice property with a great staff! Thanks so much!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a clean, bright and comfortable Hilton Garden Inn. It is in a great location close to all of the activities around Times Square. The other thing which was great is that they have Parking in the building so you don't have to go find parking around the Hotel. Getting your reservation early was a good idea because it saved us some money.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Way too strong of a perfume smell when walking into the lobby. It was there at night and there in the morning. Way way too strong. I was greeted by Elizabeth and Devon who were excellent and accommodated my request of a lower floor, which apparently isn’t typical. I just don’t want to wait for the elevator with a higher floor. The room was very clean and spacious for NYC. Very impressed. Was not a fan of the grab and go breakfast at all. The egg and turkey sausage on a muffin was not good. And then I was stuck and couldn’t have anything else. Because of this, I will probably stay at other properties in nyc as I visit once a month. In summary, spacious and clean room, staff was very pleasant and accommodating and breakfast was very undesirable.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed here a couple of times. Very convenient to theater district and all of its' bars and restaurants. The subway is also convenient if you want to travel a bit further around the city. The wi-fi was easy to connect to and fast. We also found the staff at the hotel friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at the hotel in the past when attending a Broadway play and have always been more than satisfied with our experience. This time was different. We reserved an upgraded corner king room which was very nice. However, on the first night the toilet leaked at the connections between the bowl and tank so water was all over the floor. In addition, the first flush caused the toilet to come within an inch of overflowing. At 5:30 am I went to the lobby and asked for another room. I was given a standard king room, a downgrade from the room I reserved but was happy to get another room. I asked at the bell stand if I could use a luggage cart to move our clothes and luggage. I was told guests were not permitted to use the carts - so instead of one trip to the new room it was four trips.Later that day I talked to a manager about a room rate reduction for the new room. She told me she would take care of that plus give me 10,000 points for my trouble. A week later the points have not been added to my account. When we checked out I found that the downgraded room cost me $33 per night plus tax more than my original rate. I talked to the same manager and she was confused but assured me the rate was correct. I had to leave for the airport so I let it go. Later I talked to the night manager and she was terrific. She asked me to send her a copy of the original rate I booked and she would take care of it. She did and the credit has been applied to my account - but still not the points. I am thankful that there is one person in the hotel that cares about their customers.This hotel, at one time, had a nice French bistro attached to the lobby. It is no longer there and has been replaced by "canteen" staffed to provide coffee and pastries, etc. It is a pretty sorry excuse for a dining room. Luckily, we found Times Square Diner across the street which has a terrific breakfast and great service.We'll be staying at another hotel on our next trip to NYC.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like everyone to know how helpful and caring Charles and Mabel have been, not just now but I have been visiting this hotel for at least 10 years and Charles has always been there for us. Also the desk clerks have definitely been the best in finding the rooms we’ve requested through the years. Great folks, great location! Thank you all very much for being a part of our stays in NYC the best!Barbara Darring
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location, room and bed were great but what made the visit perfect was the staff. All were friendly and helpful. Jules and Charles went above and beyond to make our visit extra special. We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would definitely recommend the Hilton Garden Inn in Times Square. From the great location in the heart of everything, to clean/ well-sized rooms, and friendly staff our last minute trip to NYC could not have been easier. In particular Charles was very helpful and made us feel welcome throughout our stay! He helped our group find an excellent brunch down the block from the hotel after the onsite breakfast place was closed. I definitely plan to come back!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a great location. Rooms were quiet and check in was fast and easy. Charles was a great help in getting the directions I needed during my stay. Plus having a parking garage right next door was convenient. I plan on staying there again on my next trip to NYC.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed staying here! Especially to be greeted by Charles and Jules! They are so friendly and welcoming. They helped us with getting around the city and anything else we might have needed in our stay! Would 10/10 recommend!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was fine, good location And we were able to check in way before the check in time. Thank you to Charles an Ken at the door for your help and nice sense of humor. Parking was next door an location was excellent.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our goal was to come and see some Broadway shows. This hotel is located in a very central part of the theater district and 2 blocks from Restaurant Row. We walked everywhere...... to 3 different theaters and 2 different restuarants. Just make sure you go out for breakfast. The in house breakfast is very poor.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. The housekeeping was horrible and the hhonors breakfast did not exist. If you are looking for that hotel that gives you a clean room and a decent breakfast, go find another location to stay at. The made to order breakfast that Garden Inns are known for was hockey pucks wrapped in paper that were 4 hours old. The individuals that server the breakfast could care less if it is edible or not. After 5 day stay ending eating breakfast 3 days somewhere else. Horrible
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was 1003 on the backside of the building. It was quiet the majority of the time. We were just 2 blocks from Time Square. The hotel was very clean. The staff were very helpful. Our flight home was very early in the morning and they arrange for a car to be there to take us to the airport. It was cheaper than a taxi and much more enjoyable. The Hotel does have a small restaurant onsite. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great location, close enough to Times Square but generally don't hear the noise of it. Location on 8th avenue. Nice sized room. We got one with a King bed and a sofa bed. Enough room for 2 or more people. Plus there is a refrigerator. Nice staff. Got a really good price for being so close to Times Square. Hope to stay here again. Close to several subway lines so easy to get around NYC.Free breakfast was a little sparse - didn't get much choice, had to tell the staff what you wanted and they handed out certain items. Not much choice to drink for the continental breakfast. Wish it included sodas or other drinks.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Large, clean room, great location for attending a broadway show. We would stay here again. The only thing that I would suggest would be improvement of the breakfast options. It is not worth it, go elsewhere.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at this Hilton. It was conveniently located to many of the New York attractions we visited. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Charles in particular helped us checkin and when we asked for a restaurant recommendation he even walked us to the establishment! We could not have asked for a better experience.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front office staff is quite rude. Called there with the simplest of questions and got transferred to Hilton customer service rather than attempt to resolve it. My issue was room change that the customer service team can’t address, it has to be done at the hotel. Rather than kindly explain anything, you get a less than courteous ‘HOLD ON’ and transfer to Hilton. Twice that happened and I finally gave up talking to these folks. Listen here is the best advise I can give any company - customer service first impressions are extremely important and set the stage for what’s to come. If you can’t deliver good service and talk nicely to people, deliver trash instead so you can talk to the garbage all you want and how you want to because you don’t deserve being the Ambassador of such an iconic brand. Business customers as myself, Diamond Member at that help drive strong revenue to these organizations that in turn allow employment to be available. Just be nice, be friendly and above all, respectful. Good Day!!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled from ohio to nyc to see a Yankees game and also wanted to check out the Times Square area. This was a great choice. Rooms were awesome and the staff was super nice and helpful! Charles was one of the employees that we interacted with...great guy!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location great. Right in the heart of Theater district. Staff very accommodating. However, while we have stayed there several times before, the hotel is in need of some cosmetic updates.Free breakfast is minimal.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent customer service!! Charles, Jules, Roman, and the entire staff made us feel so welcome and were very helpful. This particular Hilton will be my hotel of choice for all future NYC trips! Beds were comfortable and hotel was quiet
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was clean, staff was very friendly and helpful; one minor issue in room and it was fixed so quickly; Special call out to Charles the concierge. He spoke to us every day, assisted us in finding places we were headed, make my 90 year old mother feel comfortable with her surroundings and was just a delight to see coming or going each day.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time at this hotel. The location is great and the hotel staff is very helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel. The room had two queen beds which was one of the reasons we selected this hotel. The room was clean and had fridge, microwave and coffee maker.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room spacious and beds super comfortable also good central location. I travelled with a friend and stayed 3 nights then we went to Washington overnight and returned a further 5 nights. Unfortunately though prepaid there was no room with 2 beds available for us on our return so we were offered a double and rollaway bed for our 1st night back there. We were told it was a maintenance issue with leaky wet floors but as it was a public holiday weekend (and no rain) so maybe an overbooking? Anyway we were given some breakfast vouchers which were useful for a few items eg fruit, yoghurt and muffins etc. No breakfast buffet just pre-packaged items but Diner across the road is excellent and hotel guests get 10% discount.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 6 days in NYC with a party of 7. You can only imagine how complicated transportation was! We even had to buy another large suit case to bring back all of our souvenirs. Since our group consisted of two adults, 4 children and grandma, we really needed to stay together if possible. The most daunting task was the final trek to the airport. The team member, Charles worked his magic and found a Cadillac Escalade and with some creative-strategic maneuvering managed to comfortably and safely tuck all seven of us, plus our 8 bags, 7 carry on bags (including Italian cookies) in for the last adventure. Charles was very warm and friendly and told the children daily jokes during our stay. We recommend this hotel and their awesome staff for your next stay in the Big Apple.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will NEVER stay in another hotel again in Times Square! This is my new home! I had to fill in for a colleague for a few weeks in the city and stayed at this Hilton Garden Inn twice. I absolutely LOVE this hotel. The location, the cleanliness, the extremely helpful employees - and also the BEST valet/concierge team EVER! Charles is FANTASTIC and so friendly! Jules is a blast! These guys took such great care of me while I was there and I had several laughs with them while waiting for my car service. They were always there (both stays) to greet me as I walked back in and took care of my baggage after I checked out and had to attend meetings. I can not say enough about this great place and incredible team. Charles, I don’t know your last name to thank you personally but look forward to another great trip to the Big Apple!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I really enjoyed our stay! Good location, nice rooms, breakfast included, a decent convenient shop inside, and the most welcoming staff. Charles the concierge is now our New York dad. Ask for a riddle. He has some good ones :)))
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay! Charles and Mabel gave us extraordinary service and an overall great time! They made our experience even more enjoyable. We loved our room, the complimentary breakfast, and the little store in the lobby with pints of ice cream! 10/10 Had a great time!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been bringing our daughter to NYC to see shows and plays since she was 6 years old. (She is 15 now) We often stay at the Hilton Garden Inn on 8th Ave because it is a perfect walk to both Central Park and the Theatre District. One of the highlights of our trip is always the doorman, Charles. He called my daughter Princess the very first time we stayed here and still does every time we see him. He is always helpful, and makes my daughter and us laugh. He is a true delight and really one of the reasons we keep coming back. The hotel is wonderful, clean, and easy to get too.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brought my teenage daughter to NYC for a mother/daughter weekend. First time to NYC and we had an amazing experience! Hotel was basic, clean, safe and convenient to everything. The staff was BY FAR the best part of the hotel. They were warm & welcoming, helpful in every way and made us feel right at home! We were especially impressed with the bellmen, Charles & Jules. No better way to return from a long day walking the city than to see their smiling faces. Definitely recommend!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sisters and I took our mother to NYC to celebrate her 90th birthday. Having stayed at this hotel before, I knew it would be an excellent choice for both location and service. I absolutely have to give the highest review possible to Charles for making our stay even better than we expected. He was extremely helpful with all of our needs and definitely went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Just a delightful person all around - Hilton is lucky to have him!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am staying at this memorial day weekend and I hope this hotel is nicer than some of the staff. I had a problem with my credit card so i called the hotel to update my credit card hold. And could not get through for 2 hours and when i finally got through to the hotel. The gentleman who answered the phone was very rude and then before i can finish giving him my information he transferred me to another phone and that kept ringing. I called again and it was ringing again. And got the same gentleman and i asked to speak to a manage very politely he said what do you want?! In a nasty voice. So when i arrive at the hotel this afternoon to check in i do hope this gentleman will be there so i can file a complaint on his rudeness.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is really good and everything is around. The subway station is on the corner of the street. The size of the room was good and the bed was really comfortable. I went to the gym, it was small but nice.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I could, I’d give this hotel more than five stars. I recently returned from NYC after staying four nights with my 14 year old son, two of my friends their teenage boys. This was our first time visiting NYC and chose this hotel based on the positive reviews and great prices—we are so happy we did. Our room was spacious (627) and clean. We got bottles of water every day for no extra charge and the AC worked perfectly. The location was ideal as we took the subway to many places or walked and had no issues. What made this hotel feel like home were the kind and helpful staff. If you meet Michael, who works there, he is the best!!! He helped us get around, gave us outstanding recommendations, arranged a car for us to get back to LaGuardia, and made us feel so welcome. We did not want to leave. Hilton is blessed to have a man like that working for them!! When we return to NYC, it is a no-brainer for where we will choose to stay again....we cannot wait to return!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When i checked in after a long haul flight (12am) reception staff said check in time would be 4pm. When i asked whether its possible to check with cleaning staff if a room would be available earlier the just repeated check in time is 4pm and started rolling with their eyes. Very poor customer service.Also, it is smelly around the hotel as it is in Korea Town.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great customer service from bellman to receptionist. Merrill, made it possible for me to sleep a little longer after traveling 10 hrs and late check in/1am, kind and happy morning voice. Dalma, very professional and considerate. Worked really hard to put me in comfortable room and with my requests.Michael, stored our luggageafter we checked out-great offer!!Umbrella given at time of exit to protect us from the rain.Clean comfortable room, 14th floor, very of the street, no odor to the carpet(a must for me), spacious with a fridge. Close to Empire State building, Korea town, Flatiron building, 5th Avenue, etc. hints:lobby phone/Hilton Honors gives better rate than lobby;online websites give better rates than lobby phone/Hilton Honorsboos:parking is $37 for 24hrs
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have previously frequented the Martinique with no issues (when it was still part of the Radisson group). Booked a Queen room for a week and was highly disappointed with the stay this time.PROS: Location CONS: …The Hotel is now part of the Hilton Group, I was very shocked to discover that rates for this hotel are drastically cheaper on third party websites compared to the Hilton Honors website, sadly it seems for a major chain, that Hilton does not offer a guarantee on best prices when booking directly with them. …The room was extremely small and the bed took up almost the entire space in the room, making it quiet claustrophobic, especially if you have to spend more time in, or for a longer stay. … There is no closet, just a small rail with a few hangers with a tiny space to accommodate the ironing board and iron, no proper place for luggage, which had to be kept on the very little floor space, making in inconvenient to even walk around the bed.… The bathroom was like the size of a small closet, the toilet was literally right next to the door separating it from the bedroom and you had to get into the bathroom and close the door to create a bit of space to be able to get to the shower, basin or toilet, this could be a problem for someone that is more than average in size.… Overall this room can barely accommodate 1 guest with luggage so definitely not suitable for 2.… Room does not come standard with a fridge and the hotel does not provide a microwave on request even for long stays.…Hotel lobby undergoing renovations which is not mentioned when booking, as such the Reception desk is operating right at the entrance and this area gets hectic during check-in and out times, especially when staying guests need to enter or exit the hotel....Hotel also does not have a Business Centre anymore. Definitely not worth the price point for me.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a classic double queen room and ended up in room 427. There is no problem in getting a basic room, but .....This room was Very small, especially the bathroom. One person can stand there and this is 4 person room.We asked several times to be moved but every time the message was that hotel was full. Breakfast was good with plenty choice in fruits, warm and cold. Staff very friendly. Just that it is then very disappointing that they suggested Hotel Car to JFK for 65 USD including toll. That then became 85 euros when arriving to JFK. That is not right.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed the location. Across the street from Macy's on 34th. Empire State Building one block away. Quick access to the subway. From a tourist perspective, this is a solid location. They staff was very helpful and courteous. I would stay here again based on service and value.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A most enjoyable short stay made even better due to the charming and helpful staff. Beds are super comfy even if the rooms are short on style.Certainly recommend as a hotel. Location in mid town is a bit too busy but that is a personal view. Most people love mid town!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Location! Great Staff! Great Rooms! Great Hotel!July 4th trip to the city and it was a great one. The Martinique is our new hotel of choice when staying in the city. Convenient to Broadway, subways, restaurants, Penn Station, etc.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed staying in this historical hotel. Rooms are nicely updated, clean and comfortable. Very small bathroom unfortunately but that goes with an older hotel. The "executive lounge" is anything but that but handy if you want a quick cup of coffee or soda. Breakfast food and service was quite good. The location of the Martinique is extremely convenient to anything you want to do while in the city. A quick two block walk from Penn Station and a subway station right outside the hotel on the corner. It was great to be a bit away from the noisy and bustling Times Square area and yet still be within walking distance to see a play. Also convenient for walking to other areas such as Chelsea, Madison Square Park, Union Square. I enjoyed being able to walk or catch a quick subway to anywhere I wanted to go.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This old and somewhat traditional establishment is now part of Hilton, and it therefore bears some level of homogenisation that is inevitable with a chain. The rooms are comfortable, and even though there were refurbishing works around the main entrance, one can sense that this is an elegant structure. As it has become the norm, booking.com messed up with the reservation: instead of a room with two beds they got us a room with a king bed. The staff at Hilton dealt with this hiccup quite well I have to say and our stay was smooth. I was told that Hilton, among others, matches online prices, so it might become good practice to actually avoid booking.com.On the location, this is really in the heart of Mid-town, few steps away from the Empire State Building, the Fifth Avenue, Bryant Park, and Times Square, plus very easy access to subways. This proximity with so many hot spots comes at a price though as the level of crowd in the streets around the hotel never subsides.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Strategic location, comfortable bed. Did not really use any of the hotel facilities as we were out the whole day exploring NYC so could not comment. Room size is not bad but the lobby is rather small and the elevator is definitely slow.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was being renovated, so I can’t comment on it properly. So I’ll just keep my review about the staff. All of the staff were amazing. From the check in receptionist who gave me a bottle of water whilst I was feeling dehydrated, to the customer service operator who helped me cut the sleeves from my T-shirt. I was really impressed with the people. That’s often one of the most important things about a hotel stay. Special mention to The Mánager Susan who is very professional and also Candice who has an encyclopaedic knowledge of what to do in NYC (do not miss the chance to ask her for advice). Restaurant staff were wonderful and predicted my order by day 2 (Rosalind). I will definitely return once the renovations are complete and give another review.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The superior experience of this hotel started a few days before with my calls to customer service. Denise, with whom I spoke was personable and extremely responsive to my requests. Overall, the customer service at the Martinique is on point. Excellent breakfast buffet. We also had two enjoyable meals in their restaurant. Five minute walk from Penn station.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed late June 2019. Location is perfect! Close to subway station and Macy's. Staff was very helpful, would recommend staying here. We used the subway and walked as well, only about a 20 minute walk to Times Square.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was really too bad. Arrived at midnight after a little less than a 10 minutes walk from Penn Station, to find a line for check-in...because only one person was available. That's right, one person. Not only to check in guests but to also deal with the complaints and requests from customers who kept walking up - thinking that they each were more important.Our room, a double, was nice enough. The walls are thin and you can hear people next door, as well as all the morning slamming doors in the hallway.I'm really glad I didn't pay more for the room than I did, otherwise I would be more dissatisfied. The hotel is located about a 20 minute walk from Times Square or about 10 minutes by subway. Not the worst location.It's an older hotel that comes with all the quirks. Elevator lights that don't work and thin walls among them.Glad I got my Hilton points but, otherwise, this is certainly NOT like the Curio in Chicago.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel and fantastic location. All staff friendly and helpful. As a mother and daughter on a New York trip, we additionally felt safe/secure knowing reception was 24 hours and doormen always present. Would definitely stay here again as cannot fault.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was some much larger than the other hotels in the area. Very clean, and convenient to everything. I stay at a lot of hotels and this by far was a great experience. I would bring my family back to this hotel.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Keeping in mind that this hotel is under renovation in the lobby area, we still probably wouldn’t stay again. We are Diamond Members and this was the absolute worst check-in experience ever. There was only 2 employees checking people in with no HHonors separate check-in. They were severely understaffed with about 15 people in line. (A Saturday at 4pm which is prime time in the city) We booked this room as we were sharing with another couple and it’s one of the only hotels in the city you will find 2 queen beds (usually it’s 2 double). Big perk when sharing a room! The room was newly renovated and the decor was very nice. The beds were comfy as well however, the bathroom door is frosted glass so when someone wakes up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom, the room lights up so bright. Aesthetically, very nice but not functional. The location is nice being close to penn station if you’re taking mass transit and in the middle of Korea town which had great food. The hotel is old with nice charm however the elevators are small and creepy with a lobby that’s super small and cramped.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I frequently travel to NY for business and the Martinique is always my first choice when choosing a hotel. Customer service is excellent and the rooms have more space and are cleaner than many of the other hotels I have stayed at in NY. Great location
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic Location, in Little Korea, heart of Broadway, near the Empire State Building and if you like shopping Macy's is across the road, short walk to Time Square and not far from Central Park. Very nice rooms, comfortable beds. Sound reduction in rooms could be better, but still fine. Would stay again.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception area under renovation with an unwelcoming, rude reception staff. There was a line for check-in. I waited until the last guest had finished checking in when I walked up to the desk. The person at the desk was about 15" away from me. Instead of greeting me she said "May I help the next guest" loudly, to my face aggressively chastising me for walking up before being called. This is not an airline counter, and I'd walked up when I thought it was appropriate just like I would anywhere else in the world. I'd been travelling for the last ten hours and this DID NOT make me feel welcome. In general there was a bad attitude among the reception staff. A lot of eye rolling and a sense that they did not enjoy their job. The doormen and bell staff were friendly and helpful though. The inadequate service continued. The next morning I called room service to ask for a small pot of coffee and milk on the side, something I do every morning that I'm in a hotel with room service, and please note that I spend between 50 and 70 nights a year staying at hotels. The person who picked up the phone at room service asked me if I really wanted to just get coffee like that when I had a coffee maker in the room. I was shocked. No one has ever questioned my decision to get room service coffee from a hotel. I was barely awake and must have sounded stunned when I said, "Excuse me, what did you say?" He then said he'd bring up the coffee and milk right up and when he arrived he still had an attitude.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hilton really does a good job in revitalizing this former "Radisson," which looked very rundown. The lobby is currently under renovations and I am sure it will look great when it is reopened during the summer. Unlike other Hiltons, the bell staffs were great and extremely helpful. I arrived around 12:30pm and the agent was able to give me a room. The room itself is typical New York size so I have already booked myself a room with King size sofa (and once again, there is no upgrade despite my Diamond status, which is sort of the norm these days). Because of the historical building, the window is on the small side but given how busy 32nd street is, it might not be a bad idea. I also like the high ceiling. The bathroom is fine and the shower pressure is great. There is a full array of amenities including body wash/gel, so it passes my personal test of being in a good hotel. The only problem is the strange a/c unit and also the relatively slow WIFI. I have a week long stay booked here in late August and as of now, I am sort of torn because of the WIFI situation. One of pro and perhaps con is the location. It is located right at Korean-town, which means 24 hours food and subway stop right at your doorstep. Penn Station is a full block away and there are plenty of CVS, shoppings and banks within ten blocks. There is plenty to do, but at the same time, this stretch can also be noisy especially in the weekends. There are plenty of bars and Korean drinking lounges/Karaoke bars, so expect some noises in the weekend. You might want to pay for a higher floor if you are sensitive to noise. In conclusion, I enjoy my stay here and can't wait to see what the new lobby will look like. Hopefully I can get a reply here regarding the WIFI situation and if there is plan to speed it up or at least provide a premium high speed option.

review_body: I decided to spend a weekend away from home with my husband and selected the Martinique New York on Broadway as a special treat for both of us. We both had a recent birthday and our anniversary was in May and therefore based on the reviews I wanted it to be a memorable one.

Pro:Location if you like to be close to Pann StationI had king side bed which was fairly large roomCon:Unwelcoming lobby and dinning roomUnfriendly staff (beside the older door person), as i was seating in the lobby the front desk staff complianed anbout their compensation Very basic breakfastVery basic gymLow value for an hotel that presents itself as a boutique hotel. Perfectly located for tourism purposes, amazing food and entertainment within waking distance, and the price-value equation can't be better for an expensive city like NY.

review_body: Very central location, expect noise day and night. There is a refurbishment ongoing on the facade, so a scaffolding is installed which affects the sight from the window. The window is locked and it's not possible to open.The housekeeping staff took our clothes which were left on the bed, and despite we reported it 3 times at the reception, they were unable to find it again, and seemingly didn't take the problem too seriously.The room was pretty clean, had a fridge, and daily housekeeping was provided.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: Great hotel! Great location. The rooms were unexpectedly large for NYC. Modern bathroom. Really enjoyed the stay! Would stay here again. Friendly staff. It was close to Penn Station and an easy 1 mile to walk to most everything or easy to use subway. Right on Korean Way with great places to eat.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was spotless and smart as were the facilities. The hotel has character which I prefer to bright, shiny and soulless.The check in team were professional and helpful. However except for Michael, the concierge service was poor.The breakfast offering was varied and fine.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been in NYC for a few months so far for work. I found the Matinique to be convenient enough to both work and some interesting restaurants. It's generally quiet, with plenty of rooms, a usually empty enough fitness center, and a pretty decent breakfast buffet (though I admittedly eat for free with status, definitely not worth $30/pp but few breakfasts are). All this said, I'm definitely reconsidering my options on where to stay as honestly, the staff doesn't seem to fit the experience that the Martinique is trying to make. The first incident happened in mid-April, when I had a letter delivered at the hotel. Not only was I not notified of it's arrival (not a huge deal courtesy of tracking numbers) but the hotel was unable to provide me with said letter. Seriously. I went to the front desk to inquire about it, they called to the mail room, who confirmed it would be right up. 30 minutes later, still no letter. Not a good look. The second incident occurred today, in June. I ordered takeout, because it's healthier than french cuisine (what's offered in house). I was not provided with a fork. When I called down, I was told they wouldn't bring me a fork because they don't really do that. So, for the rates they're charging v. other Hilton properties in the vicinity, I'll need to take a hard look at the experience I'm getting.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a week in NYC on business, and the Martinique was a fabulous location. One block from Penn Station, right off of Herald Square. The room was adequate - on one of the penthouse floors, which gave you access to a lovely lounge. The bed was comfortable, the television large, but there's no comfy reading chair in the room, although there's more than enough space, and the full-length mirror was one of the least flattering I've ever seen. Several light bulbs were out, which speaks to their haphazard eye towards the fine details, but overall, I had a good stay in a reasonably priced (for New York) and reasonably comfortable room.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a little over a block from Penn Station, at the corner of Broadway at 32nd St. It was very convenient. The room as quiet. The hotel is the home of the PGA when it started in 1916 and they have some nice mementos displayed on the 2nd Floor. The cost was reasonable for NY (about $230), so I am not sure why people had comments about the cost. If you are taking the train to NYC and will be arriving/leaving from Penn Station, this is very convenient.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The worst possible experience - literally checked in and asked for a refund within 15 minutes. “Upgraded” Room for HH Diamond Status the worst I have ever seen for a Hilton, flys in the lobby, dirty corridors, hotel basically under construction. Certainly nowhere near usual Hilton Curio standards. Told by the manager that refunds are not possible after checking in due to ‘Hilton Policy’ - Diamond customer service not worth the time. Would not recommend this hotel to anybody or Hilton service.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was 'okay' but hindered somewhat by internal and external refurbishment (although this couldn't be helped and I wouldn't mark them down for this). Major disappointment was upfront charge to credit card (not a pre-authorisation, an actual charge) of $50 per room per night which is not highlighted anywhere. My wife questioned this on check in and she was told that 'it's all over the website', implying that it was our own fault for not noticing this. With my wife working in travel we were both confident that this wasn't the case. Once we had settled in we decided to check both the booking website and the hotel website, if it is on either of these then it appears to be very well hidden. While we are aware (and are comfortable) that almost all hotels now require a swipe of a CC for pre-authorisation in the event of using a mini-bar (although not actually present in the rooms here) etc it would be advisable to let customers know that it is hotel policy to actually charge you for this as standard when you check in. Although they advise that the transaction will be cancelled upon check out (and indeed the charge never left a 'pending' state) it is not a great start to your trip when you could potentially already be reducing the available amount you have budgeted for with this charge. Upon checkout we were again told that you're advised of the charge when booking and that proof had been printed off to show us (but had been conveniently 'misplaced'). When my wife pointed out that it is not on any website and certainly not in any of the Important Information sections we were again treated with some disdain on the matter.Anyway, to actually review the hotel.Rooms were big enough for us and, even on the 4th floor, were quiet. They were furnished to a nice standard, had a generous size TV (who doesn't want one of those?!) and had a bathroom with good water pressure from the shower and at a good temperature. One criticism of the room would be the significant lack of storage space for two people staying more than one night.Coffee machine in the room wasn't anything special though and there was a lot of wastage in the packs provided (sweetener, sugar, creamer etc). Loose items would have been better, as would liquid milk instead of creamer powder. Water bottles in the room was a nice touch as were the bathroom toiletries provided. The replenishment of the water and hot drink provisions was erratic though, of the 4 nights we stayed there wasn't a single day where everything was replenished in full.Lifts were frequent and there never seemed to be a long wait which can sometimes be the case. Also very quick so no long uncomfortable journeys either up or down.Doormen were helpful and extremely friendly. Desk staff much less so (expected greater lever of customer service and more empathy instead of blaming us for their errors and lack of willingness to rectify poor first impression).Location was excellent. Right in the shadow of Empire State building and with easy access to subway stations (and Penn Station). Not too far of a walk from a lot of the main tourist areas and plenty of options nearby for food (if you're unsure of where to eat if you haven't been to NYC before)Wifi was complimentary and we didn't have any issues connecting any of the devices we had so that's also a big plus, also seemed to be good connectivity throughout the hotel and in our room.Didn't notice any complimentary services elsewhere in the hotel (such as coffee urns etc in the lobby) which is something we've seen in every other hotel we've stayed in in NYC, although we may have just been lucky on previous trips.Overall, if you're travelling quite light and aren't too bothered about the complimentary amenities (and obviously the CC charge) that are pretty much standard elsewhere then this is a decent enough hotel. Would probably be best suited for business travellers who want wifi access and a pleasant room. However, if it's important to you that your hotel is an important part of your trip then I would say that it's not hugely suited to tourists at this moment (with the exception of the location which is, again, fantastic).In summary - an average hotel with average service that we personally wouldn't stay at again due to what we experienced on this trip.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can not believe the cost of this hotel and then the condition its in I understand it is going through a lot of updating but this should reflect in the price you pay,we are here at the moment and would not use again,everywhere is so noisy,this morning at 5.30am there is building work outside the room we are in its disgusting ,we came to New York fours years ago and the streets where far cleaner, the resteraunt that's part of the hotel is expensive for the food you get,sorry not coming back here again
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: My family enjoyed this hotel in Manhattan.Our room was moderately sized, very well furnished and very clean. The bathroom had a large shower (no tub to step in). The AC unit was noisy as it clicked loudly on and off but there was no noise from other rooms. The biggest negative is the current remodeling, which makes the lobby cramped and often noisy. In addition the exterior is being redone, so the hotel is surrounded by scaffolding. The front desk staff and bellmen were very helpful. The restaurant seemed expensive and food only average, in the opinion of my family.We liked the location near the 34th Street subway. Lots of Korean and other Asian restaurants nearby--plus Macy's for shopping!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was good and it was relatively quiet given the location. It was a Birthday celebration did even though I told the hotel they made no effort to acknowledge it. I had made it clear it when I made the reservation. The lobby is under construction and the checkin process was slow even though we prepaid. The staff was not very friendly at all. The sheets smelled of stale cigarette smoke.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Martinique late May. The hotel couldn’t have been in a better location, situation around a 10 minute walk from The Flat Iron area and with a few streets of Times Square - plus a subway right on your doorstep. Not noisy at all, you wouldn’t know you were at the centre of New York City. The staff were fantastic, they couldn’t do enough for you and were all extremely polite - especially the door staff, who ensured the door was open when walking in and out with a pram.We are in our 20’s and have a 1 year old and this hotel was perfect for us travelling with a baby. We stayed in a suite, so our daughter was able to roam free round the living space and we could enjoy our own company after putting her to I bed.Bed was extremely comfy and room facilities were fantastic, plus very clean.This is our 6th time in NYC but our first at this particular hotel and we would definitely return.Couldn’t recommend more!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually stay close by at one of the Hilton garden Inns, which are pleasant, functional, and fine. but they do lack any real unique character. That's not a criticism just a reality. I got to stay at this property memorial day weekend, the price was fair and I thought I would try something new. was very impressed with the new rooms, the staff was very nice and it was nice to stay in a place that had some character. Clearly older and renovated, the rooms were new. the bathrooms modern and clean(although mine did not drain that well. Beds comfortable, lots of plugs. My room as a double because I did not want to sit for a king, so it was small. If you are at all claustrophobic, hold out for the larger room. It remind me of the palmer house in chicago. But for a short stay I had no issues, but I think more than two nights and I would have wanted something bigger.But overall very nice, peasant, and different, which made it even nicer.And for those who do not go to NYC much, the location is great. Longest walk would be maybe 20-30 minutes tops to the Park or down to soho or Greenwhich. easy walks
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are very professional and courteous. Good valet service. The elevators are slow and a bit sketchy. If you have allergies, they’ll probably bother you from the elevator until you get into your room. The rooms are clean with good AC. Bring your own pillow though, as their pillows are far too soft. Breakfast for diamond members is great. Excellent omelettes made while you watch by a very skilled chef/cook. Overall I’ll stay at a different Hilton next time I’m in town.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm a Hilton Diamond member, and spent quite a bit of time calling many of the Hilton properties in NYC looking for a few particular needs that we had on this trip:1) No resort fee - this is my pet peeve. Just in principal, I won't stay at any hotels that charge them2) didn't mind two adults and two kids staying in the same room3) would offer a 4:00pm checkout on our last day. This is hard to get in NYC. The front desk didn't even hesitate. It was so nice not to have a NYC hotel say something like "it's $25/hour for each 30 minutes of check-out time after noon", which is what most of them told me.I just had the feeling here that anything I asked for here wasn't a problem. Everyone was friendly and just wanted to help. Even the Diamond breakfast was a REAL breakfast - not something limited and watered-down like most Hiltons do.We're scheduled to be in NYC three more times this year, and I won't even bother looking for anywhere different this time. In this day of rude flight crews, cramped airline seats, and hotels that want to skimp on every benefit that they offer guests, it was refreshing to be treated like a human being at the Martinique. Rooms here aren't anything fancy, but I'm at the point in my travels where all I need is a good mattress, a clean room, and to be treated right.They're in the middle of what appeared to be a pretty big renovation, so the lobby was crowded and the breakfast room seemed to be setup in a temporary banquet room. I look forward to seeing what the first floor areas will be like when the work is done
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect. Close to subways and all the action. They even delivered complimentary wine to our room because it was our honeymoon! Friendly staff. We were on the 6th floor and heard no traffic! Room is small but very clean and efficient. We will be coming back the next time we are in NYC. The price was too good to be true! I was expecting something to go wrong but it was perfect. They are renovating but we heard no noise in our room. We didn’t have time to check out the 17th floor bar but next time we will!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: Over an hour on the phone waiting with a reservations agent regarding price match guarantee.I am trying to book 3 nights to no avail. Hilton official website has a rate significantly higher than Booking.com, Agoda and Qantas Hotels, the reservations agent is unable to see what I am seeing? although I am doing it simultaneously as I am talking to her. I have printed confirmation from 3 different websites confirming that I am eligible for a price match, however Hilton is refusing to honor guarantee price match policy.Extremely disappointing experience. Over-promising and Under- Delivering.

12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: The perfect place for your stay!Very modern, comfortable and quiet room in the heart of the city. The price was The staff was friendly, helpful and smiling. I can not say anything more than just best for the whole stay.

12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: Although my arrival at the hotel was not auspicious given the exterior renovations and ongoing works in the reception area, I enjoyed my stay essentially for two reasons.First,the room was comfortable with a well appointed and new bathroom and was very quiet and secondly, the hotel is in a great location as it sits above the Metro station on 34th Street and which is a major intersection. I did not eat or drink in the hotel.Last but not least I would say that the Martinique is good value for money.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property appears to have gone downhill since the years when it was a Radisson (or Club Carlson) hotel. Perhaps it is still in transition. But the window shades were inneffective in keeping light out of our room. Moreover the Executive Lounge on the 17th floor does not have the variety of refreshments that it used to to have and now apparently open to everyone, and has lost its sense of exclusivity, peace and quiet.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel, great service and support from the staff. Excellent housekeeping and clean beds, towels and the rest of the room. Free sodas en candybars. Great comfortable beds! And best location you can have!!!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Choose this hotel. The staff is smiling, room service is excellent and the location is fantastic. The room is beautiful and the stay was really nice. I will book this hotel again when I will be back in New York
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent an enjoyable 4 nights at the Hilton Martinique. Location is 1 block from Empire State Building, in what is known locally as Korea Street. Room was a good size for a central Manhattan hotel. On a subway line, a short walk to Penn Station and reasonable walking distance to many sights. We walked all over Manhattan but usually returned on the subway. Free wifi and many usb charging points in the room. If you want a quiet room ask for an inner courtyard room. No view but very quiet. Would not hesitate to recommend but book early to secure best price.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came here on a girl’s weekend with my Mother and Sisters. We picked this hotel after staying at numerous places in the city with big names, but big disappointments. This hotel was just what we needed. The check in was quick. The staff was courteous and very helpful. The entrance is currently under a remodel, but it didn’t hinder the experience. The rooms are modern and clean. Bathrooms are all updated and also have that modern feel. The hotel is close to many subway stops, and a couple blocks from Penn Station. We were able to walk to many places from its location which was a plus. I’d definitely return again.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location (close to the Empire State Building). We stayed 1 week and were quite pleased except with a few details that did not affect our stay. Air conditioning was very loud and had to turn it off. The fitness room were so tiny and was there so that it can be a 4 star hotel but i wouldn’t call it a fitness room (especially for the weight lifting room). I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this hotel! Great staff! Great rooms! And a fantabulous location! I can walk to Broadway shows, MOMA, my fave restaurants, shopping, you name it. I am always sad to leave and always delighted to return!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay at the hotel with my girlfriend. Staff were very friendly and no issues with the room. Would highly recommend for anyone wanting to be close to Times Square but not in Times Square. Would say it is about a 12 minute walk to Times Square and just steps away from the Empire State Building. We were able to walk to Central Park in about 30 minutes and the subway station was right outside the hotel. Due to the Canadian dollar being poor, the hotel was a little on the pricier side but pretty consistent with all other New York hotel prices, and on the lower end. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff is very friendly. Rooms are clean. As diamond the lounge is open 24/7 with sodas and granola type bars. The hotel restaurant had some good wines and an awesome cheese board. Special thanks to Michael, a bellman, for assistance in grabbing a hotel car to LGA which was a very comfortable ride.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was perfect. Newly renovated. 5 steps to the subway and 5 mins to MSG.Never having stayed in this area or at this hotel before we didnt know what to expect but we couldn't of been more happy. I will never stay any where but here again. And the concierge made everyday great!!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: The hotel was very central to lots of things we wanted to do. The underground was very close. The Empire State Building was at the rear of the property. The staff were very helpful and the restaurant served good food.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like this hotel as its convenient to my meetings at Herald Square and has some old school personality. The staff is nice, especially the concierge, and I love the breakfast. The rooms are good sized for NYC.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed four nights in April 2019. The hotel is conveniently located and was clean and comfortable. It was under major construction but the works were disguised very well. The porters were cheerful and competent and except for one incident the reception team were pleasant and efficient. This was my first visit to New York and on one night I needed to obtain tickets to a music club so I visited the concierge to obtain assistance. The concierge desk was vacant and after enquiring, it was established that the concierge had sneaked off duty early and without telling anyone. I attended reception for help but was faced with a receptionist who was miserable and utterly determined not to assist and I was left to fend for myself. This incident somewhat spoiled an otherwise pleasant stay in pleasant hotel.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed my stay at the hotel Martinique in the city . The service and the entire staff was truly awesome to work with and I’m really looking forward to staying there again the next time I come to New York .
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: Stayed here for the 5 Boro bike tour. Excellent all the way around great location for anything that you need or want to do . Staff were very personable .Room was very clean and we were able to keep our 2 bikes in our room and still have room

12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: Very pleasant hotel in an excellent location that makes it easy to walk to much of the city or take the subway or trains to any of the nearby suburbs. The restaurant has excellent French (& American) food. The staff is friendly and helpful -

review_body: We stayed for two nights at this hotel, and I was impressed with how clean and fresh the room was. We had two double beds and the room was a good size for a New York hotel room. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. The subway is right outside so very easy to get around. Would stay here again for sure
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: Great room, great location, of course rooms are tiny but they made the best of the space. Slept well on comfortable mattress in a quiet room. Nice upgraded room. Used the car service to get to the hotel which was a little pricy but convenient.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...

review_body: The hotel is nice and very well located, however, I must say that the experience was not optimal. The room had some problems with the ac which was smelly and nosy. Moreover the room is not soundproof so you can hear everything from the corridors.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean hotel and pretty close to everything we wanted to do. Hotel staff was very nice and helped with cars and things around the city . The breakfast place was clean and had pretty good food. The room was small but it was fine for my daughter and I .
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the better Hilton properties I’ve visited in NYC for the price. Great customer service and clean larger rooms. The French restaurant connected to the hotel is excellent as well. Convenient to Times Square, Macy’s and Korea town. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. I was traveling for work and the hotel was quiet and had plenty of electrical outlets. The breakfast everyday was great but if you are a frequent traveler that always utilizes the fitness room at hotels, this is not the location for you. Tiny tiny gym in the basement. It was hot, smelly, and packed.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was built 1898 and considered one of the historical hotels in America The skill of restoration is that it kept its old external look and style while inside it turned to a modern state The check in was smooth and quick and liked our room 1022 which is adequate in size and well equipped the centre thing is the great location at the heart of Manhattan near a lot of important attraction Housekeeping was excellent as well as the overall service we are highly satt
