hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is Absolutely beautiful. We were greeted by Heather B. Who checked us in and was extremely friendly. Our room was on the 17th floor and it was HUGE!!! I have never seen a hotel room this big in NYC. Ive stayed at many hotels in the city and this hotel is the best so far. The hotel is located right near the subway so it makes it so easy to get where you need to go.The room was immaculate. So fresh and clean. The bathroom was gorgeous. Beds were a tad bit hard but still very comfy. You couldnt hear the city noise, so it was a very quiet stay. There was a lounge room in the 17th floor with granola bars, tea, coffee and other assorted drinks. There was board games you could play. After checkout we check our bags in for about 2 hours so we could get some breakfast before heading home. Michael and Raul who handled our bags were super friendly. Overall I will have to say that this will be my 1st choice of hotel when staying in the city!!!!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel for the location and the comfort and cleanliness of the rooms. We drove in from out of town and there was also parking available for an extra fee - a huge bonus. Everything is expensive in NYC but this hotel is reasonable.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely hotel! I love historic hotels, and this one balances history with modern, functional updates. Pros: nice-sized room, large bathroom by NY standards, courteous staff, great location, newly renovated, great breakfastCons: no premium WiFi for Diamond, a quasi-lounge, tiny lobbyThis is one of those hotels where every room almost has a unique floor plan, so I was hesitant to check in before arrival. I also hoped for an upgrade. Ironically, the Hilton app showed that I had been “upgraded” to the same type of room I booked. I called the hotel, and they did confirm that the hotel was booked and that no upgrades were available. It would have been great to have a suite, but no big deal because my room was lovely. It was a nice size, functional, mostly spotless, and quiet. The bedding was great. There was a fridge. My water bottles were replenished a few times during the stay. The lighting was nice and well-planned. There was a fridge, and the AC unit worked well and operated at a reasonable volume that actually helped block some of the sound from the street. Since my room was down a secluded hall, it was exceptionally quiet, and I appreciated that given the age of the hotel. The shower was great with good water pressure, and there was lots of storage. The only downside was some grime in lesser-used spots in the restroom since as on top of the towel rack and toilet paper holder. Minor, but noticeable. Otherwise, very clean except the day housekeeping left a bag of trash on my councilor. Honest mistake. I had checked in on the app, but I stopped by the front desk at check in to get a key and learn about the hotel amenities. I was welcomed warmly as a Diamond member, but I had to ask about Diamond benefits and how the work at this hotel. She explained about breakfast, but she did not mention the lounge at all. Although I would not call it a lounge. There are soft drinks, an instant coffee machine, and granola bars. It was all replenished once during my four day stay, and the lounge is accessible to anyone. I did appreciate that it was a large area with lots of seating. I am not sure if this is a published benefit, but if it is, it needs more attention and definitely needs to be brought to the attention of the appropriate Honors members for use. Sustainability: There was a recycle bin in the room, but the hotel does not seem to encourage reusing towels. I had they hung up each day, and they were replaced.There is an attached French restaurant that provides room service, but I did not eat there. I did have breakfast one morning. For Diamond, the full buffet is complimentary, and it is very impressive given the shift of so many hotels to free “continental” breakfast for Diamonds! It was delicious, but I would not have paid the $33 regular cost with so many restaurants close by. Good options for all dietary needs. The lobby is currently under renovation, and there is essentially no space there to gather. The exterior of the hotel is also covered with mesh tarp for renovation; I look forward to seeing the finished product. There are two sets of elevators, and they worked efficiently. If you do have concerns about noise, you might request a room away from elevators. The location is phenomenal near Harold Sq at the intersections of Broadway, 6th, and 32nd. The train station entrance is outside the door of the hotel and provides access to many lines, or you can walk to so many things including Times Sq. A new Ess-a-bagel just opened a block away, and it’s a great place to grab a bagel or black and white cookie!I am not sure if the WiFi system hasn’t been fully converted over to the Hilton system, but there was only one network. Diamonds should get premium WiFi, but I found the one network to be perfectly adequate for browsing and streaming. I will def add this to my list of go-to hotels in NYC.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: By the time we reached the hustle and bustle of NYC after our trans-atlantic flight we were feeling a mixture of excitement and tiredness.The cab from JFK took us to the hotel door and although we were a little early for check-in the room was ready.The lobby was quite busy, but we were efficiently and pleasantly checked-in. Loved the old-fashioned elevators and the room was an oasis of calm.Much bigger than we expected, it was cool, dark (curtains were drawn) and radio was tuned to a classical station... ah peace at last! Closer inspection revealed a clean room and bathroom with a comfortable, generously sized bed.We took a short walk around the block and returned to the hotel where it seems standard practice that you have to show your room key to the doorman to gain access (not a problem and I guess it is for security, but not something we have come across before).A good nights sleep and then an excellent breakfast with good old-fashioned service.The location was very central and only a few minutes walk from Penn Station where we caught our train to DC.In summary the hotel has retained some old-world charm and although we did not have time to enjoy all its amenities we were very happy with our stay.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've now stayed at the Martinique (formerly a Radisson property, now a Curio by Hilton property) several times over the past six months. She's a grand old dame of an earlier era in an incredibly appealing location, close to Penn Station, right on Broadway. Over the past six months, I've developed the following impressions:* Rooms vary wildly, some are truly lovely while some are unrenovated and crappy* Scaffolding facing Broadway (fairly now) is a giant drag* Showers feel modern and pleasant* Room sizes are generally better than most in NYC* Free breakfast for Hilton Diamonds is nice; a club lounge would be nicer* Gym is small for such a large property; weights are in a separate room (which helps)* Lobby is under renovation, and will presumably be lovely sometime soon* Vestibule is staffed 24/7 checking for keys, which is a nice-to-have amenityI always try to get a room in the section to the left of the (temporary) front desk. I've been on the 17th floor in a huge room and just recently, on a crappy third-floor room with endless cacophony from the street below (it's NYC, it happens, but it sucks).Lately, I'm finding better rates here than at the myriad of Hampton and Garden Inn properties around midtown/Chelsea/Penn, and definitely prefer the Martinique.Note: Uber still refers to it as the Radisson Martinique, so be careful.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: location is great, short walk to Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Broadway. Easily accessible to subway. Rooms were clean. Cons: bathroom is TINY. Literally have to turn in place to get from sink to toilet to shower. (Having said that water pressure was best I ever had in the city. I was giddy) Also, there was almost no where to put unpacked clothes. Also, my husband is a Diamond member. When he called for reservations, he asked for two Queens. They were confirmed by phone then email, but we got two full. We had our two fully grown teenagers, it made for three long nights. Also, sheets were extremely rough, mattresses were hard. Bedcovers looked like hand me downs.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was traveling with my two young children and I can't say enough good things about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff! The location is perfect, steps from the subway and plenty of good eats all around.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location only feet from the subway. Wonderful restaurants easily accessible. And, above all, everyone at the Martinique is focused on your comfort.I have been travelling to NYC for business the past 5 years. I've stayed at almost every hotel in NYC and I always come back to the Martinique.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Depending on what you are planning to do, this hotel has a convenient location still. Few steps from the subway, walking distance from Penn station. Right in Koreatown it is really busy around. Some parts of the hotel are in renovation, we stayed in a larger room on the top floor. Weren’t disturbed by the renovation at all but it is still not that quiet during the night, not even on the top floor. But it’s NyC anyways. Flight attendants usually use this hotel overnight. Nice place overall.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I traveled to New York for the weekend. The hotel staff was welcoming, check-in was swift and our room was very clean. The location is great. Easy access to the 34th Street station, walking distance to Times Square and Broadway, and next door to the Empire State Building. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting the city.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Martinique Hotel Hilton Curio Collection. Had a lovely 5 night stay. Easy checking and checkout. Friendly staff and our room was comfortable, clean and made up every day by the house staff who were also very friendly. Location was perfect for walking to Times Square and Empire State. Macy’s was opposite and the subway (Herald Sq) was right outside the hotel entrance. Perfect fro travelling the metro. Loads of eateries so no need to eat at hotel, although the restaurant did look ok. I would certainly stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay at hotels almost every day because I am a speaker. Most of what I speak on has to do with treating your clients with respect to better your business. I arrived at hotel (after an international flight) at 9am and wanted to check into my room. They were very rude (the room wasn't available and I was fine with that) but they were rude. They didn't even ask to hold my luggage (I had a lot of bags) I asked for an upgrade to my room to have extra room. The manager assumed I wouldn't pay for it and immediately said, "No, we have no upgrades". I then said, I'll expect to pay for it, do you have a room that's an upgrade to what I'm booked in now. It was almost like he was hoping he didn't have one. Most of where I travel is in Europe (although I'm American) and the service is impeccable. These people acted like it was a bother to have me stay at their hotel. I then asked the lady at the front desk- Can you let me know when my room is ready. She said, "I don't do that". I couldn't believe it. I will never stay at this property brand ever again.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The experience of the Martinique was so special because of the staff and the character of the hotel. It has working elements from the late 1800's that add so much to the stay. The PGA Tour was started here by a board meeting in the early 1900's. How cool is that!
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent room for the price and location. Lots of refurb work going on which I'm sure will make it a great location. Lots of history in the hotel too. 200 yards to Macy's, 500 yards to Empire State. Ideal.
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice historic hotel that is clean and a nice change from the traditional Hilton Garden Inn in NYC. The rooms were clean, food was great and the bathroom was all updated and fresh. I would stay here again while in NYC
hotelName:
12    Martinique New York on Broadway, Curio Collect...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I just spent four nights at the Artezen. It's a relatively new hotel in the Financial District. The hotel was great; ALL of the staff were ALWAYS helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to accommodate. No matter who was working the service was superb. My husband is Gluten Free so finding restaurants to accommodate his GF intolerance was a little bit of a challenge. We were accustomed to more restaurants in other parts of the city where we have stayed in the past; however, it was an easy walk to Battery Park and to Tribeca, where we ate most of our meals.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are friendly and professional. I was greeted warmly when I registered.My room was on the ninth floor and I was very pleased. The room is small and the queen bed is positioned right up against the window but I was traveling solo so that didn't matter. The 42 inch TV was a great treat for a political news junkie such as myself. There's a tiny refrigerator in the room, too! I like a cold beverage or two while enjoying the room and it was nice to be able to store a few bottles of soda and water. Bed was super comfy with luxurious linens. The bathroom was spacious and well stocked with towels and toiletries. Was very happy to see it had a walk in shower. Always hated the tub/shower combo in hotels. Who takes a tub bath when traveling? Nice robes and slippers are provided to slip into after stepping out of the shower.Room service is provided by a service named Hospitality Butler. I ordered breakfast online. Tasty and hot breakfast was quickly delivered within 20 minutes. The coffee left a lot to be desired but I'm a coffee snob so it's probably just me. The room has a Nespresso coffee maker. I prefer regular coffee so didn't use it. A little disappointed there wasn't a drip coffee maker.Parking is available on Gold street about a five minute walk down John street. The hotel will give you a sticker to put on the claim ticket to receive a small discount. Be aware that Gold street is a narrow almost hidden street. I drove past it twice before realizing I had to turn down what I thought was an alley. This hotel will always be at the top of my list of NYC hotels. I highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I almost hesitated to write a review because I want to keep this hotel a secret!! There were 3 couples in our group. The rooms were perfect!! Air conditioning was great! I like it cold!! Location was perfect to catch a subway. The staff were wonderful!! Everyone from the front desk, doorman, consierge were so helpful. This hotel has been my favorite so far with all my visits to the city.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a pleasure to be a guest at this little gem. Away from the hustle of midtown and the throngs of tourists. The hotel is two blocks from the 911 Memorial and a block away from Cortland St subway. Room was spotless , with all the amenities to make for a fab stay. Room was super quiet , very comfortable and the walk in shower excellent! Check in Staff were super friendly and efficient , as was the Concierge.I would highly recommend and will definitely stay here again
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm glad I came across this hotel, as it was really good value in a location that was convenient to the main attractions at the southern tip of Manhatten island and with easy connections to the rest of New York. The staff were all friendly and helpful, even telling me to ignore the tornado warning that came on my phone when I checked in. The only issue I had was that the cleaners come round to clean the room a little later in the day compared to other cities I have stayed in, but this was nothing major.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazed by the superb location, fulton subway in 2mins, world trade center/ 9/11 memorial, wall street, financial district are all 5 minute walk. Staff were extremely friendly & accomodating to special requests, shoutout to Jay Somera. Will definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here from 8th-13th June for our first trip to NYC. We weren’t disappointed- the hotel was wonderful, and such a treat to stay somewhere so fresh and new! Everyone working at the hotel was super friendly and welcoming. It’s ideally situated for exploring the city. If we’re ever back in the city (fingers crossed we will be!), we’ll be sure to stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at The Artezen 6/5-6/6 to celebrate my wifes 60th birthday. Most likely the most pleasant and helpful staff I have ever encountered at any hotel. It started when we went to check in and received an upgrade to a room with a terrace, without asking for one at no extra charge, very nice. As stated everything you need is right there, subway hub, breakfast spot, bar, etc all right across the street. It's a couple of block walk to the Trade Center Memorial, which was beautiful to just sit and reflect early on Thursday morning with coffee. Between seeing a Broadway matinee, dinner at Delmonico's, which also within walking distance albeit a bit further and this hotel it made for a perfect birthday. Again, kudos to the staff especially the girls at the front desk and the the gentleman who who worked the door as well as luggage check, all genuinely down to earth nice people. I would highly recommend!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here because reviews were excellent and price seemed good. From the get go, the staff were all super helpful and kind. I think they are working out some kinks, but their kindness makes up for any bumps. Our room was very clean and comfy. The portable crib we needed was in our room when we arrived and was in perfect condition. It was cool to have Netflix and other streaming available when we chilled in our room after busy days. The patio available with our room was huge and lovely! I visit NYC fairly often but have never stayed in this area. Surely there are pros and cons, but overall we had a wonderful visit due in large part to the comforts of the Artezen Hotel.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This amazing hotel was our first choice and we did no wrong! The location is perfect, right around the corner of numerous subway stations, clean rooms, softest sheets and the most comfortable bed, staff is beyond welcoming, helpful and they've always put a smile on your face while exiting and entering the hotel. We had a slight problem with our credit card when we arrived and they handeled the situation very professionally and made us feel calm until resolving the issue. Shoutout to the doormen and everyone on at the reception! The best staff ever!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very new Hotel. ALL of the Staff are amazing, kind and helpful!The room was elegant with fresh Figi bottled water provided everyday.It was the best Hotel experience I have had in my many trips to ManhattanThank you to everyone there, especially Michael in helping with my Reservation.SincerelyBrad
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were so helpful, the location is so close to the subways, ground zero, Brooklyn Bridge. The hotel itself is very nice, located on a quiet street, the room was fancy. The pictures of the room and lobby weren’t edited to look really nice, what you see is what you get. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at a number hotels in this area before and Artezen is definitely my favourite The staff were welcoming and helpful throughout and the room was light, stylish and super clean. The stand out thing for me was the bed, which was extremely comfortable, but there were also lots of nice little touches throughout that gave the place a sense of luxury e.g. a bottle of water on arrival, an iPad for use in the room, good quality toiletries etc. The shower was excellent and I liked that the desk was slightly removed from the main part of the room: good for keeping work separate from rest. The curtains did a great job at blocking out light, the air con worked well and the room was very quiet - all in all a good recipe for a solid night's sleep. There wasn't a huge amount of storage but there was a small cupboard/wardrobe which was enough for me to hang a few dresses and jackets and there was a room safe for valuables. I didn't use the gym but i could see it was stocked will all the essentials. Being so close to Fulton St station makes this a great location for accessing the rest of the city and there are tons of places to eat close-by (i would recommend Nish Nush for falafel fans!). If you're looking for somewhere with comfort, style and a chilled vibe then look no further.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very near with metro, foods around, including best food beside hotel and in front of hotel. There is supermarket near hotel and safe locatin even in night. Staff are very warm welcming guest, very helpfull, good hospitality, especially staff name carmello, that helped me a lot when i stay there about 2 weeks., Wuth direction and help with transport when i went to JFK
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Planned a night out during the workweek and decided to stay in the city in lieu of trekking home.Booked a stay in the Artezen Hotel on John Street and was pleasantly surprised by the staff, ambiance, sundries and decor contained in this boutique type property. Upon entering you find a small lobby tastefully decorated and smartly engineered with subdued and comforting lighting. Well mannered front desk staff are most gracious and make your check-in experience effortless and timely. The room I occupied on the 8th floor was thoughtfully designed to make good use of the square footage provided and included a small armoire, desk and chair in addition to a comfortable queen size bed. Above the desk was a wall mounted flat screen TV of good size. On a side of said desk was a coffee/tea maker and 2 bottles of FIJI water. The bathroom was roomy with a good sized walk-in shower and controls that allowed the guest to dial up hot water without restriction (which is something most important to me). The toiletries provided were custom made from CO BIGELOW which was another nice touch akin to the gratis artesian well water. More thoughtfulness as concerns the guest experience is the inclusion of a high quality steamer in lieu of an iron : I was quite impressed how well this apparatus removed wrinkles in addition sanitizing my clothes.I slept like a baby and was happy with the self regulating thermostat provided hence a guest can set a temperature to their liking.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is nothing like a brand new hotel! We searched the internet for a new hotel and found the Artezen. Couldn’t have been happier. Tastefully furnished, room spacious enough, heavenly comfortable bed. Very friendly staff, front desk and concierge.Great location. WTC around the corner. Also Fulton underground with lines to almost everywhere. Loads of food places. Could not have made a better choice. Would stay there again.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed recently for a few nights. This is a nice hotel, very clean, modern and convenient to financial district, 9/11 memorial, and subway.Small European-feel hotel with a staff is very friendly and accommodating.A few issues prevent a five-start rating:1. Upon checkin, was told that the roof top deck was not yet open. This should be made clear on the hotel website because this was a selling point for us.2. As another reviewer mentioned, the shower is not intuitive and we, too, were dealing with a cold shower for a few minutes until we figured it out. The rain head is also located too close to the wall to be at all useful.3. The alarm clock went off the first night we were there are 3:30 a.m. Hotel maids should be trained to turn off the alarm clock as part of getting rooms ready between guests.4. The front desk clerk told us that prices will go up soon once people find out about the property. This is NOT how to sell your hotel if you expect return customers or good reviews.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Michael did an amazing job arranging a surprise for my parent during their recent stay. He went above and beyond, even staying late to make sure my delivery was received. Thank you, Michael! In addition, the manager on duty, Erika, was extremely helpful and very professional.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, New, friendly staff. You can tell everyone is trying to go above and beyond to provide excellent service and prove themselves. They offered to go to the store to get me tea because there was only coffee in the room. Great price and recommended. Near lots of subways.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 2 wks ago. approx. Loved everything about it. The proximity to the metro at the Occulus means you can ride the subway with your luggage without transfer from near La Guardia and then take a v. short walk (maybe 5 min.) to the Artezen. The staff has a pleasant and engaging manner to welcome you in. I would like to see a fresh water dispenser in the lobby so I can fill my water bottle instead of receiving one of the small, free non reusable plastic bottles handed out by the doorman. The rooms reminded of some European ones. Max. 6 per floor (makes for quiet) with great floor to ceiling windows. The shower was reminiscent of Europe too. Hope they don't raise their rates too much and I can come back in future visits.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was one of the lucky first guests to stay at the Artezen at the time of their opening. I stayed for a long duration - 9 days - and had the opportunity to get to know the hotel and appreciate all the staff had to offer. My check in was quick and easy, the staff was always courteous when I walked through the lobby (thank you Kenneth!), and the hotel itself was perfect. The rooms are brand new, contemporary, clean, and comfortable. Some rooms inevitably don't have a view, but the interior is so beautiful that I would not even mind. The showers and bath products are amazing, and I looked forward to returning to this extra perk each day. The building has no kitchen/cafe or breakfast, but plenty of restaurants nearby. The Fulton Stop is across the street, and can get you anywhere in Manhattan within half an hour. Overall, this has become my favorite place to stay (and I have been back twice in the last month!)
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at The Artezen for two nights for a girls trip with two of my best friends. Before we even got into the room, we were greeted at the door with the best concierge. Carmelo was the best. He went out of his way to make sure we knew all of the spots to hit while traveling in New York. We told him where we wanted to go and he gave us ideas. He really went out of his way to make our trip great. About the room...the room was so nice. Clean and tidy. No issues at all. The hotel is across the street froM an Irish American pub. After looking out our window and seeing its popularity we decided to go there. So fun and convenient since our hotel was right across the street. The front desk employees were so nice. Anytime we called to ask for something they came within a good amount of time. I would definitely recommend this hotel for convenient. It was also across the street from the subway. Perfect for us. I would stay here again!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place and great value!The Artezen Hotel is located less than a block from most of the major train stations therefore its easy commuting back and forth from the hotel.The rooms were clean and had more perks than expected.The staff was very friendly and helpful too, I would definitely go back!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My teenage daughter and I were EXTREMELY satisfied with the hotel and staff. Our room was super clean, cozy, and quiet! The housekeeping staff were so polite and accommodating. We didn’t want to leave! We rhighly recommend the Artezen and we’ll be returning for another stay in July. KEEP UP THE GREAT SERVICE AND CLEANLINESS!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually stay in Times Square area. But wanted a new place to explore. Found the Artezen on Expedia and was glad I did. Clean and comfortable and spacious for NYC standards we even had our own terrace. The front desk staff was kind and courteous and Sal the doorman was excellent and helpful. Everyone made us feel welcome. Would definitely recommend and would like to return.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We initially had a large ADA compliant room on the 4th floor, street side which was good size, but connecting and our neighbors were loud. The front desk was nice enough to move us up to the 16th floor on the backside of the hotel. The room was smaller but I really liked it (1605). I slept so well. It was quiet. We even slept with the windows open. The hotel is brand new, super clean, staff is eager to serve, and the in-room amenities are quite nice. The biggest problem was parking. Initially we were not told that the street was completely torn up in front of the hotel so that we couldn't drop off our bags. Then when we were given information about the parking garage and driving around all the one-way streets, the garage was full. We weren't given the option for another garage as the staff told us when we finally arrived at the hotel. Thankfully, we have the Spothero app. We should have just used this from the beginning. Again, this was the only negative. Everything else was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a stunning little gem, with kind staff, brand new rooms, and wonderful amenities. It had all that I needed for a quick work trip, was around the corner from my office, and the staff made the entire process seamless and lovely. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my new home in NY. Lovely staff, very comfortable beds and delicious linens and towels. Perfect location. The staff was incredibly helpful and made sure to accommodate nay request I made. A keeper!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently celebrated my birthday in NYC and stayed at the Artezen Hotel. The hotel is gorgeous and very clean. It’s located in lower Manhattan, minutes away from the World Trade Center. The staff is amazing... very friendly, accommodating and knowledgeable. They helped with transportation questions, food suggestions and navigating through the city. They made my stay in the city that much better!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Artezen Hotel is an amazing property. I had a 2 night stay and was highly impressed by the well appointed rooms, the attention to detail, and the staff. I enjoyed staying in this property. It’s centrally located in the financial district. It’s across the street from a subway station which makes it easy to get uptown, downtown, or to Brooklyn. By New York standards the rooms are nicely sized. I can’t say enough good things about this property. Give it a try!!!!
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Neighborhood looked a little worn but this hotel shines! The most friendly and helpful staff! Carmelo and Michael were super helpful, as was everyone there. One block from Fulton Street subway. Super quiet. Beautifully appointed room, comfortable bed, Linens and towels. Complimentary water and coffee in your room each day. Would definitely use this hotel again.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice hotel with super friendly service. i stayed there a week and had a awesome experience at this hotel. all other hotels need to take note on how to treat their customers. They also gave me help with tour guides, saving money with tours etc. i will definitely stay at this hotel again. it is 1 block away from the world trade center and memorial. lots of great stores near by etc. i want to say thanks to all of the staff for being honest and friendly.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will admit I was slightly skeptical because I had never stayed here and frankly the price was very affordable for the location. I was so pleasantly surprised! The staff was all so lovely upon my arrival all the way through checkout. The room is luxurious with a comfy bed, Frette linens and a plush robe with slippers. There are even free snacks and water. I can not recommend this hotel enough and I will absolutely be back! Their rooftop is undergoing renovations but it looks like it will be amazing.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed the experience of the hotel the terrance was nice and beautiful. The yoga room and weight room was nice and fully stocked. Angel the doorman was amazing. I also had a male front desk guy that brought my food to my room from door dash because he didn’t want me to leave the comfort of my room (overnight shift April 5). The shower head was amazing lol! The room was stocked with snacks and Fiji water and refilled daily (amazing). Hotel was very clean and quiet. Front desk crew guys were very nice and friendly. Never felt ignored always greeted. On the downside the internet did not work in the room and the cable went in and out the entire stay. The lounge isn’t open yet so there wasn’t any breakfast. Not a huge issue as we weren’t in our rooms that much. And the staff made up for what was missing. Hotel is near a lot of restaurants and perfect location from subway.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I frequently passed this hotel while it was under construction and I was looking forward to its opening. I had the opportunity to stay there last night and I absolutely love this place! The hotel is brand new, has spacious rooms, is centrally located, and the price was very reasonable. They even offer complimentary wifi, Fiji water, and espresso in the rooms. This will definitely be my new home when I’m doing business in NYC.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bravo Artezen Hotel, what a fantastic hotel to stay at. This hotel is beautiful, from the decor to the staff one can tell that they run a fantastic operation. The rooms are gorgeous, the location is phenomenal and the staff is extremely attentive and helpful. I must say, I am really impressed and I will surely stay at The Artezen hotel in the future.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really beautiful boutique hotel in a very convenient location. Breakfast was fantastic and having a bathrobe was a nice added bonus. Train across the street makes getting around super easy. Easy walk to the 9/11 memorial and ferry to statue of liberty. Prices were also very reasonable and much lower compared to others.
hotelName:
13    Artezen Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was literally a series of problems from the get go. We arrived at 2:40 p.m. and told our room was not ready yet. Ok, I get it, check-in is at 3:00, but I have never been turned away when it was that close to 3:00. And apparently, no room was ready at 2:40. Just odd. "Go get something to eat and come back" was what we were told.We came back at 3:20 p.m. and then found out that their key card system had malfunctioned and thus could not provide any keys to anyone. However, they said they would cancel our reservation and find us a new hotel. Really? You couldn't tell me this 45 minutes ago when I was here? No, fine. We'll just wait to be escorted each and every time we leave the room.Next, the tv remote doesn't work. They sent someone up and he replaced the batteries, replaced the remote, then replaced the dongle and still for some reason, the remote would not work. You literally had to stand an inch from the tv to change the channel. They offered to change my room. It's fine, we'll cope. We're not here to watch tv. He suggested I ask for a discount when I check out. Apparently, it has worked for others.The room was a little dingy. The walls were scuffed. The ToTo toilet kept running at times. The number one button on the toilet was permanently depressed. The shades were a little dirty.The pluses: The shower was great. The location is fine.So, when I checked out, I asked about getting a discount because of all the inconveniences. When they finally located the manager, he looked like he literally came out of the basement, he was a bit unkempt. He reviewed my issues with the room and disputed the remote issue, And I said, "no, it really didn't work." "Oh, so they lied to me that it was fixed." "I don't know what they told you. It still didn't work unless I stood next to the tv.""Well, I can give you a discount next time."Really? Why would I want to be forced to come back here? This place was not a 3.5 star hotel. From the service to the quality of the room, you can spend less and do better.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nightmare to find! We struggled to find this hotel so did the 2 taxi drivers and locals we asked. Once found we were a bit concerned with the scaffolding round about which covered a lot of the front. The receptionist was a bit rude at checking in. It was almost like we were interrupting her and her friend who were chatting. We went to our room and were chuffed with the cleanliness, appearance and facilities. The shower was fantastic, the toiletries were rubbish. So bring your own!!! Bed was luxury to sleep in. Woke up 4am nose streaming, dry throat and the air conditioning blasting out freezing the room although it was warm outside. So we had to phone reception and were moved room at 4am in the morning. Moved to similar room same obstructed view. Great place for public transport and walking about. I’d stay here again.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's the second time we stayed in NYC. We chose this hotel bc is had a good location foodwise, close to East Village, Little Italy and Chinatown. Our stay couldnt have been better. Clean hotel, comfy bed, soft sheets, big room (to NYC standards), close to the metro and had an open view. There isnt a restaurant or a bar in the hotel but you do have vending machines for drinks and snacks. But who needs all that when you are surrounded by many different places to go. 2 rooftopbars in walking distance and plenty to eat.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, great price, great staff, and great room. The best way to move around the area is by subway. I would come back to New York and this hotel but I will be wearing a pollution mask, the city and the underground subway are too polluted and I developed asthmatic bronchitis after my trip. If I come back I will stay at this hotel for safety, cleanliness, and service. I left my clothes at the hotel and the hotel was able to ship it to me, I just paid for the shipping. I appreciated this service.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A terrific hotel for families on a budget, good location that gives easy access to anywhere in the city via subway. Rooms were clean, comfortable and well appointed, definitely recommend staying here for your time in the big Apple.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 3 friends 60yrs young staying inHotel Leon for 4 nights. We booked a suite which gave us 3 double beds and 2 bathrooms. One bed and bathroom can be partioned off with sliding doors. The rooms each had a coffee machine, safe and hairdryer. There was a tv in main room. Very spacious and clean. View from window was the start of Manhattan bridge. This hotel does not offer food, bar etc but has 24hr reception with friendly staff. There are bars, restaurants in local area so not a problem. Location was great for Chinatown and Little Italy where we found a couple of the restaurants served Gluten free pizza and pasta which was a bonus for me. Easy walking to Ground Zero, Stattan ferry etc but needed a taxi to reach upper Manhattan for places like Empire State, Central Park, Grand Central Terminal, Times Square etc. I would recommend this room for friends, family or 2 couples.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were good, decent clean rooms. Nothing special but we were not looking for fancy. Good location to Chinese restaurants and little Italy. The hotel was covered in scaffolding which made it difficult to find especially at night as the scaffolding covered the sign. Our Uber driver had a hard time finding the actual hotel. We had to get out and walk.The frustration was the wifi. I had to do some work and the connection was so terrible, it made what should have been a quick and short amount of work into a long, excrutiating experience. One should not have such poor WIFI in New York!!I would have given a five star rating but for the WIFI. As I travel a lot for business, I cannot use this hotel again owing to the WIFI situation.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nice and clean. Rooms are comfy. Most importantly: it's nicely located. Just around the corner of Soho, Little Italy, China Town, and the financial district. All in walking distance. Grand street Subway station at .4 mile.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel couldn’t be more close at Manhattan Bridge with Chinatown & Little Italy just around the corner. All of Lower Manhattan , like 09/11 Memorial or Wall Street , can easily be reached by foot. Subway is just a mere 200 meters away from the hotel.Room is spacious with nice urban view on Manhattan bridge, we loved the sofa in the window. WiFi in the room was rather poor though. Staff is friendly, rooms are clean.It’s been a pleasure for us to have stayed at this hotel, just walk outside and you are in the middle of bustling Manhattan, the Big Apple is waiting outside there for you.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The family room I had booked was just big enough for the 4 of us. The beds were just wide enough for 2, the bathroom was small. The room was clean but had an odor. The hotel does not have a lot of facilities, the lobby has 2 chairs in front of the elevator. The WiFi is slow at best, if available in the room. The area is busy even for New York, with the entrance to Manhattan Bridge in front of the hotel. The room was quiet though! All in all we had a good stay here, but price/quality ratio isn't great.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location right next to China Town and Little Italy. Overlooking Manhattan Bridge. Short walk to Brooklyn and new area of DUMBO. Very nice front desk. My room was a corner and windows were huge giving a great view, especially in the evening. Also there was a padded ledge along the window making it a great place to sit and eat/read etc while looking out the windo.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a gem, located in the center of China Town, at the base of the Manhattan Bridge. While I have no love at all for China Town, the subway stops are close (a five minute walk to most) and the area feels very safe. The hotel itself is exactly what every hotel should be - clean, quiet, and comfortable. We had a king bed that was super comfortable. Private bathroom was clean and quiet. Water pressure perfect. The window opens. There is even a huge window seat to sit in and look out the window or read. I've never seen a window seat in a hotel. Such a great idea. There was even free filtered water in the basement to refill our water bottles. Never seen that before either. The staff were kind and helpful. Needless to say, I was very impressed.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was going to stay here, but after they charged my card a full week before I was even due to check in, I cancelled. I called the booking agency and told them what happened. They then called the hotel and told them it could be up to 15 days for my refund. No explanation as to why they charged my card a full 7 days in advance of checking in. Pretty shady billing practices. Way too many hotels in Manhattan to have to deal with this kind of nonsense. You have been warned.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 5 girlfriends staying in the family room which has TWO full bathrooms! Perfect for us. The location is just on the edge of Chinatown which means it's so close to lower east side and Soho - PERFECT LOCATION if you're into bars, restaurants and shopping. The room we stayed in had three beds (for a total of 6 people). These beds are pretty small, not the usual size of a european double bed... The room was surprisingly quiet considering it was just at the manhattan bridge.There are many nice breakfast options close by.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They don't tell you there is a Popeye's Fried Chicken situated on the ground floor of this building, right next to the entryway of the Leon Hotel in Chinatown. The entire place, including the upper floors, smells like stale fried chicken, and it's pretty gross. Aside from the awful smell, the hotel is straightforward: staff who are disinterested and yet, when asked a question, can be helpful. Clean but not spotless rooms. Don't expect any frills, it's all very basic. But it's also safe and well situated. My conclusion: I don't regret staying here. But I wouldn't stay here again.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel as a one night stop over before moving in to an air bnb and actually wish I had stayed longer. The room was a really decent size and the location fantastic. The east village is a fantastic neighbourhood but it is really noisy and this hotel protected me from that! It isn't fancy but does exactly what you would hope from a reasonably priced hotel. Only criticism I had was the wifi wasn't great in my room.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On the edge of Chinatown, the Leon Hotel is convenient to also Little Italy, the Lower Eastside and many other attractions. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The in room Keurig as well as the Wi-Fi are greatly appreciated. The staff if friendly, helpful and accommodating.A good value in a great location.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would absolutely recommend the Leon Hotel for a budget-conscious traveler, and especially a family, looking to stay in Manhattan. For the price I don't think you can do much better unless you snag some amazing promotion. Hotel Leon met all our needs - a clean room, comfy beds, a location walkable to a lot of lower Manhattan. Also, my husband just loves Chinatown. As expected, there was some noise weekend nights but nothing crazy. (We all slept.) The views from the windows were not-quite-great but not bad. The blackout curtains were good. It did bother my daughter that almost every time we went in or out people were smoking just outside the door, but again, it's Chinatown. No problems with check-in or out and there was always a staff person in the small lobby when we went through. The park is a great place to people watch. Kids will enjoy the playground. Tons of cheap food options. And the temple next door is an interesting place to drop in.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A double room with two separate beds (superior double at Leon) seemed to be rare in NYC, this was one crucial criterion for us and we were happy with choosing Leon. Service was good. They for example changed our room because you could smell smoke in the first room (they told it was because of the workers smoking on the roof). The other room was fine, no smells and otherwise clean as well. It was 4th floor, a window facing Manhattan bridge so you could hear the traffic - not too noisy though, one of us was able to sleep without earplugs. Recommend taking them with you anyway! And the advantage is a fascinating view from the window. Nice location: a good opportunity to explore Lower East Side, Soho and Chinatown, also several subway lines at walking distance as well as restaurants.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, friendly staff and easy check in. The rooms are spacious and my kids loved the view of the bridge out our window. Some of the furniture looked a bit worn but other then that very pleased with the stay.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Leon hotel is you’re lower east side hotel just down the Manhattan bridge in the heart of China town.Rooms are bigger than average, and the shower is just great. (Far better than so many hotel showers!!!)Easy acces to all over Manhattan and Brooklyn from here.We had noisy neighbours but that’s is not the hotels fault.Overall perfect price/quality! Would def recommend. :)
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Leon Hotel did not disappoint. Situated in Chinatown, it's walking distance to worthwhile ventures like Little Italy and 9/11 Memorial. The room was nicely done with a comfy bed and great rainfall showerhead. The room was smallish but all we needed in a place to clean up and crash. I highly recommend and will return.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, great location, price is outstanding. Hotel is clean and staff was super nice. Our room had an awesome view of the Manhattan Bridge Arch. I had reservations about staying here because I didn't know the area and the price was much more affordable than others. I was pleased when we arrived and saw it in person. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Grade in mid between 3 and 4 but I gave 4....+Very comfortable mattress and pillowSpace in cabinets to store itemsClose distance walk to subway.Nice view of the brooklyn bridge entrance structure.Clean towels.Good AC, good heater.Fresh bathroom.- Very poor wifi. Even after midngiht it is intermittentScuffs and worn bits on furnitures and wood finishBed linen is pilled and threadbare. The cover sheet even broke against toe nail when I tried to push my feet down. Worse is the pills.Black hair (= not our own hair) found on bedsheetsOne of the cabinets tell that there was a fridge here before, why removed it? We missed a fridge so we could buy breakfast cheap and store and for cold water.Smoke (tobacco smoke) smell from somewhere 2-3 days. Quite strong smell which made me feel bad in eyes.Neutral:More hooks could be good in bathroom to hang up hand towel for example. in NYC I feel it is more "clean" with hardwood floor. Here it is dingy carpet with dark areas from where people walked which always feel icky plus makes it harder to inspect for bugs.Some of the workers could be a little more service minded and nice going.The cushions on the windowsill is a nice touch.Is it worth the price? No I do not think it matches the price which is quite ripoff, but this is New york. Alas.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was OK. Kind of expensive (300 USD/night) for what you get. There are no good breakfast cafés close by so we usually combined breakfast and lunch somewhere else.The worst thing was the WiFi. The reception looked OK but when I tried a Skype meeting with work at 4 AM in the morning I was disconnected two times in one hour. I had a ping running towards google.com during the time and it was 300+ milliseconds with high packet loss.I complained at checkout but they told me that sometimes when the hotel is full they have problems. I told them about my meeting at 4 AM when everyone was sleeping. She could not understand that.Not even Facebook Messenger worked on the WiFi. It disconnected all the time and I had to get a mobile data roaming package from my phone provider to stay online.Do not chose this hotel if you need WiFi for work or something else. The room itself was OK. There was no fridge however so we couldn't get sandwiches the night before on our way back to the hotel.We stayed at the hotel for a week.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here twice, the previous time was in September 2015, just after the current owners took over the hotel. Frankly it's starting to look a bit tired: lots of chipped furniture, surfaces damaged by hot drinks and food - these are small things that could be fixed fairly easily. Housekeeping needs to be better - the paintwork and light switch plates were grubby (just wipe them down already!), and one day we found a hair (not ours) in the bed, left behind by housekeeping. When our toilet roll was running low, the housekeeper didn't leave a new one, we had to request it from reception. Two of the plug sockets were not working (one of them was hanging out from the base). There's a safe in the room but you have to pay to use it. There is no fridge, which would be a welcome addition for our bottles of water in the city in the hot weather. The bath towels are on the small side. When we made our booking (over 7 months before we travelled), we requested a higher floor. We were given a room on what Brits call the first floor, and Americans call the second floor - the one above the ground in other words. And why is there only one chair in a King Room? And quite a hard chair at that. Two people = two chairs please.The good points: the room is a fair size by New York standards, and the price is reasonable. There's always plenty of hot water, and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. Although some noise carried in from the corridor, the external noise was not bad at all, despite the low floor (we were at the back of the hotel, overlooking Chrystie Street).There is no breakfast at the hotel. Our favourite local diner had closed down, so we used a deli a few blocks along Canal that does good take out breakfast items. There are also a few coffee shops not too far away.The location worked for us, we're regular visitors to the city and prefer not to stay in the busy midtown area. It is a long way downtown though, so may not be to everyone's liking.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second stay in the Leon and again it turned out to be a good choice. New York is not cheap when it comes to hotels and this one meets our needs without being too expensive. I say it is a no frills hotel and by that I mean that it does not have a restaurant or bar and offers no food service at all. The rooms, however, by some New York standards are spacious and clean with comfortable beds. There is free wifi and coffee making facilities. The bathroom is a fair size with limited toiletries.This hotel is not for you if you want to be staying in mid town Manhattan with all its theatres and shopping. It is in Chinatown close to the Manhattan Bridge and not far from the Freedom Tower.There are subway stations close by so that Manhattans main attractions are easily reachable in a matter of minutes.Most of the nearby restaurants are obviously Chinese, but Little Italy is a short walk away.Like most New York hotels you get some traffic noise come through no matter what floor you stay on.Having said that this is a good functional hotel that offers you a different aspect of city life in the area for a fair price.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was excellent for what we required, clean rooms, comfy beds and a functioning bathroom. There's nowhere to get breakfast or food at the hotel which was fine because as a tourist I was happy to have "american breakfasts" at diners or where ever so that wasnt a problem personally. All the staff were very helpful and polite. They gave us a very helpful guide of where was best to get food or nearby tourist attractions. Getting to all these places was easy either by foot or on the subway (stations located nearby on both canal st and grand st). The only negative of my stay was the WiFi. The signal was inconsistent but when it worked it was excellent and to be honest the WiFi worked well for all but my first night. Anyway, The Leon Hotel was brilliant for what I needed and would definitely recommend to tourists looking to explore Manhattan!!
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel reception staff are all rude with the exception of Nadia. The Manager is ignorant and unhelpful. The room was lovely, although, we stayed for 9 nights and whilst we were given clean towels everyday the bed linen was not changed! The rooms were cleaned also everyday. When we checked in the guy on reception (who we never saw again!) charged our card twice and when this was questioned with the manager he said it was the fault of the European bank we use, I subsequently contacted the bank who said the hotel had claimed for the funds twice. The vending machines were also always out of bottled water.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our favorite place to stay in NYC! Each year, we stay here for a week during Thanksgiving. The rooms are clean. The view is great. It's close to what we love about New York. It's just our place!
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay. Super friendly staff and nice, clean and spacy rooms. We were fortunate to get a view towards the arch and Manhattan Bridge. Front desk booked car service that worked spotless and had a friendly driver. We even forgot a pair of newly bought sneakers (expensive ones) but they were taken care of and staff helped to get them UPS:ed towards another one of our stays. Good and solid communication from their side in the matter. The surroundings are great and the traffic noise was not disturbing in the room at all – good sound insulation. Would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to stay here again. Easy walking distance to Brooklyn Bridge, Washington Square, Chinatown and Little Italy. We have been to NYC before and stayed closer to Times Square for more touristy things but this is where we will stay next time. Since the hotel do not serve breakfast we walked to Pearl Diner on Pearl Street. Great, cool, old-school place with food for the entire family – including picky teenagers and vegetarians.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Leon hotel is a good hotel right in the heart of China Town. Room was clean, comfortable and spacious (we did have a room with 2 double beds). Plenty of places to eat nearby and a short stroll to Little Italy. Subway is 2 blocks away- B&D lines. Walked to Brooklyn Bridge in 25 minutes. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only criticism is there was no fridge in the room. Good place to stay
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a suite of 2 rooms ( and 2 bathrooms) for a recent 4 night stay with our daughters. Overall, a comfortable hotel with generous sized rooms and fantastic views over Manhattan Bridge - the beds were THE most comfortable ever and so welcome after a days walking around NY! Given that it is located on a busy road at the end of Manhattan Bridge I was surprised at just how quiet it was at night. Easy to get anywhere by subway so a great location to see the main attractions on a first visit. We didn't have much cause for interaction with the reception staff but they were friendly and helped organise a taxi back to the airport. Value wise I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Blink and you walk past this place and miss a little gem in Manhattan. In the heart of Chinatown and a short walk to Little Italy you are surrounded by great food choices. A short stroll away for the subway for easy travelling around the city or a walk across the Manhattan or Brooklyn Bridges for great views.In Reception Nadia was super friendly and a helpful guide. Nothing was too complicated for her to do. The room was fine, not too noisy either and the beds comfortable.A big thumbs up.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for one night - we saw it as a convenient stay for onward travel to next morning. Can't fault the location in terms of its vicinity to many attractions but but I have to say it was extremely noisy, we must have got about 2-3 hours sleep, with all the noise from the traffic outside and constant banging inside the hotel which seemed to go on all night. It was the noisiest place we have stayed in.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First Time in this city Overall Can't complain Location: Good location, considering the size of New York, there was ammenities close by, and 2min from Manhattan bridge which has incredible views of both Manhattan and Brooklyn Price: Compared to other hotels we've looked at, this one was the best option and was in our price rangeCustomers Service: barely had interaction with staff apart from check in and check out, but they were nice enough. 24hours reception which was a bonus.Rooms: were cozy, clean and had good views of the city, we could see the Empire State Building from our room. The beds were comfy too.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the Leon and would consider staying again as I loved the location being minutes away from Little Italy,Soho the LES and the Financial District not to mention the restaurants of Chinatown.We booked one of the loft suite style rooms as we were with our son and daughter aged 18 and 22. This was ideal as the set up is two interconnecting rooms each with its own bathroom.One room had a king size bed and the other had two doubles with a window seat and a view of the entrance of the Manhattan bridge.Seconds round the corner was the Bowery with its many bars and restaurants- the location was fantastic for us. The staff were friendly and helpful. If there was one complaint its that the room could do with a mirror over the desk area as the only mirrors were in the bathroom and on the back of the wardrobe doors- and some art or framed pics on the wall would be great.Only other issue was that it took ages for our luggage toe be brought up from the storage room downstairs and if our flight hadn't been delayed we would have missed it due to the wait.Did like the hotel as a whole though and would stay again.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located hotel with friendly staff. Close to public transport and within walking distance to many attractions. The rooms are very clean and tidy. Only downside would be the traffic noise. Has great air conditioning
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Received a great booking confirmation from the hotel to ensure everything was in place. Staff couldn't have been more helpful during our stay recommending places and giving us tips. Room was spacious and clean although the coffee machine was strange and the air con was quite noisy at times but I'm a good sleeper. Pleasant view from the hotel of the nearby park and of the Manhattan edge of the bridge. Truly enjoyed our stay and would stay again if staying in Manhattan. Good transport links and close to cafés. Thank you to the Leon Hotel.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent 6 nights here while visiting New York for the first time. Located on edge of Chinatown and Little Italy opposite Manhattan bridge. Grand st. Subway is 5minutes walk with B and D trains taking you uptown, Canal st. Subway 5-10minutes walk with N/Q/R trains to go uptown.Check in was a simple 5 minutes and we were upgraded to deluxe suite which consisted of a another room separated by sliding doors with its own bathroom/ storage space etc. Beautiful room, suite was large, everything spotless, bathrooms small but sufficient and spotless, great shower. Plenty of towels and toiletries. Good storage space, iron, free safe, coffee/tea maker, sir-conditioning.Water/ice and vending machines located on basement. We had a great view of the Manhattan bridge with a lovely window seat.Staff were friendly and always helpful with directions, printed out maps for us. We were delighted with the hotel, it does not offer breakfast but plenty of places a few subway stops away. We definitely needed the suite for 4 of us as room would have been cramped.For a hotel like this we would have had to pay double if not triple if closer to Times Square area.Would recommend!
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First I will say that I painstakingly took a long time to pick this hotel, so many hotels to pick from in New York city, I read reviews about this hotel, which mentioned the great customer service, so finally went ahead and booked this hotel.When we checked into our room our room was 77'F, it was a warm spring day and our room was facing the sun, so we put the A/C to cool the room down, the A/C was not cooling the room, we then called the front desk, they sent someone up, it still wasn't working, what was then explained to me was that A/C system in this hotel has a hard time cooling rooms and at the same time heating others.(never have had this problem at a hotel before) So we left and came back and at 9:00 p.m. our room was still not cool, another front desk girl came up, she also proceeded to go to a special room to try to reset the A/C system, I asked her if we could change rooms, she said there was no rooms, air was coming out but not cool air. So we thought we just go to sleep with the air that was coming out. At 12:00 A.M I woke up the Air was off and our room was 80'F, we called the front desk, that person then proceeded to go to special room again to reset system, finally there was cooler air coming out, in the morning when we woke, the A/C was off and back to 76-77'We had such a bad night, the next afternoon i went to speak to manager on staff, just to see if we could somehow be discounted or reimbursed for such a bad night, she then told me that the personnel that came to our room said that our room had a comfortable temperature, so in other words our complaints had no basis. she was quite rude. She gave absolutely no validity to our complaints.she made us feel like we were making it all up. The least she could have said was I'm sorry that the room has issues with A/C. Following night we went to a different room. We travel a lot and have never had this type of experience before.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, comfortable and quiet. Everything we needed for our stay in NYC. Room is a good size and while it could maybe do with a picture or two to cheer it up, it had everything we needed. The beds were extremely comfortable, the bathroom was modern (no shower curtain as is so often the curse of mid range American hotels) and spotlessly clean. Staff were friendly and helpful. Easy walk to Little Italy, Lower East Side etc. and both Grand Street and Canal Street metro stations are in close proximity. The only things we weren't keen on were the handkerchief sized towels and the patchy wifi (even though they tried their best and put us next to the IT room). Otherwise it was ideal, and we'd definitely stay again.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a nice and cozy boutique hotel within Chinatown.Cleanliness - Everything was super clean, we had no issues whatsoever. The bathroom was spotless. Sheets were crisp and white. No stains on the carpet. I am very picky when it comes to cleanliness and this hotel met all my standards.Comfort - We had the room with the King Size bed and there was plenty of space. Inside the room there is a small Keurig machine with complimentary tea and coffee. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable. Complimentary toiletries included a conditioning shampoo, a bar of soap and makeup removing cloths, which I really appreciated.Service - The staff were friendly, accommodating and went above and beyond to take care of our needs. I had run out of toothpaste so I'd asked the front desk staff for directions to a grocery store, she happily gave me directions and also told me that she would send some toothpaste up to my room instead.Location - Chinatown is very vibrant and robust, but it's also dusty and dirty. That was the only small thing I struggled with. Still, I eventually got over it because it's part of the New York experience. The area is very safe at night. It's also steps away from a a couple of Subway stations: Grand Street and Canal Street. There's also a bus at the corner of Allen and Grand Street that will take you to Midtown Manhattan (M15 and M15-Select Bus Service.)The hotel is a few blocks away from Soho, where you'll find cute places to shop in. It's also a few blocks away from Little Italy where you will find overpriced restaurants with mediocre food. I would suggest avoiding eating at Little Italy. There are many other restaurants this area has to offer. There's a Popeye's fast food restaurant right beside The Leon, and you can find great deals for delicious baked goods at any of the Chinese bakeries--there is one in every corner. There are also plenty of grocery stores.Also, around the corner of the hotel is a popular and delicious deli restaurant called Russ and Daughters that serve yummy sandwiches and the best ice cream I've ever tasted (Halva ice cream with sesame and caramel sauce.)Overall, this location has a lot to offer, and The Leon Hotel is a true gem in this vibrant part of the city.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful little hotel, modern and immaculate with a very helpful, friendly staff. You're in Chinatown, a couple of blocks from the subway and an easy walk to Little Italy. In reality you can be anywhere in New York in about a 1/2 hour or less.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We needed a place to stay one night for a short family trip to NYC. After searching on TripAdvisor and reading reviews, we decided to book the Leon Hotel. It was a good decision!We usually stay in the Times Square area of the city but, this time, we had tickets to BlueMan Group at the Astor Place theater (less than a mile away from Leon) and wanted to do things in this section of NYC. The Leon was perfect for us. We checked in and were upgraded to a Family Suite since the rooms with two double beds (which we had booked) had sold out. It was a pleasant surprise! The Family Suite is so roomy and comfortable! It consists of two bedrooms with a partition between them for privacy: one with one double bed, a nightstand with clock, a desk with Kurig, a chaise lounge, a wardrobe with mirror, and its own bathroom; the second with two double beds, a nightstand with clock, desk with Kurig, large flat screen TV, mini-fridge, another wardrobe with full-length mirror, and bathroom. Our suite was on the 5th floor and the main, big window faced the entrance of the Manhattan bridge. You would think it'd be noisy from traffic but not at all! In fact, the rooms were very quiet. This hotel is small, newly remodeled, clean, the beds are comfortable, and having all the comforts for today's needs. The staff is super nice and helpful. They have a couple of vending machines and ice dispenser on the floor beneath the lobby.The Leon worked fine for us because we like to visit and do things in the city and only go to the hotel to sleep. Chinatown and Little Italy are right there so plenty of good places to eat.This hotel is a great value! I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting NYC, especially on a budget.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The good- Rooms are big, modern and very clean. They are the same as seen in pictures- Rooms were very quiet. Didnt hear any noise from other rooms or outside (we stayed in room 203) - Bathroom is big. Shower had good water pressure.- Bed was comfortable- Good location with 2 subway stations within 5-10 mins walk. Close to walk to Brooklyn bridge, downtown and lower east side- Lots of good restaurants close by in China town- Staff were great! Very helpful and cheery- Cold / hot water is provided in basement which was goodThe bad- nothing. Highly recommended and I would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is right in the middle of Chinatown. Newly remodeled room and super clean. Guest service also was excellent. Samantha was showing me where to go and gave me tips in the area. She also let me know that I could check in early (it was 1pm) since there was room available. Also, let me know that I could leave my luggage there before I check in or after I check out. I told myself that I buy her a milk tea or Starbucks drink when I came back pickup my luggage but I was rush to the airport. Will come back and definitely recommend to friends. Thank you
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If this property had functioning WiFi, I would have gladly left five stars. Unfortunately, the WiFi -- when it's not dropping out -- is about as fast as dial-up, which makes it impossible to use any apps for work, such as Skype or virtual meeting programs.The WiFi rarely got up to 1mbps, and was often about 1/2 or 1/4 of that speed. Hospitality research shows that WiFi is the amenity that matters most to travelers, so I don't understand why this property doesn't work on fixing its WiFi, given it would be a really easy thing to do for such a small hotel.That said, the housekeeping was outstanding (efficient and great attention to detail with replenishing coffee, tissues and soap), the bed was very comfortable, and for a location right at the edge of the Manhattan Bridge, the room was extremely quiet. The TV also had a nice selection of channels. Keurig coffee maker with four different pods was a nice amenity. The bathroom has an electric heater, which is a nice bonus. If you don't need functional WiFi, this is a very nice place to stay.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a recent college visit to Pace University, which was an $8 Uber ride away. This hotel is really in the heart of anything lower east side. It's in China Town, near the financial district, and all the other points of interest and business in this part of town. We parked about a block away, and it cost $40 for 24 hours. The hotel itself ran us @ $150. What we got was a clean, slightly small (but about the regular size for NYC hotel) but very cool layout. We had two double beds, and our room layout provided windows along two walls with a large window sill, allowing one to sit and look out over the Manhattan Bridge.  It was my wife, my daughter and myself. We arrived in the evening, checked in, went out for a bite, came back, slept, showered, and left. No issues whatsoever. Shower provided a rain shower head, which was wonderful. Front desk staff was nice and friendly at check-in, as we left and arrived in the evening, and when we checked out--even allowing us to store our luggage for the day.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel a year in advance after seeing it on Holiday Pirates. The reviews were all good at the time of booking and still are to this day. The price we got was excellent for NYC.Just checked out of the hotel.The hotel is based on the edge of Chinatown. I personally didnt like Chinatown as an area but there is multiple subway stops nearby to get you to differant areas. The world trade centre is in walkable distance (took around 15/20 mins). To get to Times Square then you would be better getting the subway line N from Canal St or the Line B or D from grand street (2 blocks away) then a short walk from Bryant park.
