The hotel is a bit difficult to find the entrance, just look for the entrance to Popeyes chicken and it is to the left with a green neon above it. Reception area is small but modern. Staff are friendly and approachable. 24 hour reception, nothing is too much hassle. They helped me print my transfers ticket due to me forgetting to do it in the UK.The room we stayed in was the Parlor King. The size of the room is similar to a Travelodge or Premier Inn back in the UK which is excellent for NY. The bed is huge. They say its a king but I have a king bed and this was bigger. It was also comfortable which is great after a day of exploring. There is a huge tv with plenty of channels and free 'on-demand'. There is an iphone/ipad/ipod dock which has a clock on. Plenty of storage space. Just wish there was a fridge. I see that the replies say there is no space but i think a small fridge could be put in where the suitcase stand is. There is a window seat which is basically a single bed too! Great to sit on there with a morning coffee from the rooms coffee machine. The bathroom was clean and modern. Our toilet flush was slightly broke but still useable. There is also a bath which is great for NY. Huge sink and more storage in the bathroom. The rooms are cleaned daily by maids who do a great job and replenish everything including shower creme etc.Temperature in the room was perfect on arrival so we didn't need to change it throughout our stay but there is a panel for heating/air con. If i was to return to NYC then I would be looking at booking the Leon Hotel again as I know that the quality throughout my stay would be high.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Once upon a time there was a lady who had an emergency and needed a place to stay... after a particular unfortunate event on my last day in the city that never sleeps I found myself with a medical emergency that prevented me from going up the 5 floors at my friend's flat. I booked a room at The Leon for one night and was treated with such a care, the manager even helped carry me from the car as I was unable to set my foot down. He then proceeded to upgrade me to suite with tons of space and a great view to the city. I was moved to tears by his kindness and attention. The hotel is great, clean, comfortable, well located, and all those things that makes a hotel great, but the real winners here are the staff. I truly hope the owners know how lucky they are to have such a dedicated team. A couple of weeks after these incident family friends send and SOS from New York, their Airbnb flat had fallen thru, needless to say this hotel was perfect, I quickly send them to the Leon and sure enough the manager and staff went beyond the call of duty. Thank you! and apologies for not remembering names.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night to attend a concert at the Bowery Ballroom and I am thrilled with our choice. First of all hats off to the front desk staff because they were nothing short of fantastic. Our girl Nadia was super sweet, professional and just an all around nice person! I would come back here just to see her! xoxo Now the hotel itself.... impeccably clean, quiet and comfortable to say the least. The rooms were surprisingly big for a NYC hotel and our view of the manhattan bridge was amazing! I can't say enough about how great this place is....you just have to give it a try!
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would stay here the next time I come back! Harlem bridge is just right there when you walk out! Right across the street is this noodle place! Subway is a few blocks! Our room was modern and had a great view! 5 star!!
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very clean, modern hotel that is well managed. Existing in the middle of Chinatown means everything around the hotel is Chinese; restaurants, etc. the hotel doesn't serve breakfast so finding a neighborhood place is difficult. The recommended place by hotel staff has no seating and is not very organized. The rooms are OK but dark; lighting is a problem both over the desk and bedside. Sort of difficult to read in bed as the lamps are weak, at best. Be careful on the rate: as with many NY hotels, they advertise a rate for the first night which dramatically increases in future nights. Read your reservation carefully.
hotelName:
14    The Leon Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only stayed one night, restaurant not open yet and we did not go to the bar. Found the room very clean and quiet (7th floor) with just enough amenities (e.g. no closet but wall pegs and a wall-mounted valet) for the one night. The place reminds me a bit of hotel version of WeWork: communal work areas, clean and spare furnishings, etc.Staff was pleasant and helpful. Even though the restaurant was getting ready for its first dinner service and couldn't accommodate us for brunch, we were pointed to a nearby restaurant that was just what I was looking for.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Sister City and plan to stay here every time we return to the Big Apple. This is a sophisticated, upper- class, no-frills sort of hotel, however bizarre that combination may sound.The minimalist design of the rooms really got to us, the utilities available on a ‚borrow and return when you’re finished’ basis was really in tune with the eco-friendly and generally visitor-friendly feel of the place.The personnel, almost invisible, were always present when we needed their assistance. The Last Light roof-top bar is definately one of the best places to see the July 4th fireworks and we can say this solemnly since we had thte on-hand opportunity to celebrate the 243th anniversary at Last Lite. The wi-fi speed was really good as well. We feel that staying at Sister City was a real treat.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 10th and 12th floor rooms are very noisy. There is a DJ bar called ‘last night’ with a building-wide balcony on the 11th floor. I got a room on the 12th floor and could not stay with the volume of the music in the room. I asked to move. They gave me a corner room on the 9th floor, room 920, which is adjacent to the elevator shaft. The corner rooms are spacious, but the wall next to the bed is shared with the elevators shaft. It is fairly loud in the room every time the elevator passes by the 9th floor. I can’t imagine anyone could stay in that room.I asked to move one last time and they gave me room on the 6th floor facing Bowery street. It’s facing a busy street so it is the loudest room on the three I tried.It is the 4th of July holiday. I suspect the hotel is mostly booked and I’m getting the worst rooms that are left. Either way, stay here if loud rooms don’t bother you
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So let me start with saying that we really enjoyed the hotel (it can be a true city escape), the amazing location, the little details in the interior and the views from the rooftop bar! But... One thing that is even more important is well trained staff!When we first arrived in the evening around 7pm, we came to the gate and saw a Sister City doorman standing there. He did not greet us and did not even smile. That was our first impression in our full week stay. We saw that same guy several times and he never said hello and kept on looking almost angry. Those type of people should not stand at the door! His other colleagues were much nicer! Especially the lady who greets everyone really enthusiastic :).The check in was not difficult but nobody took the initiative to help us out. Tip: even if you see people are busy, greet them and offer them your help. The night before we stayed in Citizenm, so it was quite a difference from what we experienced there. During the week we had some issues but the office manager was really helpful! And roomservice was also really nice and they cleaned our room very well! The only thing I was really missing was a tea and coffee machine in the room. And what I think is not hospitality minded is to charge your hotelguest 3 dollars for only hot water that also tastes like coffee. When I said something about it, I got a new one but the person who helped me made me feel a bit like I said too much.Despite the somewhat inexperienced staff, I loved the vibe, seeing like minded guests and the fantastic location! It's still up and coming, but you can have a great walk from the hotel to Broadway and enjoy NYC to the fullest. So yeah, I would come back. And hope that everyone learned a lot in their first year.. Good luck!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed only two nights, but we wished we should had stayed longer. What a Gem in NYC. Excellent services, we took a red eye flight and arrived at hotel at 9 am. Surprisingly they gave us an early check-in. That helped a lot exploring the city after a great shower. The views were superb as we got upgraded to terrace room. I have been telling friends how wonderful the Sister City hotel was. I hope they keep the price low so many of us can afford the stays in NYC. Exceptional hotel with exceptional price. We will stay here every time we come to NYC.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're on-the-go but need a place to stay, Sister City is perfect. The hotel is minimally designed with understated elegance. The food and drinks are special and delicious. The experience from check in to check out is seamless. This is not for those looking for excessive indulgences but you're into mindful design, inspiring spaces, and low impact living this place is perfect.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: King bed was comfy, and the room was clean. The room is spartan, but it had everything we needed for a one night stay. We did not have luggage given the short stay, it would have legit been difficult to fit a large suitcase in the room, so pack accordingly. As others have mentioned, the roof bar was one of the amenities that drew us to book at this hotel, but it was very crowded, some kind of priority for guests would go a long way to happier guests.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would not recommend staying here for at least another year. They really need to get their act together. I'm writing this from a Sister City room. It's a nice room (except for the random bug we had to slay, which is odd but okay for the 6th floor) done up in European sparse style.This is one of those no people places, which is fine... except when we tried to check in and the computer told us no rooms were available for out pre-booked reservation. It took awhile of sitting and waiting for a room to be cleaned (? It was 4:30 and checkin was at 3?) to eventually get a room, which cost us time in the city.One of the big draws for my wife booking the room was the roof deck, which was corwded, noisy (DJ playing), and full of people not staying at the hotel. It is a great view (+1 star), but it takes 15 minutes to get a drink ($12 can of IPA). The bartenders seem harried, so I will forgive them being a bit jerky, but we're paying to stay here, so...? My wife gave up and went back to our room.Meanwhile, the downstairs bar is closed with no notice or reason why.The room itself is fine. Big bed but cramped layout. I guess the sink next to the TV is a European thing? It works until it doesn't, I guess.Sister City needs to figure out what their deal is. Hopefully they will do so - they have all summer.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a peaceful oasis. Simple, sleek, clean, and great common spaces. My cousin and I had a lovely stay in the bunk room. Mattresses were comfortable and though the space is small it never felt cramped. We will definitely be back again! Thank you!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I know for most of the people all rooms are not big enough, for me was perfect. I like your clean, spartan style, to be honest I had everything I need. Bed was super comfortable plus big shower. I was impressed by the staff: kind in and way, professional and available all the time. All hotel is super clean, no stinky experience etc.Nice to have a Roof Top Bar, maybe could be nice, as a guest of this hotel, have a priority access. I'll definitely be back. Location is ok, literally 5 mins waling from Spring St, Prince St or Bower Station, close to Soho. Nice to have a local Whole Foods.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved everything about Sister City! Sustainable, thoughtfully designed, friendly staff, great location. We will definitely return! The best micro hotel in the city. The rooftop is a great place to enjoy a cocktail. The beds are extremely comfortable. The perfect NYC spot to lay your head.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yo did it perfect. The staff is amazing, helpfully and incredible Polite. The hotel is 100% comfortable, cozy and the rooftop is amazing. At first the neighbourhood was a little strange but after a while we can live in a bohemian and artistic neighbourhood.Thank you for all !!!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t say enough to commend this hotel and it’s staff, they are simply phenomenal!Firstly the ambiance and decor are stunning, in the lobby, restaurant, elevators, garden area, roof top bar. The Blonde woods are light bright and airy. The rooms are so efficient and clean with the blonde wood flooring. Everything gleams with newness and cleanliness. While our room wasn’t large it was so well designed that it mattered not. The bed and bedding were so fresh and comfortable. The staff are the best I have ever encountered. No question or request is ignored. A feeling of calmness is so appreciated after the streets of NYC.The location is steps from everything. The best cocktail I ever had was a jalapeño peach margarita from the roof top deck while enjoying the stunning views in all directions. I am a travel professional and I will not hesitate to recommend Sister City to everyone.Well done Sister City!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night at SisterCity in NYC. We loved it. The price was amazingly reasonable. The location in the Bowery is hip (Next to the new museum). Check-in was a breeze. You make your own key but there’s a person there to assist. The rooms are typical nyc sized but the windows are huge and there’s tons of light. We had a balcony room without asking . The rooms are simple but so comfortable and inviting. There’s everything you need and nothing you don’t. Showers are big with big shampoo bottles. Hallways are clean and fresh and lite . The 11th floor has a great inside/outside bar with lots of seating and views all over Manhattan, don’t miss it! We had continental breakfast downstairs in the new restaurant (floret). Still not completely open (June 1?). We visited friends at the four seasons hotel and liked our SisterCity room better. 5 stars!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a wonderful stay at Sister City! The hotel was an oasis from a long day of meetings and appointments. Also, the rooftop bar is a must! I will be back for all future business trips in NYC.Thank you again Sister City for the tremendous experience!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfectly located in the central of downtown new year amongst the best restaurants and shops. We never had to take a cab due to the ideal location. Rooms are super clean and cute as well as modern. I certainly recommend this place. Also great bar food upstairs at rooftop bar
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three nights for $600 (including taxes) for a top hotel in New York was a steal. Better still, it's in Soho and a very short walk ( less than ten minutes) away from LES and the Village. I arrived only to be presented with a piece of kit to make your own room key, which was rather fun and meant you completed avoided those queues to check in just when you want to be unpacking. The rooms are a little on the small size and lack wardrobe space, which will be fine if you are staying less than a week. The bed was incredibly comfortable and, as the hotel is relatively new, had brand new furniture and TV. They also give you a chunky blu-tooth speaker to have during your stay. I never eat in hotel restaurants and, during my stay, never saw anyone eat in theirs (perhaps because it looked awful) but not a problem given there are so many restaurants on the hotel's doorstep. The staff were the friendliest I have ever come across in any hotel. The million dollar question: would I stay there again? "Absolutely provided that the room rates remain sensible and I am not staying more than a few days (when I would need wardrobe space)"
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking for a great hotel to base yourself out of while you explore, then this one is perfect. Clean and tidy rooms, great location with a train station under 10 minutes walk away and an amazing rooftop bar looking towards the city.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay was really nice. The room itself is comfortable and efficiently laid out. There are nice touches like the portable speaker, the built in storage space under the bed, and the shower head straight above. I liked the natural wood furnishings, accents and floors, neutral and calming. Most importantly, the staff is friendly and approachable, everyone of them I ran into, left a good impression. Also the location is great, it's so central to downtown Manhattan, close to restaurants, LES, Soho, Nolita, and true a slice of the Bowery, it's history and current evolution, so many small art galleries to pop into. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Sister City NYC was interesting. If you don't need a closet, drawers or info on how to operate anything in the room you will like this place. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable however our room was the floor above the bar so it wasn't really quiet. There were no chairs on our large balcony to sit and enjoy a drink to enjoy the city lights. Our view was very nice. We did request chairs but the ones delivered were the same from the yet to open restaurant. I dont think this hotel has been completed yet. All that being said, I would stay there again for a short stay. The people who work there were helpful and nice.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at the Sister City Hotel was absolutely great, the room was clean and cosy, the continental breakfast was delicious, the views from the roof top was spectacular and the location is unbeatable. Thank you for the stay
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was amazing. Everyone was so patient with us and the breakfast tasted great. This hotel made our stay to New York worthwhile. We only wish our room had toothpaste, as we forgot to bring some, but everything was great.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sister City team, we cannot thank you enough for an absolutely incredible stay. The whole experience was perfect and the staff you have working there are divine. Some of the nicest, most helpful and courteous people. The room itself is stunning and so clean, while the breakfast each morning just set us up for the day and was delicious! Thank you thank you! I’ll be singing your praises for a long time and can’t wait to come back! Also, the rooftop bar is insane and probably some of the best views you’ll get in Manhattan as well as having beautiful cocktails and the best ceviche I’ve ever, ever had! Well done guys!Alex
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great stay. The design is beautiful, and service was great. I would definitely recommend this place to others. It’s best suited for people who fancy themselves minimalists, but I think anyone would have a good time there. Looking forward to the restaurant being done.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Elegant simple and modern design with exceptional service. The minute you walk in you will realize that there is something different and quite special about this place. From the comforting music to the eclectic minimalist design elements, right down to the one of a kind artistic alley entrance, this hotel stands out.I was lucky enough to stay on the week the rooftop bar opened on the 11th floor and I couldn't wait to invite my friends up. The view is outstanding and ambiance is perfect for a chill drink with friends, not to mention the service was fantastic.Though some may be thrown off by some of the minimalist design elements, the room is so comfortable that Im sure most wont even miss half of the things they thought they needed in a hotel room.If you're looking for a simple, elegant, modern, perfect location, then there is nowhere else you should be staying in LES. Looking forward to my next stay!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sister City is a beautiful and well executed extension of the Ace brand. The room product is filled with all the interesting amenities and details, the staff was understated and helpful and the complimentary breakfast was a sweet touch. My new hotel whenever visiting the city.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely quirky new hotel, just wish the WiFi had worked in our bedroom - the roof top bar, which opened in our first night there was amazing. The complimentary bareakfast was great and check in and check out was seamless
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved my stay here! The rooms are so cute; staff was kind; they offered free coffee and breakfast, and the rooftop bar is absolutely beautiful! The midcentury modern feel is so fun, and you can't beat the neighborhood! I can't wait to come back!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ace hotel did a superb job with the renovation of this building. It is modern and tiny but equipped with all the necessities. Inspired by minimalist such as Japanese Marie Kondo, less is better and with all the basic essentials. Each room has an en suite bathroom with a tinted glass shower (not great if you're sharing room with someone), seperate sink, window view & a comfortable bed/bedding. Though there isn't a lot of room for storage, it has a pull out desk with hidden TV on the wall, a retractable hanger/shelf for clothes, under bed safe, and even a B&O portable speaker. Housekeeping was friendly, use your magnet door to let them know if you need to sleep in or ready for cleaning. Breakfast staff is superb and the granola is one of the best I've ever had! The self check in process was cool but didn't work well so a staff had to help me get my key cards. There is always a 24 hour security which is helpful because at night it is dark and hard to locate the building since signage is minimal. I do wish the sink water allows for adjustable temperature and I would recommend the hotel to offer ear plugs, slippers, a bigger box of tissue paper in the room, toiletries such as disposable razor/toothbrush/etc, or a possible fridge & better communication (wasn't able to reach a staff prior to my reservation). Overall, I enjoyed my four nights stay and plan to become a regular customer especially at your member rates. The location was very convenient with Whole Foods at the corner, few blocks away from Chinatown/Little Italy, subway station nearby, lots of good eateries in walking distance such as Katz & Russ and Daughters.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you for a wonderful stay! I really enjoyed my big room with amazing view over the city. The bed was comfortable and everything was so clean and new (duh!). And the location couldn’t be any better actually. Next time I’m going stay for longer and hope I get the same room (810) because I really fell in love with it. The only thing I was missing was a fridge! You know especially if you’re visiting in the spring/summer you want to be able to store cool drinks and stuff. Also looking forward to eat at the restaurant the next time (it wasn’t open when I was there). Thank you again and I hope to see you again soon! Love/Malin
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sister City is in the perfect location for any NYC travel plans. The rooms are really functional and quiet. Beautiful view of the New Museum from my room, but also from the bar "Last Light" on the 11th floor. Definitely will stay here again!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great experience! The room was small but totally functional and remarkably quiet. The breakfast bar was nice, and the staff was helpful throughout our stay. We enjoyed sitting on the rooftop even though the bar wasn't finished yet. I would have appreciated having a top sheet to go with the comforter on the bed. We had one elevator mishap, and there was some construction noise mid-day. Other than that, we were totally satisfied. It will be fun to see the place once it's in full swing!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: That was the slogan the woman who helped me check in mentioned when I made a remark about how I much I'd enjoyed my previous stay. I've have the good fortune of sleeping here twice, and both times it was perfect. The inspiration may lean Japanese, but having spent a lot of time in Scandinavia I see a lot of that in it too. Specifically Norwegian, with its nods to natural materials, woods, and earth tones. The first night I stayed was in a bunk room. The beds are Fulls, and can easily fit two people up, two down. Not sure if that's allowed, and it would be tight in the small room, but close friends on a budget take note if you are planning a trip to NYC and don't mind a slumber party. The room is split, with the bunk bed in one, and a small lounge area in the other. The Queen room has a different, simpler layout: one room, one bathroom. Bathrooms are a good size with a really nice shower. Worth noting is the towels are super good. The fixtures are nice throughout. No detail has been missed. The on-a-budget design nerds will love it. The Lower East Side is right outside your door, so eating, walking, good coffee, are not a problem. Whole Foods is on the block, and the subway is minutes away. Best of all, the classic food places (Yonah Schimmel, Katz's, Russ & Daughters), Chinatown, and East Village are all very close - just a quick walk. You won't be starved for good food. Right next to the New Museum, and NoLIta shopping. Brooklyn is easily accessible as well. It's almost impossibly perfectly placed in the city. The staff was friendly, and the DIY check in/out process is pretty cool. When you consider places with a similar MO, that aren't nearly as nice, like The Pod, have gone way up in price, and aren't as conveniently located, this hotel is a no brainer. It's clear The Ace was involved in this project but Sister City is less of a place to hang out and be seen, and more of a launch pad for a great city.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is overall very pleasant to stay. It does not appear to me inexpensive accommodation. It looks well made hotel and friendly. Sound proofing can be improved from hallway, but it does not really bothered me. Location is pretty center of party place, and public transportation is closed enough. I will consider return for sure!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another great hotel by ACE. The staff is super friendly and helpful which is always welcome when you are in NYC. The hotel is in the perfect location in the center of everything. The lobby and rooms are comfortable warm and welcoming with well appointed amenities, wood floors, and a great shower. While the rooms are smaller they are extremely functional using every square inch of space to ensure you are comfortable and all of your needs are met. the beds are AMAZING. I ended up extending my stay and making reservations for my net trip to the city. They are still in the process of opening and i am excited to see the rooftop bar and restaurant come online in the next few weeks. Well worth checking Sister City out
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this little spot. Honestly, the price was amazing. The room was bigger than I expected, but I loved that were was space for all my suitcases to be out and open without being in the way. The heat worked quickly. The shower was cozy. I enjoyed the breakfast in the AM. I made friends in the lobby. My friend stayed one night and his complaint was that the sheets were “scratchy” But I didn’t notice. I will be back! Can’t wait for the rooftop and the restaurant!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sister City is from this point forward my new "go to" when staying in New York. Absolutely beautiful space, amazingly friendly and helpful staff, and the location can't be beat. So happy I stumbled upon Sister City (before it even officially opens) and I look forward to many future stays. Can't wait for the restaurant, etc. to be open.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great time staying a night at this hotel. I thought the concept pretty cool, the rooms had exactly what I need in a hotel room without all the extra things. I personally like the minimalism and clean look. The rooms were small but cozy and didn’t waste any space. I like how they are unique than other typical hotels.Nice lobby, and the hotel is well located. We didn’t have a car or anything and walked everywhere in the city and had great nearby food spots for when we were hungry in the middle of the night.The staff was also super helpful and friendly! So I have nothing to complain about at all.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sister City is just what you need for a trip to NYC. Located between SoHo and LES leaves you in walking distance to some of the best restaurants and shopping areas that NYC has to offer. The rooms are very minimalistic and extremely cozy (the beds are super comfortable!). Overall great stay. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a lovely staycation at Sister City! The staff was very friendly and the room was perfect and so cozy. The location is great and convenient too! I highly recommend this fantastic, brand new hotel!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great stay, Very simplistic. We had a nice view next to our bed. Nice, quiet, clean & affordable. Will definitely come back when the restaurant and rooftop bar open up!Thanks, Sister City!..
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sister City is built for the minimalist traveler. Perfect for first time New York visitors. Located in the true heart of the city. Surrounded by the best food, bars and shopping the city has to offer. Also, serves as a great place for buddy travel. Highly Recommend
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was perfect - great design and thoughtful details, comfortable and stylish but not fussy, friendly atmosphere, in the middle of everything right next to the New Museum - all you need for a real NYC experience
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sister City was a the perfect spot for my recent girl's trip. The hotel was so cute and our rooms were cozy. The hotel location is extremely convenient. It's steps to some of the best spots in the city (in my opinion!). I can't wait to go back!
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in the best part of NYC. It's steps from Soho, the East Village and Little Italy. The view from my room was INCREDIBLE. The staff was so kind, welcoming and knowledgeable. Self check in/out was very simple. The room itself was perfect - a very minimalist feel but with heightened amenities. The bed was incredibly cozy and the shower was great. I love the details like the branded hangers, bluetooth speakers and distilled water. Plus, the complimentary breakfast in the morning was fantastic! I would highly recommend this hotel to people visiting New York. I will most definitely be back.
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thought the hotel was adorable. Really spoke to the minimalist in me. Beautifully decorated. I wasn't wild about the smell of the shampoo and the small box of 4 tissues, but that is something I could look past and will just bring my own next time or ask for extra tissues if needed. Would absolutely stay again. The bed was very comfortable, I slept like so well and my room was very quiet. Everything was very clean.The check in/check out staff and housekeeping was very kind and smiley.Loved it overall, congratulations! I will definitely be back! Best,Dayna
hotelName:
15    Sister City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here a few times. Lovely staff, lovely location, great hotel overall. Nice breakfast in the morning, nice evening Prosecco and cheese reception Room was cool, overlooking Park Avenue but not really so noisy as to be a problem.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After Marriott gutted and ruined the Algonquin, our tried and true hotel since we left NYC many years ago, we tried Hotel Giraffe in 2017 on a visit back home for our 20th Anniversary.Two years on it is still one of the best hotels we've experienced in the US or Europe. The staff is still extraordinarily friendly and helpful, starting with a late check-in after a late flight in from the West Coast and ending with an on-time car service to get to the airport 6 days later. The suites are still beautifully furnished, well appointed and impeccably maintained. And the breakfast is, for "continental", still wonderful and surprisingly diverse with a variety of choices - the best part being Gabriela, the lead staff person at breakfast (and also the evening wine and cheese reception which we didn't have time to take advantage of this trip), who not only remembered us from two years ago and greeted us warmly but also actually remembered our beverage and food choices correctly and made them magically appear in minutes. How, after thousands of guests in the interim she was able to do that is a mystery, but it reflects the care and attention to detail that every staff member showed during our stay.The location is walking distance to a wide range of shopping, theater and activities, and if you hop on the train around the corner in Madison Square (lots of overlapping and connecting lines) you can get practically anywhere in Manhattan in half an hour.I am delighted to see Hotel Giraffe is still TripAdvisor's #1 ranked hotel in NYC (it was two years ago which is why we chose it) - it is a distinction that is well deserved.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay at the Giraffe whenever we can. The accommodations are always wonderful. The staff is polite and welcoming. Breakfast in the morning with a wide array of choices. Wine and cheese at night. A perfect getaway. The location is two blocks from the subway which made it very close to all. Love coming here.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really great experience in NYC. Hotel and room exceeded expectations and were even better than the photo’s. The included breakfast was plentiful and the staff was very gracious. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and suited our purposes perfectly. My only criticism is that the bathroom door does not provide the privacy I prefer since the glasses is see-thru, but other than that I found the accommodations, service, lobby, etc. to be perfect.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel. Great service and amazing value for the money. I was traveling with the family and the rooms with two beds were large and accommodating. They have breakfast every morning and an evening happy hour with wine and cheeses. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week and absolutely loved it! Can see why it’s ranked #1 of hotels in NYC on Trip Advisor. All the staff are so friendly and helpful. The room itself was nice and spacious. Loved the rooftop garden, you can go up there just to sit and some days from 5-10pm they have drinks (have to pay as I think it’s linked to the restaurant downstairs/next door?). The complimentary breakfast is from 7-1030 on weekdays and til 11 on the weekend and is a lovely continental breakfast including cereals, fruit, pastries, bagels, toast, boiled eggs and tea/coffee. At other times throughout the day there are biscuits and pastries and tea/coffee out which was lovely to come back to for afternoon tea. Then from 5-8pm there is complimentary wine and cheese, really yum Brie and blue cheese were my favorite! Piano player from 6pm All these additional inclusions were so appreciated. Would definitely recommend staying here!!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice touches from the wine and cheese, staff friendly and helpful, continental breakfast and refreshments all dayThe room and bed very comfortable, would definitely recommend and stay againGreat location ,
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an enjoyable stay @thegiraffe while we were touring the nyc. Especially enjoyed the happy hour wine & cheese with great service from all the staff, very welcoming. Would definitely recommend and stay again. Close to everything & the subway.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I just finished a 3-day getaway to NYC. We stayed in NoMad and enjoyed Hotel Giraffe: very comfortable, clean and beautifully appointed rooms, well-located in walking distance of neighborhoods such as the Flatiron District, Chelsea, Hudson Yards, Greenwich Village and So-Ho. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Nice continental breakfast and great wine and cheese included. Minor negatives: 1) window in the bathroom door: despite textured glass, you can definitely make out if someone is dressed or not. Although not an issue if alone or a couple, not ideal if sharing your room with your teenage son... 2) shower curtain for bath/shower combo: for this category (and price) of hotel, a glass enclosure would have been expected.Overall, a wonderful stay. We would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We returned to the Giraffe after 12 years and still found it the excellent, warm and wonderful place to be as it was that time ago. We often thought back to the hotel in the last years, and were thrilled to be able to return. And we were happy to find this place still as good and perfect as it was and as we remembered it to be.We stayed on a room on the 9th floor with the balcony to 26th street. Although being in NY, we could sleep with open balcony door. Room was absolutely clean, spacious and comfortable, and the housekeeping was extraordinary good –perfect in timing and thinking of everything.Breakfast from 7 to 10:30 am (until 11am on Saturday and Sunday) serves bagels, pastry, cream cheese, butter, eggs, fresh fruit, juice, jam. Pastry, cookies, tea, coffee is provided all day and night in the lobby. Wine & cheese with high quality products is served from 5-8pm every day. Gabriela, who is doing the Wine & Cheese, with her very special friendliness makes you feel welcome and comfortable.We will definitely come back to the hotel when returning to exiting New York –hopefully earlier than in 12 years.Thanks to the Hotel Giraffe and all staff for making our stay great and once again memorable.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Giraffe was a wonderful experience. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff was extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. The location was excellent in NYC, making most experiences walkable for our family. The staff there was always willing to help and go out of their way to make our stay wonderful. Extremely clean room, we even saw the staff cleaning the outside of the room doors and inside the elevator!!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice modern rooms. very clean attentive and professional staff. in walking distance of many sights. hotel offers a breakfast that is included in room rate. sad to say that breakfast is supposed to be available starting at 7 am every day it was not fully stocked till 7:30. why offer it if items are not available??second there is a wine cocktail and cheese hour daily at 5 pm, the red wine is horrible, neither my wife or I could consume it . very bitter aftertaste. so again why offer it if the wine is so bad? the hotel manager should try some, just a suggestion. very nice on property restaurant called Bread and Tulips, we suggest you try .also room attendant was putting queen sheets on a king bed.. was not comfortable.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 4 nights with my daughter’s 21 birthday. The staff are this hotel’s biggest asset. We were warmly welcomed on arrival, and the guys at the front door were always welcoming. The breakfast was perfect for us, and the 24 hour tea/coffee and afternoon wine and cheese are a great bonus. The room was exactly as shown, everything clean and well maintained, and the beds very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I just spent the weekend at Hotel Giraffe. We had a great stay. The prices are reasonable for the City, the rooms are comfortable and we really like the breakfast and wine reception in the lobby each day. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. It turns out that my wife left her wallet in the safe in the room (she didn’t notice it when she emptied the safe). When she called that night, the cleaning staff had found it and turned it in to the front desk. We have stayed at the Hotel Giraffe several times and it remains our go-to hotel in Manhattan.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone is so helpful and friendly. Location is perfect and quiet. The continental breakfast, snacks and beverages are so convenient. We had the deluxe suite and was very spacious and cozy. Beds were comfortable! Thanks for your hospitality!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing as always. We return again and again to the Giraffe because of phenomenal service. The rooms and the location are great as well. But seriously love the employees. There is a nice lobby experience as well with other customers. I feel grateful to have found a home away from home in manhattan. See you again soon!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are magnificent and can’t do enough for you. Special mention for Gabriella who makes everyone feel special. The rooms fittings and fixtures are top notch. We had a balcony room and spent time watching New York from above. I had a bottle of wine and a birthday card waiting for me in my room which was a very nice touch. This hotel is worth every penny and also you have breakfast and wine and cheese in the evening which saves money. Stay here!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Giraffe. We came to NYC for a long weekend with our daughter and her husband. We were looking for a special time and this hotel did not disappoint.The staff was pleasant and always very helpful. The room was lovely and spotlessly clean, the small balcony was a nice addition. The Library hotels always seem to be a quiet space in the busy city. The only negative I can think of, is the evening wine and cheese and breakfast served in the lobby. We have stayed at he Elysee, in the Library collection and I felt that the food choices were better and more varied, especially at the evening wine and cheese serving. Also a separate living room type area, similar to the Elysee would be nice.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we had a wonderful experience here, the room was gorgeous, balcony and all, and the staff was incredible, can not recommend it highly enough. they gave us a free bottle of chilled prosecco on checking in for no reason other than to be nice.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mid-town Manhattan has literally hundreds of hotels, and many of them are truly great. They are also truly expensive. Then there are the many that are quite good, especially for the money, but suffer from the common failing of the rooms being so small you have to step into the hall to change your mind. Hotel Giraffe is doing a pretty fine job of trying to thread the difficult needle of offering good-sized, comfortable rooms, a solid complimentary "Continental" buffet breakfast, personalized service, and a terrific location - all for a decent price for the area. A real standout is Jason, one of the regular doormen. I hope the Library Hotel Collection management realizes what a gem this guy is; he has the perfect personality for the job: warm, welcoming, and a genuine eagerness to share useful advice to any guest asking for it. I'm also going to salute the gals who handle the breakfast every day as well as the free three-hour wine & cheese evening "happy hour"; they work hard to make it go as smoothly as possible, and after a couple days they will probably remember your coffee orders! You can't get that kind of personalized treatment at the big, corporate hotels.With our recent visit we had a standard room with a queen bed - nothing special, really. What we got was a more spacious room than we expected - there was even room for an armchair with ottoman. There were French doors onto a shallow balcony, a wide countertop to spread out small items, a good-sized full bath with a very spacious amount of counter space along with even more space on a shallow glass shelf running the full width of the counter, a large closet with proper wood hangers that aren't locked in, plenty of drawers for unpacking, a large Sony TV, a super-quiet fridge hiding in a cabinet, really quiet A/C with a thermostat that's actually easy to understand (and that's accurate), and quite surprisingly, a motorized blackout curtain for those French doors. Oh, and the showerhead is wonderful, and the controller actually lets you control temperature and volume independently (a real rarity these days).Did I say the location is terrific? Yes, and here's why: it's right on the 4,5,&6 subway lines, which run the length of the east side of Manhattan (and beyond to both Brooklyn and the Bronx); the hotel is just 2 short blocks to one station and 3 blocks to another in the other direction; from the closest station (at 28th St) it's a short ride to Grand Central Station, where you can connect to the cross-town lines that connect to the Westside lines. Note also that Park Avenue has a zillion cabs cruising it all day and night. One of NYC's top jazz clubs (Jazz Standard) is just around the corner, and Upland and Sarabeth's, two truly fine restaurants, are just a few steps away. Bread & Tulips, the Italian restaurant in the basement, is a somewhat undiscovered gem, and when the weather's good it also runs a rooftop bar (12th floor). The Mexican restaurant right next door does a huge business, and it should, because it's outstanding (and we're from Los Angeles, where every other restaurant offers Mexican or Central American cuisine, so we know a thing or two about this topic). Ethnic joints abound just a block east, and just a few blocks south gets you to the Flatiron District and Greenwich Village, where fine eateries are found in nearly every block. None of NYC's famous museums, landmarks, or major parks are very far by public transport, Madison Park & Times Square are just short walks, even the Theater District is not too far, and Battery Park, where the ferry to the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island departs, is a short subway ride.About my only quibble with what we found on our recent visit was that the room provided just one USB charging port (as part of a clock radio with an iPod docking station), and that port provided so little current that charging goes slowly. (Are you listening Library Hotel Collection management?) There was also just one duplex outlet in the bathroom, and being positioned at the rather far left of the counter, only made sense for folks who are left-handed. But these are small quibbles. Remember to bring enough chargers for all your devices and you'll be fine. And give our regards to Jason.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from our stay in New York, married couple, sixty-years-old, four nights in a suite at Hotel Giraffe, and both remarked how much we enjoyed our stay. The room size was ample to lounge and enjoy personal space while the other dressed. Initially, I feared the noise from Park Avenue, but found it not to be a problem. Also, I was less happy about going downstairs to get coffee and a continental breakfast, but found the staff to be super attentive and fast. Further, I was able to enjoy good strong latte with an added shot of espresso and a yummy toasted bagel, fruit, and meet some nice and interesting guests. The location is terrific and very conducive to exploring all parts of New York. Viva Le Giraffe!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New York City hotel accommodation is not cheap. And midtown NYC is not usually at the top of the list of districts for accomodation. But the Hotel Giraffe struck the right balance between location, value for money and great service. The subway is just a few minutes walk away, there are a good number of restaurants closeby (including the pricey but delicious Hillstone restaurant just across the hotel on Park Avenue South). The staff were unfailingly friendly and the evening drinks and nibbles were just the thing after a day of sightseeing.Our room at the hotel was modest in size but the bed was very comfortable. The air con worked a treat so there will be no worries if you are staying here in the middle of summer.Hotel Giraffe deserves the great reviews it gets on Tripadvisor.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel i well situated, rooms are clean and every night Gabrielle serves you complimentary wine and cheese-always with a smile. I would stay there again without hesitation.Checkout wasn't until 1pm which was an added bonus
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, well located for all Manhattan attractionsRooms well sized and comfortable Evening complimentary wine and cheese along with continental breakfast were great additions to an enjoyable stayA true ‘home away from home’ in Manhattan Staff were friendly and always responsive.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelled with our 11 year old daughter and stayed in a Balcony King Suite, which was a reasonable size for the 3 of us as we had the sofa bed in a separate sitting area to the bedroom and a decent sized bathroom in between. Continental breakfast was ok and is served on the ground floor by reception. Went a couple of doors up to Sarabeth’s one day for a “full on” breakfast, which was great if not a little expensive. The hotel actually has an arrangement with Sarabeth’s for delivery of breakfast to the hotel, if you want a bit more than the continental breakfast. It is pricey though.Very good location on East 26th and Park Avenue. A 15 minute walk to Empire State and the nearest Open Top Bus Tour Collection Points. Good jazz bar just around the corner on East 27th, called Jazz Standard (be sure to book in advance).Cheese and wine served free of charge each evening (from 5pm I think) which was a nice touch.Would recommend.Fairly reasonable price for NYC in a suite.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fantastic hotel in so many ways! Hospitality, cleanliness, helpfulness if staff, welcome, spacious rooms, convenient location - if you are looking for an outstanding hotel within walking distance of Times Square but away from the noise and bright lights this is your hotel!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked for three nights whilst in NY on holiday. Staff are friendly and efficient. The early evening wine and cheese is a nice touch which gives a buzz about the place. Breakfast is simple but adequate and good service. Rooms are perhaps a little dated, but comfortable and well equipped.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Giraffe!! We were in the city for our son's graduation. We were there with a party of five and every detail was perfect for us. The happy hour each day was a great place to catch up on the days activities. We had the best service from Gabriela! She knew our order and was always there with a fresh drink. The front desk crew was helping us watch for our lost bag which was being delivered by the airline. The breakfast was great too with bottomless fresh coffee, the best fruit and amazing pastries. We are already looking forward to our next stay!! Thank you Hotel Giraffe staff for making our weekend truly memorable.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable, clean and spacious accommodation. Friendly, helpful and responsive staff with particular mention of Gabriella.Very nice continental breakfast served each morning and delightful cheese/wine event each evening. Very easy to use valet service to park car on arrival. Terrific location.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Im writing this while sitting in the lobby of Hotel Giraffe. Our first time to the states and New York and 100% reccomend this hotel to all. Near to madison sq park, its out of the way of the main hussle and bustle of midtown and times sq, etc...and an ideal location for exploring this mad but fantastic city. The staff at the giraffe are so welcoming, it just adds to the chilled atmosphere the hotel offers. Continental breakfast is great with lots to choose from and the complimentary cheese and wine from 5pm till 7pm is superb. A family break to celebrate 18th and 21st birthdays will live long in our memories and staying at such a great hotel was the icing on the cake.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: How have I been travelling to NY for years and not stayed at this hotel until now? I love this place! It is a four star hotel with five star service. Every employee working at this hotel was wonderful, from the doorman to the housekeeping staff and especially Gabriella who works tirelessly to ensure that guests enjoy their breakfast and wine and cheese reception.And speaking of the wine and cheese reception, it is amazing! Three hours every night and it’s free. And they do not skimp on the cheese selection! Breakfast is included as well.The hotel has suites which is very handy if you are travelling with children.Thanks for a wonderful stay, Hotel Giraffe. I cannot wait to return and also try other hotels in this brand.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is superb & ticks all the boxes. Beds comfortable, rooms spacious and quiet, breakfast superb , cheese & wine fantastic Best of all , the staff are all incredible, friendly , efficient, particularly Gabriela who looked after us superbly.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this place for our "bucket list" visit to New York. We'd never been to New York before and this place was both perfectly located and a real treat. From the moment we got there the attention to detail was excellent: it was very clean and tidy (it seemed to us that every time we left the room it was checked and made good). The shining light though was Gabriella in the longue. She worked so hard to make everything just right, not just for us but for all guests: it was very noticeable the morning she wasn't there - 3 people trying to do her job and not coping at all. My only complaint would be the price of the stay.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great breakfast and helpful staff. Very clean and have a nice restaurant on site. Especially enjoyed evening wine and cheese reception. Coffee, fruits and snacks throughout the day made it easy to stay here with my ten year old. Overall great value.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed the room and thought the extra amenities were nice. We had a night cap at the hotel restaurant, which was nice. Their was a drainage issue in both the toilet and shower, but I don’t think that was the fault of the hotel. The reason we gave it 4 instead of 5 stars was because it was very loud, even with a sound machine.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great spot. Excellent, friendly service. Unbelievable breakfast and happy hour. We try to stay here whenever we are in the City. It may seem out of your way, but we found it to offer easy access no matter where we were headed.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Rooms were very comfortable and not nearly as small as I expected for a city hotel. Our room had a sitting area separate from the sleeping area that worked out really well. Staff was friendly and very accommodating.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a king suite for a family visit this past weekend. First time staying at the Giraffe after 2 previous stays at The Library. Everything from booking of the hotel to questions I had prior to my arrival to service while we were there was awesome! Rooms are immaculate and housekeeping staff very accommodating. In fact everyone in the hotel was so welcoming and helpful-front desk, Jose and ladies in the breakfast “room”. Our TV was not working when we returned on Sunday night and although I felt bad calling for help at 10.30 pm, a bellman came up and got it working again. All this was done with a smile! I actually want to visit NYC because of the hotel! Thank you for taking care of us. The Library Hotel chain continues to rock!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice atmosphere in lobby with live piano music during cocktail hour. The rest of the day the music in the lobby was too loud and unnecessary. The lighting in the room was a bit dark especially if you wanted to read.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Giraffe is a lovely, quiet hotel amidst the hustle of NYC. The continental breakfast, wine and cheese offering at night and the relaxing lobby area are all great amenities. We asked for a quiet room, and they delivered. We will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Giraffe was perfect for us. Central location close to Metro. Friendly staff. Lovely room with a very comfortable bed, balcony and kettle to make tea. Excellent breakfast included in the tariff as well as access to a local gym. Complimentary wine and cheese tasting with live piano entertainment (the piano on some days) was an added bonus. A great boutique hotel.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the Giraffe. We had planned a two week trip to NYC with one week at the Giraffe and one week at the Plaza. Our week at the Giraffe was great. The room was quiet and large for NYC. The staff were super friendly and helpful and we loved the breakfast and evening wine and cheese. After our week at the Giraffe, the Plaza was such a disappointment we checked out early and returned to Giraffe to finish our trip. Our three-year old loved Sam the doorman.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed at this girl several times now. The staff makes sure that every need is met in a friendly, cheerful manner. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Love the wine and cheese in the evening after a day of business and how they remember you from previous trips. My 2nd home in New York.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a short 30 minutes cab ride from LaGuardia airport (around $50 USD)Right on Park Avenue South near many restaurants.Walking distance to anything you need.Small hotel but decent size room.Clean and well kept.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the Hotel Giraffe many times over the years. The staff - at both the front desk and in the breakfast room - is always welcoming and kind. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the beds are very comfortable with good quality sheets and pillows. The lobby breakfast area is large and so cheerful, with good coffee and continental breakfast and the NY Times. A great place to pass some time in the morning. I have stayed at many NY hotels -- some very flashy and edgy -- but this is my favorite place, because of it's calm, organized, relaxed, solid service and comfortable rooms.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a quaint boutique hotel with small rooms and a small bathroom lacking a stall shower. The bagel breakfast is OK as is the fruit that is available in the lobby. The staff is polite. The problem is that the windows have no sound protection and the hotel faces busy Park Avenue South. Expect to be wakened at 5:30 AM with loud truck noises. Why don’t they soundproof the windows?
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Four of us recently had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Giraffee in NYC, and we had an excellent experience. From the minute we walked in from the rain, the staff met or exceeded our expectations and did so with warm smiles and conversation. The first floor longue provided a nice spot for afternoon coffee and biscuits, and the pianist the first evening provided a wonderful soothing vibe. The wine and chesse evenings, hosted by Gabriella, were lovely. Service was top notch and as soon as we were thinking we might want some more wine or snacks, she was one step ahead of us and there to offer drinks. The staff at the breakfasts were equally attentive (although breakfast was more crowded), and the front desk and housekeeping staff were exceptionally pleasant as well. The small property felt intimate, and the 12th floor outdoor lounge was a great place to unwind. Overall, this resort made our hotel time in NYC feel comfortable and inviting. We will definitely stay there again the next time we visit NYC, and would highly recommend it for those who like a boutique hotel experience.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mom, sister, and I stayed here recently for my sister's 30th birthday and we had a truly marvelous time. We got a king suite with a sitting room and a pullout couch. The king bed was very comfortable, as was the pullout couch, but my mom said her pillow felt like a rock all night. There was a bottle of sparkling white wine waiting for us in our room when we arrived and my sister was truly touched by this gesture. I did notice it was the same wine that they gave away for free during wine and cheese hours, but it was still a nice touch to have it in our room. We also went down for wine and cheese and the bartender was amazing: a lovely spirit and great attitude. There were some cookies left over that were sitting behind the bar and when I asked about them she allowed me to help myself. We also had a lovely dinner at Bread & Tulips (where we used our 20% discount card from the hotel). Although I didn't think the food there was anything too amazing, our waitress was lovely and we had a fun time. We also had an early dinner reservation and therefore got an awesome table. The continental breakfast was what you might expect: cereal, hard boiled eggs, bagels, pastries, fruit, coffee, and tea, but the lobby is quite a nice place to be (lots of windows and comfy chairs and newspapers) so we enjoyed that very much as well. The staff even set out a small table and three chairs for us because there was nowhere to sit when we arrived. Overall, we had a marvelous stay and would definitely recommend the Hotel Giraffe to friends.
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Third time in this cosy hotel, perfectly located. Nice breakfast and very successful idea of having “aperitivo” hours in late afternoon!Very kind and organised staff and comfortable rooms!!! Hope to come back soon
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was lucky enough to discover the Hotel Giraffe on my second trip to New York City (the first was spent in a glorified closet someone considered a hotel room), and it’s been my hotel if choice ever since. The rooms are lovely and decently sized, the staff is fantastic, and the location is great (and very close to several subway stops).
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so lucky to receive a room upgrade; the king suite is a beautiful room with fabulous views.The staff is very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was included and we chose to have it in our room.. the portions are very generous and it was delicious. We also enjoyed the wine and cheese on offer from 5-8pm. I will definitely go back at the next opportunity
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing experience staying with Hotel Giraffe. From start to finish everything was smooth, friendly and comfortableGaby who is on the front desk is a superstar - from the time of booking, arrange airport transport and even making a few arrangements such as wine in the room for our anniversary Lovely location hotel, rooms, with the added bonus of breakfast and evening cheese/wineThe hotels roof garden is a welcome, quiet relaxing spaceCan’t wait to go back
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here while taking my daughter on college tours. It was close enough to NYU to walk and a quick cab ride to Fordham. She wanted to shop and we easily covered a lot of the top shopping locations, and then came back to a relaxing living room for cheese and crackers and drinks. The complimentary breakfast was also a great help, allowing us to grab something quickly before heading out to appointments. The staff was incredibly friendly and our room was spacious and lovely. Thank you to the fantastic staff at the Hotel Giraffe. We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
16    Hotel Giraffe by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this modern boutique style hotel for the weekend. The staff was friendly and professional. We were enjoying the amazing view and had tasty cocktails in the hot tub situated at the rooftop terrace. The rooms were large and clean. They offer wonderful healthy breakfast selection. The prices are affordable.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had such a great stay at the Cassa hotel and it was all because of Jessica. She was honestly the sweetest most kindest person I’ve encountered at the Cassa Hotel. Me and my husband were staying to celebrate his birthday, and she was so kind as to bring us up a bottle of champagne on behalf of the hotel. This is not my first time visiting this hotel nor my first time seeing Jessica, and I will definitely come back and hope to see her again! Employees like Jessica are what make the experience amazing.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Cassa was absolutely the best we could have ever asked for. The owner and the woman at the front desk were great and so friendly. They sent us a complimentary bottle of wine. We felt so welcome. But the highlight of our stay was Michael (5stars), he was so warm and welcoming. Came all the way upstairs to open our bottle and sent up bottles of water. We felt so comfortable with him it was amazing. I wish all hotels and the WORLD was filled with Micheals! ❤️
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Standard corner suite unit in a great location walkable to Hudson Yards. Room is very clean, spacious and has two bathrooms, one in the living room, and one inside of the bedroom. You can get complementary water from the front desk. Overall, it was a pretty good stay.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel to NYC for business at least once a year, and I will be staying here from now on! The staff was so very friendly and helpful, in a meaningful and genuine way—not in a mandatory-corporate-script kind of way. Finding a quiet place like this close enough to everything I needed, but still so very chill was a dream come true. My co-worker and I soon realized that the wine/champagne happy hour was the perfect end to our long days at the convention center, and the bonus of popping up to the rooftop for some fresh air and relaxation was a lifesaver. The design of the rooms is modern and clean — I personally am not a fan of carpet, so the floors were a lovely detail for me! Extra credit points awarded for an in-room window that OPENS. (Just a few inches, but it OPENS!!) The toiletries? Delightful! I usually skip these, but found myself searching online for “Sea Lettuce” shampoo after I came home! Breakfast in the morning was easy and such a wonderful thing to not have to worry about venturing out to find before getting the day started—just popped downstairs and had plenty of options. SIDE NOTE: The elevators are so quick! At some larger properties you find yourself waiting in the lobby or on your floor longer than you would think for an elevator—but not here. Word to the wise: They cannot currently store luggage—however, the staff provides us with clear, concise info on the nearest storage place where we were able to pop by and drop off our bags for a small fee so we could head to the park for a while before we had to leave town. I could not have been more thrilled with our stay, and I can’t wait to go back!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I had a wonderful stay at Cassa. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful, we had absolutely no complaints about the service! We felt really welcomed and looked after and every question we had was answered.The roof terrace is beautiful in the afternoon sun and it’s lovely to order food in and eat up there! Great views too.Location cannot be faulted, minutes from Port Authority, and very close to Times Square and the theatre district. Plenty of good places to eat around too! We booked a room with 2 double beds and the beds felt very small for doubles - two adults in a bed was a tight squeeze. They were very comfortable though!! The shower had amazing water pressure and the towels were soft! Breakfast could be improved with a little more variety, but the quality of the food can’t be faulted, it was well cooked and tasty. I’d recommend this hotel any day!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a king suite to have a desk for work and when we received our room, it was a standard room. The staff explained that “some king suites don’t have desks because of the columns in the building”. After insisting, we were moved to a new room with a bit more space but definitely not king suite standard. The rooms are also dark and have poor views. The hotel is only 3 floor of this high rise. Breakfast is also a joke. Albeit it’s free, but it’s very cheap and located in the basement floor. It felt like we were eating at an airport. Don’t be fooled by their pictures or the other reviews, there are better hotels for your money in NYC. Also, a ton of hidden fees in our final bill. At least $75 additional per day in 4 or 5 different taxes. I will be complaining to the Better Business Bureau and the City about this. I’ve never seen such charges itemized like this and charged to the client. It’s completely fraudulent and double taxation.The staff were nice and tried their best to accommodate. It’s not their fault. But I am extremely disappointing and will never stay there again.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cindy at the front desk is really nice! From day one she was super helpful. She helped us to checkout later on our last day. Service was great along with the view on rooftop it was amazing! Will be going back
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this hotel experience made my trip so much better! I have to shout out Michael who was immensely helpful, kind, and funny. He has the graveyard shift so that should speak volumes about his level of service! My cousin has a baby on the way so they also sent desserts, fruits, and water upon check in. Lastly, the rooftop provided a beautiful view of the city, which is great for pictures. Everything from the decor to the cleanliness to the service was top notch and I would definitely come here again!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean and staff were very friendly. They were able to send us to a great Italian restaurant. Rooftop patio was great for vewing downtown NY City both at night and in the daytime. I shared videos of both with friends and family..
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was great. Several points of interest were within a 10-15 minute walk. The hotel always provided cold water for on the go. The staff were always friendly and respectful. The rooftop of the hotel was a cool spot to relax after each day of exploring NY. I rarely spent any money on transportation. I highly recommend this hotel due to the above reasons and some.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk employee, Jessica was on fire tonight! I set back and watched her check two guests before me and I was like, "I can't wait until my turn!" She was professional, consistent with the information given and super personable. She's a "Service Superstar" and one of the reasons I will most DEFINITELY book here again!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the receptionists was very kind and niceThe room is goodThe bed is is goodThe breakfast is goodThe location is OKThe size of the room is OKThere is no place to let the luggages in case of early checkin and after checkout
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I was looking for a hotel, Cassa Times Square had the better price by location for a room with two beds (double or queen). It was relatively easy for me to find a room with a single queen at a better price, but not as easy to find two beds. I thought the two front desk individuals and the housekeeping person I encountered were excellent, even more personable than I have had at larger branded chain hotels in Times Square. It feels like a hotel that is actively trying to be a boutique property, as opposed to an upscale or well known property that rests on brand laurels, I like that.The breakfast was satisfactory and included coffee, scrambled eggs, tater tots, cereals, croissants, muffins, small bagels, and fruit. I think they could have skipped the small croissants and just done white and wheat bread/toast. In the afternoon there was water and sweet iced tea in the lobby area. I did not participate in the happy hour but I did take the wine bottle in my room up to the rooftop terrace. The rooftop terrace has a nice patch of grass which is very useful if you brought a dog.
