In my room, the showers were very quick to dispense hot water in the morning, but in the late afternoon it was taking too long to warm up for me, so I ended up taking a cold shower. The bed is comfortable. The window shade is ok, but if there was a curtain or drapery to cover the edges, you could totally black out the room which is my sleep preference. The parking garage with the entrance on the north side of the hotel building on West 39th Street (a one way street going west) is one where you leave your car with the attendant and they park it for you via an elevator. We parked for about 38 hours and the total was $112 ($94 + Tax). The hotel staff/front desk do not store luggage which was a surprise to me because I am used to leaving luggage with the bellman. They recommended a storage place, Schwartz Luggage Storage, on West 37th Street. We ended up taking our car back from the garage and loading it up with the luggage and re-parking elsewhere because it would have been about the same price since we had so many bags. I imagine this might be an issue for anyone arriving early and wanting to leave their bags somewhere secure and go around NYC before hotel check-in or for anyone checking out but not departing immediately. We went to see a matinee and parking near our theatre ended up costing $64 for ~5-6 hours. I can imagine between the additional time/cost for the original parking garage and the cost for luggage storage, it evened out in the end, and was more convenient our way. Just plan ahead for which you will need to do. If I needed a room with two beds and the price is right, I would stay here again.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like to say I stayed here to celebrate my son 16th birthday and Lucy and Cesar made it extra special. Their customer service was excellent made us feel welcome. I will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted by Diana and immediately offered bottles of water, which was so thoughtful. She accommodated our requests for quiet rooms and gave us directions to Tavola restaurant which is less than a block from the hotel and the food is AMAZING. When we returned we each had bottles of wine waiting in our rooms! My dad forgot his toothbrush so she gave him a complimentary set with toothpaste. I am sitting in my gorgeous and clean room enjoying a wonderful glass of Chardonnay. Definitely highly recommend this hotel it’s right in the heart of the city and for a great price. All the staff are friendly and welcoming. Thank you.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel's website says that this is a luxury 4 Star hotel, when in reality it is a 2 Star hostel. The room was spacious enough but had a wooden floor with no carpet. It had a mottled brown ceiling which reminded me of a nicotine stained ceiling in an old pub. The room was stark with no pictures to brighten up the walls. The carpets in the corridors and lifts were filthy, strewn with bits of rubbish. The lifts were black in colour with low lighting, so were a bit sinister. The breakfast was ok, but you had to eat it with plastic cutlery and disposable paper plates. The last time I stayed in accommodation like this was as a student on a budget 50 years ago. On a positive note, the view from the roof terrace was very good, but the weather too cold to sit out. Did not use the gym but it looked ok.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My niece and I visited New York for to celebrate two special birthdays. Our tickets to Hamilton and our stay at the Cassa Times Square made this a memorable trip. It's hard to find a room in Midtown with two beds, so our room at the Cassa was perfect. The shower was amazing! The rooms are kept very clean (loved the lack of carpet and white bedcovers). The front desk staff was uniformly helpful. The roof deck and included breakfast were bonuses.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After checking out the hotel. They deducted the deposit money plus $250 Called them latter. They said cause there were missing Ipad in the room. First of all. When I checked in no one told me there will be an Ipad in the room. Anyways I got the keys ans appearently i didnt see any Ipad and dont know that the room have an Ipad. I checked and left back home When i spoke to the hotel they told me you should have reported that to us that you didnt see An Ipad in the room,,,, i was how should i report something that i didnt know that it is includs in the room. They were like email our manager. I emaild him. No ansower yet
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jessica worked the desk from check-in to check-out two days later. She was friendly and helpful and made sure we had a ride to the airport. Augustine the housekeeping manager also went above and beyond to introduce himself and ask if we needed anything. Highly recommend this place :)
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service of Cassa Hotel Times Square was fantastic. Jessica, the receptionist, was amazing—kind, accommodating, and incredibly helpful answering all and any questions. In addition to her service, the rest of the staff was also incredible, and the HH and breakfast was delicious. The proximity of the hotel, in addition to affordability, was well worth the stay, and we looking forward to staying in the future!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location was perfect ! The service of the hotel personal was outstanding! Cesar and Diana give us an outstanding service all the time. The hotel facilities were very clean and the room service personal was very amiable.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2nd time I've stayed at the hotel with the family after visiting over 3 years ago.A few changes since, some positive, some not so.Breakfast much better, usual drinks, eggs, pastries, fruit although a little crowded.Free glass of wine between 4pm and 5pm if not out sightseeing.Luggage cannot be left at hotel if checking out but not leaving the city until later.Hot tub on roof not working.Their were a couple of issues but were dealt with really well, a lock not working and a extra towel ordered.It is really close to many sights, easy to access Penn Station and JFK and Newark Airports 1hr max.Lots of restaurants in the area.Would use again.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival I felt welcomed; prime location, wonderful amenities and a quaint, clean room— I really couldn't ask for anything better during my last minute weekend getaway with my family. Thank you Jessy for your great hospitality! Thanks to your help in finding a local church, we are able to go to Sunday Easter service 2 minutes away from the hotel. Will definitely come back again
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am only giving this hotel 2 stars because the property was absolutely beautiful. The room was very clean and the bathroom was beautiful and stocked with premium amenities. I have to take away 3 stars because the service was absolutely horrible and the night staff, Michael was extremely disrespectful and rude to me and my partner. I booked through Hotel Tonight which has a disclaimer that if I were to check in after 2am, I'd have to notify the hotel, so I called and spoke to Lucy who was very sweet and ensured my check in would be smooth and quick. When I arrived at about 3am, I had to wait 15 minutes for Michael to arrive downstairs. When he arrived, he didn't apologize for my wait and was extremely sarcastic and snarky when he addressed me. I told him I booked through Hotel Tonight and he laughed and said he didn't know what that was and that he couldn't check me in because his computer was running a night audit and was unsure when I would be able to get my room. When I told him I spoke to Lucy, he brushed me off and completely ignored me. We waited another 30 minutes for him to check us in, and only when I was visibly upset did he offer me water. I also had a friend who wanted to wait for her car with us and Michael claimed that if I wanted her to come to my room I'd have to pay a third person charge. When I explained that she wasn't staying he told me he wouldn't charge me and charged me anyway and said that we called for a roll away bed which was a lie (and the hotel manger refunded). Again, the hotel was beautiful and the manager Ronny was extremely helpful after my horrible experience. Its sad that they had such a rude person represent them.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Satisfied senior couple from FinlandReally good location in the heart of New York City, close to everythingBreakfast was good enoughStaff was kind and helpfulSpecial thanks to Manuel, he gave us several good tips where to go and made us feel at home!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked Cassa Hotel because they were a Certificate of Excellence in 2016. The location was close to the theatre district but that was the only plus to the hotel. The rooms are strangely laid out. Our first room was old and worn so they were kind enough to give us a new updated room which was minimally better. Bare bones would be an accurate description of the hotel, lobby and rooms. I understand NYC is expensive as I have stayed there many times but Cassa Hotel Times Square is overpriced even by NYC standards.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will be staying at Cassa EVERY time I'm in the city from now on. As a frequent NYC visitor, I have stayed in many, many hotels all over the city and this was by far, the best experience I've ever had! My bestie and I stayed for 3 days/2 nights for a girls weekend. I wanted an affordable room that was centrally located so we could hit all the tourist spots and have easy access to the quieter neighborhoods I love visiting. And Cassa delivered! Located in Midtown West, almost in Hell's Kitchen, it's an easy cab ride down to the Financial District, and a quick walk to Midtown, the Theater District, Central Park, UWS, etc. Our room was absolutely perfect, so large for the price! Clean, bright, with a nice view (not just of an alley or other buildings like some large hotel chains), and we never heard our neighbors! The hallways/elevators were very clean as well! AND NOW THE SERVICE. It was rainy the day we arrived... Jessica greeted us and ushered us into the FREE DAILY WINE HOUR right away. She got us all checked in while we sipped on FREE WINE, and then made sure we had everything we needed, knew where to find COMPLIMENTARY breakfast in the morning and assured me we could late check out (2p) on Sunday. Cesar was our go-to guy! He was so gracious during wine hour, and then delivered our fridge and complimentary champagne to our room! Lastly, Lucy checked us out and was so sweet and helpful, making sure we had all we needed to get back home! The last thing to note was the GORGEOUS rooftop terrace! We loved taking our free wine up there! So spacious with lots of seating and even a grassy area and kids toys! There was a jacuzzi but it was not in use during our visit in early April. I could go on and on about how wonderful Cassa was. I literally have nothing bad to say about it. If you're traveling to the city, Cassa is the place to stay!! HIGHLY recommend!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thought I was booking Cassa 45, but the site I clicked on was Cassa Times Square, and boy was I disappointed when I found out where I had booked a room. This hotel is located in one of the noisiest, dirtiest spots in NYC, right between Port Authority Bus Terminal and the Lincoln Tunnel. Nonstop trucks, traffic, police sirens and congestion. The hotel is clean, but bare bones, and most of the appointments in the room are cheap and flimsy. Stay away.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The photos are not what you get when you arrive at the hotel, nor are the services which you pay for. 5hrs after checking in having flown in from overseas, wanting to have a hot shower being 10 degrees outside, there was no hot water in our room, upon ringing downstairs we were told “I completely forgot to tell you on check-in there is currently no hot water, you seem to be the first to complain...”?! The way in which the situation was dealt with was not up to standard and it is imperative to inform your guests of ANY such issues, especially not having hot water. Needless to say we had to have a cold shower that evening and the next morning, only to have the first night discounted. The staff were rude to myself and my sister regarding the issue, making out as if it was us simply complaining for no reason. The booking includes a “cheese and wine” happy hour... there was no red or white wine, and the cheese was mass produced processed cheese from the packets at the supermarket. When we queried where the wine was, we were told sorry we ran out yesterday. We returned to our room at 4pm to our room not being cleaned yet, and were told the cleaners have till 6pm every day? This is not the standard of any other hotel and I have travelled to over 62 countries. It is simply not worth the amount paid. There was not enough seating in the breakfast hall and many guests were taking their food to their rooms. Eating on paper plates from a 6 year olds birthday party with plastic cutlery? Incredibly disappointing, would not recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is basic, clean and has a nice terrace. Breakfast is ok. Pictures shown do not match the hotel you expect to find but its still ok, just a bit overpriced in my honest opinion. Staff is friendly and always willing to support.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this lovely place in August. We can’t to New York for a secret wedding of a very good friend. We choose this hotel as it is not too big and had a roof to terrace. The reception area is small and can seem bussly but we were dealt with very quickly. The room was spacious and very clean and had everything we needed. I am wheat intolerance but the breakfast was great and I had a good choice of hot or cold food. I have to say that Michael was an absolute star and helped with everything we needed to sort out the secret wedding flowers, champagne and wine and even the borrow of the scissors for me to make our button hole flowers. I would certainly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was incredible , not only were the staff incredibly Friendly (Jessica and Ashley) but they were also helpful and knowledgeable about NYC. Would def recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NYC.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were blown away by the friendliness of the staff! They made us feel at home and treated us like royalty. Special shoutout to Lucy who went above and beyond during our stay. We’ll be back for sure!!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: no interest to stay there.... arrogant staff, small room, noisy, dirty.... they charge you around 50 dollars/day for the cleaning.... incredible !!!! pictures i saw before to book were probably the royal suite..... no interest to be there and if they have to keep your luggages after check in they invite you to go outside of the hotel to be charged again.... an ugly place I can't recommend ... bed was strong and not good at all
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My overall experience here was phenomenal. My room was very neat and clean. Additionally I’d like to give recognition to Jessica at the front desk. Very professional, very helpful and informative, articulate and genuinely very kind. She made it her business to accommodate to my needs to ensure my comfortability for the duration of my stay. Generally all staff was friendly and I enjoyed my stay. Definitely will be booking here soon again. —Jada
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cesar and Lucy were the best they made our experience so much better. Their service was amazing they make us feel so welcome. We came to celebrate our birthday and they made this experience so much better thank you so much for the attention and giving us that service!!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives: bed and pillows were comfortable, roof garden is beautiful; convenient location if you're seeing a Broadway show. Negatives: the first room we were assigned smelled like fresh paint so we had to move. Quality of the breakfast buffet was disappointing. There is no bell service, which we had counted on as we had another day in NYC, and so we had to lug around a heavy suitcase all day.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First let me say hands down the service was impeccable; the overnight crew (Micheal) front desK was AMAZZZZING very intentive, charming, & catering to our needs!! He went above and beyond to make sure that myself & my girlfriends received full New York City red carpet service we felt like rock stars. If Micheal is on duty we will definitely be back to the CASSA TIME SQUARE. Thank you Micheal
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently celebrated 4 years together with my special lady and wanted to go to the city where we had our first date I wanted to stay in the city since it was going to be a late night and Cassa did not disappoint they were so accommodating and the GM Fred Velastegui even came over to us and treated us not like guests but more like family I was pleasantly surprised and saw that they were treating everyone with the same love and respect and I am overwhelmed cause no hotel has ever gone above and beyond but after my experience I will always come back to Cassa Hotel !!! Love this place highly recommend
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Casa the night of our kids free date night. We were catching a concert at MSG and wanted to stay at a prime location between food and MSG that was affordable. The staff was friendly and great to give us points of where to eat. The room was clean and they were sweet to decorate for our stay- my hubby mentioned to the GM that is was a special stay and Fred was great to accommodate for it with wine and water and apples. We walked in with rose pedals on the floor in the shape of a heart very sweet. They have a nice breakfast in the morning. I would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a disaster for a hotel and is taking advantage of the name Cassa. The real one is on 45th...NOT 39 and 9th ave. This place is dirty and the lobby is a closet. There’s a $50 resort fee that is for junk ritz crackers, cheese and cereal for breakfast. This place is being confused with the real Cassa on 45th thus you see the reviews so high.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located to Time Square and very nice area. Hotel room was very clean and well ,maintain. Staff and room service was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was awesome, my son loves the hotel and the ambiance.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dirty walls and the hallway carpet is downright filthy! I can hear every word from my neighbors room. I can’t wait to check out of this dump! I don’t know if this is really a legit hotel, rather than an office building in disguise! Take a PASS on this place...
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: + We had a great time at Cassa Hotel, the room was very large and the bed was amazing and comfortable. On our departure day we had great assistance from Michael and Luz who gave us a late check-out, so we could enjoy our last few hours in New York to the fullest:) They were amazing!!!The rooftop terrace is great and you can enjoy a nice view on the Hudson river aswell as the new skyscrapers they are building all around. From 4pm till 5pm you can get wine for free and bring it up to the rooftop, that is a great idea and we enjoyed that very much!- the breakfast is pretty small, if you don`t want to eat much and you are happy with a bagel, a yoghurt or a banana and coffee to go it`s perfect for you. I didn`t like that all the cutlery and plates aswell as cups were plastic and out of carton. Additionally in the morning the water in the shower was not so warm, so we were freezing a bit afterwards, but I guess when it`s warmer outside, that isn't that bad:) Otherwise everything was great and we had a lovely time!!!Thank you
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in December 2018 and had an amazing time. Walking distance to Times Square and many other key sights. Two of the reception staff were extremely friendly and the breakfast was decent as well. Would definitely recommend this place to others.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing atmosphere. I really enjoyed the free bar in wine. Manuel was an excellent bartender. The eggs and croissants at the breakfast were also very nice. The location is great. Near subway and times square.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location of the hotel and accessibility to the time square. The hotel staff took a great care of our employees. I would especially highlight servis from Manuel during happy hours. Thank you Cassa hotel!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel near Times Square. New York is a really nice city. Great service and a big thanks to Manuel for making it the experience at cassa hotel even better. I would highly recommend this to everyone going to New York!
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Horrible experience. I don't even know how to start...They sell the hotel as - luxury hotel but once you get there is completely different.The lobby is dirty and workers are not profesional, wearing regular clothes instead of an uniform. Elevators were not working. The restaurants and bar feautured on he website does not exists yet. The terrace is not even inside of the hotel is located in the building next to them. Breakfast is served in PLASTIC PLATES. They only have cheese , milk , yogurt and cereal. The room was dirty, smelled like cigarettes, wall was dirty , the shower was not working well. Do not stay here please. It's all fake. We asked for a refound and they didn't want to help us. Oh also we prepared to be out of the room by 11:00 AM and pay $50 extra for a place located 10 min walking from the hotel... were you can leave your suitcases.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed at,Room dirty and run down, bathroom shower full of mold and mildew, no guest access to ice, robes thins and dirty,furniture stained and worn out, limited television stations,will never be backGo at your own risk.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was smaller than in the picture, but clean. Desk is too high to use. Wierd uncomfortable desk chair with no back, just a high bar around the back. No place to open a suitcase. TV only receives a few random cable stations. 2 blocks from Javits and lots of restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Cassa for 3 nights and it was amazing. The staff was lovely and very helpful. A couple of names to mention Diana Ronald Ashely luz and Jessica. I even Met the owner Fred thank you cassa.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great value for the location I needed to be in. Nice staff, small rooms but that's expected when visiting NYC or other large cities. The room was clean, the refrigerator wasn't very cold. The rooms are quite so you don't hear much next door or outside. The bed would be my only complaint, it wasn't comfortable and felt like it was pretty old and flat with no support.
hotelName:
17    Cassa Hotel Times Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We take a family trip (or at least with one of the kids) to NYC every couple of years. We typically stay in Hell's Kitchen (very accessible and great restaurants) but we decided to try a new location.NobleDen is a nice hotel right in Little Italy and Chinatown. Restaurants galore. And a great bakery right across the street.I booked for my family of 4 as I liked the idea of a balcony. Our balcony, however, was on the back side of the building - overlooking the back of restaurants and other buildings - and only had a wooden bench (not nice lounge chairs like the other rooms with balconies). The balcony was useless for us. Because of the balcony placement, our double beds were actually staggered and facing each other (which I had seen in the picture). Once there, however, we quickly realized that only one bed faced the TV so it was impossible for all of us to enjoy a late night movie or TV show comfortably. The shower was very cool but I found the red shiny floor very slippery. The "rain" shower head made it impossible to wash and rinse my hair - although they did also have a handheld shower head to use. We had an incident when someone from the staff knocked and walked right into our room as we were lounging on our beds (no biggie but a little unnerving).I would recommend staying here as a couple - with 1 bed. I wouldn't stay again with 4 people in 2 beds - the room we had just wasn't worth it.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay there! Always something to see in the area. Special thanks to Michelle (leader of the cleaning ladies). She did an awesome job and was very polite! Also the reception team is always there for you and makes you feel welcomed! We miss the beautiful rooftop view already but we‘ll be back for sure!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room. Loved the Juliette balcony. Could see both Little Italy and China town from it. The shower and bathroom mirror were also pretty cool. Would definitely stay here again. 200 characters is too many for a hotel review
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Swanky, sleek and clean but what stands out most was how accommodating the hotel staff is to the guests. Early check-in was no issue for the staff as well as safely holding bags in the lobby. The location couldn't get any closer to the heart of Little Italy. Highly recommended
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is very comfy and super clean hotel! The staff was helpful, showing us around and giving us useful tips (Morgan – the hotel manager – was extremely polite and gave several very useful advices), and very polite. The rooms were extremely clean! The bed was super comfy and we had huge TV in our room. Since we spent 14 nights here – we felt as at home to us The location of hotel is great. It is very close to Brooklyn Bridge for a perfect walking tour (which I would recommend) and lower Manhattan is very close. It very well connected to other places in New York because in range of 5-minute walk there are several substations from which you can take subway to almost anywhere. Little Italy in which this hotel is located is very good neighborhood with a lot of nice restaurants.They had everything we needed (including iron and scale to measure weight of bags on our leave). Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The title reflects what happens when you walk out the front door of this hotel. So it's location is remarkable and fun. Much nicer than staying in Times Sq. The room is intelligently and stylishly laid out. It was quiet on a Saturday night. The bed was comfortable. There was even an odd little wooden balcony one could step out onto, although don't get too excited about that. I was greeted pleasantly and helpfully at the desk. So what's not too like? Aesthetically, I have a slight preference for Sister City, a few blocks away and in the same price range, but only a slight one. But this is a better location.There seems to be a little coffee, etc. hospitality area just past the elevators but I didn't even know about it until I checked out. Anyway, get your coffee on Mott Street, at Cafe Grumpy or Gimme Coffee, both excellent. Very easy, straight walk to the D Train at Grand St. Station.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms in the hotel are clean and fresh, beds really comfy. Staff are friendly and helpful. Location is great, loads nearby and easy to get other places (subway not far). Overall great hotel and really worth the money!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfy, clean and perfectly situated for a nyc trip!Modern interior, beds are very good! View from the rooftop is marvelous. Lots of bars and restaurants around. Coffee and tea all over the day for free. Strictly recommended!!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean rooms with a large comfortable bed, and spacious shower. NobleDEN provides all the hotel amenities from toiletries, hair dryer to hotel slippers and a cute stuffed toy to take home! The rooms were spotless and well planned to utilise the space efficiently. We arrived early in the morning and rooms were ready for us. There was a USD25 early check in fee, which we thought was very reasonable for NYC standards. We checked in and could immediately begin exploring. The hotel is located in the heart of Little Italy and there are subway stations within a few blocks in every direction, giving us great access to most of the lines. Not a complaint to be had!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (two adults) stayed at NobleDEN for one night in April 2019. Upon check-in our room was immediately available and served our short stay perfectly - it was incredibly clean, quiet, and completely smoke-free, which is crucial for us - even a hint of residual smoke from a prior visitor causes us health issues.The room was equipped with some clever space-saving solutions (such as the safe stored in an under-bed drawer) and came with slippers, good toiletries, and a complimentary stuffed bear, which came home with us for our friend's child. The one caution is the sink is in the room, rather than a separate bathroom, which could cause issues for some - from either a noise or privacy perspective.The hotel is situated at a great location for exploring SoHo, LES, and several other neighborhoods. There are multiple close subway stops and tons of excellent restaurants, shops, and bars just outside the hotel. Although the area was constantly busy, we didn't get any noise disruption in the room.We we given a late check-out, thirty minutes or an hour after their normal time, and the front desk happily offered to hold our bags until our evening flight home. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would gladly recommend NobleDEN for a visit.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived a 3 hours early and was told by reception that our room was ready, but we had to pay an early check-in fee of $25. It baffled us as it was not as extravagant as half a day earlier. This is our first encounter of such additional charges. We refused to pay for a policy that did not make sense as it was not like the hotel had to scramble manpower to get our room ready before the preset check-in time. It was no extra cost to the hotel but it felt like they went out of their way, offering to store our luggage, just to make things difficult for us. Reminder to travellers to be on time rather than early!Room was clean and everything fitted perfectly into a small space. We did however had a fenced up balcony with no view.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Step outside and find yourself in bubbly Little Italy. Metro stations close in all directions, small walks to Soho, Tribeca, Brooklyn(bridge) etc. The lack of a hotel-restaurant is not a problem since there are plenty of options just steps away. Rooms are clean, quiet and well equipped. Would come back next time.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Down the block from the Little Italy sign, the neighborhood is ideal for walking around day or night. Clean, decently sized rooms with all of the required amenities at a reasonable price. Especially enjoyed the large shower.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at NobleDEN. It can be challenging to find a relatively cost-effective AND well-situated hotel in Manhattan, and this very well may be it! I liked my room, with a view of Grand Street, and though the street noise was intense, I managed to sleep easily. I took the subway to Brooklyn (from Canal St) and another to the Upper East Side (from Spring St) while in the city, and the location of the hotel was just steps away from the Q and the 6 trains, respectively. I only gave the hotel 4 stars because the ventilation isn't great (kept smelling the restaurant next door, a hot pot place, which is connected to the hotel, I think!) and hallway noise woke me both mornings (before 7 am). That said, I will likely return to NobleDEN on future visits. I agree with other reviewers that the car service to the airport was excellent and well-priced, and the teddy bear as a gift was a nice touch. :)
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 8 nights and it was an excellent base for us. Close to different subways, close to Little Italy and Chinatown, no laundry service at the hotel but there was a laundromat just around the corner. Bathroom was massive and the shower head was the best part about the room. Room came with a closet, mini fridge, comfortable bed and good size TV. All the staff we came in contact with were super friendly and made us feel welcomed at all hours of the day. Coffee making facilities and water is down in the lobby but we just grabbed what we needed before heading back to the room. Room was quiet, we looked out over a court yard but we were barely in the room so didn’t care what the view was. Would highly recommend NobleDEN and would most certainly stay here again.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is great, the manager is lovely and so welcoming. One of the staff members was a bit grumpy (maybe she was having an off day though). The room was small, we had 2 x adults and 2 x children but that’s New York for you. Would have loved the shower to be hotter. I would stay there again. Great position, near great restaurants and subway etc. all good.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Nobleden hotel for a short family holiday. It is positioned in a great location with lots of restaurants on your doorstep, the nearest subway is only a 5 minute walk. We had the most delicious fresh pastries delivered from the Italian bakers across the road every morning which was a nice touch, with hot drinks and water always available near the lobby. The staff were really genuine and friendly, they went above and beyond for us, even searching through the rubbish for an item that had been mistakenly disposed of!!!In a great neighbourhood, not overly touristy, in Little Italy and Chinatown too!Would recommend this small, personal hotel 100% to my family and friends, the rooftop views were a great start and end to each day
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amidst a 48 hour visit to NYC, was pleasantly surprised a boutique hotel, Nobleden on Grand St, between Mulberry and Mott, provided the perfect oasis to relax, recharge and proceed with 2 full days of meetings at Lexington Ave, Grand Central on 42nd. Street. Nobleden was walking distance to Bloomingdales, Little Italy, Chinatown and Financial district of Wall St. Nobleden was extremely clean and under managers Morgan and Ewan and their team, provided a welcome change to hectic work schedule with complimentary 24hr tea and coffee. Worth another visit when next in the big Apple putting hotels like Hilton Midtown with rates over 4 times Nobleden to shame.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three nights with my husband and daughter. All three of us stayed at a king juliette room. The bed was big enough for the three of us but the room was a bit tight, which was expected. Wasn't a fan of the open bathroom though. The balcony view was really nice. The bed was too hard for me and my lower back was aching after the first night. Wish that was a bit softer. Free wifi but we were always disconnecting and had to sign in again. They give you two free bottles of evian water (if you ask for more it's $3 additional/bottle). There's free coffee/tea/hot chocolate in the lobby. Sodas are $2. Pastries at 7am although I didn't see any when I went down at 7am. They also have some fruits if you're lucky. There's a mini microwave. Also, they have umbrellas if you need them - just ask the front desk. Staff were all very nice. Love the location. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is simply amazing! The rooms are spacious and very clean. The surrounding area has everything you could want and need! The hotel rooms are also stocked with all of those things we seem to forget I.e. toothbrush, toothpaste, and q-tips.The staff is very personable, accommodating and overall just great! I left some items behind and they immediately contacted me and arrange for my items to get back to me. Honestly one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed at. I will definitely be telling anyone traveling to New York to stay here you won’t be disappointed!!!!!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I normally stay in a very different part of NYC. And I usually pay much more than I did here. I chose this location out of convenience because I had business in three different parts of the city so I tried to be centralized. This hotel straddles the Little Italy and China Town area. It is quite busy here but I had not problems because I chose to check in earlier than the 3pm time on my reservation. This was accomplished for $25.00. Well worth the cost since I ended up checking in at 6am. (rooms available). Staff was very accommodating, helpful and friendly. If you are looking to save a few dollars but still stay in a very clean hotel I recommend this hotel. So much to do nearby.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great stay! The hotel staff was incredibly polite and accommodating. The room is the most efficient use of space you can image. We really liked the neighborhood and the restaurant next door. We will definitely stay again!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern and clean facilities. We loved our stay mostly because of location and neighbourhood. They only offered coffee and croissants for breakfast, but really not a problem when you live right across the Ferrara, Italian bakery and cafe. Also cosy bar nextdoor With excellent Spanish wine and tapas. Concierge extremely helpful and serviceminded.we would love to visit again.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We tried something different on this NYC trip - instead of staying at a chain near Times Square, we stayed here in Little Italy. We got to the hotel early in the afternoon and one of our two rooms was ready. We booked a queen for us parents and a double/double for the two teens. Our queen room was on the side of of the hotel, third floor. So, no view. But, for NYC standards I found the room to be very spacious. My husband overpacked and wished there was bureau or small closet (there were two small drawers in an end table aside the bed). With just two nights and only a few casual clothes in my backpack, I didn't need any storage room. The kids' double/double was on the first floor and was really pretty big. In fact, if i'd known how big it was going to be I might not have booked us parents a separate room (maybe I would have: it's nice to have some space from the 15/16 set sometimes). The double/double had a nice closet and even more floor space, and the bathroom sink area seemed bigger as well. And, the double/double had a balcony - very nice even without any "view." We loved the rooftop. Even in late December, we went up there in the evening and took in the amazing views.Included wifi was good. Huge thank you for the available umbrellas in the lobby. Nice coffee/tea/hot chocolate area with a microwave there too. Our room had a tiny refrigerator as well, and a safe under the bed. Extra blankets were brought up very quickly. Quiet and responsive heating/cooling in each room. A couple block walk from a few different subway lines. Very friendly front desk staff. Loved the neighborhood! Plenty of tourists, but plenty of real people too :). We left our luggage in the lobby for our last afternoon after check out - and when I say in the lobby, I mean in the lobby. But, the lobby is so small and staff so attentive I had no hesitations leaving it there. We booked online pretty far in advance and am glad we did. If we ever get to go back when it's warmer out, I'd love to get a room on the streetside of the hotel with a balcony. One day!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I rarely stay in hotels in NYC so we really loved the proximity of this hotel to some of the best food/shopping/etc in Manhattan and I really loved the boutique feel of this hotel as well. From the spacious rooms (YES! Spacious for NYC standards) to the adorable juliet balcony and the thoughtful amenities in the bathroom area (individual toothbrushes and toothpaste, q-tips, etc, how cute?!). I thought the value was fantastic to not stay in a chain and they had beverages available throughout the day. I thought the bed to be very comfy, and loved all the lighting in the bathroom. It was a fantastic room!! I do have to say that I feel the service could be a tad better... my husband left his ID with the front desk staff (they'll ask for it upon checkin) and we went the entire day not knowing until we were at dinner in which we went through all the scenarios and worrying about flying back home to find that it was at the hotel with a sticky note saying we'd return. Which YES we'd ask but they had my email and probably my phone number so I'm kind of sad they wouldn't have reached out. Or tried to call the room after we checked in. Just a little bit of customer service can go a long way in this regard, especially knowing we're all pretty much traveling. Not anyone's specific fault but just thought someone should've tried to reach out since an ID is pretty important while traveling. Otherwise, I'd HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. I really loved it otherwise. Loved the view from the roof as well. What a special treat!!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a very fun location if you wish to avoid the crowds of midtown. We based here and walked around little Italy, Soho, and Chinatown. We are big walkers, so we also walked to and over Brooklyn Bridge (Ubered back). Dined in Little Italy, then had dessert at a place right accross the street. Washington Square/ Greenwich Village, High Line from Greenwich Village to Chelsea Market (Ubered back again!). So my review of the hotel is based more on the location that we wanted a lower Manhattan trip. The hotel itself was good. Small, boutiqueish. Not much help from front desk as far as directions or activities. Clean room, small but for NY not that small. Cute amenities in the room, like little stuffed animal, bath shoes, q-tips, toothbrush. Everyone was nice, they got us right into the room, no problems. Room was surprisingly quiet too.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: NobleDen: Nice basic 3 * hotel my room on the 3rd floor was fine for 1 persons mostly sleeping nice open bathroom king bed small desk room was thought out for 1-2 persons but not a lot of room for sure... only complaint is like at a lot of hotels the lower floors definitely have street noise issues as my room was facing Grand ....Staff was friendly and smiled all the time .... room was smaller than expected however the price was substantially less than other hotels in the near area.... The location of the NobleDen is its true draw .... the crossroads of Little Italy Chinatown LES and SoHo Nolita Tribeca.... can't beat that....there was free coffee and pastries in the morning small comfortable lounge. Elevators were quick and the water pressure was great. Shower had both a large rain feature and a hand held portion. This is a great option at a surprisingly affordable price. Pros: Location price and efficient small modern roomsCons: Front room do have street noise as Grand is a commercial street and it is NYC 24/7
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: NY is expensive when it comes to good accommodation and areaThis hotel was brilliant for the money we spent Right in between Little Italy and Chinatown and only 3 blocks from the closest subway stationRooms were modern, staff friendly. They provide complimentary coffee and snacks Would happily stay again
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in October and thought it was fantastic hotel. We got a good price for the stay compared to other hotels and was delighted to find how nice this place was. Always staff on the desk if you needed anything. Room was always cleaned spotlessly every day. Pastries of a morning and free coffee etc. was nice touch. Area is very lively with great choice of restaurants. Subway stations close by as well. If you want a good priced hotel for your stay I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There's nothing bad to say about this hotel - the staff were fantastic and happy to make (great) recommendations when asked. Check-in and check-out were easy/quick, they even moved us up to a room on a higher floor which was appreciate - was not noisy at all.Location was fantastic - 5 minutes from a number of subway stations and easy walks to all the nearby areas.The complementary coffee/tea was fabulous and we only wish there were more pastries in the morning!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed this past week end at the NobleDen. We loved this hotel. It is in a great location in the center of SoHo, little Italy and China Town. We were surrounded by great places to eat and shop. The Hotel was modern and clean. The rooms were comfortable with a unique design. I loved the waterfall shower option. They have a rooftop veranda that overlooks the city and would be a great place to have coffee or a drink. Off of the lobby they have coffee, tea, cocoa and warm pastries in the mourning for their guests to enjoy. The staff was friendly and welcoming. I want to especially thank Morgan the Hotel manager who could not do enough to help us with our question. He knows everything you need to know to help make your visit to the City an enjoyable one. We can’t wait to return.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here after I ran the NYC marathon. It’s a small boutique style hotel between china town and little Italy. Great location to spend time downtown. The hotel itself is very modern, it seems new. The rooms have toothbrushes and other toilet trees, and the staff is more than willing to bring extra pillows and towels.The price is also great. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was exactly what we were looking for. The 24h coffee availability; the shower and bathroom were perfect for a New York hotel. The staff were always present and offered advice on anything that a tourist would like/want to know.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location in a lively area. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was a decent size, clean and comfy and great to have free tea and coffee. We were put in a quiet area of the hotel as requested so no views but at least we could sleep!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gem of a place, almost don’t want to Such a great hotel, I almost don’t want to share it with the world. My gfs and I loved everything from check in to check out. Perfect location, great staff, and best views.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great view, great location, friendly staff, warm pastries in the morning. What more could you ask? This really is just the way it should be done. Minimum of fuss, high quality, quiet and on-demand TV too!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location near fabulous places to eat and close to several subways (5-8 min walk). Super helpful staff, huge rooms, to die for shower rain head, and comfortable beds. Best NYC hotel! Highly recommended!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 5 nights at the city and this area is my preferred. Location is great, close to the sub and to many of little Italy/Chinatown/SoHo locations. Rooms were small but very clean and very well organized and equipped with modern decor and great bathrooms. Staff was helpful when ever needed. The hotel also has nice rooftop at which you can relax with bottle of wine (From next door wine shop) on a sunny day.Very good experience although a bit pricy .
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very disappointed in this place. The rooms are very small. There is no place to put your luggage. The place was very clean and the staff was great, very friendly. Although the room was very efficient it was too small for me. The HVAC and water pressure were fine, no complaints. I personally did not like the location. The dealbreaker for this place for me was that it was noisy. I could hear every door close in the hallway and I could hear people on both sides of me. Additionally, I could hear all the street noise.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good and clean hotel. Not too fancy but a very good location! Rooms were - despite the roomsize - well equipped with radio, Big tv, ironer, hairdryer etc. Its pretty close to all the fancy shopping streets and metro stations
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel on our first visit in NYC. We found the location to be very good with many nearby subway lines. The room was very quiet and the bed was big and comfortable. The staff was helpful and was always smiling. They had a taxi service we used to the airport and this was cheaper than the yellow cab. There are many good restaurants in the area especially if you like Italian cuisine.They also had a rooftop with a view of the Empire State and One World Trade Center.I would recommend this hotel if you want a quite and clean hotel the basically offers only rooms.It was perfect for us.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed two nights at the NobleDEN Hotel recently following a cruise. We loved it! I was forewarned that hotels in NYC are small. Our room was larger than I expected, immaculate, everything was in good working order, it contained a refrigerator, it was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. We met the hotel manager who assisted us with getting a car service to LGA. We interacted often with Bryon and Kelvin who both assisted us with giving us the best directions/advice to getting around the city. We loved the location in Little Italy. It was a quick walk to the subway we needed. This was our first visit to NYC and we will definitely return and book another stay at NobleDEN.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were fortunate that an Italian festival was being held for 20 blocks around the hotel which provided great entertainment for us. The hotel is very well maintained and clean. The rooms have hardwood floors which we like much better than carpet. The staff was outstanding in helping us figure out where we were and where we were going. The subway system can be intimidating, but they helped us out greatly with this also. The only drawback we had was that they don't provide face cloths. This makes a quick wash-up impossible. Other than that, the place is awesome..
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was spotless clean, had the best shower, comfy bed, cold AC, great location in Little Italy, and I loved how the hotel utilizes room space! Excellent morning coffee & pastries. Will definitely stay here again!!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the hotel recently for 6 nights with my sister. We shared a king bed room. The room itself wasn't huge but this is normal for New York and we had plenty of space for the 2 of us.The water pressure in the shower is really great also.We were in a room at the back off the hotel as the San Gennaro festival was on right outside the hotel and we couldn't hear the noise at night from the festival which was awesome. They provide free coffee/tea all day which is a really nice tough and they get a tray of pastry's at 7.30am every day for the hotel guests to help themselves too. Be warned - they are gone by 8.15am.The front desk staff can be hit and miss. We spoke to a few different people during our stay and a few of them weren't very helpful. One of the girls told me to Google my question which I thought was terrible customer service. I had asked her a few questions about the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island tours.I need to call out Kelvin who was AMAZING! The hotel needs all their front desk staff to be as awesome as him. My sister and I asked him numerous questions one morning and he was super helpful and went above and beyond.The hotel is an an awesome spot and is so close to SoHo and Chinatown. Being in Little Italy means there are restaurants all around.Overall I highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay there agin one day.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nobleden has a very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel was immaculate and a great place to relax from the chaos of NYC. The shower was like being massaged by a waterfall. If you stay here don't forget to check out the rooftop deck, with a beautiful view of the city. The neighborhood is a great place to walk around and much less chaotic than midtown.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is wonderful. Features I loved most: it was spotlessly clean, quiet (we had a room to the back), lovely new beds and bathroom fittings, delicious pastries in the morning and charming, helpful front desk staff (and fabulous manager Morgan:-). Don’t stay anywhere else!!! The location is superb as you are close to various subway stations. Loved our stay. Don’t miss the rooftop terrace and the stellar views!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really liked this hotel. Our room was fairly big (especially by NYC standards), and we both had space to have our suitcases open on the floor. The location is fantastic, lots of really great restaurants only a short walk away, but we weren’t disturbed by any noise from the street in our room. The bathroom has a sliding door to the bedroom which we found a bit strange, so definitely only go with someone you are comfortable with! Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed one night at this special boutique hotel. It was a perfect choice. We stayed in a King Room overlooking the street. As with most New York City hotels it is a little small. However, our room was designed perfectly and had everything that anyone could want in a hotel room. It was also extremely clean. The large rooftop has amazing views. The reception staff were exceptional. So helpful and friendly. They could not have been better. The location is great with lots of restaurants and bars in the immediate area. NobleDen Hotel will definitely be our go to hotel on future visits to New York City. Highly recommended!!
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just came back from a week long stay at NobleDEN. NobleDEN is a small 7 storey boutique hotel. We had two people to a queen room facing the rear of the building. It would be really nice to have the juliet balcony facing Grand Street but it's New York and we really weren't in the room all that much. When I was looking for a place to stay in New York, I also considered a hotel near Times Square. But after doing my research, it was clear that this hotel was located in a far superior location. I would rather stay in an area to experience the New York lifestyle and culture that Little Italy and Chinatown has. I am really glad I chose this location because we probably spent a total of 15 minutes at Times Square and it was the worst part of NYC! I know this place is advertised as between Little Italy and Chinatown, but the real gem is that it's literally two or three blocks to Soho which is a super hip and trendy area. Every corner you turn in the neighbourhood, there's a cool restaurant, cafe and trendy shopping.The room we had was clean, spacious and quiet! I believe it was a wheelchair accessible room so the bathroom was supersized by New York standards. In regards to housekeeping, for some reason they didn't refill our soap or shampoos... but other than that they did a good job of cleaning. There was usually one worker at the front desk, each of whom were pleasant but not overly friendly. There are drawers under the bed which is where you can find the safe (it took me a day to find it). The hotel comes with an ironing board but no iron... I'm guessing you have to request it at the front desk. The rooftop patio is nice but they could really use some lights up there so it can be used at night or umbrellas/cabanas for the day. There was a heatwave during my time there so it was really unusable during the day as there was no shade.The morning pastries were all right but you'll still need something else for breakfast to get through your morning. You have to go at 7:30 am to get first dibs. They are still warm at that time. I went down at 8:30 one morning and there was nothing left. And for some weird reason one morning there were apples and bananas... But only one morning during my stay out of a whole week. It would be a nice touch to provide that everyday.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We staid now the 4th time in this perfect location. Nothing to complain. Excellent service combined with a perfect location and rooms which are well designed. We love the flair and opportunity to enjoy all parts of the city starting from that wonderful place.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at NobleDEN. The location is excellent and is near fantastic restaurants and shops. The room had very modern features and did not feel too cramped. The shower had 2 heads to choose from and the lighting in the room was good. All toiletries were provided. Bed was comfortable. The rooftop access was nice. The air conditioning worked well. Service was good. Only bad thing was that you could hear the noise from the hallways from within the room. Otherwise I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable boutique hotel right in the centre of all the SoHo, Little Italy, Chinatown and Tribeca action.Friendly Hotel manager and staff.Tea and coffee available in foyer all day.Great rain showers.
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at the NobleDEN, having chosen it for its proximity to a wedding I was attending in Hanover Square. While I could of course have stayed closer to the wedding, I wanted to stay at a place that was a bit more in the thick of it. NobleDEN satisfied my want for a bustling neighborhood, and exceeded my expectations with the actual accommodations themselves.First, you'll probably see this on hotel sites or NobleDEN's site itself, but the hotel really is at the intersection of many neighborhoods. Little Italy is to the west, Soho more to the north, Chinatown to the South, and the Lower East side not far to the east. With all of these energy-filled areas nearby, you are at no shortage of things to do and see. And of course, there are various subway stations in the area, meaning you'll be able to get basically anywhere you need to do.As for the hotel, it's got a stylish, contemporary look, both in the lobby and in the rooms themselves. The rooms being more important, I was really happy with the way our queen size room was laid out. In fact, the room on the spacious-side for NY standards. When you walk in the room, there's a sort of open bathroom layout to your right. The sink and mirror don't have a super distinct division from the rest of the room, and then they have the space for the shower and toilet surrounding them (which are enclosed, in case you were wondering).In front of the bed, there is a long counter space (perfect for putting your various things), and also perfect to put luggage, etc. underneath. Next to the beds are really cool light fixtures (that bend and move to almost any desirable configuration), with a empty fridge underneath one.The bed itself was extremely comfortable, with delightfully firm pillows. I really can't stand weak pillows, so if you're like me, you should expect a good sleep here. The shower was my least favorite part of the room, but certainly wasn't as bad as many other hotel showers I've experienced. Overall, the pressure was good, but it had a giant rainfall style showerhead on the ceiling, which of course by its nature isn't all that great with pressure. But, there is a handle head on the side of the shower, which does provide acceptable pressure. If its holder was just a little higher up on the wall, it could even have functioned as a straight up regular showerhead experience.A couple bonuses that you don't always get (but should): 1.) coffee/tea in the lobby and 2.) free WiFi (that actually work
hotelName:
18    NobleDEN Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Andaz is a great place to stay if you need to be near Wall St. Very friendly and helpful staff, great location and big rooms with the right amenities. The feel is very European in terms of the decor (though European rooms are smaller). Great shower, lots of USB outlets, well stocked fridge and all of the niceties you would expect. The cookies in the lobby are a nice bonus, though maybe not for my waistline! This is now my go-to place.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved it there - went for an anniversary trip to the Andaz on Wall St. I guess it wasn't busy because we were upgrade to an amazing room with high ceiling and comp mini bar. The room was huge for NYC! There was even a makeup counter built in being the tv unit. The shower was all glassed in between the bathroom and the bedroom - loved!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough about the customer service at this property. Everything and everyone were no nice and accommodating. Very very helpful. Will definitely stay here again. Rooms and amenities were great!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was not easy to access this hotel or even park and unload luggage. As this is Wall Street Property.The furniture in lobby is very old and low seating. You can’t get up from the chairs. Our room AC duct didn’t have cover, pillows were thin, bedding not that great, no body lotion, no cups to drink water, very bad location for AC Temperature adjustments, can’t read display, No instructions for window dark.We didn’t have hotel phone lines for two days. Think what can be done in emergencies like fire??Having established franchise name doesn’t mean you get the best as advertising. I wouldn’t stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendliest staff I have ever encountered , you can't go wrong staying here, large rooms, very clean.everything you could want to do is walking distance ,ferry to many other places is steps away, we will be going here again !!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property did not disappoint! Within walking distance of the NYSE and tons of nightlife. The hotel has very unique meeting space - perfect for a meeting for 50-70. The staff couldn't have been any better! Jessica in Sales, and Gabore, Shawn and Aaron at the bar were all extremely knowledgeable, courteous and welcoming! Thank you to all of you for going the extra mile for a girl who was only in town for 24 hours!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Frequent guest of this property. Big rooms, nice staff. Great location, subway close by. Lots of restaurant options close by. WTC is less than a 10 minute walk, South Street Seaport a short walk away.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like this Hyatt brand. It is modern, efficient, clean and friendly. Location in lower manhattan is quiet but accessible and perfect for FiDi tours; and jumping over to Staten or Liberty Islands. Always enjoy coming back here. Looking forward to trying other Andaz properties in the future.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was outstanding. Rooms were large and beautifully furnished. Amenities were excellent. Check in was easy and quick. The hotel is so convenient to Wall Street, the pier, and so much that we wanted to see. I highly recommend it and will definitely return.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Andaz Wall Street last weekend and had a very lovely time. We were welcomed by extremely friendly reception staff - lobby was stunning. Our room was spacious (haven’t seen rooms this big in nyc) and very clean/modern. My favorite part was the massive walk- in/overhead shower. Decor in room was very cool, and bed was like sleeping in a cloud. We stopped by the beer garden in the outside patio one afternoon and listened to the live band - awesome! Location is also great - middle of wall street and next to lots of fun restaurants. Still, it was not noisy at all. Also quick and easy subway ride away from other spots around the city. Thank you Andaz for such an enjoyable stay - will be recommending to friends and family!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Andaz Hotel this past week with a few girlfriends and had a VERY enjoyable stay! The reception staff was extremely welcoming and friendly and the lobby was beautiful. Our room was stunning, spacious, and clean. Loved the new modern decor. Beds were also very comfortable (which was good after a long day walking around the city!). The hotel's location is perfect - right on Wall Street, near the 9/11 Memorial and Brooklyn Bridge. A short subway ride from all the city's main attractions. Will definitely be recommending the Andaz to all my family and friends and can't wait to return!!!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great experience.Was welcomed by nice and friendly people.Spacious room, recently renovated, fresh and modern, needs to extend to the bathrooms.Liked the bar and the bartender Gabor.Great location, perfect in downtown.I will be back.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just left Andaz Wall Street and wish we could go back already. This hotel had a fantastic location in the heart of wall street, and the staff were very kind and helpful. The building is modern, the lobby and reception area is gorgeous, and our room was roomy, clean and very pretty. Loved the modern style and beds were extremely comfortable. We also spent one afternoon at the new outside beer garden which was super fun!! We will for sure be back soon.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Andaz by Hyatt on Wall Street is a terrific hotel for business stays. Minutes from the Metro with many dining options nearby. Breakfast options were better than usual and service was very good. The manager was attentive to the problems with the AC unit in my room and offered to switch my room but I declined.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay here was thankfully short. I say thankfully because I got very little in the way of rest here. First, the positives: Both the check-in and check-out staff were friendly and helpful. They should be commended. The shower in the room was nice, as were the bath amenities (C.O. Bigelow). The location is convenient to Wall Street. But, as the card next to my bad forewarned: convenience comes with a price - noise. Even on the 14th floor, there was LOTS of external noise that made sleeping difficult. The noise in the morning from other rooms and housekeeping was also painful. The hotel has no soundproofing, and everything can be heard. They provide you a pair of cheap earplugs next to your bed, as if that is somehow going to make your stay better. The blackout shades in my room would not go down (no, I did not call maintenance to fix, it was late and I was already undressed). There is no pool or spa in this hotel, either. The restaurant & bar shut down at 11:00PM. Overall, while most of the staff I encountered were friendly, it is all for naught when one can't have a relaxing time at the hotel. I won't return unless the noise issues are remedied.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited with a group of friends and our stay was super comfortable. The rooms are very spacious, and four of us fit well! The lobby is super nice and the free happy hour drinks, and coffee + snacks in the am is a huge bonus! Definitely recommend staying here
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another great stay.This hotel is a great place to stay when you downtown.Rooms are huge, warm and friendly service, we were welcomed by Adam, who recognized us from previous stay, and was very kind and very professional.Restaurant breakfast was great, and the service there is very kind and attentive, kudos to Lazlo.We had the chance to have a drink at the beer garden, wonderful music and great service.One day we experienced the happy hour with the chef, they do a different and unique happy hour kind off, the chef prepares exquisite canapés, and come to you, served and explain everything he uses, great idea.We will be back.Our place in NY.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed the oversized room and luxuries - rare in NYC to have so much space. Nice extras like drinks and snacks. Giant shower and bathing area. The electronics in the room are a bit complicated and not so user friendly.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Andaz Wall Street was the best hotel for a weekend getaway with the girls. We had two rooms on either corner of the 11th floor, both huge with two large beds and a spacious entry/bathroom area. The beds were very comfortable, and the staff was very attentive throughout our stay. The best part was that they knew we were celebrating and left treats in our room with a lovely note upon our arrival making us feel right at home. The hotel had a cute beer garden right outside, and included complimentary snacks/juice/water in the room. They always had coffee and cookies in the lobby, and from 6-7pm they had complementary wine downstairs, where people staying at the hotel could go and sit/socialize. Though this was our first time staying in the area, we loved South Sea Port and the Wall Street Area. There were tons of places to eat, cute shops, and it was only one block away from the water and fun restaurants and bars on the water. The service was truly amazing and we will definitely be staying at Andaz Wall Street again!!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Andaz Wall Street was the perfect hotel for a girls weekend getaway. The rooms were huge, beds comfortable, lovely shower, and all the amenities were perfect. It felt like the hotel staff had thought of everything. We felt totally pampered throughout our entire stay - the staff was very attentive and helpful. Not only were the rooms comfortable & enjoyable to be in, but we slept really well too. Other unique/perfect perks in the hotel included a complimentary wine & beer happy hour in the hotel, a lovely beer garden right outside, free wifi, complimentary snacks/juice/water in the hotel room, and more. Because we were celebrating, the hotel also left us a special treat in the room and that just made the whole weekend feel special right from the beginning! This was also my first time staying in the Wall St district and it was so well located to everything we needed - cute coffee shops, shopping in the sea port neighborhood was so close by, and the entrance to the subway only a few blocks away.I was blown away by the service and will ABSOLUTELY be staying at Andaz Wall Street again! Thank you!!!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel - it's in a great location, is clean, modern and bright with amenities such as 24hr coffee, quick elevator service, always someone to greet you when you come in to lobby. The room was very large with separate sitting area and had a cool rainfall shower. We will definitely be staying here again
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at the Andaz Wall Street for 4 nights whilst visiting the city for a friends hen party, I was really impressed with the service you get as soon as you arrive.We had a beautiful hotel room(one of the biggest I have seen in the city), the wine hour down in the lobby was a great way to unwind after a long flight.Having access to tea/coffee 24 hours along with chocolate chip cookies put a smile on our faces.I will definitely be recommending this hotel to friends and family and I hope to stay with them on my next trip.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel during the week before Memorial Day Weekend, and had an excellent experience.Welcoming staff, warm and friendly.Rooms are great, modern, spacious I would say super spacious for New York, was not expecting and was a great surprise, I had a renovated room, very fresh and everything working properly.You need to work on the bathrooms, I know is not dirty, are stains in the marble, you need to polish and seal it.The floor should have been touched during this renovation, I spoke with the manager and he told you will be working on it next year, great decision.Restaurant was fantastic, wonderful breakfast, and very warm and friendly staff.Loved Kevin and Lazlo, they are an asset to your hotel.Had the chance to have a beer at the Beer Garden, great usage of the space, there was live music and was fantastic.Had also the chance to taste the happy hour with the chefs around preparing and serving the “tapas”, great idea, I never seen it before, you doing a great job with this idea.We will be back for sure.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk staff very helpful & knowledgeable. Rooms a very nice & updated. Celebrate our sons 16th B Day & all attractions were within walking distance.The restaurant has great food for those who are tired & want to eat there.We definitely recommend
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel in the Wall Street district. Gorgeous room and bathroom with a separate bathtub and toilet and rainfall shower. Bed was very comfortable and surprisingly located in a quiet area of NYC. I didn’t hear much traffic noise at nighttime. Nice staff. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location for Downtown and Wall Street. Comfortable , spacious and very clean room with good facilities , although a coffee machine would be nice.Breakfast is functional but not very inspiring but probably works well for the business clientele. The staff in the breakfast room are very welcoming , friendly and hard working.I had one room service meal which was mediocre (but aren’t they always?!) but there is an extensive choice of pubs and restaurants nearby.TV in the room was not great. No international news channels available (not even any signal for CNN).For what is effectively an up market functional business hotel there are some nice touches ,( free coffee lounge and free wine hour).
