Great for a business trip , but not the Pierre , and not the price either!Big compliment to the staff .
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious, modern, well-appointed rooms with convenient location to Wall St. Good customer service with restaurant which is just right for those there for business or vacation. Would definitely recommend to others and stay there again.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is the best. Its a 3 minutes walking distance to my office that is located in Wall street. There are a lot of restaurants. The room is clean and the space is okay too. Things to improve though is the bed, comforter and the pillows...please! You may need to change your furniture also both on the lobby and room. Lastly, front desk people looks very intimidating. More training is required and help them practice to smile. Stayed from May14-18.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They had very dirty carpets on the 7th floor by the elevators and the hallway baseboards were chipped and scuffed. The service person often forgot to replace items in the room, like the bathmat, a water glass and once forgot to empty the bathroom trash can.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had some nice experience with the hotel previously and today I have to stay here again to attend to some personal business in NYC. What a delightful surprise to receive a newly renovated room, which was very beautifully and smartly designed. The staff was professional as always and Kyle at the Front Desk is a gem. Wish we had time to spend another day... Well, we will surely be back, Andaz Wall Street! Two thumbs up for you and your team!!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were large, clean and included free water, juice and snacks. The room service was quick and the food was delicious. Every staff person I interacted with was very friendly and helpful (like at Disney). This included check-in, room service order and deliver and checkout and doorman experiences. I'd definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Andaz for 5 nights commencing April 23 rd ,the hotel is comfortable  and modern , and Wall St is a great location to be based , rooms are large by NYCstandards and well designed . Staff are friendly and efficient and very helpful with answers to the usual tourists questions . The nightly wine hour is a good opportunity to socialise with other guests . There was an issue with the destination fee which was resolved promptly and efficiently by the manager . I would definitely return to this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Heads up- the restaurant is not open on Sundays. I came in on a Sunday for several days of meetings - the restaurant was closed, as are many places in the area. The hotel is lovely. The rooms are spacious - but a little dark. Lots of extras like coffee and snacks in the morning. It's just a couple blocks away from numerous restaurants.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Andaz for the 5-boro bike ride and were initially pleased with the hotel room--it was spacious, comfy, and in a great location to reach the Staten Island Ferry. When we first walked in, the laminated wood floor felt springy/spongy, but we didn't think much of it. Later, we found out why. When I took a shower, the entire bathroom floor flooded before I realized what was happening. We called the desk to ask for towels, but no one came. After we cleaned up, I informed a second staff member in person. He promptly brought up more towels, which we appreciated. I informed a third staff member upon checking out. We only want to keep other visitors informed and aware. Our stay was fine besides the flooding.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very disappointed with the hotel. The front desk personnel were not friendly and generally acted like they didn't care whether we were there. The suite we had was VERY dark and not well lit. It had no drawers for clothes storage and basically one small shelf. The bed was comfortable but the chairs and couch were old and well used. The bar and restaurant staff were very good and friendly and the food was also good.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even in the craziness of NYC- this place is quiet and comfortingThe hospitality of the staff is awesome The food is delicious and the room service is prompt .We stay here every April and December and love it each time
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in a good spot. Some rooms are a little more updated than others but rooms are very big considering it’s New York City. I hate the fact that they add this $30 destination fee per day, Which although it gives you a $10 credit per day to use in the restaurant/bar and gives you some discounts for some local attractions I think it’s kind of ridiculous. Staff was pretty friendly and a few nice touches with free coffee and even wine and cookies.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Aaron and Lazlo provided outstanding service - especially during my birthday luncheon. They provided excellent meal suggestions and even kept the restaurant open for us until the last guests left at 3 pm. The rooms are very modern and quite large. The view from our 14th floor suite was breathtaking with the East River and NYC skyline. We highly recommend the Andaz - the financial district is better than staying midtown or uptown. I’m originally from NYC currently living in the Washington DC area. I highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We attended a wedding in downtown Manhattan. I have always stayed in mid town when we visited NY. It was an eye opener to stay downtown. We enjoyed the atmosphere downtown and would consider staying at the Andaz the next time we visit.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Andaz last week for our trip to New York and everything was absolutely amazing. Check in was extremely quick and simple, the staff were always so friendly regardless of if we were just walking through reception or if we actually had a question. The location was perfect as you are close to some must see areas (statue of liberty, ground zero) but it’s also nice and quiet after a busy day sight seeing! It was so nice to leave the crowds of Times Square and get off the subway at Wall St and enjoy some of the restaurants and bars in the area (Adrienne’s is a must!) We will definitely look to stay again in the future!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was nice and easy, probably the quickest I’ve ever experienced. The room was nice but no art on the walls so it felt empty. Bathroom was nice and clean. The pillows are awful. They fell flat.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay here quite often, and the staff at Andaz always makes sure my stay is perfect, they know which rooms I like and they are always very attentive.Recently they have completed a refresh of the rooms. This included new wallcovering furnishings and carpets, the updates look great ! Thanks !
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was spacious and clean. I LOVED the hardwood floors...no carpet with creepy things crawling underneath!! Close to the wedding venue...we walked there and to several eating establishments. Highly recommend. Kyle was very nicecat check in.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed at a few different boutique-y hotels in NY, and the rooms here were much more spacious. The rooms were that of a higher-end hotel - comfortable king bed, remote black-out curtains, free non-alcoholic drinks from the mini bar, rain shower - but the price was very reasonable. Location was fine; it's in the financial district, so its a little quieter on the weekend than other neighborhoods, but you are walking distance to Battery Park, 9/11 memorial, and the ferries going to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Subway stops are close too.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came from NJ by ferry and the hotel’s proximity to Pier 11 was key. Con Ed noise on street at 1:30am was pretty bad on our first night. Second night was great. Nice to have a fridge with complimentary drinks and snacks. Would appreciate in-room coffee maker. Gym was OK, but limited in equipment.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, the accommodations surpassed my expectations. Everything was spotless, and the suite I stayed in had great views and tons of room. The hotel itself is beautiful and very conveniently located to the water taxis and subway to get to Brooklyn, which was on of the primary reasons I booked this hotel. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an OUTSTANDING stay at the Andaz hotel! We were welcomed by very kind and warm staff at the stunning reception and were impressed by the size and beauty of the room, very spacious and modern - biggest rooms in New York for sure!! We had a few meals at the restaurant and the food was delicious. Service was quick and friendly there as well. Location was awesome - close to Brooklyn beach, seaport and the observatory at 9/11 memorial. Super quick subway right to other sightseeing locations. Will be back soon and will stay at Andaz again! Thank you!!!!
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Andaz exceeded my expectations! The rooms were modern, clean and spacious. The staff members were very professional, kind and accommodating. We hosted a 30 person meeting and the food was actually very tasty. The free in-room water/snacks were helpful, too.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Andaz is well located in the financial district. Staff was very helpful and responded to our needs in a timely manner. Guest rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious by New York standards. Recommend the Andaz. - John
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Andaz is a great place to stay. I have stayed there a lot and even though I hadn't been back in almost a year, they remembered me. The hotel was updated since I stayed there last, and they were nice changes. I don't like the resort fee, but that's because since I was there for work, I couldn't take advantage of the items that came with it.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided for this hotel after looking for downtown hotels, and found this with great reviews.Was an excellent choice, great and spacious rooms, spacious bathrooms, far the best in NY, location is perfect for downtown, plenty of things to do.Staff was great, talkative and very engaged with the guests.We loved the vibe.The free amenities are a very welcome plus, sodas and snacks in the fridge, and the coffee and cookies station down in the lobby was a great touch.People talk about midtown, but midtown is way more expensive on weekend, for a better deal, we had a much better experience, and if you want to go to midtown you have subway (2 and 3) at 3 min. Walking distance, then in 15 min you are in midtown!!! Downtown is peaceful compared to midtown.This place is an hidden gem.Will be back soonThanks for all the tips received by the staff at the bar. They are great.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived we were offered an upgrade which we accepted, fabulous room, lovely bathroom/wet room, comfortable bed & furnished really well. The staff were more than friendly and helpful. Free coffee and tea 24hrs in reception area, would highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wanted 2 beds to show my son around town for a post-college job. Used Hyatt points and found this hotel. Booked 3 nights and found it to be a great base for exploring all points south of The Theater District and Brooklyn. All subways pretty much pass within 2-10 minutes of the hotel. Front desk was fantastic. Shout out to Mildred who hooked me up with a 9:00 am early check-in after a red eye flight. The shower was amazing, the beds firm and comfortable and the automatic blackout shares really cool. Could use some more places to hang things—clothes and towels—but it is manageable. Met a friend for lunch at the hotel and was pleased with the food and service. The free mini bar was a nice treat and well attended to. Would definitely stay here again. Good value; great location and attentive staff. Felt safe taking the subway back to the hotel after Midnight.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: beautiful hotel, first room smelled like cigarette smoke. but was quickly given another room and many apologies. HAving coffee available in the lobby was good, but I really would like it in the room. Free wine and cookies an unexpected pleasure.
hotelName:
19    Andaz Wall Street
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: People are clearly choosing the James Soho for its location and great par/ rooftop pool, and they are right. The bar is really cool and so is the rooftop during summer. Location is also very good, in the middle of Soho, near cool restaurants and shops.That being said, the service is far from being great, the internet connection was terrible, and the room was not as clean as expected, a lot of dust in the corners...So if you're looking for a hype hotel , well located go there! But dont expect great service...
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for one night and was upgraded to a room with an amazing view. The hotel gets the little details right with complimentary water in the room and coffee/scones in the lobby. The staff is also great — especially Bobby who checked me in!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our corner studio had nice views of the One World and was surprisingly quiet despite us being only on the 5th floor. The set-up of the rooms are nice and I always prefer a hardwood floor over carpeting. The room itself was just showing wear and tear, bathroom sink clogged etc. The Jimmy (the rooftop) is a plus and fun to visit at night.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great time! Had a great night and invited friends up to the pool for birthday festivities. Highly recommend! Drinks are expesnsive, breakfast included with my stay was not noteworthy - but I otherwise had a great time.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this place is a mess. unorganized. not clean. check in process is a nightmare. nobody has one clue as to what they're doing. they do not change the beds daily. it's overpriced. the lamp shades are falling apart.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I regret not reading through other reviews outside of five-stars lucky enough to receive night-and-day service from what we felt was very absent service, and terrible value.As others have noted experiencing, our main issues were: sound, price, value, and issues with guest staff.We looked forward to having a great time at the pool and bar, especially since we paid the SoHo fee they said enabled them to provide complimentary cocktails. No one we spoke to could give us a straight answer on how to get them. One gentleman (we'll call him G, since providing names isn't one of James Hotel's strong suits) said we'd have to purchase a platter. Nothing in the booking said we had to purchase anything to receive the free welcome cocktail. In fact, the $40/night fee was paired with them saying we'd get a few things in return (that we never did).Funnily, G was standing right next to another person (manager?) after we brought it (and other items) to their intention. The manager said we were misinformed. When we noted the person standing right next to him literally just told us about the required pre-purchase, G just looked away and shrugged his shoulders.For the price, the room is very small even by NYC standards. While it notes floor to ceiling windows, they mean feet-above-the-floor-to-ceiling. Which is probably a good thing, considering they have the worst sound insulation (if any) of any place in NYC. The old surge protector on the night stand and randomly unplugged devices (lamp, iHome) were a nice touch. Do not go by what you see in the pictures.We were excited about the idea of hitting the pool. Maybe we accidentally booked on a birthday for teenagers, but it was hardly possible when even getting to our *room* was met with battling the crowds of teens / kids? on the elevators. There was a female apparently trying to operate the elevators, and she let us on eventually when the pool party attendants were set. So nice of them to let guests into their rooms!Had hoped for a more mature, fun bar pool setting versus what felt like an open pool in the middle of the day for teenagers, but that's not necessarily the hotel's fault. I understand that the pool/ bar area aren't the responsibility of the hotel (they made that abundantly clear when we addressed some of the issues with them). Ultimately, the noise became unbearable. We tolerated the first night because we checked in so late. The noise was especially intense late evening. We recorded what sounds like grinding and shifting. The second night added sounds of glasses dropping and scratching. Hoping it was just from construction or the bar and would fade, it actually woke us up the next morning.When we brought some of the issues we had in the evening, the manager said he was sorry, that they couldn't control what happened with the bar or other noise. During construction, hotels usually provide earplugs or a warning. At the James, it's apparently just not their issue. To the manager's credit, he did offer to upgrade us when we said we planned to leave (we were scheduled to stay for 3 additional days). But at that point, the noise was only one of a variety of issues. We checked out first thing the next morning (thanks, early AM noises, for making sure of that!).I almost raised the review to two-stars, because our last experience with the hotel was with a doorman we hadn't seen at that point, who was polite, prompt, and helpfully opened the doors for us and assisted with our luggage as we left. We told him that alone was night and day from everything else we'd received.The total cost for two nights was almost $1000. For that much, we could have stayed on Park Ave. with better food, better bars, no kids, no noise, and better entertainment. In fact, we got all of that at the next hotel for (much) less near Park Ave!If it weren't for the room making such a terrible first impression, and various staff (especially G) giving us the runaround, we might have stayed through our scheduled booking. Of course there will be weekends where noise and non-guests will be a factor in any hotel, especially one that's open to the public. But the cost, lack of ownership by (most, not all) of the staff, and lack of amenities just don't add up.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well situated but it has a big default and it was a big disppointement : the roof top and the pool close very early (2pm in the we and 4pm in the week) for "parties". When you have children and teens you have no access it's really a pity for the price and because the view is beautiful from there. No breakfast service only room service expeansive and not taken over quickly.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place, very clean, professional staff. Affordable and within walking distance of several great places to eat and shop. Roof top bar and pool are very nice. Pool is a little small but wasn’t crowded. Nice views from the roof top bar, good drinks.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel looks nice on the inside and the views from the a Penthouse are breathtaking. However, they may still be completing construction renovations, as a loud disruptive noise kept us awake. Also, the food service is slow and of poor value, if you can order at all. We received cold food after waiting over a hour and were told the next morning room service would be over a hour wait. This establishment really needs to make sure the staff and service provided matches the rates they’re asking customers to pay for rooms.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived we were immediately greeted by Johnny and Bobby. We had such a wonderful check in experience, these guys were extremely genuine and helpful, they made us feel right at home. We were given an upgrade, which was completely unexpected, but highly appreciated. Our room was a beautiful corner room with amazing views of the city. The gym was a bit small but it had everything needed for a great work out with great views of the city, I truly enjoyed my morning workouts. They provide cold water and fresh towels. The roof top has a pool with amazing views. Overall our stay was great, we were there for 6 nights and we did not want to leave.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We reserved the Penthouse Suite for my husband’s 50th birthday. The music system was not working as there was no adapter. We wanted to invite friends over but we were unable to play music. So there went our birthday party. They finally put an adapter in our room at the end of the night but we couldn’t use it because went out to dinner. Earlier in the day, they also kicked us out of the pool area stating that someone else has reserved the seats we were on. Also, the blinds in the apartment were electronic and not functioning. The furniture and decor was very dated. On of the shower drains didn’t drain at all and flooded the bathroom floor. For what we paid—$2000 this was all a huge let down and dampened our experience. We told the manager Alex—and he was cordial— he only offered to take off $200 from the stay and also breakfast. But I think that we should have been refunded more (like pay for a regular room rate of $300-400). We were really unhappy and I am going to take it up with my credit card company. Will not go back.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the heart of soho ultramodern and fabulous the roof top has a great lounge with little pool room are very modern clean and light The lobby are is very nicely decorated and offer computers coffe and snacks I enjoyed my stay very much
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so blown away with my stay here. I found the room to be decent sized for NY with great views. The location is awesome with access to the subway and the greenway. I didn't get a chance to try the onsite dining but there are some great food options not far away! Great night sleep - will return! (The front desk staff were super nice - always a plus.)
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Angelique and Leslie were so very helpful when I stopped them to ask for information! They were kind and helpful and I was so thankful for their kindness! Even when seeing them again in passing, they made me feel so welcome and at home! What a great experience for my first time to NYC!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling for business but brought my wife along for evening in the city. The staff here was amazing. The bellman down stairs, I think Kenny and Wayne, could not have been friendly and helpful. We unfortunately had to drive in and they brought our car up early to prevent us from being charged another day for the extra hour we were there. Natalie at the front desk was also wonderful. We had a corner king room and the view was amazing. The room was small but typical for NYC. The shower was really nice though. The roof top pool and bar are an added bonus. The chairs up there are comfortable and it was nice for my wife to hang out there while I was working. On the weekends they have a pool party starting at 3PM. My wife and I went up and had a great time, but if you are not into that scene you may want to avoid and request a room on a lower floor. You could hear the music down the elevator shaft several floors. It didn't bother us, but I could see how some would be bothered.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is great in all the ways that count. Clean, great service but the extra touch was an awesome dude named Eric working there. Apart from just being a nice guy to talk to for a few minutes, he gave me great and most of all honest recommendations to places to eat and things to do during my 2 day stay. All in all a great place to stay but the great service from Eric made it a tad better than the competition!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am not sure where to begin....This place is amazing and with a professional staff and a great atmosphere. Let’s begin with the staff, a huge shoutout to Yu-On, Sasha, Mavis, Christina, Shefi, Johnni and even the pool boy, Michael. Wow what a team they have. These guys went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable even thought I was there for only 2 nights. The room was clean and pretty spacious for SoHo. This place has everything that one needs, a great rooftop bar, Jimmy’s, great staff, clean rooms and is closely located to the train. Thank you guys for a great stay and see ya soon!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had another amazing stay at The James, SoHo! The location, views, and rooftop pool at this hotel are unbeatable. Hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and we could even talk to the front desk via text message. Will definitely be back again!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cool location, modern, good food, well meaning staff. But this hotel is not at the top of its game. Room was not well policed before I moved in, toilet missing a part, front entrance is not well staffed, took 2 days to notify me that I had a FedEx delivery. Staff is pleasant, but it all seems sorta of haphazard. A great hotel is about attention to the details. The James needs to sharpen up its game and focus on the details.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great week at the hotel, staff accommodating, roof top was the extra treat with great views, music and staff. Rooms are spacious enough, some rework was done on the top floor and the gym needs some attention but overall great stay
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travel to NYC with some frequency and love to stay in the SoHo area, so thought we would give The James a try. It is in an excellent location, has amazing rooftop views, the beds are very comfortable and the heated bathroom floor is a definite bonus. We had a 6th floor corner king, so, while the sunlight was great, we weren’t able to take in the views the higher floors offer. (We requested a higher floor but none were available.). The wine and cheese are a nice touch and the cookies and scones are amazing!!!! Unfortunately, this is where the greatness seems to end. For a 4-5 star hotel, they miss the mark on service. The hotel is VERY focused on the rooftop bar and almost seems to let the hotel and hotel guests take a back seat. After 5 pm it is near impossible to take an elevator to your room - especially if trying to catch one on the lobby (2nd floor). You are better to go to the ground floor to go up and hope you aren’t pushed out of the way by rooftop patrons. The hotel seems very understaffed with one person working the lobby area/registration desks, rarely a doorman or concierge to be found. The room was small, but to be expected in NYC. We had a very slow sink drain that was finally repaired after repeated requests - on the third of a four day stay. Worse, housekeeping never cleaned the residue from the slow drain. Walls are scuffed, curtain stained and a lot of dust and dirt build up on floor boards. There was a nice floor lamp - if you wanted to plug/unplug as needed. We could hear the guests above us every time they walked across the floor. tv would occasionally lose cable/satellite connection and you couldn’t access guest services etc.Unfortunately, this one did not live up to our expectations. Perhaps they were too high given the website and our past experiences with James hotels? Go for the location/views/rooftop party. Don’t stay for the attention to detail of a finer hotel or to expect top notch service.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The James Soho is a conveniently located, stylish, modern hotel. You can walk to the West Village, Greenwich village, Downtown, Lower East Side, and many subway stops. My wife and I are walkers so the location was a huge plus for us. If you want to shop till you drop, there are many many places nearby to spend $$$$. The hotel: Enjoyed the views from the rooftop. There’s a bar, indoor seating area, wading pool, and outdoor seating as well. Hallways and public areas look well maintained and clean. Large windows surround the lobby which brings in a lot of light. The design throughout the hotel is definitely modern but there are lots of warm tones that add a “homey” feeling to the spaces. Service: The door guys are really helpful. When we checked in they held our bags until our room was ready. Every time we needed a cab, they got one for us in a jiffy. Need an umbrella? They can also get those for you. Front desk staff were quick, efficient, and friendly. They gave us complimentary drink tickets so we went up to the rooftop bar and had some drinks while we waited for our room. We didn’t do room service or needed a valet so I can’t speak to those services. The room: We booked a suite with a separate living area and bedroom. It was very spacious and well appointed. The view from the 16th floor was stunning. Although we enjoyed our stay, there’s definitely room for improvement. On arrival, there were several issues with the room (housekeeping and engineering related). I won’t list them here because it was properly dealt with. I would say the room could use a refresh - couch pillows look worn, the bed was too lumpy and soft, and power strips behind the side tables are not efficient (don’t like reaching behind to plug things in!)Overall we really enjoyed our stay but we did encounter various issues with the room (which were acknowledged and resolved by the hotel staff).
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a short trip and unfortunately did not take advantage of all the amenities (sad). However, the room was really nice and the heated floor was an AWESOME touch. The only issue I had with the room was the lack of visible/available plugs. They were buried/invisible behind heavy curtains so you didn’t have the option of plugging it in comfortably by the bed/on both bed stands. Small thing that certainly didn’t take away from the overall experience. Most importantly, I was there for a post engagement celebration and Kris at the front desk was very accommodating to help us celebrate, she was awesome and I’m very appreciative she was able to work with me on such short notice (there was a miscommunication so we had to act quick). It really added to the whole weekend and I couldn’t have done it without her. It’s reasons like these that will bring me back to the The James Soho. Thank you!!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the James soho! It is a beautiful hotel—the amenities are great and Gitano’s is such a fab addition. Definitely recommend if you’re looking to stay in the Soho area. If you’re lucky, Bobby will be at the front desk to assist you—he’s a gem! So happy I stayed here.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location but difficult to get to due to one-way streets and limited parking. Room are very trendy but a little small. Bathrooms enclosed by glass and it limits privacy in room. Nice staff but you have to navigate bar patrons trying to get to rooftop.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dishonest pricing with initialBooking and final billing. Same goes for breakfast included? We did exactly what they said and ordered the breakfast they offered but they only comped part of it, that was not explained. The price is not worth the quality at all; the only reason we stayed was because of the pool and the pool staff was rude and inconsiderate the whole time and treating us like we were just random people not paying customers probably because we didn’t look rich enough.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at The James for 5 days and it was amazing. First, they had our room ready when we arrived at 8am. This was huge because we wanted to shower and start exploring. The staff was really friendly and went beyond to make you feel at home.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, with luxury amenities, rooftop bar and pool. Staff friendly and accommodating. Complimentary coffee and snacks all day. Complimentary wine served 2 hours in the evenings nice compared to 1 hour at similar hotels
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel need a remodel including its staff who let the phone ring endlessly at guest services. Everyone is slow and requires multiple calls to get anything done. Everyone acts bothered when you ask for something. And don’t both getting a drink in the roof. You’ll be greeted with nothing but attitude.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with awesome amenities (morning scones, evening wine and cheese). Also love the rooftop bar. Stay here every time I come in for work. Service is phenomenal, they go the extra mile - Kris & Bobby are legends!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you so much for the amazing hospitality and the wonderful accomodation! Super location @Gitano and @lobbythejames!Kris and Bobby are the best! We’ll be back here . Although the rain, sun is shining @thejames
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service here is exceptional but the rooms need to be completely renovated. We were woken up at 8:00 by banging on the floors in the room directly above us which is ridiculous why we were put in that particular room to begin with. It was a Wednesday night so it wasn't sold out that's for sure. The location is great and they have a wonderful rooftop bar but this was the second time we tried this place and both times we were very dissatisfied.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Disappointed stay with poor service No effort to make client happyVery small gym room for such a big hotelEven no umbrella while it was raining and the personnel claiming the management knew the day before that it will be missing...Amazing and surprising way of welcoming clientsWould unfortunately never come back again
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at The James now a number of times; Chris and Tyrell at the front desk always making my stay glorious, as well as Kenny downstairs taking care of the car and my bags. 10/10 would stay againThanks guys!M
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel.Staff very exceptional and friendly.Check out the roof bar (Jimmy’s)Wont be disappointed.Great location.Bar food at Jimmy’s also tasty.Easy walk to local bars and restaurants.Giving a true feel of the non tourist New York.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel, great location, excellent value for money would definitely stay here again and recommend to others. Friendly staff who couldn't do enough for you checking in process was very easy very happy with my overall stay.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are OK. The hotel overlooks a very busy road hence traffic noise in lower rooms and upper rooms have VERY loud bar . You get charged a $40 facilities fee each night which is a hidden cost and apparently to cover free coffee/wine that's offered early evening, neither of which I had but was still made to pay this ridiculous charge. There are much better hotels in the same area.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had 3 days here for work, it was a great location, lovely rooms. Most of all the staff were incredibly helpful. Special shout out to Yu-On who helped me print stuff, and generally made me feel like nothing was too much for him. I will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Took my wife into the City for her first Mother's Day. Natalie and her team rolled out the red carpet and gave her an incredible VIP experience. It was very relaxing and such a wonderful experience. Can't wait to be back.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here is amazing and so welcoming. From the moment I checked in to getting extra wine during their free happy hour, their staff is SO friendly. The beds are super comfy and the rooms are nice and updated. There is even a facemask in the mini bar! They also offer free coffee and scones in the AM and free wine and cheese during happy hour. All lovely.However, it pains me to knock off stars because of the above aforementioned positives, but the walls in this hotel are so thin. I know it’s NYC, but I kept hearing random doors slamming and loud building noises all night long. Early in the morning I could hear an annoyingly loud dude screaming into his cell phone for a half hour, not even sure if he was in the room next to me or above me. You can hear every single person walking by your door at all hours. If you are a light sleeper/easily bothered by noise, this likely isn’t the hotel for you. If you love amenities, a cool location with awesome dining/rooftop bar, and can sleep through anything, you’ll be in good shape here.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay at the James !!! Location is perfect, room size is on the smaller side but it’s soho and the room has everything you need. Restaurant on site doesn’t really match with the hotel but it’s nice. Rooftop is beautiful but best part of the hotel is the staff. I met Cristina during wine hour and she was super sweet and knowledgeable about the hotel and area. Leidy and Mavis checked me out and they too were super sweet. I wish I got the name of the person that cleaned my room, they too deserve credit. Look forward to my next stay and will recommend to my business partners.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chris & Natalie offer amazing service and great hotel with amazing roof top bar and swimming pool and great corner room at hotel. Roof top bar serves awesome cocktails with great bar snacks and service from all staff
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As frequent business traveler. It feels good to stay at a hotel without being a Bon Voy member that treats its guest like Titanium members regardless. Kris, and Natalie treated me great. Will be back soon!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Always love staying here, our 4th stay in NYC. Smart, well presented rooms, and great service. The front desk is ready to accommodate requests , in particular Jose Martinez. Tea coffee in the morning and Wine and cheese in the evening is a great touch in the buzzing Lobby.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so confused traveling from outside the city, but kris was able to direct me to the best places to eat/drink in SOHO, my trip would have been a bust without her. If i could give more stars I would.THANK YOU!!!!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: had a great stay sleep with the windows open listening to the sounds of the city. The front desk staff member Kris she was very sweet. The manager Terill was very helpful when I ask to change my reservation
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whenever I come to NY for a shot holiday or a long week- end I stay at the James. The rooms and the facilities are great and the staff goes a long way to make you feel at home. Terrill and Kris have been great un taking care of me last time I was there in May.Thank you!
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our stay st the James Soho. Rooms were well appointed and positioned in a great spot in soho. The rooftop bar (jimmys) was awesome aswell. The staff were always willing to assist and super friendly.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are elements of this hotel which are great - it's in a great location, it's nicely designed, some of the staff are very friendly..However, the receptionists seem to be chosen for whether they look cool rather than how efficient they are...I was waiting for packages to be delivered which one particular lady swore blind hadn't come when they had - a simple check with the post room would have clarified this so I had to check out of the hotel without them having waited for an hour and half in reception for a courier who had already been..The same lady was actually standing next to deliveries when I arrived and also said nothing had come..The shower also smelled unpleasantly of damp ..To credit the hotel they have sent me the deliveries but since I live in another country this is not ideal..For the prices of this hotel charges I would expect a far higher level of service and I will not be back...
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kris and Terril were terrific at the front desk. Wonderful views - a must stay while in NYC. Close to Soho and great italian restaurants. The rooftop bar is lots of fun and we really appreciated the help from the staff.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First they couldn't find my reservation. I had to wait half an hour, though they knew I was coming around 11 PM and that I had been travelling from Europe, tired and with a kid. Then my room wasn't ready. I had requested a room for 2 adults and a kid with enough space, the extra bed wasn't there , and there was no space to circulate in the room at all, we had to jump over the beds. We had to wait till 1AM to go to sleep. then no breakfast restaurant, only in dinning poor breakfast...But no space to eat in the room, we sat on the beds...Room not even correctly cleaned...staff not helpful. Horrible experience we left after 24 hours. Do not go this is terrible place pretending to be 4 stars, must be a joke.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at The James Soho on many occasions and it’s always a good time. The hotel is in walking distance to Tribeca, Soho and Chinatown plus it’s a short walk to the subway. So many great restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are traveling to NYC The James is an absolute must. We travel to the City often from upstate NY, both for business, and pleasure. We used to stay at another place in town, until we found The James. We decided on a whim to give this place a try, and had no idea that we would make it our new home away from home.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From check in to check out, everything was great. The property has a chic and elegant feel with lots of things to do within one building. The cafe, restaurant, and bars are all great places to hangout depending on your mood. The staff is very kind and helpful. Kris was great during my check in and stay! I will definitely come back here and encourage my NY friends to visit the rooftop and restaurant.
hotelName:
20    The James New York SoHo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriends and I spent 5 days at the WestHouse hotel for our all girls’ getaway trip. What a lovely place!!! Everyone was so friendly and helpful especially Petr, the General Manager. He was always very helpful to us. It was our first trip to NYC and the whole staff made it very easy for us to enjoy our time in the city. The hotel was very clean. We enjoyed the free delicious buffet breakfast. It was always nice to come back to our clean rooms after a busy shopping day and evening dinner parties. We love it!!! Thank you so much! We are planning to come back again and will stay at the WestHouse.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very pleasurable stay at the Westhouse for our first trip to NYC. We decided to stay here due to the extras that the hotel provides and the proximity to Central Park, 7th Ave Subway and 5th Ave shopping all being very close by. It is customary for many Hotels in NYC to charge a residency and city tax on top of your room rate and is done due to governing forces - however the Westhouse actually gives back to their guests by offering daily breakfast, an evening meal with wine, beer or bubbles and offers wifi, telephone calls and bottled water all as part of the enforced taxes. Many hotels do not offer any of these extras but still enforce the tax.We also found the price for a suite was very impressive. Having searched through many websites looking for a good hotel, the Westhouse suite was by far the best offer we came across coming in at the same price as many standard queen rooms offered by other hotels.Our suite, on the 22nd floor consisted of a seperate lounge and dressing area, a full size wardrobe, 2 tv's, kingsize bedroom and a bathroom all well decorated and well appointed. The bed and pillows being extremely comfortable and the room very quiet. We were glad to be on the 22nd floor as we did not experience any traffic noise, just the distant ever present hum and car horns that one may expect in the city that never sleeps. Concierge was very helpful suppling us with maps, tips and hints about what NY has to offer the first timer.The rooms are serviced daily and a turn down service is offered.All the staff are friendly and welcoming and do their best to make sure that your stay is one to remember.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our 3rd visit to the WestHouse Hotel and each time we stay it feels just like our home. You will not go wrong with this hotel. A completely awesome staff, perfect location, amazing rooms and the 23rd floor Terrace lounge with great food and evening wine & cheese reception is an absolute bonus. We’d highly recommend the WestHouse to anyone visiting NYC
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived after traveling 19 hours we finally arrived at the westhouse hotel and was greeting with a large smile by the woman on reception who asked how we were and how our travel was. (It’s the little things)Hotel room- lovely and perfect size!Staff- lovely and very helpful5-7pm all inclusive drinks- keep them flowing.Food- lovelyLocation- honestly it was just perfect. 5 minutes from Central Park, Fifth Avenue Times Square and Broadway. The hotel is also located right next to a subway so handy to get to and from places.The only issue (which wasn’t he hotels fault... more the company I booked through) was the hotel/service tax. If it makes you feel better (the readers) you get your money’s worth with the all inclusive drinks, food and amazing service! Can’t wait to stay here again!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a long flight and a dreadful ride to the city from JFK arriving at the hotel at Midnight, there was Kathy to greet me. She was warm and welcoming. The hotel charges a hotel fee for the breakfast and "indulgences" in the evening. This minor cost is nothing compared with what you get in return. The full breakfast with everything you can think of especially the mini NY Bagels is delicious. In the evening its even better. The location is right where you want to be, the MTA is right out the door at 57&7th ave. The metro card is easy to purchase and much cheaper than a cab (they have gotten very expensive) The team at the hotel do everything to make your trip enjoyable. The concierge also was a god sent..
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous hotel in a great area, you have plenty of options down and across the street. Central to Time Square and a few blocks from Central Park. Plenty of stores to visit while walking down the street. Good room, late check out. The service from the staff was excellent. I'll make sure to stay here again next time I'm in the area.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: NYC is known for great service, but Westhouse team really take it to the next level. Highly conscientious staff that took care of my stay from the minute I checked and to the minute when I was helped with my bags into the car. I was even asked if I wanted water for my trip back.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The amazing thing about WestHouse is that every visit feels like a true coming home. We really appreciate the care we are given each time. The service is palpable from the cleaning staff to the highest level of management. We wanted to specifically recognize Sharon, who cleaned our room with love and attention and was attentive to all details. As always, we recognize Tarik Boukhari for his endless hard work and his personal attention - he is a priceless employee with a radiant smile. We appreciate Ashley for helping us check-in in a timely fashion.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A somewhat last minute work trip brought me back to NYC for a few days and back to my favorite place I went! I really do just love this hotel. Ashley at the front desk is a darling. So, so welcoming. She always remembers me! And Christian too. Always just super helpful with getting up all of my work stuff. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are so clean which I love. Housekeeping definitely does a great job - I come back to a fresh clean room - and I’m kind of a tornado when I leave for my meetings. Also, their complimentary wine reception at night..for that reason alone this is literally my favorite place ha ha! Absolutely the best hotel in NY. Thanks again for a wonderful trip Westhouse!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed in a suite at this wonderful hotel next to Carnegie Hall and near Central Park. Juan the manager quickly took care of a minor matter when we checked in. Ashley was very engaging and helpful throughout our four day stay. Then there was William the bartender originally from Cali,Columbia.He had my wife and adult son in tears with laughter with his stories. The WestHouse was spotless. The breakfast and afternoon "snack" were very good. Our rooms were rather large for New York.They were certainly comfortable. Would not hesitate to stay there again.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay at the Westhouse for work frequently and it is a great location, always clean and the staff is pleasant. Rooms near the elevator can be loud at night but otherwise it's a great spot. Very close to Times Square, Carnegie Hall and lots of restaurants.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my 7th stay at this hotel and I am always amazed by the kind, helpful very friendly stuff that works there. I love the continental breakfast every morning with so many choices. Love the location.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great location and the staff goes beyond and above. Special shout out to Ashley and Ben, the extras make this the best deal in NYC! Included in your stay is a full breakfast and heavy appetizers from 5-7pm.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the staff, extremely friendly and helpful. Juan, the hotel manager, had great suggestions for our trip. Other staff members, Moe ,Ashley, and Kathy were so nice to deal with.The concierges floor was the best idea yet! The complimentary breakfast had a fabulous selection of all types of hot and cold items for a yummy, filling meal plus delicious coffee.The cocktail hours also had a large assortment of food...even great cooked veggies for vegans! I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room that I had was a Luxury King, on the 19th floor. It was much nicer than I had attended. Wonderful view. My only issue during my duration of the trip is that the walls are paper thin. You can hear EVERYTHING! There was a family next to me with screaming kids up all night, and on the other side I could hear thing that were a bit R RATED. I know the hotel can only do so much, and are unable to reconstruct the walls for my liking, but never had this problem in any other 5 star hotel. It was like they were in my room. I’m not a complaining person, so I never took my option to call the lobby to see if they could do anything. That’s why I’m keeping my 5 star rating, cause I know they would’ve, but I didn’t take the opportunity. The staff was beyond professional too. Beyond that, the decor was stunning in the room and everywhere around the hotel. The breakfast is nice too.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 4 nights post cruise and it was great from check in to check out. We arrived early, having notified the hotel in advance. To find one of our rooms was ready. We then dropped all our luggage in the one room until they notified us when the other room was ready.The staff were helpful and pleasant. We jammed the safe and within 10 minutes of reporting it someone had come up to open it for us. We were expecting continental style breakfast so was surprised to find Scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon available. As well as cereal/toast etc.Coffee machine and soda were available throughout the day free of charge. Also, was surprised to find happy hour included a light meal & wine/beer all included in the resort tax. we were expecting snacks, but this was more than that.Having been advised that the resort tax was higher at this hotel we certainly felt that it was worth it for the extras we had.We chose the hotel for its proximity to Central Park. The subway was steps away from the front door for easy access to Battery Park & other sites. Just make sure you don't get on the express.On our last day the hotel arranged a taxi for us to the airport and stored our luggage until we left.Not sure but we never had a turndown service in the evening, not sure if we should have or not. But this didn't bother us.My DH celebrated his birthday here and the hotel left a bottle of wine and chocolates in the room for him. Which was a special added touch for his special day.Can't comment on the Gym as we didn't use it.Overall we had a fantastic stay and if we returned to New York would stay here again.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This top class, luxuries hotel situated in the heart of Manhattan is the perfect spot whether travelling for work or pleasure. All staff are friendly professional and take an active interest in the hotel experience of each guest, which made my stay at the West House memorable. It is easy to see how a hotel can be of such a high calibre when you meet the managing director, Mr Don Fraser, whose attention to detail and inviting personality sets the bar high for any hotel wishing to even compete. He went beyond the call of duty to ensure my stay at the West House exceeded expectations. All of this and I haven't even mentioned the exquisite rooms, great hotel amenities, perfect location to times, square, central park, Columbus circle and subway stations. If you are considering choosing the daily access to the lounge level, trust me, you will not look back or regret it. All in all, I will be staying here the next time I am in the city.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: from first greeting by Vanessa at desk, Ben's help as concierge and the wait staff in bar and 23rd fl. dining everyone to housekeepers was cordial, initiated greeting and follow though graciously with assistance when needed. The location was ideal for seeing shows, museums, getting subway and walking to central park. Petr, GM was personable, relaxed and informative. All the best to add to our comfort and experience. Did I mention quiet?:, no street noise, spacious room well appointed for our needs.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love the Westhouse hotel! I rarely return to a hotel more than once and am very picky but I just returned there for a second time. Quiet room and great free breakfast (cappuccino machine!!!) and they provide a light dinner at happy hour every night which is quite good and is perfect if you are seeing a show. The staff is amazing - friendly, helpful, and devoted to making sure you are happy.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the WestHouse for 3 nights in June - we would stay there again. Great location near Central Park, Carnegie Hall, 57th St subway. Rooms well set up, good desk are, hotel rooms on higher floors so quiet for NYC. Front desk and concierge staff very helpful. Good buffet breakfast and cocktail hour food and drinks.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got this hotel through Hotwire. It has an upscale feel. Comfortable beds and linens. Hot shower. Refrigerator in rooms. Complimentary Happy hour and continental breakfast included. I was pumping breast milk and they stored it in a freezer for me overnight. Very accommodating staff. It is completely under exterior construction right now, so views outside the rooms were hindered.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would expect a five star hotel to not have maids carts stationed permanently in the corridors as its unsightly and a risk in emergencies. The making up of the room was a bit random; sometimes we had enough towels, sometimes not and definitely not enough toiletries for two people! Stains on the carpet, and on the mirror, no stationery and no room information or room service and it took half an hour for ice to be delivered to our room. No duvet cover just sheets either side of the duvet, which became especially irritating. No vegetarian choices for dinner on occasions in the 'happy hour' service. No slippers or gowns as you would expect as standard in a five star hotel and especially as one of the "Small Luxury Hotels of the World" - worn and a bit tatty in general.However, the hotel is positioned conveniently close to a Subway station and within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park and the beds were comfy!The 'Bell Boys' were especially nice as were the waiters, although the maids we encountered were standoffish and rude. Unfortunately scaffolding was up at the front of the hotel during our stay which we were not informed about when we booked and it ruined any view we might have had.There is a great bar just across the street and a half decent deli as well.This hotel was basically clean and comfy enough for a short stay just not worthy of the money we paid or 5 stars!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is gorgeous and the staff is so lovely. My room is beautiful and my window looks right over Carnegie Hall which I absolutely love. The bathroom is stunning, and I love that you get a light breakfast in the morning and a light dinner between five and seven. What a gem in the middle of mid town! Close to everything. Fantastic service. The entire staff is so courteous and lovely. They upgraded my room which was very nice, and I was given a drink ticket. It’s the little extra touches like this that make me happy. Customer service is not dead. The decor is chic and classy. The whole place has a European vibe and reminds me of Paris or Rome. I love it! It’s going to be my go to place now when I come to New York.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We made a reservation at the Westhouse because my sister has stayed there and said it is a bit more private than it's sister hotel and worth the extra money. We did not feel our stay lived up to that. The GOOD: It was very quiet, and everyone with whom we dealt was pleasant. To assure reduced city noise, we requested a "courtyard" view which we knew would be an air shaft, but it was a very large and nice air shaft, and on the 25th floor, just 1 floor below the sky. We didn't hear other guests when they were in their rooms. Our room was tastefully furnished and the drawers of the dresser were very clean. The BAD: Our king size bed was actually on a queen frame (no box spring) so it was rather uncomfortable. I was pretty amazed when I noticed this in the morning after sleeping on it. That explains all the bedding coming untucked from the sides overnight...The bathroom was really tiny. 5'x5' with a 2'x2.5' alcove for the sink. As the door opened into the bathroom, you had to either open the door fully while pressing back against the toilet or scrunch into the alcove with the sink to get the door by you. The LED lights in the bathroom flickered (except the one over the sink). The flickering gave both my wife and me headaches.There was no full-length mirror in the room. The one mirror that could have worked had a little unusable shelf-like projection at the bottom, which blocked the view of my ankles and feet. There were no bathrobes in the room. Although I realize this is somewhat of an extravagance, the hotel had been promoted as "luxury" so we expected that. Probably not the hotel's fault but we expected a higher class of people than the inebriated (sounding) people talking loudly and for quite a while beginning at 2;30 AM right outside our door.Finally: valet parking--they should warn guests it will be approximately 25 minutes to retrieve their car, so the guests can plan appropriately.And one complaint against many NYC hotels - they tout "free" breakfast and cocktail hours but charge a mandatory $49/person/day to cover that. Please just add that to the room fee to accurately list the room price.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked the option to have early dinner at the hotel, but very early! Rooms are nice butBathroom are very small. During the night I have listened some noise and I have waked up with the air conditioning turned off. I guess it is normal for the hotel but it was very warm for me. I have chosen this hotel because of my office distance.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 6 nights in May and spent so much time sightseeing and did not spend much time in the room but the complimentary breakfast and evening appetizers and drinks were great before going out. All of the staff we talked to were very helpful and pleasant including the staff that looked after the evening appetizers. The food was always replaced promptly when needed. Housekeeping was also excellent. Lighting in the room could have been a bit brighter but had lots of light from the outside (had an exterior facing room with nice view of surrounding buildings).
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights with my husband, it was our first trip to the big Apple.Ok! We arrived at check in and had no help with our bags, even tho I did request it! After a while my husband jus said it’s ok we’ll handle it! Got to the room and I must say this hotel is NO 5 star I’m not even sure I’d give it a 4 star as it’s so tired and we found dust everywhere not jus that the mirrors were stained. Lighting was quite dim, for us ladies who do make up. We had so many issues as one evening there was no Shower gel replacement and no shower floor towel, also no face towel replaced. I did complain about it at the desk but was told to come back and see a manager, why should I see the manager? He should find us and speak to us or leave a note in our room. Not very professional at all as I’ve stayed in so many 5 star hotels and not had this treatment. We drank at the Den cocktail bar and service was great the first night! But the next day it was really bad, the same bar tender was sooo miserable it put us off our drink. Jus don’t go to the Den as so many amazing bars who appreciate your custom. One of our faves was Living room in Time square.The only positives I have about this place is that the breakfast was good quality and the cocktail hour was good! But don’t forget we allPay for that anyway so it’s not complimentary as they tell you before you book. All in all we had a great time! But don’t be fooled, book somewhere else.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has it all, beauty, chic, location, amazing service and beautiful rooms with amazing extras. Me and my wife just enjoyed our second stay at this hotel. We first visited from the UK when we were engaged in 2017, our stay that time was perfect. Our second time was as husband and wife and the hotel was just as good as before, if not more appreciated.If you are visiting NY as a tourist or a business trip the hotel is ideally situated, there is an Underground station about 15 seconds from the hotel and Central Park is a 3 minute walk and Times Square a 6 minute walk. The staff work exceptionally hard to make your stay enjoyable, and the decor and smell of the hotel is amazing. The ‘hours of indulgence’ from 1700 - 1900 is essentially a happy hour, where you have access to unlimited alcohol and soft drinks as well as amazing food which is easily an evening meal if you choose it to be. This is all included within the price.The breakfast has a great selection and is also included in the price and really sets you up for your day of business or exploring. The hotel has a great gym and many of the rooms offer a fantastic view of Manhattan.New York is a magical city, with an energy I have seldom experienced anywhere else, the Westhouse Hotel is the cherry on the top, it’s a genuine 5 star hotel with class and chic and the hotel goes above and beyond to make your trip perfect. You need to stay here, you won’t be disappointed.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family just loves everything about the WestHouse, from the location to the room decor and how they keep the hotel so beautifully clean! The employees are by far the best I have met at a hotel from how friendly they are to helping you find the best way on the subway routes. I would like to mention some people that stand out with going above and beyond with helping my family. Juan, Vanessa, Ashley, Nick, Tarek, Jason, Kathy, Moe, Ethan, Anthony, Tom, Rafael, Hamza and Raymonde! THE BEST STAFF! We are definitely coming back to stay again soon.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First stay at the WestHouse. Won't be the last. It started with Kathy at the front desk (who couldn't have done more to make my stay comfortable) and set the bar for the whole time. Great culture across the board, including housekeeping and Raphael at the bar. And of course the room was really lovely! Congrats!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for for a quick get away and it was amazing. The dark theme of the lobby is breathtaking. Did I mention complimentary daily breakfast and dinner with champagne and wine?The only thing I didn't like about the hotel is the entrance’s proximity to the street.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel and fantastic staff. Overall a very nice experience and a good concept. Good services, nice beds and clean rooms.Special thanks to fantastic bartender Rafael and his great Mumm champagne.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second visit to Westhouse Hotel in New York for business. The staff has been accommodating and friendly. Tarik at the front desk specifically made a previous circumstance during my stay even better the next visit and even remembered the inconvenience despite it happening months prior.The rooms are clean, comfortable and modern. I look forward to continuing my business and personal travels here.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Westhouse is a 1920’s style boutique hotel with a fantastic location! The rooms were small but well appointed and very comfortable. Walk to Central Park, a Broadway play and Times Square. Steps from the subway too!The best part was the attentive staff. Vanessa at the front desk was sweet and helpful. Raphael at the bar made you feel like he had known you forever! Make sure to ask him for an Italian Margarita... the best!!!The evening happy hour was much more than expected. You could actually make it dinner. The breakfast was also very good.The only con... for such an upscale hotel I hated seeing the housekeeping carts/vacuums being stored in the hallways all night. (They did cover them since there was nowhere to put them.)A definite recommendation!!!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last night in NYC before going back to France. Wonderful experience : juste a one night stay and yet a great expérience.Thanks to Mo, Tarek (at front desk) and Ben (concierge). We will return with pleasure.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you have staff at a hotel that remembers you post check-in that shows another level of service and understanding of its customers. Tarik in particular was lovely and very welcoming, all other staff I interacted with were also great. The hotel offers extras such as breakfast and early evening canapés/drinks also adds to the experience, thus I have made the WestHouse my go to when I travel to NY. The hotel ticks a lot of boxes from a travellers perspective,
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were treated very well especially by Tarik at the front desk and Juan, the manager. They assisted us in getting the lovely room we wanted. We loved the close proximity to Central Park and the theaters. Having delicious breakfasts and light dinners there saved us lots of money and time because we went to the theater each night and didn't want to eat heavy beforehand. Can't wait to return there again.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was perfect for me traveling solo. They graciously accommodated me with an early check in- and my room was a perfect corner city view. The lighting was great because of the windows; and in the evening, the lights in the room were bright where there were mirrors. The bed and pillows I found super comfortable. The room will probably need updating soon. There's some signs of wear and tear now-but I liked the decor and it was a huge space where I could do morning stretches and sort thru my luggage. I consider this more of a 4-4.5 star hotel. It would be even nicer if they provided robes and had room service. I read other reviews referencing the daily $49 resort fees-so this wasn't a surprise to me when I was billed at the end of the stay. It was actually perfect for me because as a solo traveler, I was able to grab breakfast from the buffet at the Terrace dining room and it was a wonderful assortment. The crowd was definitely mixed with families, couples, and adult groups. I worked from the hotel room-where the free wifi worked without any problems. All water bottles were complimentary. Then there was happy hour 5-7pm with wine, beer, champagne and food, cheeses/meats, dessert- the whole spread felt more like dinner. It was fabulous having the happy hour and easy for me to get back to my room to get ready for my shows. I didn't get a chance to check out The Den bar near the lobby. The hotel location was superb within 1-4 blocks of the theater shows I was attending. I felt completely safe. Central Park was a short walk-and I rode the subway to get to the Met Museum. I ended up finding a great health food store a block away to grab a supplement I needed. Hotel staff were super kind in all their dealings with me. I would definitely stay here again!! It was perfect for my needs.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I and my "special guest" (as WestHouse refers to dogs) were welcomed with a dog bed and bowls already in our suite upon our arrival for a six night stay. The hotel has excellent proximity to Central Park for off-leash runs before 9 a.m.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel in a good location with great service. Mo (front desk) was extremely helpful and dealt with all of our requests with a smile. And we loved our room - very spacious, nicely furnished and private. We’ll be back.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I spent a few nights in NY at the WestHouse. We’re very selective; and both agreed we loved the WestHouse ! We had a one Bedroom suite; so plenty of room. Bath was fine, small but not by NY standards. Decor lovely. Very clean. Staff was super nice, efficient and helpful! Loved the breakfast and cocktails and hors d'oeuvre 5p-7p each evening! Highly recommend the WestHouse !!!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a group of 12 family and friends, booked in 6 rooms at the Westhouse. We came to New York from different parts of the ISA, to celebrate my husband‘s birthday. From the moment of check-in, to the rooms, to breakfast at the Terrace, and to housekeeping, every aspect of our experience at the Westhouse has been unparalleled, and an example of what every hotel should do to make its customers feel at home.Upon learning it was my husband‘s birthday, our delightful and incredible housekeeper Alice contacted the manager, who promptly showed up with a bottle of champagne! We were touched and grateful for such a level of attention.The front desk staff bent backwards to provide us with rooms on the same floor, and upgraded us. They made our stay very homey. Everyone is extremely communicative and always checking in with us to make sure our stay is going as best as it could be.The rooms are lovely, have a soothing palette and delightful mix of fabrics and textures that feel luxurious yet “liveable”; attention to detail is everywhere. Our king bed is as comfortable as sleeping in a cloud, with additional pillows and blankets in the closet if needed.The complementary breakfast included with the room is satisfying with many options to choose from, such as eggs, croissants, bagels, yogurt, bacon, etc...that gave us enough energy each morning to tackle visiting New York City. The rooms windows are well insulated against NYC’s constant noise, whether the room is on the inner side or facing the avenue. All 6 of our rooms are on the 25th floor, and “exceptional” according to our friends and family.Special mention goes to Alice, Najee, Juan, Mohsin, and many others who’s smiles and “go-the-extra-mile” attitude made our stay memorable.Thank you Westhouse Hotel staff! You are now our home away from home when visiting New York
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an outstanding stay at the Westhouse Hotel New York. Phenomenal staff (thank you Stephen for your welcoming personality), roomy rooms, incredible location, terrific amenities, fantastic breakfast (and soda)...I am running out of superlatives. Simply awesome!!! Gary
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful stay Reception is great and efficient (special mention Tarek, Nick, Ethan. they will do everything they can to make you happy)Concierges are great (Shawn and Ben give great advice and are very efficient) Breakfast is amazing Bonus : indulgence time !
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:- Service is excellent; super accommodating staff. Nick is amazing!- Breakfast provided; great selection- Good size rooms and bathroom; we had a room with 2 queen beds, more than enough space- Boutique style, modern furniture, very nice lounge area in the lobby- Great Location!
