Few blocks to Times Square and very close to Central ParkCons:- None, I will definitely return
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel continues its consistent high level of service and accommodations while maintaining its personal touch by making each individual feel welcome. There is no pretense. Only a desire to please. So well located- easy walking to theatres and great shopping— subway right outside front door
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with my wife for a week and thoroughly enjoyed it. Very helpful staff, nice clean and comfortable rooms and a great „happy two hours“ with free beer, wine and champagne as well as hot food from 5-7pm on 23 floor.Worth considering though is that New York is a noisy city. We orignally had an inner courtyard room where there was a constant hum from some air con generators below and asked to be moved. Turned out the front facing room we moved to was even nosier (Lots of road works). Staff were exceptionally helpful in moving us and waived 2 days residents tax. What I found a little disappointing was that there is no place to have a drink during the day (bar in lobby opens at 7pm if I remember rightly) and although not the worst failing, I can‘t understand why some hotels don‘t have toilet brushes?! All in all would book again.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel is wonderful, Ashley at the front desk helped us out so much and even got us into our room earlier than check in time. This is the only hotel we will stay in on our next trip back to NYC!!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got to the front desk, very tired after a long day of work and in need of a bath and a nap, only to find out that the company who booked my stay made a mistake. At many hotels this would have resulted in a long frustrating run around in the lobby. Luckily for me, Tarik was at the desk. He worked the phones to his people and to my people and within ten minutes I was relaxing in a very nice, very quiet room. Thank you Tarik.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What started out as a exhausting day of airport delays and cancellation ended with an amazing beautiful night!! I travel two weeks a month to NYC and will now move my trips to WestHouse!! The room upgrade and glass of wine was so thoughtful and greatly appreciated. Beautiful room, and amazing Front desk!! Thank you Tarik! See you next time !
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and customer service. Upgrade easy. Full buffet breakfast and happy hour on the 23rd floor a welcome service. I asked for a late checkout and it was accommodated readily by duty manager . Juan, Harik and Vanessa were great.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our March, 2019 visit to NYC and our stay at The West House. First of all the price was right! Our room, however, was very small and we asked for an upgrade. We got one for a bit of a price raise, but the room was a suite and absolutely fabulous. Living room, couch, tv, dining room table--very roomy. View of 7th Avenue looking down to Times Square. They did have scaffolding around the building and you could not go out to the deck, but that was minor.Front desk service was fabulous. Starting with arranging for a room change. The front desk person Ashley was amazing, highly professional, and did everything with a very big smile. So were Aleksandra and Moe. The concierge service was outstanding! Ben and Shawn made many arrangements for restaurants and visitor sites. The best restaurants that we would not have know about were River Park and Milos (a very short walk from the hotel.) Milos was the best Greek restaurant we every ate at! Every time we went out we got advise on whether to take a taxi or the subway. If we walked, we got excellent directions. They made us feel so comfortable and nothing was too much to take time to speak to us and advise.The hotel is close to everything! The subway is about 15 steps away and they encouraged us to take it, even though I was hesitant. We used it and loved it. We felt like real New Yorkers! We easily walked back to the hotel from the Theater District and even farther away areas like the Lower Eastside. So many great restaurants close by. Great neighborhood in Midtown--clean and safe.The complimentary daily breakfast was a real plus and delicious. Lattes and cappuccinos were available! Never attended the complimentary afternoon appetizer and drink event but heard it was lovely.The beds were super comfortable with wonderfully soft sheets.Maid service was excellent.It is not the fanciest or updated of hotels, but very clean, fabulous service and so centrally located.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: WestHouse is a gem! It is a marvelous boutique hotel in a wonderful location with walking distance to many places such as Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Time Square and Broadway Shows which saved us so much time traveling.Thanks to the WestHouse staff for trying your best to accommodate us from late arrival to late check-out! Even though the suite we originally booked was not available because the previous guests decided to extend their stay due to emergency, Alexandra from the front desk called us and made arrangement for us. Our flight was cancelled because EWR had some air traffic control issues, so we were en route to JFK and ended up arriving 9 hours later than planned. We are so glad that WestHouse still held our rooms for us. On the day we needed to check-out, we had a concert at Carnegie Hall until 2:30pm. The manager in charge generously granted us late check-out, so we could have a place to change out of the concert attire. Thank you so much! You made our trip so much easier! This is the 2nd time that we stayed at WestHouse and we are sure to be back! Thanks again for everything!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the stay. The location is very convenient and close to Central Park. The hotel itself is very nice. Tarik at the front desk was very helpful and took the time to help us during our stay. The breakfast was also great.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here from 4/15-4/18. Nice stay, super friendly staff, very comfortable and very well located. The residents fee charged covers breakfast, fitness center and “hours of indulgence “ with wine and light dinner from 5-7pm. We enjoyed our stay!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a three night stay for a family of 5 so booked 2 adjacent rooms. I’ve got to say that this was exactly what we were looking for. It’s a high quality, relaxed hotel with five star quality but non of the stuffiness that you might expect. It feels like a boutique hotel and we felt welcomed and relaxed from beginning to end. The breakfast is a really pleasant buffet so we were able to wander up and have our breakfast and then send the kids as and when they were ready. Finally, the location is perfect too. Any family that’s weighing up the pros and cons between an Airbnb and a hotel should simply book here, and let the hotel staff look after you.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not pick a better hotel for my solo business trip to NYC. Great breakfast every morning. Absolutely unexpectedly nice happy hour/food every later afternoon. Vanessa and Starlin were great on the front desk. Trenton ran the bell desk like a conceirhe. So friendly and professional. Great representatives of a hotel whose entire staff really cares. Tiny issue with temp of rooms. Thermostat seemed to be more for show as room was pretty warm no matter how it was adjusted. Otherwise great room, great services. Loved it.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of 4 with 2 young children found this to be well appointed, excellent breakfast and happy hour included as part of Resort cost and nicely located, blocks away from Central Park. Highly recommend
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love NY and this was our 5th time visiting the big apple. We’ve stayed at different hotels previously but this time we stayed at the WestHouse hotel close to Times Square for five nights. The website tells you that it’s a 5 star hotel but I wouldn’t agree.The lobby is nice, staff friendly and service minded but that you can find at any hotel no matter the stars.We had a nice room, a queen size bed, and some kind of view since they were remodeling the outside of the building and had a construction platform covering the building and windows.We had the breakfast buffet and it was ok, coffee was good and they had well made scrambled eggs and bacon. I would have loved if they had some selection of cheese, ham and vegetables. They only had fruit salad for some days during our visit.The cleaning was average for being a 5 star hotel. The forgot towels and water one day and I also found long black hair beside my toothbrush one day (I’m blond) Not so nice...Cleaning could definitely have been better.The last night we had dinner at a nearby restaurant and decided to have our coffee in the bar at our 5 star hotel... turned out they couldn’t serve coffee at the hotel at 9 pm.We had a great time in the best city but that was not because of the hotel and it was definitely not worth the price.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was such a pleasure staying here thanks to the customer service and hospitality I experienced while staying at this centrally located hotel for business. My first positive impression was that when I requested a quiet room, the woman who checked me in truly then did give me a very quiet room. She knew the pro’s and con’s of each unit and described them to me so that I could decide whether to wait for my perfect, silent room. The concierge was very responsive and resourceful in booking an appointment for me. The property is clean and organized. The proximity to Central Park is phenomenal. I will stay here again for business or pleasure.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the WestHouse. We travel frequently and highlyrecommend this hotel. Our room was clean, and the staff were both helpful and super friendly. Special shout out to Ethan and Ashley at the front desk who greeted us with genuine enthusiasm and followed up mid stay to make sure we were happy. We had originally booked a luxury King room, but Ethan was happy to offer upgrade us to a suite. The Terrace on Floor 23 is a great place to grab a quick bite, coffee or drink and is included in the cost of your room. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in a wonderful location, two blocks south of Central Park. Very comfortable rooms, clean and well appointed. Excellent service by staff. Residents enjoy breakfast and a light dinner each day which was perfect for our stay. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful accommodations, attentive staff and great breakfasts included on the 23rd floor. The front desk manager was very welcoming and helpful. Later, the concierge made a great recommendation for dinner at "Robert" on Columbus Circle and completed the reservation for us. The staff made us feel very comfortable. Very convenient location. We would stay there again!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The WestHouse is a very nice hotel: the room was well-appointed and seemed newly-remodeled. All the public spaces were clean and pleasant. The Terrace lounge/dining area was a pleasant place to enjoy tasty breakfasts and a free espresso during the day. The location is also excellent, adjacent to the 57th Street subway stop off 7th Avenue. All spaces were meticulously clean.What really stood out, however, was how pleasant and helpful literally every staff member was. The breakfast buffet was well-stocked by people who seemed genuinely committed to creating a pleasant experience for everyone. The front desk, concierge, and housekeeping staff members provided warm greetings at every turn. Can't wait to go back.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon entering the WestHouse, after a long and tiring fitness-dance Conference, I was greeting with a joke & a smile from Tarik, the front receptionist on duty. We laughed & danced a little Salsa with Raphael from the restaurant bar, and Tarik so kindly granted me my wish with a gorgeous room on the 24th floor. Thank you Tarik. So far, a lovely experience,& I know I will sleep better, knowing how kind, fun, diverse, yet professional and a gentleman Tarik, and Raphael were. I can’t wait for the gratuitous breakfast tomorrow morning!!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, spacious and excellent staff. We visit NY often. Great hotel with kids also. Good area for quick walk to Central Park, broadway and Times Square. Anthony Sturiale, food and beverage manager, went above and beyond making our children feel welcome. Would definitely stay again our next visit to New York.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a 5 day trip to New York for my partner for his 30th Birthday as a surprise . It had been booked in July 2018 for March 2019. Upon booking at the hotel I had paid for a Times Square King view room to ensure that all aspects of this trip was 5*. When we arrived at the hotel it was pretty late and upon check in the manager came to talk to us. Unfortunately the room we had booked wasn’t available. However by way of compensation the manager wiped our residence fee and also moved us to a suite.From start to finish the experience in the hotel was absolutely 5*. In fact we stayed in a different room on the first night until the suite was ready. Even if we’d have stayed there the entire time the room was beautiful and reflected the 5* nature of the hotel.The location of the hotel couldn’t be better, two streets below Central Park and 3 blocks from Times Square you are in a very central location, just enough to be in the hustle and bustle but not too close to be overwhelmed by all the tourists.The staff at the hotel are incredible polite and amenable. We intend to visit New York again soon and we will definitely be staying here again.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Expedia gold status awarded us complimentary Resident status at Westhouse, which includes 2 drinks at the bar and complimentary lounge access on the 23rd floor. This had daily breakfast and dinner buffets, although modest (2 hot dishes and cheese and wine, plus espresso machines) were enough to keep us going during some of our 6 nights. The City View rooms can be just a little noisy from the sirens, but this is NYC and the view is worth it. Everyone was very helpful, accommodating (brought a heater to our room), and pleasant (our maid Angela was great). This is a great place for longer stays, feels very safe, and we love the area for subway access, Columbus Circle shopping, Central Park and food in Hell’s Kitchen. #petfriendly this is also our best experience so far in NYC staying with our Chihuahua (in the last 5 or 6 hotels).
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a room at the Westhouse, which is attached to the much lower quality Park Central Hotel. When I arrived, surprise surprise....... there was a problem because they had overbooked the Westhouse and did not have a room for me so they charged me the full cost of the Westhouse room and then stuck me in a closet sized, low quality room in the adjacent hotel. They would not reduce the price and I in no way got what I paid for. Beware of sham hotel owners who pull a bait and switch like this one.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent 6 days at the WestHouse hotel. What a lovely place! Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean. We enjoyed the free delicious buffet breakfast and free happy hour. The bartender Rafael was very nice and we enjoyed his great customer service. All the staff seem to enjoy their jobs. There are many restaurants and shops within walking distance. Times Square is just minutes away. We will stay again at WestHouse on our next trip to New York.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was fabulous! The staff was friendly and helpful. The suite was very spacious and clean. We enjoyed the breakfast and cocktail hour! Delicious food! Location was spectacular! We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to NYC!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well appointed, and other than room doors that bang shut which will disturb light sleepers, this was a great midtown pick. Melida in F & B and Rafael during wine hour were good humored and attentive, even with more difficult guests. The breakfast choices were beyond the average continental, and even towards the end of service hours there was plenty to eat. Front desk staff were welcoming and charming- Aric/Eric(sp?) especially.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely, warm, cozy, elegant retreat from the chaos of Times Square! I've stayed here multiple times, always having a clean room and comfortable bed and gorgeous rooms. But this time the service was even a step above. Kind, polite and warm staff from the front desk to the waiters to the bartender, Marcello, who deserves special mention. What's more fun in this world than taking a child to stay at this wonderful hotel and seeing a few shows? Enjoy.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is stunning and right in central location. You can walk right into Times Square, Broadway, even central park. On arrival we received a bottle of champagne and had complimentary GHD hairdryer and straighteners. Was a lovely touch. The room was very spacious and very clean. The staff were helpful. You could help yourself to drinks from the restaurant area such as coke, lemonade or water. Makes up for paying such high city tax upon departure, which you dont get told about.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A true luxury property with every amenity imaginable and a staff that delivers sincere concern for guest comfort. Since moving out of our CPS apartment and trying CP area hotels, we have finally found a home. For those traveling on business, you can have extraordinary productivity by holding your meetings on the concierge floor and if traveling for pleasure, Westhouse is the ideal spot for couples or families. Incredibly impressive!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel! Clean and friendly. Rooms that we stayed in were nice and clean ..small but to be expected in New york and a little dark but overall nice! The breakfast and Happy Hour were great! Lots of choices and everything was great!Great Location also! would stay here again!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Westchase is a "four-star" hotel in a two-star building with three star service. Issue: Really poor climate control in the rooms. Like other old buildings in NYC you either get heat or a/c. In good hotels, they have made updates or figured out how to give you a choice in your room. In this hotel: no choice. If you are in one of the hot rooms, like we were, even with the heat turned off you might just bake. In addition, the rooms are on the 19 floor and up and there are only two elevators, which can make for a wait. Hence the two-star building. The rooms were nicely appointed with good soaps, etc, and the lobby and breakfast room were nice (with above average food and service in the breakfast room). Hence the the ability to call it a "four-star" hotel. The front desk and cleaning crew were about as helpful as you get at a run of the mill big brand place. Hence the three star service.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I had very pleasurable stay at the Westhouse, it’s always a wonderful experience, we loved how close it was to everything, we love to walk to Central Park and broadway. Excellent customer service, we want to say thanks especially to the food and beverages manager (Melida )she’s amazing she make us feel welcomed, We will definitely staying again, “Highly recommend”
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The WestHouse is a fabulous Hotel! Everything from the rooms being kept so clean and tidy to the up to date deco. The staff is just amazing!!! Everybody that works at the WestHouse is great. I just want point and exceptional bunch of people that made our stay extra special Juan, Ethan, Ashley, Jason, Vanessa, Tarek, NIck, Petr, and Kathy We have stayed at the WestHouse many times and are most definitely coming back again. Everyone at this hotel is so friendly and extremely nice. We just love this Hotel!!!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I organized a group stay at the WestHouse. Working with the reservations team (specifically Suzanna and Su) was an absolute breeze. They responded quickly to all of my many requests, changes, and additions in the most professional and kind manner. Everyone in the group enjoyed their stay, and they loved how close it was to everything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a prime NYC location that's both elegant and cost effective. Also--there were no "hidden" fees, so I have no idea what these other reviews are referring to--all pricing information is available if you read thoroughly. We will definitely be working with WestHouse in the future.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have booked flights and 3 nights at WestHouse Hotel via Opodo, all fees included and ALL payments were done in advance, double room with breakfast. I certainly accept local city-taxes but at the check-in counter they asked friendly but strict for another 53,35 $ per person and night for a mantatory resident-fee. So another 320 bucks for 3 night´s. After a serious discussion I could negotiate and cutt off 50%, still had 160 bucks to pay extra, which is simply not correct and made my arrival not that good. After all I got an upgrade from queen to king. Besides that the hotel was really great and it is a strong suggestion. Next to times-square, metro, bars, restaurants, central garden, etc., it is just a perfect coice and the service is really good. After check-out I wanted to call myself a cab to the airport but the door-man asked what I need and than he was extremely pushing and just called a cab for us. Instead of usually 70-90 bucks for the tranfer to Newark (took just 45 minutes at 3 p.m.) we paid 115, probable 20 bucks for the door-man included :) All together it´s a nice, clean and great located place just be careful with extras and fees than it works out perfectly! The staff was nice as well, big thanks! Yes, next time I book at the WestHouse Hotel directly all inclusive ;-) without discussion and than it´s a 5 star rating.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Happy hour between 5-7 great , could be 5-8 like some other hotels who offer this . Overall , room nice cosy and clean .Little bit of noise from latecomers chattering and slamming doors in the early hours of the morning but on a weekend I suppose to be expected... Breakfast could be a little better - the eggs were not good and there was no fresh fruit until the last day. Staff very nice , especially Raphael,
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where to begin? I came to the Westhouse hotel in celebration for my 21st birthday. My boyfriend at the time used to live in New York and we knew it'd be the perfect place to be for this pivotal moment. We had visited New York before and stayed in the Jane hotel. I was Curious as to why it *felt* we had decided to stay in a much nicer hotel this go round (to my surprise he later during this trip proposed.) And as a congratulatory gift from his mother she rented us this hotel room.On arrival I used my card for a (refundable) $500 downpayment for incidentals. After a seemingly decent trip I returned and was never refunded the downpayment knowing full well we left the room in immaculate shape. When calling to see why I had never received a refund I was sent to department after department and wasted 30 minutes on the phone. I did this about 5 times. At this point it was nearing Christmas and not only did I not receive a refund I couldn't even get anyone on the phone to understand why I was being charged.About a month later I finally am able to get Juan Vargas the general manager of the hotel on the phone (after badgering a seemingly innocent concierge.) And I am told that this was NOT my downpayment, but the residence fee. He goes on to tell me it is made visible on the booking website, and after explaining that I am not the one who booked this room and that it was a gift and that I was never made aware of such fee that I was only told I would be charged for incidentals, he went on to tell me there was nothing he could do. Fast forward to months later and hours upon hours spent on the phone with my bank. I look back on this stay (what should've been a magical time in my life) as nothing but a nightmare.In addition the luxury items they boast about online are A LIE! Upon arrival there toiletries were nothing more than your standard inexpensive shampoo and conditioner, and the "luxurious" brand named heat appliances for your hair are LITERALLY CONAIR!! My straightener is better at home.Also the residence fee for this "Continental breakfast and cocktail hour" is food straight out of a bag, and dried out, luke warm chafers full of average at best dishes. Oh! And don't forget the cheap champagne. So if you want to be spending $100 bucks night for halfway decent food when you can go ANYWHERE else in NY for better quality, AND you intend on being there to take full advantage every night than go right ahead, but I can say from experience you WILL be disappointed.Lastly there is no restaurant and the bar is almost never open, the rooms are TINY and we faced a concrete wall. There are plenty of better hotels in regard to service, location, and size. In conclusion. if you want to spend a good amount of money for hidden fees, and a headache than this is the spot for you!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is just shy of getting 5 stars. The resort fees are $49 per person per night. It's NICE that you actually get something for this here. The breakfast is a nice way to start the day. The wine and light snacks from 5-7 is a nice touch. The bottled water in the room was appreciated. All of the workers were kind. the location is GREAT! Walk to Broadway shows Times Square and Central Park. The rooms were nicely decorated. Overall VERY clean. The trash can and wall had some spilled coffee on it (Room 2414) in the bathroom and the bathroom sink stopper does not work, All no biggie at the end of the day. BUT, the reason only 4 stars. We had two rooms and both were SO HOT. Neither rooms slept well. Open windows did not help. When we complained we were told the AC had not been switched over yet but they were working on it. We stayed 3 nights, and never got AC. We also asked for fans and none were ever delivered. When we checked out, they did take off some of the resort fees. So, they did make up for it, but really, a hotel of that size should be able to accommodate the changing of the seasons. But we do recommend this place and WILL stay here again.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from my first trip to NYC with my daughters and stepmom! This hotel is wonderful, clean, high level of customer service and food for breakfast and afternoon appetizers is wonderful! Would stay here again, just a couple of blocks from Times Square and Central Park, a great location in NYC!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The west house hotel is by far the nicest place to stay in New York City. The location puts you in a great spot close to transit in a safe area near times Square near Rockefeller but not too close where it’s too busy. Not only do they have countless amenities but the staff is amazing and always accommodating. The hotel is ashetically pleasing and is always clean. I have stayed here 3 different times and have been in both suites and king size deluxe rooms and they were all always clean and gorgeous and provided great city views. They offer a free breakfast and free dinner service which is always amazing quality food. They also have free drinks including soda champagne wine etc. throughout the whole day on the 23rd floor. The staff is always willing to help you with recommendations,directions, and anything you need throughout the city. I have never had a bad experience with any staff member during the many times I’ve stayed. I have been going here since 2015 and it has always been consistent and amazing. It is never too busy where you feel overwhelmed and is always gorgeous and a happy place to be. If you were looking for an amazing hotel in New York City look no further you have found it.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelled with my husband, daughter & granddaughter. Excellent hotel with a fantastic greeting from the staff on duty. Our rooms were ready on arrival & were perfectly clean on the 20th floor. No complaints about either rooms. Take your travel kettle if you are used to a cuppa on waking up. Room has USB connections which is ideal as you don’t need too many continental plugs. Hairdryer etc is all good. Beds are incredibly comfy with lovely crisp cotton linen. We had a street view which was lovely to see all the skyscrapers. If traffic noise bothers you such as sirens & horns going off in the night then pack earplugs or make sure you have a room on the inside (not so attractive). Great breakfast but limited in choice if you’re a fussy eater. Its America! Its cooked very well & you can eat as much as you want. Scrambled eggs & bagels were very tasty. Really good choice of beverages throughout the day. Paid residency with evening complimentary food & drinks (happy 2 hours) was amazing. Only one choice of meal plus cheeses, grapes & bread. Over the 4 nights we had very tasty meals with wine. Congratulations to the chef. In my opinion very nutritious & healthy meals. Finally all the staff are so friendly, helpful & up for a chat. Wonderful hotel & well done to Ethan (Director) you run a well oiled ship. Hope a Yorkshire Hotel can look after you when you come to visit
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is fantastic. So is breakfast which is included. The rooms are quite nice but a bit tired, but would probably recommend this as a good stay in the city, near the park, shopping and restaurants, with pleasant staff and a boutiquey feel to it. Sadly my room had no views at all and my neighbors kept slamming their doors which made the whole room vibrate!
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was absolutely perfect.....and the "Hours of indulgence" from 17:00 to 19:00 with nice food and good drinks was an extra "value for money". The room was nice, tidy and clean, and we could open the windows....with no noise from the outside :)
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: NYC is expensive. Breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks, a bottle of water, a cocktail - you will pay more for these things in NYC than just about anywhere else in the world. Therefore, when a hotel offers a big breakfast (eggs, meats, potatoes, pastries, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, the works!) every morning, and a happy hour spread each night that includes gourmet salads, hot pasta dishes, cheeses, beer, wine, and champagne, and all of that is included (along with free wifi, access to a full gym, bottled water in your room, etc.) for a $49 per person/per night fee (on top of the regular room rate) it is more than worth it. This hotel is steps from Broadway and Times Square. It's cute and quiet, with a cozy decor and spacious rooms. The lobby is small and intimate, with a nice-looking bar off of it. The rooms are larger than most in NYC, with nice bath amenities and bottled water. Very clean and nicely appointed. The real show-stopper is the aforementioned food - up on the 23rd floor Terrace. It's almost a shame because the food is so good here, you really could skip dinner but there are so many good places to eat in NYC, that you don't want to fully partake. My plan for next time is to have a 10 pm dinner reservation and enjoy a pre-dinner here at 5. There are so many hotel options in NYC but I keep coming back to the WestHouse because it is a great value without feeling like a "value" hotel in the least. If you want to be in Midtown, this is where you need to be.
hotelName:
21    WestHouse Hotel New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I truly enjoyed my last stay at Moxy NYC Chelsea. Staff is well trained and it shows. Cleanliness is outstanding. I would defintely return and recommend this hotel. Danny the front desk staff was amazing and truly never made us feel as just another customer. This young man deserves a 5+One advice I would offer is to try to find a way to settle account at departure, I feel I had to check my account too many times to understand the money charged, the pre $20 / day, then rest but still waiting for adjustments 2 days later
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely loved my stay at the Moxy! It was small, but extremely comfortable. It gave me everything I needed, without the extra fluff that hot rooms charge you hundreds more for. The view was spectacular, the bed was so so comfey, and I loved how quirky yet adorable the room was. The service at the front desk was always nice, they were always smiling, and so helpful when we asked questions. The location is close to Chelsea Market. Hudson Yards, Madison Square park, and some cool places, all within walking distance. I would 100% book here again when I come to the city. I love this place!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My second week in New York and I choose the Moxy hotel as it was closer to some events on my schedule. The Hotel turned out to be the best I've stayed at in my 6 years of visiting NYC.. Say goodbye to the tourististy volume properties and say hello to faboulous service, stunning food and epic cocktails.. all topped of with stylish rooms and fantastic team.... I will be back.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came here for the weekend and had to stay additional night, so we chose Moxy and we had a great service and accommodations. I would say the downside is late checkout was at an expense and the bed was not as comfortable. However, everything else was amazing. The view especially
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Faimly trip to New York City for the holiday weekend. We wanted a place that was close to midtown but not in and close to SoHo. Loved this property. Perfect location good vibe super nice and helpful staff. Really liked Danny at the front desk. The tokens for a free Prosecco was nice touch. Would recommend and would stay there again.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff at the front desk and bar. Made our stay enjoyable. Danielle and Danny helped us get to where we needed to be on a steamy fourth of july weekend. When looking for directions to the west village or to a bar to watch the world cup, they made sure we were comfortable and go to where we needed to go. Grateful for their help.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked directly on the Marriott website since I have a member number there(a bit of a price break and free to be a member). I got a standard king room to share with my cousin for one night(we're in our 20's and 30's). I've stayed at some hotels in the Chelsea area, as well as other parts of Manhattan and Brooklyn. Things I did like:- The hotel is easy to find and in the flower district. If you're there early enough, you can check out all the gorgeous flowers. - I found nearby parking to house the car for 24 hrs for a lot less than the hotel charges, you can just search on spothero or parking panda- We were able to store our backpacks in the baggage room on the C level of the hotel. Much better than lugging them around until check in.- I checked in and out on my iphone through the Marriott Bonvoy app. I was able to request more towels and pillows through the app. Super convenient and I was able to "Check in" around 2 and my room was ready around 3. You can do it remotely without being at the hotel and the app alerted me when my room was ready. You use your phone as the key. - The bed was super comfortable Things I really didn't like, so much so that I won't go back:- thin walls. I heard a gaggle of girls outside our room at all the time shouting and laughing. I'm not sure even if they were in the hall or the room next to us. - not enough elevators and they're slow. Plus, you have to use your "key"(in this instance, my phone key) to get to your floor and its hit or miss with the elevator touch key pad. - the 4th floor was loud, dark and had an office building directly across(from the looks through the windows, office is a guess). Do you want to keep the curtain open? You're going to show your bits to the neighbors across the way. - I was aware of the bathroom situation, or so I thought. I knew there were barn doors with frosted glass and that the sink is outside of those spaces in the room. The pain in the neck is: If you want any shred of privacy you'll be hard pressed to find it. If you want to disrobe in the shower, there are no hooks at all. You have to open the door and drop your clothes on the floor. There's nowhere to hold a towel so you again have to slide the door and get it off the floor. Then you have to get dressed in the shower without getting your clothes wet from the floor. This is a ridiculous, awkward design unless you love being naked with whomever you're rooming with. - In the shower there's two pump bottles on the wall: conditioner and hand soap. Yes, it says HAND SOAP. I used the app to request shampoo, he brought more HAND SOAP. I have color treated hair so I'm not going to just slap anything in it to wash it. After a stupidly hot day walking around, this was very frustrating. I didn't bring any hair washing products because I've never encountered a hotel without shampoo. - No complimentary anything. There's Fiji water in the room (5 bucks a bottle). No coffee maker. No small toiletries. No fridge. No microwave.- The room price fluctuates greatly and there's no price guarantee unless you catch the difference within 24 hours. I don't like the gambling factor of cost fluctuations. There's no Marriott member loyalty to adjust the cost. I think overall this hotel is designed for aesthetics, not for common sense use. People say "unique" but I think hotels like this in the area are a dime a dozen. They're all trying to be cool but lacking the functionality. The bathroom in the room is annoying with a bad design. While I appreciate the use and convenience of the app for certain things, its very impersonal. The only person I spoke to was to ask about where to store bags and she wasn't welcoming or friendly.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hospitality, customer service, attention to detail, energised and upbeat staff personalities, gorgeous lobby garden and 2nd floor decor, comfy beds and ample size bathroom. 35th floor restaurant and bar is a must-see. Great location!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a long weekend and found this hotel to have everything we needed. It's a block from the 28th Street station and made it very easy to get around. The hotel opened in February and still has its newness. The second and top floor have bar spaces. The rooms are creatively designed and include some fun features to take advantage of it's NYC sized rooms. The staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed in a front of the building on the 22nd floor and had relatively quiet evenings-this also gave us some nice city views. We would stay in this flower district location again.  If you fly into Newark, its easy to take the train into Penn station and then the 1 train one stop to 28th and walk one block.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently visited the moxy Chelsea whilst in NYC for a show. We had 4 fantastic nights in the hotel and would love to stay again. A very stylish modern hotel with friendly staff and clean rooms. A busy lively bar area which serves food and has a DJ playing at night. There is a lovely looking restaurant which we didnt eat in(but did in the bar). A nightclub is on the roof but we didnt visit as we had our 2 teenagers with us.A great hotel which is ideally placed for a lot of major attractions(we were there for Madison Square garden) and is a very short walk from Penn station.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the rooms are small, they are well-designed with nice amenities. We had no issue with street noise, likely in part because NY streets are much quieter than the avenues. But what really made the difference for us was the service. My daughter contracted food poisoning while in NY, and the staff did absolutely everything they could to help. extended her stay, found another room with two queens for her sister and me, contacted the hotel doctor, and checked in with us a few times during our stay. All this during Pride weekend! Sometimes hip comes with attitude - Moxy delivered hip with caring and compassion.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time staying at Moxy. The service and friendly employees are what makes everything the best. Rooms are well designed and they have every essential needs of a guest. Keep yourself open minded about your expectations especially about the design of the rooms. Personally I loved everything about the hotel especially bar and the restaurant must try. I definitely recommend this place and I would like to stay again for my next NYC trips.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not all properties are catering towards or good for families, so definitely want to say that I understand if this property is geared towards more hip, young, single people. But I feel like even for that crowd, this hotel has some challenges. At $500/night, I was surprised this is no bell service. They give you a cart and you go it alone. We used valet parking--although they try their best, given the very narrow and congested street they are on, the valet parking situation is super chaotic. It took us over 35 minutes to get our car. On the positive side, the restaurant on the ground floor is great--beautiful, good services, good food. The lounge on the 2nd floor was also perfect for our purposes. We had a big group so we just grabbed a large table in the corner and ordered a ton of very tasty pizzas. There was a cute indoor bocce table to use. Service at the restaurants and front desk were quite good, and they do manage well in a very chaotic/demanding/loud environment. The rooms are super spartan and very small. I felt somewhat like I was camping, as little folding chairs/tables are hung from pegs on the walls, etc. However, my kids thought the room was great as it was quite different from the 5 star properties we were staying at elsewhere in NYC. The view from the room was great. But the sink is a metal stand right next to the front door. Noise did not seem to be an issue--we had neither street noise nor noise from surrounding rooms even though I believe the hotel was nearly full. We were disappointed not to be able to enjoy the rooftop bar as they do not allow under 21 up there, even hotel guests. There was massive confusion in the morning as we called down to ask what breakfast options were, and they told us either the rooftop bar or 2nd floor. We tried to get to the rooftop bar by elevator but housekeeping told us the elevators were broken and not able to go all the way up, so they directed us to the services stairs, which were dark and weird. Of course when we got to the roof, staff told us breakfast hasn't been served up there in a really long time, and directed us to the ground floor. Anyway, I'm sure if you're looking for a fun scene and not worried about amenities or parking, that this could be a very enjoyable property. For me, at that rate, I was just expecting nicer rooms and more full service.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling for work, I stayed at the Moxy Chelsea for 2 nights in April 2019, just a few weeks after they first opened. I was delighted to see that Marriott is getting into the Boutique Hotel scene. CHECKINThe "lobby" is discrete, and hidden behind a lovely flower cart that you walk thru in the foyer. Walk toward the yellow neon sign, and that is where you checkin. The attendant upgraded my room to a high floor (floor 25) in a Wheel Chair access room, so my room ended up being HUGE. I was given a wooden token to claim a happy hour drink for free in the lobby bar which was a very nice touch!ROOMMy room was supremely well designed and cleaned. It was equipped with a wall of accessories from a laptop table, to a luggage stand..etc. The vanity was a "farm sink" just inside the door. The beds were comfortable, however my room was terrible hot both nights-- I think the A/C was not working well, making it very hard to sleep.BATHROOMThe bathroom was in a separate room and was HUGE (because it was handicapped access). It had a large soaking tub, tiled with cute words like "get wild". All of the hardware was matte black. Very chic. FACILITIESThere is a lovely lobby bar on the second floor that you can claim your free welcome drink at. There is also a rooftop bar that I was unfortunately unable to visit- it seems to access the rooftop you must go thru the cafe on the bottom floor/entrance.The location is not what I would necessarily call Chelsea proper. It's more like Koreatown, which is totally fine. I would definitely stay here again, but make sure my A/C worked well next time.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel to NYC for business and stayed at this Chelsea location Moxy. This was my first Moxy experience. It is unique. The staff was wonderful. The rooms are small but efficient- you can request a refrigerator but they are not typically in the rooms. There is a hydration station in the gym and quality gym equipment. The gym was also exceptionallyClean which is pleasant! Unfortunately the rooftop was closed for the days I was there due to an even so I will have to experience that another time. The hotel did not offer any type of points or room credit and also did not notify me of this closure prior to my arrival which I found disappointing. Again this was my first stay at a Moxy. The restaurant located in the lobby was so chic and had great servers and menu options! I also loved that there is a little flower/gift market in the lobby with good quality items! Will likely stay again for the view but will definitely verify that I will be able to utilize ALL of the accommodations prior to arrival.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed two nights here on business. It was a good experience and I would stay here again. Super clean, modern hotel. Very hip vibe. While the lobby was loud and bustling my room on the 18th floor was very quiet. Room was very small, even by NYC standards. I was by myself, but even one more person in the room would have been crowded. No bathroom privacy but with just me it was no big deal. Shower did leak into the room and toilet area. No coffee maker in the room but I hear you can get free coffee somewhere in the hotel (I never found it but I didn’t try very hard). There’s a grocery/pharmacy across the street where you can get anything you need (don’t need to spend $5 on water). There’s also no room service here but plenty of restaurants and take out options nearby. The TV was great and WiFi was fast and easy. Being in the middle of so many flower shops was lovely! Easy walking distance to many places and close subway access. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed this past weekend at the Moxy Chelsea and really loved the style, decor and design of the whole building.Pros:-Convenient location to everything you need in NY-Great Bar with friendly staff-Free morning Coffee-Bed is very comfortable-Quiet rooms, besides the odd door slam in the corridor-Great use of the small space, hooks everywhere and storage available under the bed-Brand new building so everything is clean and modernCons:-Room is TINY.-Water leaks from Shower into the bedroom-Zero privacy when showering or using Toilet-Sink drains very slowly-Musty/ moldy smell in the room-Elevator wait can be long at peak timesI think overall if you were in the city for 1-2 nights this would serve you well for what you need but any longer i would seriously consider staying elsewhere.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights at the Moxy NYC Chelsea. Our room was facing the Empire State Building which was really cool at night. We visited the bar and had a great time. The music wasn't too loud where you couldn't talk to one another. Overall, a really cool hotel.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Moxy NYC Chelsea during our stay in New York. The location could not be faulted! We were close to great bars and restaurants, the subway, Chelsea Market and were able to walk to Central Park and Times Square. The front desk staff were amazing and so good and were more than accommodating.Rooms were very small so we had to ensure everything was packed up each time we needed to grab some clothes out for the day as their was no wardrobe as the rooms were small but all rooms in New York are small and the set out still worked really well. Only minor things we could fault during our stay was that the rooftop bar accidently charged our card twice for cocktails we had there but we didn't notice until the next day and didn't know how to approach it so left it. Also the housekeeping hadn't filled up the bodywash when doing the rooms so we ended up leaving a note to try and get more and they had missed filling up the bottled water after we consumed one (which cost $5 per bottle) so by the time housekeeping came again the next day they charged us again so by the end of the trip a few extra bottles were added on. We could have said something and I'm sure it would have been fixed, but that was the only small things we could fault. Other than that the experience was amazing!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really fun design. The staff was very helpful. The bar/cafe Feroce connected was delightful. The host was so upbeat and friendly - the food was delicious and the space was very pretty. The location in the flower district was fun and pretty (maybe except when delivery trucks were in the area) Loved it overall and would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very creative design, super cozy room, and awesome city views. Drinks and appetizers at the bar were excellent and the rooftop was a lot of fun, great music and fun vibe. Would highly recommend to anyone!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fun hip hotel in a great location. Staff is friendly and informative. The roof is beautiful and the views from the rooms are great. There is a lot of bars and restaurants in the area. Close to the flatiron. Linda, Danny and Avery were energetic and fun!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I hesitated between 4 and 5 stars here. 5: bed, shower, amazing view, location, silent rooms, bar & facilities. 4: no free water even if you are Platinum, no feather pillows in the rooms. Also no closets but really, who cares about that. This may have become my go-to Marriott property in the city. I will definitely be back.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had to events in the city and instead of driving back and forth we decided to stay at the Moxy. The location is great and it's brad new. The rooms as small but stylish. We got two rooms because we are family of 5. They only have 2 connecting rooms on each floor. The double bed rooms are located on the corner of each floor so there are only 4 of them per floor and they are not connecting. The hotel isn't really made for families. I would recommend it for a couple of single.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The entire establishment is gorgeous and I loved the room so much. The second floor, rooftop, and restaurant next door were all amazing— I even showed my NYC local and she plans to bring her friends back to enjoy the bars! Would absolutely stay again, and would recommend anyone I know. The views were great, the use of the small space was amazing, and just generally loved the hotel.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This very attractive boutique hotel is wonderfully placed in the flower district. Easy subway access and much within walking distance. The staff was exceptionally nice, the room was very clean and attractive, the bed was very comfortable, and the price is moderately reasonable. The rooftop bar is stunning (although does not allow anyone under 21, so my teenagers could not enjoy the view). For a hotel of this small size, I thought it had a good number of nice amenities as well. We had a king bed, and I thought the layout of the tiny room was ingenious: the sink was in the bedroom and the toilet and shower had separate sliding doors (frosted glass) that opened right into the room. I loved the use of space, however, it is not much for privacy. Some might find this off-putting. My only complaint was that for myself AND my traveling companions in a different room there were never enough towels. We were shortchanged the day of arrival, housekeeping took those towels and didn't replace any the second day, and the third day we were back to being one towel shy. The fourth day they left us with extra! They were always happy to supply more when I asked, I just think there staff on my floor was a bit confused. Also, my friends sink drained slowly, and after reporting it and being assured that it would be fixed, it never was. These things aside, I would highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: loved the room! decor so unique.. the shower is out of the world! rainshower. tiled floor.. you have to see the sinks... so cool. Italian restaurant next door was great.. fantastic wine selection. perfect location, literally so easy to get to
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here last month as family was visiting from out of town and absolutely loved this new property!! As someone that has worked in the industry, the atmosphere and staff of this hotel were amazing!! Shout out to Christian for assisting me at the front desk - he made our welcome that much more special! Awesome hospitality!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely flower smell from the entrance is going to welcome you! Casual and friendly service will be provided from the Front Desk. Highlight is the room!! Unbelievablly beautiful room! Very stylish and extremely cozy and comfortable bed with stunning city view. However, it was bit difficult to organize my stuff (No luggage rack & no closet) because of the size of room. Very limited space.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern hotel and nice bar, however, there are soiled stained towels in the stairwells blocking the fire exit, slow lifts, waited half an hour to get into our room due to the mobile lock running out of battery.Overall pretty disappointed and interested to see what the next 4 days holds....
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the opportunity to stay for 3 days. Keneisha is one of the best personalities I’ve meet through Marriot. I’ll be staying here whenever I’m in New York. Appreciate your amazing grace. See you guys again soon!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed here on a whim for staycation. Overall, I can see what the hotel is trying to do in terms of concept and how they can appeal to.... specific generation of people. To that end, the hotel does it rather well. If you have the right expectation for the basic level hip hotel (think Ace hotel or sort), then you will be satisfied with what you get for the money you pay. This ain't St Regis but I can see myself coming back. Con:tiny tiny room not the cleanest roomno shampoo (this is absurd but I can see this being some accident. It gotta be)AC makes loud noise not all power outlets workPro:amazing view- if you get the room with city view. i think it's worth it especially for the priceprice- price point is amazing. don't know what else is sayclever interior- I mentioned about tiny tiny room. some collapsible furniture makes it less badlocation- it's not bad really. Nomad itself may be lacking (yah it's not quite in Chelsea) but easy to get to anywhere
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel! Great location in the flower district. Rooms are modern and clean on the smaller side but very comfortable. The rooftop bar is amazing and very "instragramable." Would definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From Penn station to Moxy Chelsea is a 7 minute walk, through the flower district. The entrance is beautiful and smells wonderfull with all the flowers from Putnam & Putnam. The check-in area is very trendy. We got a very, very warm and nice welcome from Marvin, and also from Kenisha. Thank you both! We travel as a family, with our two children of 20 and 15 years, and decided to book a room with 2 double beds. We got a room on the 30th floor, with an amazing, breathtaking view. The room is small. We travel only with hand luggage, so small suitcases, but there is no place to store them. So you have to put them somewhere and the are in the way because of the size of the room. There are no closets, to store you can use the draws underneath the beds and you also can hang lots of your things on the big coat rack, left and right from the lcd tv. The beds are lovely, and how convenient to have wall-plugs with charges. So no need to bring your own plug-in.The shower is spacious and has great shampoo and conditioner. Smells delicious! Even the time waiting for the elevator is nice, with good music on the background.The rooftop bar is beautiful but the kids weren't allowed, unfortunately, it is a club for 21+. The bar Feroce on the second floor I can recommend, nice vibe, great design. Next to the hotel entrance there is the caffe and restaurant Feroce. You can sit and have breakfast, but also get a coffee to go, or a focaccia for a snack. The restaurant we did not try, but it looks nice and with a good Italian menu.I will definitely go back to Moxy Chelsea, the ambiance is really nice, and feels good. We liked the design, and the trendy urban vibe.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Moxy NYC Chelsea reflects the way we all hope, as guests, to be treated. The staff is terrific; the rooms are clean; the location is within a walk of some of my fave spots in the city including some of the great restaurants...Eataly, Gramercy Tavern (awesome) and the original Shake Shack. It's in the heart of the flower wholesale business so early every morning the street is loaded with buckets of flowers and potted plants...orchids abound. FUN!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here last weekend with my boyfriend for a city trip. I had initial room shock to how small it was, but it was very functional and the views from the room with floor to ceiling corner windows were absolutely stunning. The room was comfortable and was perfect for a 2 night stay. Given that it was brand new, everything was exceptionally clean and the bed was very comfortable.Staff was friendly as well! We used the gym both mornings which was fairly large but lacking equipment and almost all free weights and machines were in use. We didn’t get a chance to try either of the restaurants but we went to the rooftop bar and it was stunning! The views were amazing. All in all, it was a great hotel and I’d definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Moxy is a contemporary little nugget of a hotel that sits at the heart of a bustling district. and because its a small establishment, it was a bit of a struggle having came from a long work trip and didn't had the luxury of travelling light. We had 5 big luggages and it was quite a struggle having to lug them from the car to the reception area and into the rooms cause the person serving you at the reception, is unfortunately also the same guy bringing the luggages to the room. And because the rooms are compact, unpacking requires a degree of thoughtfulness cause you will walk into things lying around carelessly given that tiny space.Toilets are segregated away from the room by a mere frosted glass and you can actually see the silhouette of the person sitting at the toilet bowl doing his/her thang and I am guessing it might be quite an uncomfortable sight if you are sharing room with a friend/colleague. Side from that, Moxy spots a very sophisticated interior aced with a bar that looks incredible both in the day and in the night. And for those of you who are feeling a bit peckish and don't wish to eat in the hotel, the all American fast food giant with the Golden Arches sit just across the hotel.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a 4 night stay at the Moxy Chelsea. We were very impressed by the hotel. It was extremely clean, very well appointed and the staff were very pleasant.The rooms are not large, but suited us well as we traveled light. We requested a city view king room on a high floor. We had a terrific view of the city, the Empire State Building was right there. The room was comfortable, quiet and visually appealing. Loved the shower!The 2nd floor lounge is absolutely beautiful. What an amazing interior design concept. Could hang out there all day!The hotel is on 28th street between 6th and 7th Ave. Subway on 28th and 7th and Broadway. Just a few minutes walk. 28th Street is lined with Flower shops, so pretty when heading out.It's also central to everything. We walked everywhere. Chelsea Market and the High Line were a 20 minute walk, Time Square the same. Macy's and a ton of shopping 10 minute walk.We had drinks and Breakfast at Feroce which were good but pricey, but what isn't in NYC?Would definitely recommend this hotel, it was a very comfortable enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Moxy in Chelsea with three friends for the weekend. The rooms are fantastic, location is perfect and the staff could not be more helpful! Especially Danny - who really went above and beyond to ensure we had an incredible trip!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was constantly helpful, even during my late PM arrival, I was amazed at how welcoming Sheana was at such a late hour. The room was fantastic and the ambiance was relaxing, had a great gym for its size as well.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a new hotel from the Marriott “Moxy” brand — small and simpler but high quality rooms, and great restaurants and public areas. It is targeted at a bit more of a young/party crowd than me (200+ night per year upscale to luxury business traveler), but I wanted to try something new and liked it.Rooms are small but efficient (no large furniture, just a bed and a sink), but with a relatively large shower, and overall not too bad for NYC standards. The lobby is nice, but where the hotel really shines are the coffee bar and Italian restaurant.Overall, I’d recommend this to anyone who is coming to NYC to go out and do stuff.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for the bed arrangements so no one would have to share as there was 6 of us travelling. We had two rooms booked, a bunk bed room and a double bed room. The girls in the bunk bed room had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. We had a view of McDonald’s.Marriott hotel guests, this is not what you expect from the brand, moxy is supposed to be a pared down European style hotel.The pros-brand new and very clean-Beautiful lobby with flowers -Friendly staff-Comfortable beds Cons-too far from main tourist attractions, there are dozens of great hotels closer-Zero bathroom privacy in double bed room, you can see everything in the bathroomwith the frosted glass (drywall would have been better!)-the trendy sinks do not drain, very bad design flaw!-rooms are small, definitely not suitable for a family of four -expensive for what you get-no fridge-no toiletries other than soap, shampoo and conditioner -no coffee maker I would definitely not recommend this hotel to families. I would recommend it for very young hip travellers, maybe under 30’s only that are travelling together but only for the bunk bed rooms. My last hotel stay in Manhattan was the Lotte New York Palace and this obviously doesn’t compare! Sorry Moxy Chelsea but I won’t be back and would not recommend to anyone I know.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an amazing time at the new Moxy Hotel in Chelsea this past week. Beautiful hotel and comfortable room. Smells like flowers as soon as you walk in the lobby! Location is very convenient for exploring different areas of the city. Christian assisted me with my stay and he was so polite and helpful! Thank you to him for making my stay even more enjoyable. I will definitely be back!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sisters and I did an overnighter in Manhattan and stayed at the Moxy. It was Perfect! Upon our arrival, there were bottles of water and champagne glasses for the four us to begin our celebration! We had the room with the four bunk beds and it was fabulous! The beds, comforters, and pillows were so comfortable, none of us wanted to get up for brunch the next day! The water pressure in the shower was awesome and there were plenty of towels for us all! I highly recommend! Only complaint was that we were not permitted entrance into the Rooftop bar on Saturday night because we were not on the guest list (rather disappointing) ... especially being hotel guests.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'd prefer to give this a 4.5 than 5 as I had the ill fortune of getting a cold shower one morning, but solicited everyone else in my group and I guess it was just me so will let it slide. more on the positive side of the review however I'd have to say the service/staff were super-friendly, there was tons to do just in the hotel as the 2nd floor atrium's and bar were great, well stocked and had great staff as well. The Rooftop is also a must do if you get a bit better weather than we did.otherwise, the rooms were clean, unique and decently laid out given the size. Best part I think though was how quiet they were which is tough for NYC. I'd do it again!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No hot water for three straight days in my room. They kept saying they would fix it but didn’t.One night at midnight they called and said I had a visiter. I reply that I don’t and that they woke me up. They sent him up and he knocked on my door at 12:20am and woke me again.Then the next AM they had someone knocking on every door of my floor at 7:50am waking me up again!Finally they fixed it right before I left.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No closet, no space, not quiet, no desk to work from. Don't stay here if you are on business or need space to relax and work. This hotel is more suited for party goers and has a nice club to serve that purpose.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at the Moxy hotel in Chelsea was wonderful! The hotel is absolutely stunning. What made it extra special was the woman who checked me in. While I don’t know what her name is, she remembered my name and called me by name every time she saw me in the hotel throughout my stay. I also loved getting the free glass of Prosecco at the bar. Not to mentioned bring surrounded by beautiful flowers everywhere you turn.I will be back!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room we stayed in seemed to have a prison motif. There was absolutely no privacy in the bathroom which was embarrassing and outrageous! There is a sliding glass door that separates the glass bathroom area from the two beds in our room. No closets only hooks and no space at all for suitcases! The slot in the door looked just like the ones the prison guards slide the food into the inmates room on TV. The tile in the bathroom spells out grow-up!While the beds are comfortable, a hotel with no bathroom privacy is not for me. It ruined our stay here! This is definitely a hotel for millennials with no expectations of privacy or modesty. I am shocked anyone would design a room like the one we stayed in!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a wonderful stay at Moxy Chelsea! Friendly staff, trendy room, great location with easy access to the subway, amazing views from the rooftopbar, high quality Italian food at the restaurant and a nice, laid-back vibe at the 2nd floor bar/lounge area (great for drinks with friends or simply to hang out while finishing work on your laptop). I’d recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great time in NYC.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good spot to start most of the sightseeing, being in walking distance to times square etc.We got a nice little room with a beautiful view on the Empire State Building and the bed was very comftable! You should definately visit the awesome rooftop!
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Moxy was in a great location. The room was very nice with a lovely view. Bar staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. Very comfortable mattress and lots of nice touches in the room such as clothes steamer and hair dryer.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in 2107 and had a sensational view of the Empire State Building from my room — great at night. The hotel is nestled in the Garden District with easy access to Madison Avenue, Broadway and the Flatiron District.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, I picked this location in the Flower District of the Chelsea neighborhood because it was within a 10-minute walk from my event venue in the Flat Iron District. If you like flowers, you'll enjoy walking around the block of the hotel as all the wholesale flower shops line the sidewalks with their colorful sweet smelling living beauties. There are many other hotels on the same block but I'm a Marriott brand loyalty member so I chose to stay at my first Moxy hotel. There is a 1 local train stop on the other side of the block and a R W local stop one block over the other way which was convenient when I wasn't walking or car share riding. I drove into Manhattan with my own car and lucked out finding free street parking not in a hotel loading zone after 7 pm on the block of the hotel which is metered M-F for commercial vehicles only . Despite arriving after 7 o'clock in the evening, my room was not ready. But I chose to accept tokens for a couple free glasses of prosecco and $30 towards food at Bar Feroce on the second floor. When the room was ready, thankfully it was very clean. I stayed in a room with 2 beds on the 22nd floor (no view of the Empire State Building) but pleasantly way from both the rooftop lounge and street noise. There really is not a lot of space in the room. I did assemble the table hanging from one of the hooks on the wall to rest my suitcase and I could still get by it to get to the side of the bed nearest the window. There are bedside nightstands to rest your phone, curtains to block the sun, full length mirror, storage under the beds for shoes, big screen tv, telephone, laptop tray. The bathroom was a comfortable size and it has a sliding door. I found the beds comfortable and slept well. Only 2 of the elevators in the lobby go down to the gym level and parking garage so there were lines for the elevators at busy times. It was also another small annoyance there was no door man at all times because the front doors to the hotel weren't motion-sensor opening. It was a nice perk to have a caffe to grab my morning coffee/tea, a bar (DJ unitl 1 am on Saturdays), a lounge (before 9 pm), a restaurant, and a flower stall all right there in the same building. In addition, the hotel/bar/cafe staff were friendly and provide great service. If you're looking for a trendy new hotel in this area of Manhattan at a reasonable (For NYC standards) price for limited space, check it out.
hotelName:
22    Moxy NYC Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first trip to New York and we found this hotel in its midtown location very convenient to all the main attractions. The rooms are well equipped with extremely comfortable beds and good showers. There are also electrical and charging facilities.But it was the staff that were really good. There were a couple of problems, not caused by the hotel, such as noisy neighbours and an air conditioning failure (in stifling July, and these were handled really well and elegantly by Marcos. For the noise he changed our room and when the aircon failed even let us sleep in another room for the night, where the aircon was still working. Whilst this hotel has no bar or public lounge, there is a really nice roof terrace to relax on. If you are wanting to be close to pretty much everything in Manhatten at a budget price it’s hard to go past Carvi.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly hotel staff, small rooms but clean. Great location for walking around East side, Grand Central, Lex Ave Subway, etc. No restaurant, but access to a rooftop terrace. Close to tons of restaurants and convenient coffee shops for breakfast.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent option. Very well located, with several metro stations under 5 minutes walking services nearby, such as wholefoods and pharmacies.Perfect stay in New York. Excellent relation price-quality.The room was surprisingly big, especially for a hotel in NY.The staff was super professional and friendly, bilingual (speaking Portuguese).We booked through an online platform but if you can call directly the hotel you would get better prices.I would definitely stay back here when returning to NY.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have been there 1 week with my 2 brothers.Great location, near to several metro accesses. Good bedding quality. Bedroom big enough including ironing solution. Bathroom complete incouding hair dryer. Qualitative housekeeping. Special thanks to Marcos and his colleagues for their advises and help during our stay !!
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel. Very clean and well equipped rooms and very helpful, friendly staff. Very reasonable cost and so, therefore, great value for central NY.The location of this hotel is perfect for walking to many of the NY visitor spots and very close to lots of eateries.Due to a last minute change in our trip details we stayed one night in one room and then moved for the second night. This change was our fault and the hotel was great in dealing with the amendment but unfortunately the room change was necessary. This wasn't a problem.Why it becomes relevant, and indeed the reason for dropping a point is.....The first night we had a room at the back of the hotel. It was perfect. The second night our room was at the front. This was very noisy from the street below and, coupled with my jet lag sleep disruption, meant I had practically zero sleep.Rooms excellent, small but v clean and well equipped. Comfy beds, good showers, coffee and water.Staff excellentLocation excellentValue excellent.Just make sure to get a room at the back.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
