review_body: Carvi hotel is a very clean hotel in the perfect location. The staff were extremely friendly and eager to please.Room had all that was needed and very quiet and comfortable. Lucy in reception was always very helpful.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from New York for Saint Patrick's weekend. Excellent location, very clean hotel, very close to subway. Marcus at reception went above and beyond both prior to our arrival by responding to my email inquiries and during our stay. Would highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just home from this hotel today after 6 nights there. Such a clean hotel. Rooms are clean and the bed is so comfortable. Lovely shower. The hotel is close to many subway stations and a short walk to many attractions. I would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent Hotel with friendly Staff, clean and cozy ! In city center from everything you need .... week done Carvi Hotel Bed absolutely comfortable Frigo bar Cleaning Reception 24hIf I will visit again New York I absolutely wanna back to here
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No offense intended to any other hotel I have stayed in, but as a disabled person, this was a complete pleasure. No special equipment or anything like that, just ultra helpful and sensitive staff, at all times through all shifts. I have never been offered a chair for the shower, except for here. I have already booked the Carvi for my next N.Y. trip in March.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, pleasant and helpful staff, very cozy and not noisy room (we had interior room), strong wifi. Well working air condition. Was nice to have bathrobes, coffee machine in the room. Only minus as for me - there could be a mirror not only in the bathroom, but also inside the room.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for an evening for a business trip in September. The room was clean and affordable, and spacious. I would definitely recommend staying here.Amenities were minimal, but for the price, and the spacious room - it is well worth it. Especially if you’re visiting the city with the need for a place to sleep.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights. Staff very friendly, welcoming and helpful. All areas very clean and tidy. We had an inside room with no windows, but that wasn't a problem (don't like seeing how high I am). Stayed in room 303. Room was smallish, but had everything we needed, mini fridge, tv, telephone, iron, desk etc. The bed was very comfy and we also had heating and air con. The bathroom was also smallish but included toiletries and a hairdryer. We enjoyed our stay here and are returning. It's only 10 minutes walk from all main attractions and lots of food place a around it.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Low key and really good. Midtown East within easy distance of the UN. New rooms, clean hotel, wonderful little rooftop terrace. Handful of eateries and conveniences in 100 yards/metres. Would definitely stay again - worked a treat for a business trip to Midtown East.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay, clean, centric, very cozy if you go to the terrace on the 7th floor. The most important thing to me was how friendly and clean the hotel was, they offer robes, towels , shampoo, and even brown towels for some women who use heavy makeup so you do not stain the white towels!!!Brilliant
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took a chance on this hotel because of a special we found on booking.com and the location. I had my doubts but was more than pleasantly surprised. The halls are very narrow as if it were a European hotel but the rooms were very comfortable, update and clean. I loved the room we had and although we were very close to the lobby and another room it was very quiet. We greeted at the front desk and were made to feel instantly welcome. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and can't wait to stay here again. The location was perfect, quiet yet very central to all we needed for a quick trip to show friends from another country around NYC.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I live in NYC but planned a night out with my wife for dinner, a show and a one night stay at the Carvi Hotel. A day and half before check in my wife had a stomach virus.Understanding they have a cancellation policy I wanted to ask if the hotel would agree to letting me move the reservation to a different date. I called the hotel and was told to speak to the manager named Greg. I left him a message and never received the courtesy of a call back. I emailed the hotel and never received the courtesy of a return email.How do you manage a hotel but not return calls or emails. Luckily for me I work two blocks from the Carvi so I went to see Greg the manager in person on the day of check in to explain the situation.I was told I cannot cancel or move my reservation. So I told Greg "OK, I'll just bring my wife who has a contagious stomach virus and check her into the hotel". I was told that would not be allowed either. So I cannot cancel or move my reservation BUT I am not allowed to check in with my wife because she is sick. I'll be contacting the better business bureau.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Though a very small hotel, I like it for its Cleanliness and Quiet. The corridor on my floor is only wide enough for a large size luggage, I hardly heard any noise from the other occupants on my floor, the exception being the loud talking of a few guests stepping out of the elevator on the Sunday night. I suppose that can't be controlled if these guests are not mindful of others. I stayed for 3 nights and through the 4 days stay, I hardly heard any sound from the hotel's housekeepers, I am glad they are mindful of the need to go quietly with their tasks. Special thanks to Lucy at the Front Desk for her cheerfulness and helpfulness! Jimmy who checked us in at 1:30am was most helpful and cheerful too. First impression counts! I will stay again if I am in that part of town.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 5 nights at the Carvi Hotel, small but that is why we booked it.Good location in midtown, near a few tube stations.Rooms were clean and had everything we needed, The only small gripe was how little cupboard space there was.We were 2 adults and 2 teenagers and literally had no space to put clothes.Beds were comfy and towels super soft. Plenty of hot water.We were in room 702, no traffic noise at all.The staff were helpful and courteous and helped us with a couple of requests.Would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel because of location. We had a window in our room, which some people said they did not. The room was a little small, but was perfect for staying for one night. Everything was clean and worked out great for us.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was GREAT value for the money. Yes, the room was small, but that is common in NYC. The room, however, was tastefully decorated, with comfortable bed, reading light, mini-bar/fridge, safe, desk, TV...everything you'd expect in a nice hotel was there. The location is quiet: not in the middle of restaurants and bars or tourist attractions, but this being NYC, you do not need to go far for any of those. It is easy to get to by E subway train from Penn Station or JFK. The service was friendly if not the most efficient. Per advice from other reviewers, I did request a room with a window and got one. The "view" was of an inner courtyard. The place may get a bit claustrophobic if you are there more than a day or two, but if you are looking for a clean and comfortable place in a quiet neighborhood but still convenient, this would be a very good choice, at unbeatable value.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very decent hotel for the price and location, but not the ritz. Service was fast and friendly. We had one minor problem in our room and someone was there to address it within 5 minutes. We stayed in a room with two double beds; those all rooms apparently have windows, although we did not have a view. The room was clean and beds were comfortable. As others have said, there is a small half closet. The room also had a safe, mini-fridge, iron and ironing board.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is right in the center of NYC which makes it easy to move around. Most attractions are simply a walk away, even with my 8 year old we didn’t struggle to walk to Central Park, Times Square, Empire State Building, etc. It’s a small well kept charming hotel with a wide selection of reading material made available in the rooms. There’s peace and quiet for a hotel that’s situated in the heart of NYC.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The bed is so great, the pillows and blankets are so soft. The location is also good, near the metro and near restaurants. The cleaning was very good, you also get free coffee. The shower is a bit small, but it was okay. Minibar is expensive.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had to travel to NYC between Christmas and New Years because of a death in the family, and because of housing issues we ended up staying at the Carvi on two separate occasions, the first time for one night and the second for two nights. Both times, the Carvi more than met our needs and we highly recommend the hotel for anyone needed to stay in Midtown East for up to four nights. Perhaps more if you’ve packed light.PROS:1. STAFF: Great staff can make a 3-star hotel seem like a 5-star hotel, and vice versa. The staff at the Carvi made us feel right at home at a very difficult time. They were professional yet compassionate and we can’t say enough about the quality of the staff at the Carvi. Top notch. 2. ROOM: For what some might label a budget to mid-range hotel, the beds were outstandingly comfortable. Surprisingly so, and more comfortable than at far more expensive hotels we’ve stayed at in NYC. And while the room size was a slight issue (see below), the room had (almost) everything you might need for a comfortable stay (again, see below).3. BATHROOM: The bathrooms were surprisingly large and well appointed. There were good sized showers with fine products (e.g., shampoo, soap, etc.) and plenty of good towels. There were even dark colored washcloths for women to remove makeup with. A nice touch, we thought. 4. QUIET: We had two interior rooms during our stay, so never once heard any outside noise from the street. We also never heard any noise from the hallways outside our room, even though one of our rooms was directly off the the lobby. It made for a good nights sleep.5. FREE WIFI: I always say, in this day and age of interconnectivity, any hotel that charges for WiFi should be shunned, and any hotel that charges for WiFi per device should be driven out of business. Luckily, the Carvi offers free, and surprisingly reliable, WiFi.6. COFFEE MAKING IN-ROOM: This is completely a pet peeve of mine, but I hate when hotels don’t offer even the most rudimentary coffee and tea making in their rooms. Even instant coffee and a hot water kettle is fine. Once again, luckily, the Carvi has coffee and tea making in their rooms.7. IN-ROOM SAFE: My wife and I live overseas, so we always have passports with us that we’d prefer not to carry around with us everywhere, so it was nice that the rooms at the Carvi supplied in-room safes. 8. LOCATION: I know this depends on each person’s need, but the location of the Carvi, which is only a few blocks from our family was perfect for our needs. It is also right next door to our favorite dim sum place in NYC, the Kung Fu Little Steamed Buns Ramen restaurant - fantastic food, particularly the xiao long bao (soup dumplings)! Ha!9. IRON AND IRONING BOARD: This is always nice to have if you have nicer clothes with you.10. COST: As I said, we had to travel to NYC between Christmas and New Years, one of the most expensive times of the year for hotels in NYC. The cost at the Carvi, however, was almost insanely cheap. The hotel definitely punches above its weight in terms of value for your money. CONS (all relatively minor):1. ROOM SIZE: So, the rooms were pros for the reasons I listed previously, but one of the downsides is that the rooms, or should I say the more budget rooms we stayed in, were really small. Although, given the price it shouldn’t be that surprising. It wasn’t a problem for us because we left our larger luggage with family and packed light during our stays, but it might be problem for some with larger luggage, particularly because of…2. STORAGE: In the rooms we had, there was VERY little storage. Again, this wasn’t much of an issue for us, but if you’ve packed suits or a lot of clothes that need to be hung up, you might find this problematic. This is why I think that the Carvi is perfect for shorter stays, but may be problematic for anyone wanting to stay longer term.3. POWER OUTLETS: Another issue is there were hardly any power outlets available in the rooms. This could definitely be a problem if, like my wife and I, each person has multiple electronic devises (e.g., phone, laptop, tablet, etc.) to charge.4. NO BAR/RESTAURANT: OK, so this is exceptionally minor, but the hotel is small and does not have a bar or restaurant attached to it. So, no nightcap before bed at the hotel. This didn’t bother us at all because there are plenty of bars in the neighborhood, there is a diner directly across the street for breakfast, and as I mentioned before, Kung Fu Little Steamed Buns Ramen is RIGHT NEXT DOOR! Haha!So, despite some relatively minor cons with the Carvi, we highly recommend the hotel for anyone wanting or needing to stay for a short time in Midtown East Manhattan, NYC.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have been here this week, stayed with a friend. The bed is a decent one, shower quite good, even though annoying that the shower head can not be taken off the hook, but water temperature was excellent. We’ve had an interior room, with no window so it was very quiet. I would’ve liked to know before booking that there is no window though, so perhaps advertising correctly with travel agents to avoid disappointment would be a good idea.The excellent addition to our stay was the super star receptionist lady: Lucy, who checked us in and was there through our whole stay. She couldn’t do enough to help us out with everything: directions, umbrellas, extra duvet, wine glasses, anything you want, name it and she’s there to help! In whole honesty, she’s a real asset to the hotel, such a welcoming and friendly, helpful Many thanks again Lucy and wishing you all the best!
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Stayed as a couple, just before Christmas for a week. Excellent location, very clean, bigger than usual NYC size rooms, and lovely staff. I accidently left behind something and the staff found it a few days after I left and went to a huge amount of effort to post it to me at no charge. They went above and beyond what you would expect. Our 4th time to NYC but I would stay at this hotel again without a doubt.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was just ok nothing really outstanding. I did love how clean it was and the clean comfortable bed but that was it. Unfortunately the hotel room is super tiny not meant for more than a person or two, the walls are super thin, making it almost impossible to sleep, the rooms are so close to each other every time someone opened their door or knocked, I would wake up thinking it was my door. The staff was another sore point, from the moment you walk in there they are so unwelcoming like they don’t want you to be there and you are an annoyance. The manager (Greg) seemed to be an exception to this.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Carvi for 4 night beginning of December. Rooms are clean and well furnished. As with all New York hotels they are compact but are a great base for exploring. Reception very helpful. Location is around 15 minutes from Central Park and 25 minute from Times Square would definitely stay here again on a return trip to New York.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is excellently located being close to Lexington Avenue on 55th Street. It is within easy walking distance of Central Park, Rockefeller Centre and Central Station. The nearby subway station is easily accessible from JFK and offers good links to Downtown Manhattan. The room was kept clean and tidy and had coffee making facility and TV, needed to get own tea bags. General facilities limited to Front Desk and small Roof Terrace, no bar.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most of New York's landmarks such as Time Square, Broadway, Central Park, Fifth Ave are within 10-15 minutes walking distance. There are at least two subway stations within 5 min walking distance. If you are a film buff, locations for Breakfast at Tiffany's are all within walking distance. Serendipity cafe as well. The rooms are neat and clean. Staff is very helpful to your needs. No free breakfast, but there is Dunkin Donuts nearby and a pizza place. Also there are those food stalls at street corners.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An excellent small hotel with clean and well appointed rooms. No restaurant or food service but there are restaurants all around. The only negative is the typical NY city noise outside the building at all hours. So much more reasonable than the majority of the NY hotels.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights, mid week as we were attending a conference at the Javits centre., We had a king room with no window and this was perfect for us. No window was not a deal as we were out most of the time. The staff were great, helpful and very friendly. We were able to leave our luggage as we arrived too early (11am) to check-in. A great location as its easy to get to the metro, or walk to the tourist spots. Many good places to eat- we went to Ipanema restaurant as recommended by the hotel- best meal we've had out in a long long time. Will definitely be back.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here on business and found it adequate. I particularly liked the in room coffee maker and 2 decent sized windows. Bed is a bit hard and the room is typically small for NYC . A bit on the expensive side.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The receptionist was very friendly and helpful; check in was a breeze. Room was very small, but clean, with all the necessary amenities. Bed was comfortable, and room was quiet. There were no windows in the room where I stayed. Subway is close by; not far from Time Square, Mediterranean Restaurant right next door.Considering the location, this hotel is a very good value.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just checked out of Carvi Hotel. A small, but lovely hotel situated right in the city of New York with good walking distance to both Central Park and time square. Friendly staff and nice clean rooms.Will definitely book here again next time we're in NYC.Also great value for the cash.We've been around at so many hotels in this world, and stayed at fancy hotels that definitely wasn't worth the money. Often find out that the hotels that are at affordable prices are just as good. And Carvi was definitely one of those.Nice roof terrace to enjoy the city noises. We had a room on the sixth floor, and we had no noise during night, so a good quiet sleep.Absolutely recommend it.. enjoy your stay
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location of the hotel is great,5 minutes walk to the subway. across the road you can have a descent breakfast (about $15)the receptionists are very helpful and friendly.the rooms are quiet small but the bed is very comfortable.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed a night for business purposes. Good beds and service and all important things are fine. Hotel has no breakfast, bar or other areas for hanging out. But this is not important as it is close to everything. It is by close to 5th and Central Park and has the nicest pub and restaurant PJ Clarkes a few feet away. Price is ok given NYC is an expensive spot.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Carvi gave us everything we needed from our hotel, clean and modern, good location, friendly staff.Our room was internal, with no windows, this was great in terms of noise (there was none) and ensuring we slept easily when we needed to. Not quite so easy when trying to work out what the weather is doing while getting dressed but a quick trip to the roof terrace resolved that!The staff were keen to help and always greeted us as we left and arrived.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel at a great location, the staff is incredibly nice and helpful, i rekommenderande you ask for a quiet room. In short, its a great, quiet hotel with great staff, i truly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited the Carvi hotel on the 5/12/16 for a week. The hotel is quite small but located midtown so near all the main tourist attractions. The room was nice and spacious and cleaned daily with a flat screen TV. The staff were very helpful recommending restaurants and things to do and giving little tips. I find when in New York as a tourist I just need somewhere to sleep at night as the majority of the time you are out exploring. The Carvi hotel provides great location and comfort at a great cost.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our bedroom didn't have windows! I confess that not having natural light was weird, but there was AC (blessed! So important in the summer!), a nice size bedroom, so it was ok. The staff was nice, the location was good, I'd probably go back. There's a Starbucks close by, perfect for breakfast. There was a computer in the reception you could use and a terrace for relaxing on top. However, it's a small building compared to those around, so not much use going up to the roof.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got a fantastic rate under $100 a night in Midtown manhatten. a few blocks from Blooming dales one way and a few blocks from the Walrdorf the other way. Restaurants and Bars galore.. The hotel is quite discreet in appearance. There is one person at the desk, Ive met all of them and they are very very nice. The rooms are wonderful.. they hagve their own library int he rooms, shelves of books left behind by guests, The beds are VERY comfortable. They have room service catered by the restaurant?diner across the street... It is a very safe area and I know this becasue i used to live in the apartment building attached.. It is also very quiet.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good service, confortable room and well located hotel. And with a fair price.What we liked best was the very good location of the hotel combined with a fair price.There were nothing special that we have liked least. The hotel is good and we will recommend for our friends.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The people make this hotel stay a pleasure. Most helpful all the time. Location is perfect for all tourist attractions and nice restaurants. We had an executive room which was quite big and quiet on floor 4. The only gripe would be not enough hanging space in wardrobe for longer items, especially if staying for long stays. Would definitely stay again and recommend. Thank you for making our stay very pleasurable.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently spent a week at the Carvi Hotel. Nicely located on east 55th St, this small hotel has clean and quiet rooms, not large but bigger than one would expect for a hotel in this price range. Lots of restaurants nearby, about a half hour walk from the theatre district.Would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well located and very clean. The room we stayed in was small (typical NYC) but the bed was very comfortable. Walking distance to the subway and Central Park. Good restaurant choices nearby and we would be happy to stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, I have to say that the location of this hotel is very good. Walking distance from Central Park and very close to both 51st & 59th Street subway stations...those two stations get you to so many different parts of the City.Unfortunately, that was pretty much the only positive with this hotel, which actually has all the standards that people in the UK might associate with a budget hotel chain. The price is not cheap enough to justify such a slack approach to decor and service.The windows are so thin that, if your room is at the front of the hotel, you will get very little sleep thanks to all the car and van horns outside. The windows were also very dark, with blocked views of the outside street. There was no restaurant or bar in the hotel and the restaurant opposite, which the Carvi give you a 10% discount for, was awful. We went in for coffee one day as we had to leave our room for 15 minutes (evidently being out of our room for 7 hours with a "service" sign on the door handle wasn't enough time for our room to be cleaned) and the place was really old fashioned and not very clean. One of our mugs had two bright lipstick marks on it!! In the hotel room, the old fashioned shower cubicle leaked under the door/screen each time we showered, meaning we had to waste towels drying the floor each day. When we checked out we were never actually asked how our stay was at any point. The final poor point of this hotel was that the wardrobe space is almost non-existent (space for about 7 hangers and no length for anything longer than shirts) and there are very few hooks elsewhere in the room. Even Travelodge hotels (with all due respect) manage to solve the wardrobe space issues better than this hotel do.Throughout our stay we had no real interaction from staff and the entrance area/lobby was about that same size as our room, which meant there was nowhere to relax. When we were waiting for our car to collect us at the end of our trip, we had to sit through members of staff moaning about not getting paid their overtime and there was literally nowhere for us to go to avoid these "private" conversations.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Carvi on East 55th St is a great place to stay for a few days while visiting NYC. Situated within walking distance of many of the Midtown sights including Grand Central, Times Square, Rockafella centre, Central Park and the shops of 5th Avenue. Staff on reception very friendly and eager to advise. No breakfast in hotel though Midtown Diner directly across road provides more than adequate meals at reaonable prices. Tube station on Lexington is just a 5 min walk away from which you can easily access all areas of the city. On arrival at JFK we paid $70 for a taxi to hotel. On return we paid $14 for tube which was probably quicker and just as convienient.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel worked out well for me. I requested a quiet room and was pleasantly surprised! 702 was very quiet...but no one was using the roof top patio given the time of year. The room was a good size for NYC. Lighting wasn't great but otherwise the room is fine, beds were comfortable etc. The roof top patio looks very nice!
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would whole heartedly recommend the Carvi. We travelled as a family of 3, 2 adults and a teenager. The hotel is clean and modern. We had a good size room with 2 double beds. The room had a clean and well lit bathroom. We had bath robes provided and plenty of towels. There is also a mini fridge with soft drinks and snacks available - we didn't use. Coffee making machine that I did use daily, these were replenished for me.The staff are friendly and polite, especially the lady. She was super nice and really helped us out when we were checking out. The main selling point of this hotel it the location. 53/3rd Lexington Sub is minutes away. Additionally, it is in walking distances from all the major sights in Manhattan. When we return to New York I would return to this hotel.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed only one night for a business trip. I wanted a place that was a short walk to my client's office in midtown Manhattan, and the Carvi hotel was very convenient. The front desk staff was pleasant and professional, the room (one king bed) was a comfortable size -- neither cramped nor spacious, with a good-sized bathroom and ample closet. The bed was *very* comfortable. The price was quite good for what you get, and included many extras that other hotels charge for: WiFi, premium TV channels, on-demand TV. Even the minibar was reasonably priced (a bag of cookies cost me $3). My biggest complaint is that the bathroom door had a spring closure that would result in it slamming on its own. I ended up putting a towel in the door to keep it from closing all the way. Also, the number of towels they provided would have been skimpy for a couple, though I'm sure you could ask for more towels if you need. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived and requested an upper floor with lots of light. We were told that the room we had did not have any windows. I thought that was illegal as it is a fire safety issue, but was told that they can put us in a windowless room. They offered us a room with a window for an additional $60. As it was in the evening, we paid the $60 and got a smelly room with some sort of loud machinery 10' away from our window. I cannot imagine why this hotel has good reviews. Maybe the owners relatives are posting? It doesn't make sense to me.
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: comfortable bed, nice desk. no comfortable chair, no available breakfast, somewhat short staffed (when I needed a light bulb I was told only the front desk person was there and she couldn't leave it. when the maintenance guy came in he was somewhat unpleasant and didn't pick up the pieces of broken light bulb glass). Front desk people were pleasant and location in manhattan great
hotelName:
23    Carvi NYC
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A gem in the heart of Manhattan. Stylish, practical, and great service from all the staff. Easy to walk to anything and everything. Enjoyed the rooftop bar nightly (not a thumping party scene but a beautiful terrace and view) Nice breakfast with the NY Times (old school paper!) and happy hour was a welcome refuge to look forward to after hot summer days playing tourist. Shout out to Steven (doorman) who was always congenial and offered help to find the unmarked airport express bus stop a block away. Birthday champagne and chocolates were waiting in my room as ordered by a friend. Only improvement worth mentioning is better makeup lighting in bathroom.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apologies for late posting of my stay.... Love this hotel!Cozy room and nicely decorated. The library area is a relaxing place to unwind and have a coffee, there are snacks (included in room rate), however it would be nice if there were also gluten free options available (apart from stock standard fruit). The rooftop area is wonderful too - fireplace on during those cold winter days :) Great location, walking distance to many places.Staff at reception and the door are so welcoming - thank you.When in NYC, I would not hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is unique! It is conveniently located to the New York Public Library, The Empire State Building and Times Square. The service was excellent. I stayed at the Petite room. It was small but tidy, clean, cozy and modernly furnished. The only disadvantage was that it was close to the elevator. I spent the afternoon in the Poetry Garden reading a novel because the weather was rainy the first day.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our first visit in February 2019, we decided to come back again. We booked the same type of room but we were upgraded to a queen room, #702, Paintings. This room was very nice and just as our first room, the space was utilized very well. Our only complaint was the mattress seemed to sink or lean in towards the center of the bed. While it made that nights sleep a bit uncomfortable, the room was clean and wonderfully decorated. I can’t imagine why, but I found the first rooms books on Economics more interesting that the books on Paintings. It is is a great location and it is worth money.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 6 nights in June. Lovely hotel and staff. Ideally situated in midtown Manhattan. The complimentary breakfast and cheese and wine were the icing on the cake. Very close to Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, and Empire State Builiding.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had such a wonderful experience at the Library Hotel. Would have loved to have stayed longer. The continental breakfast was perfect as a quick start to the day. And, the 24-hour access to coffee, tea, treats and books was awesome. We stayed on the 12th floor in one of the larger rooms. The room was great. Love that they do turn down service. And, just so nice to have free bottled water in addition to the continental breakfast and evening receptions. It was refreshing to not be charged or things every time we turned around.The staff was fantastic. Always there to help. Everything about our stay was pleasant and uncomplicated. These are qualities that seems to have escaped most hotels these days.We will definitely stay there again and definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a night at this small gem of a hotel located in mid town Manhattan. Service couldn’t have been better from check in through the included breakfast the next morning. Great value, clean and accessible. The only issue is street noise. Located at the corner of 41st and Madison that should come as no real surprise.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved!!!this hotel, from the welcoming and friendly “Libra to the unique and individual rooms. The bed was awesome and the amenities delightful. I can’t wait to come back and pick a different room. We especially enjoyed “bookmarks “ the lounge on the 14th floor. Simply lovely and located in the heart of Manhattan.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the 5th time my family and i have stayed at the library hotel and we love it. The rooms are spacious, the staff is thoroughly professional and courteous, and the amenities are most welcomed.The location was ideal and I whoeheartedly Recomend this to anyone who is looking for a terrific NY hotel
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in NY, I made a right choice to stay in this hotel. The best location for us, it’s so close to the Grand Central station only a few mins walk from the hotel so it's safe our time to get in and out of NY as the traffic could be quite bad in the city. You can find so many great restaurants nearby and easy to get a cab or Uber. The hotel has a distinctive character, each room has a different name. Our suite was a good size, spotless, bed and pillows were so comfortable. The hotel offered Continental Breakfast which was a good choice of pastries and all day refreshments plus wine and cheese for aperitif. Hotel staff was EXCELLENT, so friendly, efficient and attentive! THANK YOU to everyone (specially Billy) who made our stay in NY so memorable!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was lovely and clean, staff were great. Comfortable beds with plenty of space in the room. Wifi was good, nice rooftop. Great location over in Midtown. Reasonably priced compared with similar hotels we have stayed at. Hopefully we can return in the future.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel was absolutely lovely from the elevators to the Rooftop. The rooms were wonderful The amenities could not be beat The staff were friendly helpful and kind The breakfast was delicious The wine and cheese at 5 were perfect The check out time was 1 pm
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a week and were ready to move in permanently. The rooms are small but lovely and perfectly appointed. The staff is excellent. The reading room is lovely - for early coffee, breakfast, wine happy hour, and of course, reading. The restaurant (Madison & Vine) is excellent, and weather permitting, a lovely place to eat, sip and watch the world of NY walk by. We will be back!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel. We took the “single” room and it was just fine for two of us. We enjoyed all the books, the great breakfast (in the book filled lounge) the happy hour (delicious and great selection of cheese). We visited the roof top terrace one afternoon and regretted never getting up there after dark. The location was perfect - one block from NYPL along Library Way. Walked to the theatre, Times Square, MOMA, Central Park.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A most enjoyable stay in a very pleasant hotelGreat location and staff were very nice and concierge most helpful and friendlyWould return again when visiting your beautiful cityRooms most comfortable and always a pleasure when returning to relax after a busy dayMany thanks
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My book club and I spent the night at this amazing hotel and loved every minute. From the moment you check in with employees standing in front of an entire wall of card catalog drawers, you know this is going to be epic. The Reading Room amenities and drinking Tequila Mockingbirds at the rooftop bar Bookmarks were cherries on top of the amazing Dewey Decimal themed rooms that made each member’s stay at the Library Hotel unique. I would definitely come back in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in NYC for a long weekend and stayed at the Library Hotel on the recommendation of friends. It was wonderful. We don’t usually like staying in midtown but this was an exception. It was an excellent location for Broadway and anywhere else we wanted t9 go with Grand Central right around the corner. Staff was so friendly. Dick at the desk was a delight.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights in late May, beginning of June and had a brilliant time. Yes the rooms are a bit small but that’s New York. It’s also pretty noisy outside for most of the night. However the staff were amazing, breakfast was lovely and the complimentary cheese and wine is a nice touch. I would certainly recommend this for those looking to visit New York, it’s really close to grand central station for the subway too!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is something special here that is rarely found in many hotels today. Nothing is overdone, meaning that the staff are courteously diligent, they quickly respond to our needs and even anticipate them. I like the rooms, their cozy feeling, and I will continue to stay with them in the future.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Read great reviews on Tripadvisor and they did not let me down. We stayed four nights and enjoyed every minute. The room was lovely and it was a perfect central location, but the service was the standout. Everyone we encountered, from front desk to housekeeping to the attendants in the Reading Room, was personable, helpful and friendly (a special thank you to Bill, the concierge, and Duke at the front desk!). I am already planning my next stay with you.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Library Hotel is ideal for those who want to be thoroughly indulged whilst exploring New York. It is very close to Times Square, Grand Central Station and the Chrysler building. The welcome is absolutely fantastic - nothing is too much trouble - and there are pleasant little extras like complimentary breakfast and 24-hour coffee, hot chocolate and pastries. The hotel is not very big, so it doesn't suffer from the impersonal feel of some hotels. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying at the Library hotel has been on my bucket list for a long time! It was an amazing experience, from the Dewey decimal themed rooms to roof top bar! It exceeded my expectations! Would love to stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Library for four nights. The location is one block from Grand Central Station and withing walking distance to many attractions and excellent restaurants. The room size, at the Library, was satisfactory for New York standards. It was attractive, clean and very well appointed. The second floor lounge area was a nice setting for the complimentary breakfast and evening wine and cheese offering. The lounge was friendly and helpful and did an admirable job of attending to guests and managing the cleanliness of the area. The breakfast included all types of coffee selections, juice, fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, bagels, toast, and sweet rolls. The wine and cheese offering included a nice choice of good wine, cheeses, crackers, nuts and other assorted goodies. The front desk staff was excellent. they were friendly, professional, and very helpful with directions, how to use the subway, and suggestions for things to do. We had difficulty with the HVAC in our room. Service staff were dispatched quickly but needed to return after repeated concerns to complete the repairs. I would definitely return to the Library and will seek out the other hotels in other cities.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 5 days in a very comfortable Hotel. The personnel of the hotel has been very nice and helpful for a couple who were for the firsta time in New York. The position of the hotel is "strategical" becuase very closed to the public transportation, to Time Square, Broadway, the 5th avenue, the Moma, The Empire State Building…..These are surely most of the reason which made our holidays SUPER
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second stay and they did not disappoint! The room was exquisite and the service friendly and accommodating. A great location right near the library. I am a librarian so of course this place is near and dear to my heart. The continental breakfast and wine and cheese offerings in the reading room are delicious. The reading room is a fun place to hang out. Can’t wait to go back!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have always loved this hotel which feels like home and is very well located to walk to many places in New York. It has been one of my favorite hotel since 2002! I have referred it to friends and family, all of whom have also very much liked it. We all continue to return to the Library hotel whenever we are in Manhattan. Great stay!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent accommodations. Extremely clean. Very comfortable bed. Friendly and engaged staff. All in a great central locations in mid-Manhattan. Having the second floor lounge always available makes it like staying on a concierge floor.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reminiscent of European boutique hotes - l tucked away just off Madison but within walking distance of everywhere!Superlative staff. Cozy rooftop bar. Rained constantly the week we were there, but complimentary umbrellas kept us dry. Wonderful recommendations for dinner and day trips. I definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the rooms aren’t large the staff are so friendly, professional and knowledgeable you really come to feel you’re part of the family. The location is great if you’re spending lots of time near Times Square. Being near Grand Central Station afford great opportunity to hub and spoke around NYC. The hotel chain itself seems to be near fantastic neighborhood-like bars and restaurants which makes your stay even better.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In addition to the unbeatable location, the Library Hotel has terrific service (including complementary continental breakfast and evening wine, full turn down service, robes, slippers) and is impeccably clean. The rooms are a bit small, but they really work and are very comfortable. And of course, the place is a book lover's dream--the theme is carried throughout and does not disappoint.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed this hotel very much. The room was small but very comfortable. The bathroom was nice and included a makeup mirror. The location was great and it was surprisingly quiet. The breakfast and evening wine and cheese room is a nice plus. The only downside was the price, which was high. But I would definitely go back.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! Such quaint little hotel with everything you can possibly need. The service is amazing! Free continental breakfast, wine and cheese in the evening and Coffee, Cappuccino, Bottle Water, Latte and pastries all night on the second floor. Definitely recommend it! We stayed in a corner suite room 1006.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would thoroughly recommend this gem of a hotel. Nestled in amongst the busy streets centrally, a stones throw from Grand Central it is a real tranquil and friendly stay with a gorgeous and cosy roof top bar. The hotel is set out like a library too which gives it a cool quirk.Also - a rarity for NY - is breakfast / snacks AND cheese and wine...included in the stay!When they realised it was my birthday they sent a complimentary bottle of Prosecco to our room. Many thanks for Billy and the team for the great care. Really positive experience.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was one of the best hotels we have stayed at. We were there recently for 10 nights and loved every minute of it. From Duke who made us feel so welcome to all the staff they were all wonderful. We looked forward to the complimentary breakfast everyday and the glass of bubbles at night. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else in future. Perfect location, perfect hotel.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights after reading reviews on tripadvisor and not disappointed . Room was very comfortable, good shower, enjoyable breakfast with good choice , free coffee/tea anytime and wine with snacks late afternoon. Staff were very helpful. Good central location.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really love the Library Collection hotels on Manhattan. First time at Library Hotel, a very positive experience. Within walking distance to a lot of sights on Manhattan, such as Central Park, 5th avenue, Grand Central, The Rock, and also towards Soho area. Easy to get to Newark with direct bus service from Grand Central. Very clean and nice rooms, a bit small, attentive staff, small but great complementary breakfast, A nice perk is the complementary afternoon wine and cheese from 5-8pm. Quietly located on Madison. Highly recommended. We’ll for sure be back.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently traveled to NYC for the first time in Feb. for a week of sightseeing. We found the Library Hotel on the recommendation of friends. It was perfect!The location in midtown is very convenient. It’s only a short block from the magnificent Midtown branch of the NYC Public Library, Grand Central Station, numerous great restaurants and a 5 minute walk from the theatre district. The hotel was very quiet, clean and fresh and the staff was professional, helpful and friendly. We look forward to returning.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Library Hotel is a wonderful, boutique hotel just a block from the New York Public Library (which is worth the trip in itself). From the moment you check in the staff is wonderful and attentive. The room was great. The morning breakfast and evening wine and snacks were a pleasant surprise and after one trip to the rooftop bar, you're a regular. We can't wait to get back.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s perfect. Quiet. No crazy nightlife scene. Off the beaten track but still close to things. The staff is terrific. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. Nice wine hour and breakfast. I’ll be back. Wish they didn’t have a two night minimum.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel, very tasty breakfast (especially for vegetarians: bagels, cream, fresh fruits, porridge etc.), efficient, helpful and very friendly staff, room had very comfortable bed, big bathroom, cosy atmosphere in breakfast room with books and newspapers, cool rooftop bar - amazing both inside and outside, excellent restaurant!We loved the special extras: bottle of wine in room, books as present at check-in.Walking distance to Public Library, Grand Central Terminal, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Times Square.Highly recommendable hotel!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was perfect for a quick business trip. Check in process was fast and easy. Front desk provided restaurant suggestion and called ahead for me to make sure I could get in. Bkfst was great! Do over.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were rather small (hey, it's New York City) but nice. Service was good, and the breakfast room is a nice place to start your day. Good location -- about a 10 minute walk to Times Square/Broadway theaters.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I enjoyed returning to our hotel each day. It was a nice break from the hustle and bustle in the city. Everything was clean and the employees were kind and accommodating. The breakfast and afternoon reception was something we looked forward to each day. We would definitely stay here again if we return to NYC.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very sweet and charming. The amenities are wonderful and the service super. There is a rooftop bar with trees and views of the library, and is extremely well located. The service was very attentive.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: our stay was really pleasant. the room was clean and the bed very comfortable. the service is nice and the wine and cheese at 2nd floor was a very good experience. Perhaps, more smiles from the personal in charge of the breakfast would be a good idea. I strongly recommend this hotel !
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed in a different hotel every time we visit NY but will definately go back to the Library otel, it is a firm favourite. The staff are all very pleasant, helpful and friendly and go the extra mile to make you welcome and comfortable. We mentioned it was my husbands birthday during our stay and came back to our room to a lovely bottle of red wine and a card from The Librarians, thank you!We had a petite room, which was so cosy, comfortable and clean (housekeeping do a great job, they are unobtrusive and there is a turn down service). We had two large windows, aircon, tv & dvd, fridge, bath and shower, complimentary toiletries, wardrobe, drawers, a safe, large mirrors, great lighting and a very comfortable bed. We were on the 11th floor (Philosophy!) which was far enough up to not be troubled with street noise, we slept soundly as there were no banging doors, noisy guests or elevator noise.. bliss. The complimentary breakfast was plentiful, fresh and there was a great variety to enjoy with your complimentary newspaper in the lovely ambience of the Reading Room, overlooking Library Way, with a view of the NY Public Library. You can make use of the Reading Room and enjoy complimentary drinks and snacks 24 hours, as well as prosecco, wine and cheese every evening from 5-8pm. Things like this make the hotel a comfort you look forward to returning to, rather than just a place to sleep.There is a business centre with two internet pcs and printer, with free use. The hotel has a very popular restaurant, Madison and Vine and room service is available at a very reasonable cost. There is also a roof terrace, bar and lounge.The hotel is in a great location, very close to Grand Central, Bryant Park, Fifth Avenue and the subway all within easy walking distance.Thank you so much to all of the Librarians for making our latest stay in beautiful New York City a memorable one. We will see you again.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can only endorse all the positive things already said about this hotel. We were very kindly given an upgraded room (thank you Librarians!). We were visiting New York from Scotland to celebrate my 60th birthday. My husband had researched and chosen this hotel and WOW it did not disappoint. From the excellent location to the 2nd floor Reading Room and all of it's amenities. We packed a lot into our few days stay in NY but I can honestly say that the Library Hotel is one of the big highlights of our holiday. I must also mention the Librarians, without exception everyone we encountered were an absolute credit to the hotel.I hope to return to this wonderful hotel and I'm recommending to all my friends that they MUST book this hotel should they be planning a trip to NY.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a great locationright in the middle of manhattan, but quiet.I liked the opportunity to have breakfast in the hotel ( incl. The New York Times!) and cheesem and wine in the evening. The room (single) was small but the bed was comfortable and it contained everything one needs.Walls and floors a bit drabIf I come again to NY I will again stay at the Library Hotel
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the lovely ladies in the breakfast room who remember I like a full carafe of tea when I come in, to Steven at the door who greets us with a warm welcome to the ladies who clean our room promptly..the best!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second stay at the Library Hotel.After a busy day in the city, it is an oasis of hospitality and relaxation. The staff is always very friendly, very helpful; in short, superb. The evening wine and cheese, and the morning breakfast, are well-staffed and excellent. Of course the whole idea of being surrounded by all those books is wonderful.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from a great 5 days in New York. I wanted it to be really special, as it was a treat for my sister’s 60th birthday. My brother and sister in law recommended The Library, and I am so glad they did. I could not fault this hotel. It was amazing in every way. The room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The Reading Room was ideal for us, especially the complimentary wine and nibbles between 5pm and 8pm! It was great to get a wee prosecco and a nibble before we ventured out at night. So relaxing, especially with the subtle background music. The breakfast was perfect for us – juices, cereals, bagels and bread (which the staff were happy to toast for you), and the fresh fruit cocktail was delicious. You could also pop in to the Reading Room at any time for a tea/coffee and a biscuit or a piece of fruit just to chill out. The staff were also fantastic. The reception staff (so friendly and helpful with any advice we had), all the girls who worked in the Reading Room (were just lovely and so attentive), the staff in the rooftop bar, the guys who worked on the door and the cleaners. The location is ideal. Just round the corner from 2 different subway stations (Bryant Park and Grand Central Terminal). Also if you are travelling from Newark Airport, there is an express bus that drops you just round the corner from the hotel. Can you tell that I liked it?
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All you need is here. Perfect location, smiling staff, spotless rooms with new bathrooms, great decor with the library theme and very generous hospitality with 24h coffee and snacks and a free light dinner with cheese and wines. Rooftop bar and another Bar at the street level. Price is reasonable. Difinitely would come back.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I recently stayed here for 5 nights and we can’t recommend it enough! It’s a great location with so many places you can walk to nearby - Grand Central Station, Central Park, Times Square, Empire State Building and many more. The hotel itself is perfect - you always feel welcome and very personal. The continetal breakfast, wine & cheese reception and 24hour refreshments are great - it really added to our holiday experience. The room was big enough for two with lots of little extras like chocolates and a daily weather report. The bed was really comfy too. Would highly recommend this hotel - if we come back to New York we will definitely book here again!
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second visit, this past March (2019). Same great hotel, very nice service. Breakfast and happy hour both included with room, with very drinkable wine for happy hour. Service by gorgeous young people. Helpful people at front desk and at the door. Price commensurate with location.
hotelName:
24    Library Hotel by Library Hotel Collection
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No one wants to find a bug inter bed, any type of bug but that's what I had after one night at the Four Points Midtown West. I called to reception and said there was bug in my bed and I wasn't sure if it was a bed bug or not. It took maintenance 35 minutes to get up to my room. which was much longer than I wanted to stay there. In that time I must have called down to reception at lest 3 times.They really didn't seem to know how to deal with the situation. Finally they said they would dry clean all my clothes (which they really meant was putting them through a regular dryer) and steam my luggage. Which they did.All I wanted to do was to leave the hotel, just get out of there but they weren't prepared to move me unless I paid for a new hotel and I assume they would refund me my stay. This was impossible at such short notice as there was no way I wanted to go to another Four Points and everywhere decent seemed to be about $400 plus taxes per night.I was frustrated and mad as I honestly didn't think they dealt with this the way I expected.IN the end, as I couldn't see another way around t, I moved rooms to another floor, asked them to deep clean the room I entered nd just stayed there for the rest of the time.Grissele at reception, tried her best to help me but the decisions weren't hers to make. I tried to sort it through Marriott but they were zero help saying all decisions were made at hotel level.Well that's my last ism at a Four Points.Just to add I'm gold level status withMarriott and even with that they had no interest at all in helping me.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect for some days of Manhattan sightseeing excursions. It is well connected and right in the center of midtown west - good base for exploring Manhattan from the North to the South. The Highline begins more or less in front of the hotel entrance. The hotel itself is ok - rooms offer enough space, comfortable beds. Housekeeping is bad - we needed five days until they changed our sheets - not at all acceptable : its not a budget hotel! Rooms are noisy as windows are not protecting enough. AC works unreliable and is extremely noisy.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a 5 night stay. Great location very clean and modern big bed large shower and staff are great. Always helpful and courteous. Would definitely stay again and the city view was worth having
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for three nights while attending the 2019 PGA Championship because of its proximity to Penn Station. Decent rooms at a reasonable nightly rate. Beware of the noise in the area due to a LOT of construction. The exterior windows and HVAC are also not insulated well enough to prevent standard NYC street noise from entering the room.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't say enough nice things about this hotel, especially the staff. They really go out of their way to make sure you have a great stay here. I was here for a week and will definitely stay again. The room has lots of outlets, including USB, and light switches on both sides of the bed that control all the lights in the room. It was also very clean and the bed was comfortable. There was complimentary coffee and water both in the room and the lobby.There is the typical noise level you can expect from NY during the day but at night it's way quieter than being right in Times Square. I noticed some reviews complaining about construction noise at night but that has been addressed by the hotel and I didn't hear any during my stay.The subway, line 7, station is an easy walk and I felt safe walking back to the hotel alone at night. I was here on vacation and it was very convenient traveling all over the city.Did I mention how great the staff was? Excellent!Will definitely book again!
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff were great and the hotel itself was really nice, so the location is so unfortunate. When I checked in, there was a note saying construction wouldn't go past 6pm - which I thought would be fine. Cue relentless, noisy jackhammering EVERY NIGHT UNTIL FOUR AM. The last night was the worst - construction noise made it absolutely impossible to sleep, the night before an important meeting.To future guests: under no circumstances allow yourself to be placed in a room facing westTo the hotel: please don't set unrealistic expectations about construction noise. It always started at 10:30pm when I was already in bed -- if I'd realized it would be every night, I would have gotten myself moved during the day.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a new hotel in the gentrified Hudson Yards area. Very nice, albeit small rooms. They have a bar and breakfast area. Since it’s new everything is in great shape. A bit pricey at this level but hey, it’s manhattan.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Pros: - good location if you are going to Javits Center- comfy bed with slippers and robes- close enough to walk with luggage from Penn Station- store luggageThe Cons- no room service. They stopped the service but still advertise that they have it, even on menus printed in room-very loud from nearby construction starting at 8 am
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone working here is very nice and helpful. This does not overcome the terrible location smack in the middle of many construction sites that are working 24/7. Jackhammering all night and clouds of dust make it unpleasant
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 5 night for trade show at Javits and wanted to be as close as I could. This is one long block away and hotel was such a nice surprise. I arrived exhausted after a long trip and found major construction noise just as I climbed into bed for a nap. Even with earplugs it was hopeless. They moved me to a much quieter room within 5 minutes of my call (though makes me question why they didn’t give me the quiet room in the first place). Concierge very helpful, little restaurant perfect, food yummy, beds and rooms comfortable, spiffy and clean, and staff almost unusually delightful, helpful and fun. I arrived with no expectations and found I had a wonderful time here! Highly recommend!
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is currently stuck in a construction zone but this is hardly the fault of this hotel who go to good lengths to warn guests on check in and locate you away....The rooms are typical Manhattan small side;, but well equipped and comfortable, good free fast wifi. Good breakfast area and only a few blocks from the main central tourist areas and a few mts walk from the high line walk....only 2 running machines in the small fitness center....I would stay again...
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unethical lazy staff!! Stayed here for 2 nights and they didn't even bother changing the bed sheets or cleaning the room. On day 2 I left the room at 11am and returned at 5pm with no service. I called the front desk (who spoke to a manager) who told me the room cleaners went to my room around 2pm and said I had a sign on my door (I didn't) and that the cleaners already left. They said there was nothing they could do and hinted that I was lying about the sign on the door.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptionally clean place 20 minutes from Times Square with helpful, attentive staff and good internet. Free tea and coffee 24/7 available in the lobby, room service and restaurant menu available in the cosy bar along with local craft beer.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked our room months ago for Thanksgiving Week. When we arrived, there were signs everywhere explaining that there was construction in the area and they apologized for the inconvenience. The pile driver started hammering about 0630 every morning and continued into the evening. If you’re an early riser, no problem! If not, pray you’re a heavy sleeper! Rooms were nice and clean. Although they’re small, a lot of storage areas are provided so a couple won’t feel cramped. Breakfast is available but wasn’t included with our room. The location is only about 10 minutes from the nearest subway station which was very convenient for us. The folks at the desk were very friendly and accommodating. We asked for more towels one evening and they were delivered warm right from the dryer (nice touch). Just remember, the construction won’t last forever and the Sheraton is doing what it can to minimize the inconvenience.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been for over a week at the Hotel. Clean, tidy, cozy. Great beds.Modern, well mantained.Room Size is perfect. Bathroom size is perfect.Restorant downstairs is great too. Staff is great.I have only one downside to address and it the Air Conditioner noise.Just two blocks from Javits Convention center (I been there to attend to a convention).I would definetely recomend it and I cant wait to get back there again!A little on the "costly" side, especially on the week ive been ther but.. everything is expensive in NY...
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights at the Four Points. It’s a smaller hotel but relatively new and still quite clean and maintained. It’s locations is excellent if you are attending a conference or tradeshow at the Javits Center. It’s two blocks away and a straight shot down 35th. Check in was quick, friendly and efficient. I went up to my room in the bank of two elevators. I was worried I would wait for the elevator during the week considering there were only two but I never waited. There are only 6-7 rooms on each floor (it’s either 6 or 8 but I don’t recall). I had a single queen. The room was quite compact but perfectly fine for a single traveler. Would have been fine for a couple too. There was enough space for my luggage and enough closet space to place my clothes. The only thing missing I would have liked was a mini-fridge. The bed is on a platform so it’s higher than normal but fine. Mattress was firm enough for me. The bathroom is smaller but not to small. Single vanity but not a lot of counter space though. The washroom needs a small shelf somewhere. The walk in shower is a nice size too. Water pressure for the shower was fine but the water pressure for the sink was quite week. The staff downstairs in the lobby were great and friendly. The restaurant was good and the staff were great. Only downside is the construction noise which isn’t the hotels fault. Lots happening in the Hudson Yard area. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was very good , rooms good , staff friendly, bar in lobby very nice food and beer , drilling starts at 6.30am Monday to Friday you can hear it but we was up and was like an alarm clock so wasn’t a big deal for us , check in and check all good was a nice stay
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even by having a confirmed reservation from a travel agency, they force you on a weekend during your travel to enter your credit card information again - written confirmation was provided in advance and credit card sent
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton Midtown September 21-25. This hotel was absolutely perfect! Our room was not huge, but by NY standards it was well above average. We had the King Bed room and it was more than enough space for two people. The room was incredibly clean. The bedding was perfect and there was more than enough for my daughter and I to divide up so that we weren't pulling on each others covers all night. The provided closet and drawers were more than enough space to keep all of our belongings and luggage tucked away. Though there was construction going on, we barely heard anything in our room. The extensive window shades/curtains/sheers blocked out ALL of the light so we could sleep as late as we wanted. Each room has it's own thermostat so we could keep it at whatever temperature made us comfortable. Our room was directly across from the elevator, and unless someone was exiting on our floor, you barely heard it. Pretty much the same noise level that one would encounter if they were staying in a hotel in the suburbs, which is pretty incredible when you're in the middle of the city. The location of this hotel is outstanding! It is located less than a block away from the 7 train which is one of the cleanest and safest subway stations we encountered on our stay. It's one stop away from Times Square. A couple of blocks away is the entrance for the High Line, which is a gorgeous must see and at the other end is Chelsea Market. There is a lovely cafe on the corner that is literally steps outside of the hotel entrance. If we didn't already love this hotel enough, what really sealed the deal is that in a moment of panic, they saved the day. We had ordered a car to pick us up to take us back to the airport, but due to the president being in town, the roads were getting shut down and our planned car service couldn't reach us. I had looked up Uber and Yellow Cab and they would be almost another hour out. Eddie, who I believe is the manager was keeping an eye on us, making sure everything was okay while we waited for our car. He checked in after our service cancelled and were starting to panic that we weren't going to make it to the airport in time. He said he would see if he could get his driver to pick us up. THREE minutes later Tino was there and we were on our way! I cannot say enough great things about this hotel and it's the only place I will ever stay in the city when we return! The entire staff is amazing and incredibly friendly, especially Eddie. This hotel deserves all the stars!
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't know where to begin! This was an altogether awesome stay. From the desk clerks, to the restaurant and bar, and even the doorman...all were professional, accommodating, and just plain friendly. Our experience was above expectations and we will definitely stay there again! To all of you reading this: the food is prepared by a world class chef and the bartender, Marshall, was incredible! The only minus was the construction noise, but that wasn't the hotel's fault. Hopefully, they'll be finished by our next visit!
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really tried to give this hotel five stars. After all, it was impeccably clean, with modern rooms, and nifty light switches, a nice comfortable bed, snazzy bathroom lay-out with sliding door, glass shower enclosure, and pristine faucet fixtures. I really appreciated the elevated window sills that enabled me to walk around buck naked without fear of being spied upon by secret admirers in adjacent or opposite buildings. The pull-down shades and blinds were an excellent touch to keep the room extra dark, and the ventilation system didn’t sound like a bunch of leaf blowers in my neighbor’s yard.Unfortunately, the value wasn’t there. There’s no way that I can give Four Points Sheraton five stars for the price I paid. And yes, I realize this is New York City, and everything here is super expensive, but even with a negotiated corporate rate, I ended up paying over $1000 for two nights including a couple of breakfasts I hosted for one other colleague. That’s just not right.Let’s also talk the room, shall we? Yes, it was clean and modern, but it was also the size of a king bed with four feet on either side. The ventilation system was so convoluted, neither I nor my two other colleagues could figure out how to turn it on properly – too many buttons, too unintuitive a design to be practical for folks not living there full-time. The gym was so small, I didn’t even bother going. And while the bathroom was clean, the water pressure was a joke. The water in the sink faucet trickled so slowly, it would have taken an hour to fill up a gallon container. Why does this matter? Well, I am all for conserving water, but there are limits. I still like to be able to wash down toothpaste spit. I still like there to be hot water within five minutes of me activating the faucet. I don’t really appreciate the hypocrisy of the hotel ignoring my on-line willingness to skip room service only for it to restrict my water consumption as if I were an irresponsible teenager.
