The shower wasn’t much better – my colleague complained the first day that she wasn’t even able to rinse out the conditioner from her hair.Let’s also talk about the restaurant downstairs. Four points Sheraton seems to be entry level, like a Hampton in the Hilton line. And yet Four points Sheraton makes you buy your own breakfast, and what a crummy expensive one it is. It was virtually impossible to get out of there for under $30, and for what? Slimy scrambled eggs cooked in oil with the saltiest chicken sausage east of the Mississippi along with hash browns and a couple pieces of toast? No thank you. Breakfast should have been complimentary, especially since there was construction on the street below that woke up a LOT of people at 6 AM. Management did leave a letter on the desk in the room informing us that they had no control over this, but they still should have considered this as part of the overall experience. After all, not all of the suffering should be endured by the customer. I fault Four Points Sheraton for not doing enough (or anything) to compensate its customers for this inconvenience in light of its high prices and an a la carte breakfast system. I left utterly convinced that this place should have cost SIGNIFICANTLY less, and that management was taking advantage of its clientele.In summary, I give Four Points four stars for being clean, proper, and “correct”, but a huge negative star for lacking value. I would only return if this were addressed AND if someone rectified the ridiculously poor water pressure situation.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quick check-in, we were advised of the possible construction noise from the Hudson Yards. Booked a King room, very clean and modern, comfortable bed. Location is great the High Line park, Times Square and other sites walking distance. New neighbourhood feel however lots of construction around. Away from the craziness of Time Square. We were in town for the US Open, the hotel is conveniently located on Line 7 (Hudson Yard Station) first stop on the line and last when returning from Flushing Meadows. Enjoyed our stay would definitely recommend and return if given the opportunity.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location - close to the Javitz Convention Center and shopping! Clean and quiet - the rooms are cozy and nicely decorated. The staff is very courteous - and a special thanks to the Concierge, Alejandro, who helped sort through a couple orders we had for the show and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed delivered on time.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was clean, well organised thanks to a very courteous staff.The Hudson Bar on the ground floor was perfect for breakfast and convenient meals.The location is also convenient: ose by to small restaurants, convenience stores and a gas station, a luxury in the City if you drive
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed here twice in the last year and can say have not been disappointed once. Great location as 2 blocks from my work but also close to all the shops and restaurants so great location all around.Good hotel rooms nice and clean and gym not bad. Well worth staying here.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Efficient but personality-free hotel is convenient to the High Line, Javits Center, Times Square, Macy's. Rooms are super small, like "you can't really walk around your bed" small. Which is fairly typical in NY. Some of the front desk staff was helpful, although the guy who checked us in was that special mix of disinterested and clueless-- told us he could not sign us up for points (wrong), told us we had a bathtub (super wrong! later another staffer told us there were no bathtubs in the entire hotel!) No lobby area, really. The place seems clean and you can get to local attractions mentioned above or to the subway quite quickly. I was pleasantly surprised that our SPG membership resulted in a generously late check out. Each pro was balanced by a con:later I was taken aback that we had to check out in person, but fortunately there was not a long line. Missed room service cut off by minutes and the bar would not consider even a snack or dessert. So definitely not a service-driven location although all the staff (including the disinterested and clueless guy) was pleasant. We had a nice view across the block-- nothing fancy, just a glimpse of the walk up apartments facing the hotel, and over the rooftops. A classic New York vista, and one that seems endangered given the unbridled level of demolition and building going on right now. Historic preservationists, where art thou?
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were driving into NYC when our car had problems coming through the Lincoln Tunnel, we were only able to get one block from the tunnel when the car broke down steps from the Four Points hotel at 444 10th Ave NY. It was raining, so while we were waiting for help we went into the hotel. Patrick Dadie asked us what we needed, thinking we were going to be checking in. I told him about the car, and he jumped into action! He called another front desk person to take over for him, and told us he was getting his own car out of the parking lot to see if he could give us a battery charge. He provided us all with umbrellas, and a moment later he pulled up his car to connect the battery chargers. After a while we realized this wasn't enough to fix the car, so we had to settle into the waiting area of the lobby. Patrick offered us drinks and made the restrooms available to us while waiting. He couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful! Unfortunately we weren't staying at this hotel, but the next time I need to stay in NY, or if anyone I know needs a hotel, this one would be my choice. It's one block from the Javits Convention Center, and a very convenient location to walk to 42nd St, Broadway or the Port Authority. Thanks again Patrick!
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were Exhibitors at the Summer Fancy Food Show at the Javits Center in NYC. It is the Perfect location, Two blocks to and from the Javits to the Hotel. Beautiful rooms and a nice lounge area as well as a nice restaurant.Front desk personal were very helpful.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in one of the higher level room and it was very quiet. Rooms are larger than typical NYC hotels. Decent size room, good size bathroom/shower. AC was quiet. Quality furniture (super comfy pillows lol) We had a very quick check-in (even though address is 10th Ave, the entrance is on 35th street. Welcoming lobby with smiling faces :-) I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location for lots of things in New York. Staff great.Room was good though beds a bit narrow. Bathroom was fab though water pressure not great.We noticed plenty of parking places nearby and there was a great deli not far up the road.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a new hotel wood panel, fancy light switches and colorful carpets. The hallways are a bit stuffy, needs ventilation but both the bed and restroom is top notch. The best part was the staff, Katrina in specific was very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West Hotel for 4 days. It must be the nicest hotel in all of New York City! I have stayed in other hotels in NYC, but none are as nice as this one. I had an incredible room with an amazing view of the Hudson River! The room was large, comfortable and quiet. The staff at this hotel treats you like you are their family. They are very helpful, kind, and professional. They printed out tickets for me for my boat tour, as well as our boarding passes. They were always available to answer questions and give directions. They basically anticipated any needs a traveler might have. I plan on always staying at this hotel when visiting NYC. Its location,(about a 15 minute walk to Times Square), the large and comfortable rooms, and a staff that surpasses any I’ve met elsewhere, are more than reasons enough to stay here.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dont know where to start. You know when you check out, and are asked "how was your stay" and you want to say "disaster!" but don't? To begin with, were told on the phone that weekend parking on street outside is ok, signage says otherwise for saturday, but sunday is fine. There's a police station nearby and they have signs for them. There is construction nearby in the yards and a building across the street. Its busy on 10th = noise. We arrived early and dropped off luggage to get to business at Javitts and were told 'guarantee' room ready by 1pm. 2 pm came and went and no room. Then I had to come back to hotel because no one else in party was in the system and they needed my id, which they had already checked on checkin earlier. woman at desk was a real a$$ about it, or she was just a typical new yorker. Gave me a hard time when I asked to speak to manager. Was again told we would not be put in room facing yards/construction, and what were we given - you got it. In addition it was a handicap room. Went back down to change room and given the smallest room in the building - filled with a king size bed no less. I dont know how this passes fire inspection. We had just stayed the night before across the river in a Sheraton room which was literally four times the size of this room for less $. Asked for foam pillows 3-4 times, finally told they didnt have them. Heard a dog barking in the hotel, stairwell?? HVAC unit made a huge noise - unnecessary size in such a small room. If you changed the setting, it would switch back later that night to a preset and get warmer or colder. Some a-hole employee in the lobby (concierge?) asked my girlfriend if I was "her boss"! I DON'T EVEN KNOW WHAT THAT MEANS!! Like I was a pimp or something?? Altho its a new hotel in a close location to Javitts take my earnest advice and stay anywhere else. The inconsideration of the staff was astounding.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All in all we were happy with this hotel. Just don‘t expect luxury. The rooms are clean and modern. Check-in and check-out went smoothly. Friendly staff all around. There is a lot of construction going on so it can be a bit loud. And the breakfast choice is very limited, so we ate out after the first day. The location is quite nice with 2 subway stations close by, though the nearer one is on the 7 line which is not so convenient for going uptown or downtown.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I mistakenly made reservations for a king bed and needed two beds. Tryell, at the front desk, was very helpful and accommodating. Tryell helped us get into a room to for my family even thought he hotel was sold out. I really appreciate his enthusiastic positive energy.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This one night with the air-conditioning sound in Room 710. It is so loud intermittently all day and night. Hope can change the room tomorrow or ask for earplug. In general it is a comfort room except this terrible sound.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed across the spectrum of hotels in NYC and I always come back to this one, which has become my second home away from home. Can't beat the great balance of service, facilities, and location, especially if you're attending a conference at the Jacob Javits Convention Center! It's also away from the craziness of some locations like Times Square, which isn't that far away (1 subway stop or I prefer to walk). It's part of the changing west side driven by the Hudson Yards development but still manages to be in a quiet little block. Great little restaurants on 9th Avenue. There is a small restaurant and bar/lounge area adjacent to the lobby; very cozy. The rooms are better furnished than most Four Points in NYC and I've stayed at most of them. The front desk staff is wonderful! Special kudos to: Bernice, Danny, Natasha, Eddie, Patrick, Michael, Alejandro, Marcos, & Seth! They always go out of their way to provide the best service possible and will do everything possible to welcome me back. And on top of all that it's an energy efficient building. I almost don't want to give a great review as now the secret's out! ;-)
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a room at this hotel as an spg gold member. I arrived for my stay to check in, only to find out that my room is not ready. I returned 4 hours later and was finally able to get my keys. When I opened the door to my room, I was essentially confronted with a broom closet. I couldn’t believe the size of the room. If I stand in the middle of the bed, I can touch all 4 walls (I thought to myself, maybe that’s why it’s called four points! Because I can touch all four walls from the center of the room).Keep in mind that as a gold member, I am entitled to a free upgrade when available.It just so happens that a friend of mine is also staying at the same hotel. Upon visiting his room, I found that it was a regular NY hotel room that one would expect. The difference was that he booked his on Priceline and paid less for the room!So not only did I not get the upgrade that I was entitled to (a better room was available and for sale on Priceline). I could have been in a better room for a lower price by booking through Priceline.Oh. I almost forgot. I did get a free bottle of water!!!!!My advice is: 1. Don’t stay here!2.if you have to stay here, use Priceline. You’ll get a better room than a gold member and pay less...
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As long time Starwoods members, we've stayed at all of the Four Points Hotels in Manhattan. The new Four Points Manhattan Midtown West is the best of them all, under the outstanding leadership of Eddie Donovan, who, with his entire staff, was extraordinarily attentive and excellent in every way. Not only was the facility top notch, and clean, but the entire staff didn't know what else to do for us, down to the smallest request.The Desk Staff was welcoming and courteous, as way every single staff member. Having fresh coffee ready at all times in the lobby was very much appreciated, as was the restaurant in the hotel, as well as the connected Fresh restaurant next door. I give this Four Points our highest recommendation.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First let's get the good parts done, great location, modern hotel with good amenities, great views, and great transport links, I stayed here with my wife and two friends, we had a queen room on the 18th floor, room was an ok size but with minimal wardrobe space, barely enough room to hang our coats, before our stay i requested some bubbly to be put in the room for a birthday surprise, but it wasn't provided, I was a little disappointed with that as I had been told it would be, we also requested a fridge to keep medication in but that also wasn't provided until we queried it, the room had a great view over the Hudson river and overlooking the Husdson Yards, but if you want a lay in you might want to ask to be on the opposite side of the hotel as the work somedays started at 6am, took a while to check in as the desk staff seemed to look straight through us, picking and choosing who to serve, but what tipped us over was when we checked out we were asked about transport to JFK, we were asked if we wanted to get a car and were directed to an Escalade, we agreed and booked the car for later that day, however when we returned there was no Escalade but a smaller Mitisbishi, with all our bags it would've been a struggle to fit in, after about an hour of staff trying to arrange a bigger car for us they managed to get one, the driver was excellent and did everything he could to get us to the airport, managed to get there 20 mins before check in closed.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t overemphasize just how genuinely friendly the staff are. From reception to the cleaning staff, the restaurant, everyone seemed out to make you feel welcome. Impressive cleanliness. Our room on arrival was very tidy, sheets clean. So was the bathroom. Tiny rooms. To be expected. Yet shower cabin itself was pretty spacious. Glad to see the hotel have priorities straight :)Gadgetry spot on. Each light in the room can be operated from each switch plate anywhere. Eg bathroom lights (both of them) can be operated from the (only) nightstand. That’s actually more useful than might sound. Restaurant food is quite good. Doesn’t taste pre-cooked and it does take a bit for them to bring out the order which is fine by me, it tastes fantastic. Special mention is beers they have on draft. I think it’s from a local brooklyn berewery, I’ve sampled their Pilsner and it’s nothing short of original I’ve had in Prague. Walking distance from Penn station and Javits center. Few hotels make me want to stay longer. This one has. I’m sure we’ll be back.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front entrance is not on 10th. Bad signage. Taxi has to round the block to get to the 35th street door. Easy walk from the Javitz once you find the place. No doorman. Taxi service is non-existant at this location. Front desk just tells you to get an Uber and continues to visit with each other. Uber took over an hour to arrive. Average NYC room. High soft beds. Motorized curtains.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel! Conveniently located: a 5 minute walk to the Javitz Center (where a lot of Bolt and Megabus drop off/pick up), and a 10 minute walk to Penn Station/many subway connections. There were a few good, reasonably priced restaurants nearby, like Fresh & Co. I am a super light sleeper and never heard a peep from neighbors or the street traffic. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable, and they offer nice amenities like water bottles and fresh brewed coffee in the lobby. The staff was friendly and accommodating of early check-in and late check-out. I would stay here again!
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was attending a meeting at the Javits Convention Center. The hotel is 2 blocks away. Comfortlable beds. No need for shuttle. Nicely appointed rooms. Not big but modern and clean. Front desk and bell staff very helpful. Restaurant on first floor.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in Dec 2017. This hotel is in a very convenient location away from the bustle of Times Square. There are subway stations within a 5 minute walk which we found very convenient. The area overall felt safe. The hotel is very clean and quiet, we found our room to be more spacious than we were expecting for NYC, which was a nice surprise! The hotel gym was well equipped. For SPG Platinum, they offer a hearty breakfast in the hotel restaurant which we were very happy with! Would stay here again for sure.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel to Manhattan often for work and have at last found MY go-to business hotel. Close to Penn Station so easy and convenient, but just far enough west that the neighborhood isn't considered as desirable or glamorous as Chelsea or Times Sq. And yet the hotel is probably the newest and in best shape of all the SPG properties in the area. Pleasant staff. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Neighborhood is residential and quiet. Great value.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very good hotel in the sense of size, cleanliness and service. The hotel is practically new so the furniture and the hotel itself is in very goos conditiond.I would improve the gym and a wider variety in the restaurant menu.If you are going for tourism i wouldnt stay here cause you would need to walk ti the metro and its isnt near any attractions.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I generally like this hotel. It's decorated nicely, and in particular the front desk staff is extremely courteous. Somehow after just 1 visit, when I returned 2 months later or so, they had remembered my name (or they did their homework regarding guests that would be checking in that day - either way commendable).The gym is nice as well, and the Wi-Fi is relatively quick & reliable. It's a 2 block walk to the metro, so that's not a problem either.I don't like the oddly shaped bar (with normal-height chairs). It's midtown Manhattan so it almost goes without saying, but the rooms here are particularly small.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother and I spent one night at this hotel during the recent winter storm. I was quite stressed out upon arrival as our flight had been canceled and we had to pack up and transfer from another hotel in a hurry. Eddie, the bellman, met us outside in the cold and blowing snow to assist with our baggage and made us feel welcome and at ease despite the circumstances. He told us about the Starlight Diner around the corner which has great food and decent prices. The hotel is clean and in great condition. We were upgraded to a corner room which had a nice view and very comfortable beds. The front desk was kind enough to give us a late check-out while waiting on our flight. The complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby is a nice touch. The hotel is a short subway ride from major attractions. The Hudson Yards and Penn Station stops are both close by. Of note, use the Hudson Yards station if you need an elevator/escalator for baggage. I would highly recommend this property if visiting on a budget.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 5 night the Rooms are clean and new, stuff are nice, location is perfect. Free water, coffee tea in the lobby. Nice restaurant great value for your money! Very recommended to stay in this hotel
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We onky stayed a night but it was really nice. The staff is courteous and focused on ensuring a pleasant stay. Our room was small but extremely comfortable. We didnt visit but there is a bar and restaurant just off the lobby. The property is two blocks from the Hudson Yards station and maybe a 5 minute walk to Penn Station. Being from this city I expected an uncomfortable stay, hearing other lodgers and the noisy street. The hotel is on a quiet block and the walls are thick. No complaints.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Manhattan Midtown West took the utmost care of me and my friends for our stay in NYC. The staff was kind and helpful at all times and the rooms, and hotel as a whole, was very clean. Would definitely come again!
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this hotel because it's relatively new and hoped that there wouldn't be any bed bugs or any kind of insects. But I got a nasty insect bite (not sure if it's bed bugs) when I woke up in the morning. I hope the hotel should do a better job cleaning the bed and bed sheets.
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After staying many times at four points on 40th and Elements on 39th, I must say that this four points on 35th&10 surpases both of them by a very large margin in terms of quality. It feels a lot more modern, the room service is very fast and all 4 meals I had were very satisfying, except maybe for the in-room breakfast that was just "ok". Heat/AC runs strong but the controls are limited (vent always at max = noisy, and the temperature keeps reseting = anoying), but I've seen much worst, just a small detail really and nothing that would keep me from going back. At last, regarding the location, it is more practical than I expected, with the subway station only minutes away (penn on 35th/8). I'll go back
hotelName:
25    Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan Midtown West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was very small and the bathroom was tiny.We were close to the elevator. It was a noisy location for us. People entering and exiting the lift, the motor running the lift and the telephone ringing near the lift kept us awake when we were trying to sleep.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Iberostar hotel has great staff who seem to really care about your stay. The rooms are nice, clean and spacious with a very comfortable bed. I am very happy with my stay! I would stay again while staying in New York.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful hotel. From the moment you enter you feel welcome especially the front desk staff. Some friends arrived unexpectedly and Melissa kindly found me a room to fit us all - given it was Pride weekend they were pretty full. Rooms were very very clean and comfortable. And QUIET! Ice cold water in the lobby was refreshing. Big shout out to Melissa, Efrain and Colon for making my stay so comfortable.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here for 5 nights. Great hotel in mid Manhattan. Iberostar is positioned within 2 short blocks of Grand Central Station. The customer service was great right from when i walked in the front door. Would definitely stay here again if visiting NY.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff and nice rooms.The location is alright, if you want to be close to the downtown area. Grand central station is a 5 min walk and it is easy to commute to anywhere from there. The staff was super friendly and we felt good staying at the hotel. The area is safe and close to stores.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the warm reception to checkout, Iberostar has the feel of a good European hotel. Fruited ice water and NY Times in the lobby...friendly maids and turndown service...clean, nice decor in rooms. Great location near Grand Central etc.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stylish, convenient and great service! I was greeted by a friendly smile at the desk and was allowed to check in a bit early. I appreciated their professional and friendly service. Door men were all very nice and pleasant to talk to. I asked for a cab and they had it for me in one minute. Only 25 minutes to JFK early Sunday morning!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We always feel at home form the moment we hear “welcome back” from one of the ladies at the front desk to the ‘enjoy your day “ from the door man. It’s a good feeling to know that you are appreciated by everyone on the staff and they value you as a guest!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located just a few blocks south of Grand Cental Train Station on Park Avenue, it's within walking distance to subway stateions and caffe shop and restaurants since it dosen't have any eating place. We had a queen double room which is small but well kept.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was well furnished and nice. Air worked well after a hot day of site seeing and the staff were very helpful, without being pushy or over accommodating. Overall, my wife and I had a great experience here. The bathroom was a little small, but I felt that was to be expected in the city for what we paid.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well located to visit New York, the rooms are very comfortable and the attention of the staff is excellent. I would definitely recommend it to my friends. Good location, good service.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there for five days in our honeymoon and our stay was wonderful! All the staff in the hotel were really kind and helpful, especially the concierge, Jesse. Also, the hotel is well located, near Times Square, the Empire State...We really recommend it if you are going to New York!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 5 nights and love the location as it’s just a short walk down the street to Grand Central, Coffee Shop and Deli. Clean, Friendly and Great place to stay! Even provide umbrellas when it’s raining out.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff. Room was very nice, modern, and comfy. Melanie and Melissa accommodated us for an early check in when we got in at 1030am. Room has a pretty good view of the empire state building.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Iberostar Hotel on Park Ave in NYC is a beautiful, intimate, classy hotel to stay in! I highly recommend the hotel and the staff is friendly and so helpful. The hotel modern decor, is clean, exquisite with great attention to details. The hotel is quiet and peaceful.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to explore the city there will be no better starting point than the Iberostar. No matter if you walk or take the subway. Check-in went fast. Our room was big and clean. Wlan could be faster. We can highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you for a wonderful stay back in the beg of APRIL 2019. The Iberostar 70 Park Avenue Hotel, is truly a gem in NYC and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a wonderfully situated hotel in NYC. The staff is friendly and all of them did a wonderful job accommodating my families needs. We also appreciated the Doormen who always greeted us with a smile. The rooms were contemporary , clean and we were lucky enough to have a view of the Empire State Building. The Midtown East location is very central to everything, and we could easily walk or take the Subway to any place in NYC. We also found lots of affordable eateries in the neighborhood which made it easy for us to grab a quick bite even when we came home late. I have stayed at many New York hotels and this one stands out as being the best. I can't wait to book 70 Park Avenue for my next NYC stay.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at 70 Park for only one night, felt like 5 days of rest! Super friendly staff, great room, for upgraded and treated like a king and a queen. Cheers to Leidy, Wordell and other hard-working experience-making team members and entire Iberostar team. Definitely coming back!!!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Iberostar at 70 Park is lovely. The room was small (to be expected) but clean with a fantastic view. The staff was INCREDIBLE! Friendliest hotel staff and super accommodating. The location is perfect as I was able to walk to Grand Central, Times Square, Rockefeller, theater district, etc. Next time I have a meeting in midtown, I'll stay here again.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sarah helped me to get adjoining rooms so the 5 members of the family could fee like we had a suite. The front desk staff was helpful all weekend as was the concierge and bell staff that helped get us cars and directions to anywhere we needed. They all went over and above!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel on park ave. Central to most attractions and 2 mins from grand Central station. Hotel was clean and quiet. Rooms cleaned daily. Staff were extremely helpful and organised a trip for us to a shopping outlet which did not disappoint. Would recommend hotel highly.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have recently stayed at the Iberostar hotel and was very impressed! The hotel cost was reasonable, considering how central it was (5 min walk to Grand Central Terminal). The room was very modern and bright, with a very comfortable bed. The only improvement that could be made was the bathroom - its functional but could do with being updated.Despite it being very central, the street the hotel is located on is fairly quiet (for New York!)The staff were very friendly and approachable. Should I return to NY, I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at 70 Park Ave hotel was amazing, thanks to the ladies at the front desk; Melanie, Evelyn and Melissa. They were very helpful with recommendations, courteous and made me feel like I was at home.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, all staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Rooms large and airy, and cleaning staff lovely too! Very very central - I have been to NYC a few times and this isthe nicest hotel we have ever stayed in in Manhattan.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is very nice, great located for everything you would do!The team of the hotel , was very kind and helpful !!!Our room was big enough for 3 , maybe the closet could be a little bigger . The rooms a not noisy and we had a nice view about park Avenue! We would book these hotel again!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel mainly for the location. I was travelling to NY for the first week of the US Open and this place is just a few blocks from Grand Central. But the hotel itself turned out to be a very pleasant surprise. First, it was nice to check into a boutique hotel - one without a big, loud lobby. The staff was very efficient and friendly. I was given a corner queen suite which is one of the nicest I've every had in my many trips to the city. It was beautifully furnished with big windows overlooking Park Ave. The bathroom also had a window, which I love for natural light. Everything was beautifully appointed and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the turn down service with chocolates was a nice touch. Since the city was in the midst of a heat wave, it was always pleasant to make my way back to this hotel and be greeted by a smiling doorman holding the door open and iced fruit water in the lobby. The hotel was also very quiet which is always greatly appreciated after a full day of activities. The whole experience was lovely and I would not hesitate to book it again.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Morgan Library with the JRR Tolkien exhibit (sadly closed as of May 12th) was just around the corner and the Jewish Museum with the Leonard Cohen exhibit (through Sept 8, 2019 - highly recommend!) was not much further. The theater district was also walking distance. We took a car to the Metropolitan Museum of art, though, because we wanted to save our energy for the exhibits there. Good value considering this is midtown NYC.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve stayed in this hotel in May 2019 and felt just like home in New York. It was, for sure, a great choice.We loved the kind staff. Everyone is willing to help, no matter what is the problem. Our special thanks to Jesse and Willian. The room is very clean and everything regarding cleanliness exceeded our expectations.WiFi connection is very fast. Much faster than most of hotels we’ve ever been.The hotel does not offer breakfast but this is not a problem. There are many options few steps away.The location is perfect. Few steps from Grand Central Station, where you can move to everywhere in the city.The only thing we would change in this hotel is the window’s blackout. It’s not enough to block the light and wake us up early.From now, when in New York, this hotel will be our first choice.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this ideally located, cozy and comfortable hotel from May 11-18, 2019. We booked a King Deluxe and were given a room in the interior of the building for added quiet. After unpacking, we turned on the TV and discovered the channels would switch and the volume would change without our control. We called the front desk for help. The maintenance person rebooted the system but it continued and he informed us that there is a problem with the TV’s responding to other remotes in the core of the building and that they were aware but it had yet to be fixed. We booked for 7 nights and we didn’t feel this was acceptable. The front desk offered to move us but informed us we may still encounter the same problem. As there were no other comparable rooms available in the rest of the hotel, we were prepared to find another hotel. My husband went down to the front desk to ask if there was anything that could be done. Melanie wanted to make it right and realizing we had booked for 7 nights she upgraded us to a larger and beautiful Premier Park Avenue room (Room 415). Melanie even sent up a bottle of wine to apologize for the inconvenience, which we gratefully drank during our uninterrupted episode of Game of Thrones! We were so happy to remain in this comfortable and quiet hotel! Just a shout out to Leidy too for the pleasant chat during our check out. All the employees we encountered from the housekeeping staff, doormen, concierge and front desk were very friendly and helpful all the time. Love your bright, cozy and welcoming front lobby. Oh and such quiet air conditioning. I hope you fix the TV cable problem. And one other suggestion for you. I booked knowing you did that you did not have a restaurant. We unfortunately failed to notice until our last day that you did offer room service through Butler Hospitality and other delivery options. There were a few times that we were hungry but too tired to go out for food. It would have been helpful to be informed of your food delivery options when we checked in. We loved staying at Iberostar 70 Park Avenue and we will definitely come back!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Iberostar is the ideal Grand Central Area Hotel. New Room service availability is ideal. Staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. They will grant all your needs in a pleasant manner. The hotel is the ideal location for parents whose children are going to Fordham as it is 2 blocks from Grand Central and Metro North.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very well placed to access a wide range of sites, including a few pubs and eateries. The room was spacious with a superb king size bed, large screen TV, minibar and a safe. The air conditioning was good and the storage was adequate. The bathroom was small and would have benefited a shelf to keep items on. The shower was also small but adequate for our needs with a powerful jet spray. The staff was friendly and helpful. The price was good based on the overall quality, central location and time of year. The standard of the overall accommodation adequately reflected four stars. A good hotel providing a good experience at an affordable price.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect. You’re steps away from grand central station and walking distance to Times Square. The rooms are nice and clean. I will definitely stay there again the next time I’m in New York.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is good. They have a timely response to concerns, friendly staff and concierge, doorman and a well located hotel. If you just gloss over the review and read the title then it sums up the stay. There is absolutely nothing wrong with the hotel as a hotel. A place to stay and it is friendly welcoming and does what it needs to do. The issue and reasoning why the review is not 5* is for the fact that it is advertised as a luxury hotel which for what I received was not luxury. The room was within the realms of the hotels age as it should be. It was aged and was fairly small. The furniture was worn and had signs of its age. There is of course nothing wrong with that. The shower was in a tiny bath and the bath room lacked the luxury feel. Everything in the room was extra, tempting as the sweets and treats left on the shelf were not complementary which were covered in dust (clearly no one else was willing to pay 8$ for some sweets). The room just looked a bit sad and unloved. There was no room to put clothes other than one small bedside table and a pokey wardrobe that housed a very cramped space with a safe, ironing board, slippers, iron (which left little room for anything else). Having raised my thoughts to the management at the time. They admitted that the hotel was under a renovation program and that some rooms had and some rooms hadn’t been renovated and that it was being undertaken in phases. I was welcomed to revisit in future when the renovations have been complete and look forward to returning back to enjoy this soon!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean rooms and comfortable bed. Convenient to all the things we wanted to do and close to public transportation. Great neighborhood with lots of stores and restaurants for all of our needs and desires. We look forward to staying here again!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place for a weekend in the city. Excellent location, in a quiet stretch of Park Ave. that still provides great access to transit, shopping, etc. And the staff is excellent--both friendly and efficient. Parking is quite expensive, but then again, the valet service is much quicker than at other hotels in Manhattan.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are stylish and comfy, the hotel itself is easy to get around and the location is very convenient. The entire staff was attentive and helped me and my sight-impaired sibling navigate the excitement and joys of NYC! Thanks to Rachel, Efrain, Leidy, Melanie, Charlie, Julio, Jesse, Melissa, Evelyn, Howard and Bo!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fab from beginning to end! The staff were simply fantastic, Melissa, Leidy, Jesse and Howard did everything they could to make our stay special. Rooms were spacious and very clean, couldn't ask for more! We will be back!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We like the hotel. The people have been friendly with us. The room very very good. The situation of the hotel very well. We would have liked to have breakfast in the hotel.Cleaning well, except one day, they did not make the room. Thank you
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was the perfect hotel in this wonderful city! Very clean, very friendly staff, perfect location and very good beds! On my next trip to New York I will gladly book again !!! We felt very comfortable and were very satisfied. I know the Iberostar hotels already from Mallorca and can only say that this one in New York is in no way inferior.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a family vocation during this April. we chose the Iberostar 70 Park Avenue hotel when we were in New York. I strongly recommended this hotel which has the best location, rooms and other facility. Especially all stuff in this hotel are really nice and friendly. The whole family had a very good time. we definitely will come back.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really good location in mid town on Park avenue just 5 mins walk from Grand Central/42nd street and 10 mins walk from Empire state and Bryant park, rooms were clean, a little dated but a decent bed with excellent air con and a small bathroom but powerful (beware of the blast!) shower. It's the staff that make this hotel though particularly Jessie on the door who was genuinely helpful and friendly and always keen to ensure we were having a good stay. Would recommend Ginger Man bar on 36th between 5th Ave and Madison Ave, Scotty's diner on Lexington/39th for genuine NYC diner meals and Zaros bakery in the dining area in the basement of Grand Central for sausage & egg croissants mmm. Missing it already!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had to stay in New York for a couple of weeks for business and was recommended this hotel by a colleague. I couldn't be more satisfied with my stay. The staff was super friendly and service is excellent! The room I stayed in was extremely comfortable and quiet. I stayed on the third floor but no outside noise what so ever. Bed was comfortable and relieved my jet lag quickly. We travel often for business, so I am definitely recommending this hotel to all of my colleagues moving forward. The location is super convenient too with many restaurants and public transportation access within walking distance. Thank you Iberostar for making my stay memorable!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights here in March. The location was great. The rooms were quite small but well equipped and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was tiny but had a lovely shower with nice smelling toiletries. The staff were very friendly and the concierge Milton was very helpful. I would recommend to stay here
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exzellent and very tidy, food locared and quiet hotel. Very friendly personal. Prolonged keeking of the room due to late flight was possible without proplems. Well stuffed fridge. We probably come back again.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was and I am very happy for the reception during my holidays. They were always there to help us if we needed, asking if everything is okay, smiling. Thanks to Howard, Evelyn and Melanie and see you soon !
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I just got back from an 8 night stay at this hotel. It was our first time in New York and we loved everything about our stay from the minute we arrived. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Check in was fast and efficient. Our room was beautiful, clean and quite big compared to what I was expecting for a Manhattan hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location, close to times square, empire state building and grand central station. We had a lovely view from our window of park avenue. We slept really well because there was no noise and the beds were very comfy. Bathroom was big with bath and shower. Cannot fault anything about the property. If I ever return to New York I'd definitely book with them again.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Words can not express how much we enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff was amazing, I wanted to take our door man home with us. The gals that cleaned our room did an amazing job considering my husband and I are slobs. The hotel is in walking distance of almost everything you can do in NYC. If you want to use the subs, Grand Central Station is just three blocks away.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was very helpful with booking problem. Stayed here often, good rooms with a fair price for NYC plus being within short walk to Grand Cetral is a plus. But lack of a coffe bar or complimentary in room coffee is not good, since the closest coffee is a block away. I don't that would be asking too much
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the hotel in January and opted to upgrade for $15 /night. I has a gorgeous king size bed in a large room. It was clean, well-appointed, had a beautiful view of Park Ave and was very quiet. Just recently, I stayed again and opted to not upgrade for $15. While my room was clean and well-appointed, it was tiny and without a side table with a lamp next to the bed. The bathroom was also small, but clean and well-appointed. This hotel is one of the best deals in NYC. Shhhh!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Iberostar is in the perfect location. Close to Grand Central Station , which is stunning, yet in a quieter area. Rooms were a good size. Both our rooms had good views. Beds were incredibly comfortable. Mirrors were all in the right places with plenty of power sockets. We made use of the gym which is open 24hours. The staff were great. Highly recommended. We booked through Secret Escapes.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All staff were very friendly and helpful. One evening I had a video interview and noticed the wifi was not functioning correctly. I called reception and they swiftly transferred me on to their technical team who were able to solve the issue for me within minutes.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back to the UK from a short 5 night break in New York staying at the Iberostar at 70 Park Avenue Hotel and what a stay it was for our first time ever in The Big Apple. Fantastic location, ideal for exploring and the staff were absolutely first rate. Room was superb and we had the luck to be looking out at the Empire State Building every day when we got up and when we went to bed. Special thanks to Ana (Concierge) who sorted out many things for us and thank you to Evelyn, Melanie, Melissa, Howard and Efrain, all of whom made us very welcome and always had a smile. Thoroughly recommended to anyone.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just recently stayed at this hotel with family members for a 3 night trip to New York. The hotel itself was in a fantastic location, literally 2 minute walk to grand central station and close by enough to walk to Times Square. The staff there were super friendly and helpful and made our stay really enjoyable. The rooms were clean and may need some modernising but for the time you’re in the room they had everything you need. Could just do with a kettle to make a morning cuppa. Overall a great little find at a really reasonable price.
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, staff were all friendly and professional. The location of the hotel is fantastic with many attractions within walking distance. My boyfriend and I were travelling to New York for our anniversary and were greeted in our room by a bottle of wine which was a lovely touch.Thank you for an amazing stay, we hope to visit again!
hotelName:
26    IBEROSTAR 70 Park Avenue Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel mimosa is a lovely stay with really friendly staff. It is located in the middle of Chinatown. We consider Chinatown a bit dirty with a lot of trash. Not the best location to stay, however the hotel makes up for that. It is clean and has good air-conditioning. Free coffee at the reception is also a plus. A five minute walk to the nearest subway station and 10 minutes by metro to times Square (without transfer).I would definitely recommend this hotel because it looks like the best price-quality hotel.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a chance to do a quick trip with friends up to New York City and was so glad to return to the Hotel Mimosa. Found another great restaurant and love trying out the hotel's recommendations. They really do know lots of great food options down here in Chinatown. I really enjoy their large comfortable bed and this time I stayed in their smallest room in the hotel at a price that is quite affordable for New York. Also, the room was quiet. Street noise, if any, is blocked out.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well situated, clean and very helpfull and kind personal. Ideal for exploring NY. There are many restaurants (chinese and non chinese) around and MTA is easy to reach. You can walk to Brookling bridge.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights. Very helpful en friendly employees. Clean rooms. Located in China Town . Near the Subway / train and lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood. Only the WiFi on the 4 th Floor was not working properly. The staff did their best but were not able to solve the problem. I would defnitely recommend this hotel
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself & my sister stayed here for 5 nights last week. A wee gem of a hotel situated in Chinatown and only 5 minutes walk from the metro for accessing uptown Manhattan.With Battery Park, the Statue of Liberty, Manhattan & Brooklyn bridges, and the financial district only a short trip away, Hotel Mimosa made our sight seeing very easy to navigate.Staff were very friendly & helped in anyway they could. Room was just what we needed.Would 100% stay again - thank you for having us.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean quiet stay, room was normal NYC size, staff was very friendly. The Mimosa is right in Chinatown and is walking distance to great markets and restaurants. Grand St Subway stop is about an 8 minute walk and the Mimosa hotel sits across from the Manhattan bridge, the subway goes across the bridge, but I wasn’t bothered by any noise in the hotel at all, although my room wasn’t facing the bridge.  I liked this hotel and will be returning,
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything works fine, from reservation to check-in, check-out, ...Hotel is clean and nicely arranged.The staff is efficient and friendly.Concerning the room, it is small but well sound-proofed (4 window panes). I was a bit scared of the metro noise but it is ok in the room.Internet is fast and stable.Only minor point, the bathroom tub has seen better days...
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, cozy and quaint. It's worth the value of its dollar. Not many nice things can be said about any hotel in Chinatown. Hotel Mimosa is the exception. I spent one night for business purposes. The bed was comfortable and the amenities were generous. The hotel staff were very accommodating and they went well out of their way to ensure my comfort and happiness. For a young hotel, they are well on their way to greatness.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there 6 days at the end of March & the beginning of April, and it was a great experience. The hotel was clean, the sheets and the towels were clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. Although the subway line (and the Manhattan Bridge) is very close (= the location is great), the room was quiet, and the bed was bigger than in Europe. If I'm going back to NYC, I will definitely stay here. Great experience.Bonus: free Nespresso cafe in the morning :)
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful two night stay in one of the Superior Queen rooms. Very comfortable accommodations and well maintained - very clean. Absolutely top notch staff! They were always happy to provide recommendations for dining and other activities around the area. The room rate is unbelievable for NYC!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No better value in NYC! I took a group of 22 people to the hotel and everyone loved the hotel. Conveniently located in Chinatown the staff gave us good recommendations for places to eat. Very friendly and helpful staff. You won't be disappointed staying here.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here last month while my apartment was being repaired. My room was clean, very comfortable and I enjoyed the hotels great personal service. Its difficult for me to get around but their location is very convenient and the hotel really knows the different places to eat down here . I found a great new breakfast place and I'm a local. will come again
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Mimosa Hotel one night when I was attending the New York Boro Race. It's located in China Town and it was a short walk to the Race starting point. The reception is small, but check in was quick (please note that you'll be asked for a $100 deposit that will be returnedat the end of the stay).The room itself isn't that spacious, but it's still quite comfortable. The bed was big and although the hotel is just across the loud Manhattan bridge, it is completely sound proof and you can get a good night sleep.There's a blow dryer, a large TV and several toiletries. The shower and towels are quite acceptable. You can get a nice complimentary cup of coffee or tea at the reception. The staff was attentive and provided us with a piece of paper with lots of local recommendations for food.Overall, it's a pleasant place to stay when you want the comfort of your own room without paying the large figures typical of New York.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Hotel Mimosa New York, an outstanding little hotel, as I had a big wedding to attend in Chinatown and needed a convenient overnight stay. The staff here are very good and accommodating. They help you with recommendations and car services anywhere. I highly recommend this place, especially if you have downtown events to go to.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear David and Hotel Mimosa,Thank you for making us feel at home when we were 1,000 miles away. Even in the beginning before our trip started David made us feel welcomed. Frantically last minute booking our rooms, after I booked I realized I scheduled our trip for the next day instead of the days of our trip("oh no im going to get charged a cancellation fee" is all i could think) once I realized it was "after hours" I called the hotel hoping somebody could help, the staff was friendly and they told me they would leave a detailed message for the manager who will arrive in the morning making me feel a little more at ease. when the morning came I called and spoke to the manager, told him exactly what happened and then told me everything was okay and moved our reservation to our dates we would arrive and there wouldn't be any fees for my mistake(we all know some hotels are "too bad, so sad") When we arrived at Hotel Mimosa David the manager was there and we were very pleased to meet him as he seemed he felt the same! we were offered candy and also hot tea. we spent about 15 minutes in the lobby after check-in talking with David about things to do, see and even places to avoid because of safety(haha) and cant forget to mention they also have a print out of recommended places! AND if it wasn't for David we wouldn't of known they were filming for a new movie right around the corner, so we got to see that! our room was on the front side of the hotel so our view was very neat with the city in the distance, it was the perfect size for me and my husband and the bed was comfy! As we plan our trip for this years trip to NY, hotel mimosa is for sure a place we will stay at again! we will be seeing you soon and thank you again!-Mr. and Mrs. D'Andre Webb (stayed at hotel mimosa October, 2018)
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wasn’t sure when my agent booked it but I have to say it was amazing little place. Even though train goes by and looks like noisy place it was amazingly quiet! Super nice people and it was very clean and comfortable. Easy to get around and not so touristy. Would stay again. If you want to be down around Chinatown, this is the place.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nice stay at Hotel Mimosa. The location was excellent. Although metro was very close to our room, it was not that noisy, so we could sleep well.The staff at the reception were very kind and helpful. I liked the free coffee at the reception (Nespresso). Free wifi was fast. The room was small but comfortable enough. All in all it was a fair value for its cost.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice accommodations, great location! The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom toiletries were very good. I would definitely stay again. Nice lobby and friendly staff. In Chinatown but close to lower east side.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was so great, so many wonderful places to eat nearby, I had a great walk in the area and my room was so quiet and comfortable. Front desk are the best I've ever experienced as a business traveler from the west coast.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Mimosa is a very friendly family run hotel in Chinatown, a short walk from East Broadway Subway. Rooms are on the small side which is typical for Manhattan. You can be in Midtown within 15/20 mins on the subway and you are 20 minutes walk to Brooklyn Bridge or the Financial district where you will find the 911 Memorial. The hotel has very fast and reliable WiFi plus complementary tea and coffee, (no bar). We felt safe out at night as it is a quiet neighbourhood. We had no trouble during our 5 night stay. The staff are very helpful. They can also arrange airport transfers which I would recommend. I would happily stay again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was exactly what you need. A big double bed and clean with great amenities in the bathroom. Room a bit smaller but I have paid more and got even smaller room so I was pleasantly surprised. The staff and the manager David was very friendly and I was happy by their service. Being a big fan of Chinese cuisine I was really looking forward to get som great Chinese food after a hard days work. David gave me a list of local recommendations and this was very helpful. The wifi worked well and I had no problems what so ever. Highly recommended hotel!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed at Hotel Mimosa several times. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. The rooms are always clean and the beds are very comfortable. Along with the wonderful, cozy accommodations, I’ve fallen in love with the neighborhood. It’s not “touristy” at all. You are surrounded by local people, food and culture. The base of the Manhattan bridge is close by and you can rent a CitiBike and ride over to Brooklyn in a matter of minutes. The busier section of Chinatown is a short walk where you will find various shops and even more delicious, authentic food, including the famous Chinatown Ice Cream Factory. If you want to visit NYC and experience real NYC life, rather than the manufactured tourist trap that is Times Square, the Hotel Mimosa is an excellent choice.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very nice stay at Hotel Mimosa. Staying in China Town gave an extra quality to our stay.The staff was positive and friendly. The room was small and simple but free from bugs and clean. Tea and coffee was obtainable in the lobby - very much valued. There was a good WIFI.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the hotel for 7 nights, which was a fantastic decision. I really liked the rooms' style. Very tasteful. Complementary coffee, tea and if needed very good umbrellas. I can definitely recommend the place. Nice people, good price, professional service.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel staff, who offered great restaurant suggestions. Very courteous and friendly.If you want to be in China town, have quick access to the metro and minutes away from Manhattan Bridge, then Mimosa is the place for you!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent customer service, staff very helpful and kind ;great premises with cleanliness to a high standard, good location near some of the more interesting attractions. Underground very close. Special price for the cab to JFK.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful friendly hotel, with fantastic views of Manhattan Bridge & One World Trade Centre Accomodation very comfortable, everything you need for a base to explore New York. Excellent value for money. Staff very friendly. Will definitely be back to stay
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff with lots of insider tips of restaurants and places of interests. They make you feel welcome and help you in all situations. Beautifully furnished, clean and cozy rooms, i loved the bathtub and bathproducts. Close to several subway stations. I would choose this hotel again!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited hotel Mimosa in March and stayed for a week. We had twin room on 4th floor. Room was quiet and very clean. Extra plus for very comfortable beds. We missed more racks on the wall since there was no closet in the room. TV was big enough :) Service at hotel was excellent!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a very cute place with lovely, helpful and courteous staff who provided helpful maps and a comprehensive local restaurant guide on check-in. The room was perfect for a short work stay. The bed was very comfortable and the amenities were great including an extended range of quality toiletries in the bathroom - toothbrush, toothpaste, razor shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Everything was very clean. Location was excellent for walking to the Lower East Side for my work events. They will gladly store your luggage securely after you've checked out too. Couldn't be happier with my stay!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here twice over the last year and would definitely return again. The location is great, only a couple of blocks away from the subway which is the F train that takes you uptown and to Brooklyn. The rooms aren't massive, but you're in New York, you're going to be out and about! The room is clean, done everyday. Complimentary drinks are a nice touch too. The staff are friendly and helpful. We look forward to visiting again in the future!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for two nights while in the city for a concert. Although the location is a little out of the way, the hotel was great. It was clean, and the staff went out of their way to make you feel at home.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Mimosa is now my "go-to" hotel in New York City. I come to the city three or four times a year and look for a place which is clean an economical. I've stayed in many different hotels in Manhattan, but this is my favorite. It's like a European family inn, and I know by experience. The staff are friendly and efficient. If you need something, they will follow through. You will have a unique experience in Chinatown, because the owner will help you decide where to eat, as he grew up there. He will recommend not only a good Chinese restaurant, but the restaurant which serves the kind of Chinese food which is their specialty. Okay, that's food. As for the Arts, the owner can direct you to what's happening in the city as far as painting, music, opera, theater, etc. And by the way, the rooms are quiet at night, street noises will not wake you up, as often happens at other places in the city. In sum, I can tell you that staying at the Hotel Mimosa will not only be pleasant, but will result in a broader experience of New York than you could possibly have with glossy tourist pamphlets as a guide.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in the city and wanted to book a last minute stay in and found this gem! Hotel Mimosa was extremely affordable for such a lovely place. Our room was a standard queen with a tub/shower and equipped with toiletries (the shampoo and conditioner left my hair incredibly soft), hairdryer, and cable. The room was a bit small but perfect for our stay. Upon arrival we were greeted with genuine warmth- the concierge even provided us with a list of convenient bars & restaurants with a brief description which I thought was such a personal touch! I will definitely be staying here again and recommend it.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, affordable price, the staff is super nice and helpful with maps and restaurants recommendations, the room was cute, clean and big enough for two people. I highly recommend this place!!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We has a great time at Mimosa hotel. Super convenient location and very friendly and service minded staff. The rooms are spacious, toilets are well functioning and clean. Looking at the price and comparring to hotels nearby this is a bargin.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a fantastic find and gave us a great base in which to explore the city. The staff couldn’t be nicer and were extremely helpful in showing us good places to eat and drink as well as quick routes to the subway etc The rooms aren’t huge but a Queen Superior is more than enough and let’s be honest it’s a city you want to be out in not stuck indoors. £309 for 4 nights was exceptional value.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very good time at hotel mimosa. They made us feel welcome and at home. We were greeted very friendly when we checked in and also each time we came back, no matter what time. The front desk staff genuinely seemed to care how our day was and what we did. They gave us great recommendations and helped us out with finding routes to museums and a taxi to go back to the airport. Thanks so much that was amazing!The rooms were nice. The bed was one of the comfiest I have ever slept in and the bathroom was nice and well equipped. Although there is no kettle in the room itself, you have a wide variety of teas and coffees downstairs at reception and can help yourself there. That was a nice touch.Area is great too. Very close to two stations and next to great restaurants and pubs.I will indeed recommend Hotel Mimosa to my friends and family and come back whenever I go back to new York. Was really sad to leave!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in New York so was torn between staying somewhere near Times Square or near China Town. So glad we decided on staying near China Town as it was so convenient for us to get something to eat inexpensively.The hotel was excellent, comfy beds, clean rooms and friendly staff who gave us their personal recommendations for good food. Would definitely recommend to all our friends and family. Hopefully we will also be back for a second visit in the near future.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful place to stay while in Chinatown. The bed was fabulous. Best sleep I've had in a week. The management and staff are wonderfully attentive and anticipate your every need. My wife said it was the best stocked powder room she has ever seen.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful hotel! Staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable, there is a cozy lobby with free coffee, tea and a huge bowl of candies, clean rooms (yes, they are small but the beds are comfy and the bathroom is spacious) stocked with the essentials, within walking distance of great coffee shops, restaurants and more. Oh, and the room rate is very economical! Check it out - you won't be disappointed.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. The room was definitely a great deal for the price. Would stay here again. The hotel is a bit confused due to the layout of street in the part of nyc.. I believe ther reviewer mention this.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, right in the heart of Chinatown. I don't understand the complaints about the noise because we didn't hear a thing. 5 minutes from the F train so easy to get around the city. Small rooms which can be expected in NY but didn't feel cramped.I can't recommend enough.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for a night while our Queens apartment was being sorted. The neighborhood is authentically Chinese sans tourism, which was a cool experience in itself. It really is a hidden gem in a classic corner of the city that still feels like it has the original heartbeat of downtown. The staff at Mimosa was wonderful and the room was spotless and comfortable, at such a reasonable price. We will for sure stay her again and suggest it to family when they visit. Thank you, Mimosa!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome place to stay and I will be back soon very clean place lot of nice restaurants around that area and also a lot of things to do around that area the people that work there are awesome front desk is very kind treat you with nothing but respect and kindness
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend this hotel if you’re looking for a very affordable hotel option. The staff is so friendly and helpful, there is complimentary coffee + tea, and the room was exactly what we needed- very clean and cute. Right in the heart of Chinatown. Only 10 minute walk to Soho. Would go back!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there just for one night.My room was very clean and comfortable.The bed as well was very comfortable, with 4 pillows!The personnel at the reception was very kind and provided me good advices for restaurants.Last but not least the price is very interesting for a hotel located in Manhattan.I'll come back!Thank you
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiancee and me had a great stay in the hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, nice comfortable room, great location near two metro stations and... free espresso and chocolates all the day, What's more to ask for???? Definitely come back!!!!!!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Mimosa was clean, comfortable, and accommodating. Even though I know the area pretty well, the list of nearby restaurants and shops turned out to be really helpful in a pinch! Modern fixtures and knowledgeable staff! The only thing that threw me off was the rule of having no guests after 11pm, which I didn't know before booking. Overall, a lovely, unexpectedly comfortable hotel right in lower Manhattan!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was small, however, was very clean. The rooms didn't look worn, considering that the other buildings look quite worn down. Good location in Chinatown and walking distance to the subway stations. Reception was helpful too. You can also ask for taxi to the airports from the reception for a fixed price. However, one bad point is that the soundproofing of the rooms can be improved. The hotel is very near to the subway tracks so you could hear the subway travelling back and forth.
