Also, loud noises from the corridor or other rooms could be heard for example, the beep from unlocking of the room door, others watching tv in their room, etc....
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location in Chinatown, 5 minutes away from the subway (lines B, D, F) but not too noisy thanks to the windows. Reception provided good local adresses of restaurants and cafes. Welcoming staff.Very clean room, good bathroom (space and amenities).Great room for two!
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the first time we stayed at Hotel Mimosa. We always try to stay in a different area of the city when we visit. I read good reviews online and the price was very good. We were in town for 4 days and 3 nights to see the Xmas sights. We did not spend much time in the hotel since we had full days of sightseeing but the bed was good and bathroom was clean. The staff is super friendly and gave us a list of all the eateries within a 10 minute walk. The rooms are not big but I don’t know that I have ever had a large room in NYC.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have enjoyed my stay at Mimosa. The staff was very professional, helpful and polite. The location was great with nearby metro station (5mins walk) and a walking distance to many attractions. The hotel was clean and offered a great coffee. I would stay there again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in town for business and chose this hotel because it was an affordable option in the lower Manhattan area. Rooms are on the small side, but if you are there just to sleep it is not an issue. Front desk staff was super helpful for dinner and breakfast recommendations in the area. Very close to the main Chinatown area. 2 blocks away from the F train to Brooklyn or midtown Manhattan. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Hotel Mimosa New York
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a sort of BnB. You get a breakfast but come early if you want the eggs. Strong coffee!Great roof deck. Rooms are cozy and while sharing a bathroom is not for everybody, the inclusion of a sink in the room really made this easy for me.I stayed for 2 weeks and by the end of the week all the staff knew me. Everyone was friendly and welcoming and I met some interesting guests too.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An excellent location on a quiet street in the middle of Chelsea, a perfect base to visit New York. Very comfortable and clean with fast wi-fi, but the best thing about the place is the friendly and helpful reception from Tony and all the staff. Thanks, guys, we'll be back :)
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Colonial House Inn has always been a friendly and convenient place to stay. In the heart of Chelsea, it is close to subways, restaurants, Chelsea Market and the High Line. Breakfast is included. I would recommend it to anyone wanting a smaller place to stay.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Colonial House has been my go-to place to stay in NYC for decades. The staff is consistently friendly and helpful. The rooms are small and clean. Mattresses are comfortable. Rates are reasonable by New York standards. The inexpensive rooms do not have toilets; toilets and showers are in the hall and are shared with another room or two. There is a breakfast spread - and a happy hour with complimentary alcoholic beverages! The place is welcoming to members of the LGBTQ+ community. The location is convenient: subway entrance a block away, walking distance to the High Line.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay in January 2019 was my second stay at Colonial House Inn. My son and I went to New York to spend a week on holiday. I am very happy to have found Colonial House Inn, because the hotel has a very agreeable ambience and is centrally situated in Chelsea. I prefer hotels that are not too big, where you come to know the receptionists a bit and feel welcome.Some of the rooms share a bathroom on the same floor, but it is no problem, as there are only a few rooms on each floor. Additionally, a small sink is installed in each room. The rooms are not very big, but nice and clean.The hotel is very well situated near several Metro Stations, and if you like to walk it is possible to reach many places by foot.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place, I took a superior room which included a private bathroom, but excellent location, helpful and friendly staff, nice breakfast and happy hour, really nice room and very clean, very quiet building and area and safe at night, Go!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I chose the Colonial House Inn for a 3 night getaway to the City to visit a relative who lives in East Village. We stayed in a Superior room, as we wanted a private bath. Colonial House is situated on a very attractive tree lined street, and we enjoyed being in an area with a neighborhood feel. Our room was on the top floor (a 4 story walk up), and looked out on the St. Paul Lutheran Church. The room was pleasant, but very small, with the end of the bed reaching to within a few inches of the wall! The staff was very pleasant, and breakfast simple but adequate. One morning a hot breakfast was among the choices. Some guests buy take out dinners to eat in the breakfast area. We found the restaurant choices in the area plentiful and ate out every night.We enjoyed walking on the High Line, discovered the Chelsea Market and walked miles around Chelsea, Greenwich Village, and lower Manhattan.We checked out the roof top area (not in use in October) and it appeared very pleasant. For the price, it is hard to imagine finding a nicer B&B in NYC, and we would not hesitate to return if we visit the City again.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is excellent, especially if you arrive by Penn stn., also easy subway access. Close to the great scenery of the highline. Nice room very confortable bed, large varied breakfast, very warm welcome.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for five nights and was made to feel at home from the moment I arrived. Lovely staff, and good location. Help with my bags up the stairs was much appreciated. I chose a room with shared bathroom and this worked perfectly. Yes the room in New York small (although I have had smaller!) and the bathroom was only a few steps away from my room, always available and always clean. I sometimes used the desk in the lobby/breakfast room during the day, thank you staff for turning down the television! Lovely to arrive home at the end of a cold day to this comfortable, snug B and B.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great and breakfast nice. There is a sitting area near the front desk. We had a small room with shared bath and no complaints there. Only issue was the surprising amount of street noise that went late into night and affected our sleep. Beds were comfortable. I’d stay again but would bring ear plugs.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the ambiance of the hotel, specially the roof top. You have a marvellous panorama above the roofs. The breakfast was great and we enjoyed the pleasent staff of the hotel. It was very clean despite of sharing-bathrooms. The subway is very close to the hotel and you will stay in a silent area of NY. Nearby the hotel is the High Line Park. Furthermore you can find a very good foodmarket next to the hotel. Little (our room) but fantastic.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had one of the two big suites and it was very nice. The Inn was very clean and we felt secure.The location is great, right in the heart of Chelsea. We enjoyed the continental breakfast each day and the welcoming glass of wine was also a nice touch.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Colonial Inn is in a quite street close to the subway so better than staying in the chaotic center. The staff is great always very helpful with suggestions and you can always have a nice chat, a nice tea and a nice happy hour.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our 7th stay with family and friends. We always anticipate our yearly return. The staff, personified by concierge Tony, who incidentally deserves a raise, is friendly, very knowledgeable, helpful and curtious. The location is ideal as re many & varied restaurants & transportation, both subway & bus. The breakfast is nutritious with a wide variety of items. The Happy Hour is a treat. The rooms are quiet, clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is thrifty way to stay on budget with luxurious accommodations. We were there in November and had a chance to grab some Black Friday bargains and we're planning to come back to catch some of the holiday shows and dining spots the front desk concierge recommends.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I knew that we were sharing a bathroom in the hall with strangers, so expected the stray pubic hair here and there... but they really need to get a better quality toilet seat that won't slip around on the commode! Also, the heat is turned way too high (charming old building with no room thermostat). There was not a single chair in our room, and we had to turn sideways to get around the bed. Not at all a romantic scenario. Last, but not least in my book, there was powdered cream for coffee in the morning. Although we stayed here 10 years ago and obviously enjoyed it, we won't be back after this stay.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking for a standard, cookie cutter place, this is not it. But if you want a place that is full of character, comfortable and fun, this will more than fill the bill. The rooms range from small to luxurious - we had a nice room with a beautiful bathroom and were very happy. The little lounge is a nice place to hang out after a day of trekking around the city, especially with the offer of a drink. The neighbourhood is delightful, with great places to eat. You're near everything - there's a fabulous view of the Empire State building at the end of the street. And there's breakfast, with good coffee to set you up for the day.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Colonial House Inn is a very peculiar hotel, we felt more in London then in NY ... in a good way. Placed in a very quiet and elegant location from where we colud confortaby reach every corner of Manhattan (Subway within 2 min walk). It offers a very nice breakfast which is a plus in NY. Staff was discrete but helpful when needed.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed her recently when we went to NY.Our stay was great and it was all thanks to Colonial Inn, everyone was really nice and accommodated to our needs, clean room and fresh food everyday.It's in a great location with loads of food and sights near by!I would definitely recommend.Thanks for a great stay!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was coming in a day earlier then planned trip and stayed here for a night. This was one of the best places I have ever stayed (wish it was my whole trip). They were super accommodating and helpful. 5 stars all around.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I must admit it's difficult to know what to say about this place. It was not what I expected but maybe I didn't read the description closely enough when I booked it.What surprised me was that my room didn't have a bathroom or toilet ( although some rooms do, I believe) and was quite small. Also there is no elevator and you have to drag your case up to 3 or 4 flights of stairs if you are on the upper floors. I was told that the City doesn't allow this historic building to be modified hence no elevator. In fact you also have to climb a number of steps outside to get to the entrance.Having said all that, there are some redeeming features. The staff are friendly and helpful, there is a reasonable help- yourself breakfast included, free coffee and snacks are available 24h and there are alcoholic drinks available (I think for free but I didn't partake) during a happy hour. It is also conveniently located for shops restaurants and subway stations.In conclusion, however, I think that at $220 a night for a small room with no bathroom and no elevator is a high price to pay even in New York. Be cautious when booking this place.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After arriving from my direct non-stop 5-hour flight from Vancouver to Newark, I took the subway from Penn Stn. in Manhattan on New Jersey transit's train service, to the 23rd St. E-line subway stop and it is only a 5 minute wallk to the hotel! Great location, which helped right off the bat, since I used the E-line often. Tip: buy a 7-day NY subway pass for $32 - it saved me money after 2-3 days of using the subway anywhere.Once I arrived at the hotel, the staff member was friendly and checked me in. I had the Superior room, which was great with ensuite bathroom and shower - deadbolt lock for the room was a little noisy when opening or closing it - only a minor detail, if your neighbour noticed.Nice rooftop for having a drink or even eating when ordering take out and bringing it back to eat...it was hardly used during the 4 days I was there - partly due to the rain but nonetheless, it was a nice touch!Breakfast was nice in the morning with good coffee...guests were friendly and overall, I would definitely come back again - hopefully, next year! Nice staff and well-kept. Lots of mom and pop restaurants within a 5-10 minute radius of the hotel and a few grocery places, too. I would highly recommend this hotel, with its great pricing and overall satisfaction of staying here. I especially loved hanging out on the roof when not doing touristy things during the day - great a night to see part of the Manhattan skyline!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Congratulations to the whole team of the Colonial House Inn (reception, cleaning) for keeping a quality place in Chelsea. I am a regular visitor to your place and hope that you will keep the hotel as nice and friendly as it is now.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was great !!! I rather stay in a place here instead of a hotel the front consierge lily was very inviting and very welcoming we definitely coming back! Great customer service!! The rooms were clean 24 hr coffee and great service
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Colonial House Inn was a very affordable, friendly bed & breakfast that I recently stayed at on my NYC trip. Great location, only 1.5 blocks from a subway line (C & E). The front desk staff was very welcoming yet efficient.I booked a superior guestroom so I could have my own bathroom. The sleeping area was surprisingly large for a room in New York. The bathroom, however, was very small, similar to a bathroom on a cruise ship. Not a problem for me since I'm used to it, but be advised. Also, because it is an older building the A/C was via window units instead of central A/C. My room was on the "terrace" level; I don't mind street noises while trying to sleep, but if that's an issue I'd see if it's possible to be on a different floor.Continental breakfast was from 6 am to 10 am every morning. The front desk staff also said there was a happy hour in the afternoons, but I was unable to make it.I recommend Colonial House as a solo traveler and would stay there again.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this place. One of the best places we've stayed. Our family of four (mom, dad, 2 teenagers) stayed in the West End Suite. It had its own bathroom and plenty of room to spread out. The kids had their own space in the sitting room w/ their beds and our king sized bed was in its own room at the back. The place was surprisingly quiet, especially for an old building in the heart of NYC. I slept like a rock every night, and I'm rather finicky that way. The front desk folks are always friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations. The location can't be beat - a block from the nearest subway station, 10 blocks to Penn, a couple blocks the other way is the Highline. Definitely will stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to NYC for a show but didn't want to stay in the theatre district so we chose this hidden gem in the Chelsea section. About a mile walk straight up 8th to get to everything you want to see. Room included a happy hour with a wide assortment of beverages - we had two big glasses of wine. Continental breakfast also came with the room and was just perfect. It's located close to the High Line park which we walked. Overall a great experience and we will most definitely be back!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I fund Colonial House In very nice and got a familiar feeling. We stayed there for a week. It was good situated in New York and the sorrundings in Chelsea was nice. The first room we got was very small but the manager fixed another one without any extra cost. The breakfast was good and the rooftop was nice to visit from time to time. I will definetly recommend it to anyone I know who will visit New York.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an awesome little gem! The staff is kind and wonderful, breakfast was lovely, and for snacks and dinner, there are loads of choices just round the corner. Laundry is also easy just 3 mins walk away. Room is small but super confortabl and very clean: room and bed made, and fluffy white towels replaced every day! I really could not have asked for more! Thank you so much, Colonial House Inn Team!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I needed a place to stay in Chelsea while dealing with a family matter. Many of the big chains have properties in or near Chelsea now and I've stayed in several, but what a pleasant surprise to find Colonial House just down the block! We stayed in the West End Suite, which is effectively a one-bedroom apartment with living room, kitchen, and private bathroom. The bed was firm but comfortable and while the bathroom was small, the space available in the suite was enormous (particularly for New York) - the high ceilings make it seem even bigger. The staff is courteous and available 24/7 - you must be buzzed in to the building at all times. Continental breakfast was perfectly serviceable if not "gourmet" and happy hours each evening provided a welcome respite. If you need to leave your luggage before checking in or after checking out, the staff is more than happy to oblige.As others have said, the location is great - one block from a subway; 15 minute walk to Penn Station/Madison Square Garden. Minutes from Chelsea Market, the High Line, the Meatpacking District and Greenwich Village.The price for our suite compares very favorably with chain hotel prices for rooms that are much smaller (and don't come with breakfast or a happy hour).Be advised - there is no elevator, and there is a reasonably steep staircase just to get in the front door. (The staff will help carry luggage if you ask.) Believe me when I say it was worth climbing a few stairs for the comfortable stay.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Colonial House Inn is a great small hotel in Chelsea, within moments of a great range of restaurants, bars and shops, and an easy walk to the Chelsea Piers park overlooking the Hudson, the High Line ex-railway line now an interesting elevated park, peopler-spotting and walking area,.Greenwich Village, Midtown and Times Square. The hotel serves a buffet breakfast and has a pleasant rooftop garden where residents can sprawl in the sun, sit and read or perhaps smoke if so inclined. The staff are friendly, warm and helpful..
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very nice stay! The location is great - close to the subway and other cute locations. The personnel is super nice and welcoming! Colonial house inn has a nice breakfast and the 24 hrs coffee/tea is great after a long day around town. Overall a good place that we definitely would recommend!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a regular visitor to New York I city I continue to lovePart of that is staying at the colonial houseChelsea is still a great central place to stay And the staff have always done everything to help in every way.Brilliant
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found the small bed and breakfast by our son, his daughter celebratetd her confirmation in the church quite nearby. We liked the familiar atmosphere and colonial furniture.We had one of the two Suites 1. floor, very charming.The hotel has best breakfast service, coffee and tea the whole day with delicious small homemade potato cakes, a roof garden and a very friendly stuff. We will come again!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Colonial House is a throw back in many ways: small, friendly, pleasant, well managed, reasonably priced. Rooms are small but comfortable. The location is withing walking distance of many popular sites, on a quiet residential street The staff is friendly and helpful. They even have a free happy hour each evening. If you are looking for a European style inn, this is the place.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night on our way home to UK, wonderful position and made to feel very welcome.Really enjoyed our stay, breakfast was very good and room small but very quiet.We were able to leave our bags while out for the day and all our questions were answered very patiently.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For sure rooms are small we are in New York, but it is so well organise. The bed was comfortable, breakfast were great, the area quit and the staff very helpfull and kind. Stop at Forager Market just around the corner to grab something to eat.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location on a side street in Chelsea. easy walk to Subway or shops and food. Hotel is a converted walkup and rooms vary in size. We stayed in luxo courtyard suite with 2 rooms, massive bathroom (would be the size of a complete hotel room in some chich Soho spot) and private patio. Good value compared to other options for 3+ people. Place needs a bit of decor update and could be cleaner. Breakfast has decent selection and easy access. Afternoon free drinks is a lot of whiskeys, nice touch! Staff is good but takes some cultural adjustments as they are from other cultures and their style can be a bit abrupt (see other reviews) - did give very good service.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Colonial House Inn is a traditional brownstone located in the Chelsea neighborhood. I stayed in a room with a double bed; the bathroom/shower was a short distance down the hall. I never had difficulty accessing the bathroom and the shower is excellent. There is also a hairdryer, mirror, and magnifying mirror mounted to the wall in the bathroom. There was a sink in the room. The bed was comfortable; the linens were soft and there were lots of pillows. They have housekeeping service daily. The hotel is non-smoking. The Inn offers breakfast between 7:00am-10:00am every day. It’s filling since they have boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, and an assortment of bagels, muffins, and other breads. Coffee, tea, and juice are also available. In the evening, the Inn offers happy hour with an assortment of alcohol. Tea and coffee are available all day long. Each time you enter the Inn, you will need to push a button beside the outside door to be allowed in. I thought this was a great safety feature. It’s easy to access the subway and buses from this location. The neighborhood is quiet and there are lots of restaurants nearby. Note that if you have mobility issues, there is no elevator. (You might also want to pack light to avoid lugging heavy luggage up and down the stairs.) Also note that the Inn has a less liberal cancellation policy. Cancellations or modifications to reservations must be made more than 14 days prior to arrival. Since they are a small property (22 rooms), this helps them to guarantee boomings. They suggest getting travel insurance in case your plans change. In sum, this was a great place to stay.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This inn is a welcome oasis away from all the political bluster in Washington. Besides great customer and concierge service, they offer a slew of surprises including afternoon lobby libations tastings, a clothing optional sun roof that bring high voters from the right, left and everyone in between.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Although there are shared bathrooms, it was very clean and at least there was a sink in my hotel room. I also really liked the art throughout the building and in my room. Also, the room keys are physical and they ask you to give it to the concierge when you leave so you don't lose it. This didn't bother me as the staff was very friendly.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been staying at Colonial House for years. The staff is extraordinarily friendly and helpful; the rooms are clean; the price is reasonable. The place has in the past catered particularly to the LGBT community - and as a gay man I have always felt - and still feel - especially welcome. Bathrooms are shared with other floor-mates; but this is not a problem.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great stay at the Colonial House Inn. The staff was accommodating and rooms tidy and comfortable. The continental breakfast hit the spot each morning to get my day started. Highly recommend by me.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We ended up finishing our honeymoon at this cute little brownstone B&B unexpectedly for two nights last week, when our flight home was cancelled due to Storm Grayson. Firstly, the place is great value for those on a budget. The rooms are small but clean, with very comfortable beds. Even the shared bathrooms were kept clean at all times and the shower was great. Most importantly, the staff are really warm and friendly, giving helpful advice about what subways are best to get, printing stuff for us and welcoming us back when we arrived miserable and downbeat (and with no reservation) after spending the day in queues at the airport. The next day, they were happy to have us hang out in the reception room, use their WiFi and avail of their (free!) Happy Hour while we waited to leave for the airport once again. It really made a difference to us. It's the sort of personal touch that you just don't get in big chain hotels. If we ever return to NYC, we'll be staying here. Great location, too - 2 mins walk from 23 St. station and 10 mins walk from Penn Station. Thank you, Colonial House Inn!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: By New York standards this hotel is very good value. The staff are very friendly and helpful and it’s very clean. A plus is the large modern bathroom and plenty of cupboard space. Be aware that there are a lot of stairs and no elevator.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my two sons and felt very safe ! It's in a great location , easy to get to everywhere . The hotel is full of great art work which you can't stop looking at , the rooms are spotlessly clean and very comfortable . There are suits available aswell , a garden one with a fully equipped kitchen and lounge , and a great jacuzzi suite too . The continental breckfast is great , fresh American pancakes with a big choice of teas , coffee and fresh juice .  There is a happy hour with complementary alcohol and snacks which is a great addition .  The staff are amazing , so helpful and friendly nothing is to much trouble . Especially Lilly whom I'm going to greatly miss , wish we could take her home . My 2 year old son absolutely adored her .  I'm honestly going to be sad to leave had a great time and I would rather stay here than other 5 star hotels I've stayed in before , just because of the exceptional service and personal touch . I will not stay anywhere else now and can't wait to come back . The colonial house deserves the trip advisor gold award for 2017/18 . Thank you for making my holiday a fantastic one . ❤️
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, metro stop at 23 st. is very close by. Also hotspots like the Chelsea market and the high line are within a walkable distance. The Hotel staff is very friendly. The room was nice. The bed was too small for us, bet slept well. The breakfast was a very pleasant surprise.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend the colonial house inn! I stay here frequently, and my stays have always been great, from the very comfortable accommodations to the extremely professional, friendly staff, and convenient location!
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent, off the beaten path on a quite side street but in the heart of Mid-Town. Friendly and helpful staff. Very nice, cozy rooms. Rooms are on the small end but that's NYC! I traveled to NYC almost weekly for 2-4 days at a time for apx 1.5 years and stayed almost exclusively here. Great breakfast, clean facility, great guests. I've recommended several friends and colleagues here since.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve visited Manhattan enough times to know that the chrome and glass experience of the big hotels in congested Mid Town are not for me. The Coloniel House Inn is the boutique hotel alternative in a really cool and convenient location that offers a far better experience of Manhattan. Chelsea is a very vibrant, laid back neighborhood with great food and shopping options. The subway is one block from the hotel plus there are many things within walking distance such as the Highline. My last morning I walked to see the Flatiron, Empire State and Chrysler buildings in about an hour. Super convenient! But th best thing about the Coloniel House Inn is the staff. Very friendly and really good people.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: About half the rooms at The Colonial House are cheaper because they share a bathroom with one or two other rooms. The others have a nice bathroom with shower. There is a warm welcome and a breakfast with freshly brewed coffee, a variety of breads and bagels and muffins, pancakes, eggs, cereals and fruits. During the rest of the day you can help yoursekf to coffee or a good selection of teas with cake or pancakes, and at about 5 they lay out a free bar, with wines and spirits and snacks. There is a roof terrace where you can sit and read or enjoy the view (or sunbathe in the right weather, or smoke if that's your thing).The staff are always friendly and hgelpful, and will organise visits, advise guests and print boarding passes etc.A lovely place to stay in a great area of new York. Esay walking distance of the River, Greenwich Village, Macy's etc, and lots of good local restaurants.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: How much better can it get in the Big Apple? Our Ab Fab place to stay has always been known for clean comfortable rooms, world-class concierge service, prime location in Chelsea, friendly staff, clothing optional sun roof. But on our latest visit we found they have raised the bar to new heights with a pre-dinner wine and booze tasting every afternoon around 5:30 ish. This isn't "fake news" I have the pictures to prove it.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice and convenient location, don't miss one of the two suites at ground or first floor, with kitchen or private garden...Living room with fireplace, and large bedroom with giant tv.On top of the above, Manager is a nice and kind guy.
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Gem Guest House 9/29/2017 - 10/1/2017. I booked a two beds bedroom with shared bathroom. The staff is very friendly. They serve breakfast every morning till 10am. They also offer happy hour with wine and snacks around 5pm. There are only about 40 rooms. My room was at the 3rd floor and though I picked share bathrooms there was never an issue/there is a full bathroom in the floor with shower and another 1/2 bathroom. The guest house also has a roof top where I went to see the sunset I highly recommend this place
hotelName:
28    Colonial House Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea was enough: clean enough, quiet enough, close enough to things we were doing, enough for a night or two. The desk staff was very helpful. There were plenty of options around for breakfast and shopping.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were incredibly friendly and went out of their way to make me feel at home. Delicious breakfast and anything you want. Dog friendly. I will definitely be returning as reasonable prices too. They got my dog from the car when room was ready and put hi in the room as I was at a funeral. I couldn’t ask for friendlier people and was lovely to chat to a few of them
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a weekend and loved the hospitality and warm, homey feel in this quaint and charming little inn. We have been to New York many times and usually stay in large hotels, but The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea is a great alternative to those. The staff took great care of us, and we felt so at home. We had a two room suite for my husband and I and our two young adult sons. It was perfect. Also we loved the cozy dining room. The breakfast was plentiful and well-thought out, well-displayed and delicious. We had never really explored Chelsea before, so we loved being in that neighborhood and discovering another great part of New York! We would definitely stay here again on our next visit.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about the Townhouse Inn was great! The rooms are eclectic but large and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent! Bagels, breads, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc. We had room 33 (3-person room) and 34 (4-person room). Both were great as long as 2 people are ok in a queen bed. Very convenient location on 23rd Street between 6th and 7th Ave. Go to dinner at Omail Vienamese restaurant - it was fabulous!
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Townhouse Inn of Chelsea is a gem of a hotel. It’s really a bed and breakfast inn with spacious, clean rooms unlike anything you’d typically find in New York. The room we stayed in featured exposed brick walls and a quaint, “old style” decor with a king size comfortable bed and a separate lounge area. Additionally, the breakfast in the second floor common area/library offered delicious selection of breakfast foods, such as bagels, croissants, muffins, breads, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit, cereal, oatmeal, coffee and juice. We really enjoyed staying here and will definitely be returning! Whoever wrote a negative review disparaging this establishment obviously would pick apart every place they stayed in!! We had no complaints and met other couples who have stayed here before and love it! Thank you, Townhouse Inn of Chelsea for making our stay in NYC so enjoyable!
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this place. The location is fantastic and the rooms are lovely. But most importantly, the fine art of service remains intact at this gracious inn. Eric and the team make sure that everything is ready for you — in your room and in the exquisite library/breakfast area.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a nice, large room at a good price and the Inn is in a fabulous location. If you want sleek chrome, room service, and a health club, do not come here. If you want a large room with funky charm, then you will be happy here. The continental breakfast is perfect--the bagels and croissants are delicious and the "honor" bar is a nice touch for other times of the day. I have zero complaints. I hardly saw the managers, but when I needed something there was always someone to take care of things. My room was in the back of the hotel which was great as it could not have been more quiet. Wifi is strong and works in the rooms perfectly--must have recently upgraded. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here last Thursday. This is our favorite place to stay in Chelsea. It is more of a B&B than a hotel. The manager Eric welcomed us and let us check in slightly early, though we just asked to only drop our bags off. We were greeted by his friendly pair of Bulldogs, Sofie and Max. The library area on the second floor is so warm and inviting, you just want to have a cup of tea, and sit and watch the people go by on the street. There are plenty of books and magazines to read. The continental breakfast is fantastic, with 3 types of breads, bagels, cereal, fresh fruits, yogurts, fresh made jellys, coffee, and tea. This area is not as crazy and crowded like 42nd st, yet close to the subway, only 3 stops from Port Authority. The bedrooms are roomy, with nice brick wall accents. The bathrooms are modern and clean, along with great hot water for showers. The place is normally booked up, so you must reserve early. This is a must place to stay. I highly recommend staying here when you are in Chelsea, or even going for a play. I guarantee if you stay once, you will be back again.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little place and very quaint and clean. Booked it on Expedia which was a big mistake as very strict 30 day booking policy. Could not shorten our stay by one day due to medical reasons though 28 days out we called. . Tried calling but the policy had no flexibility as far as we were told. I now know I should have spoke to the owner directly. Owner called me when I left an Expedia review and I talked to him. He said I should have called Expedia to make any changes but my wife had talked to manager who said no go so we left it at that. ( when we called to see if three nights could be shortened to two ) I thought the place was great but the owner was not very nice when he was giving me a hard time on the phone. I gave 5/5 stars but left info on the strict policy which he did not appreciate. Just trying to help out fellow travellers. Great place non the less ! Would recommend it! Just be aware of the terms of your booking!
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Townhouse Inn at Chelsea. Beautiful old townhouse mansion converted into an inn but retaining the old city charm. Nice spacious breakfast room with tasty continental breakfast each morning. All the rooms are spacious and nicely furnished. Ask for Room 54 on top floor, big brass bed with a vaulted ceiling and skylight. Would definitely recommend for a couples weekend in the city.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is certainly not a shiny, modern, 24-hour manned boutique hotel, but that was one of the reasons we chose it. The room we had at the side of the hotel overlooked the adjacent empty church which made the room a bit gloomy during the day, but at least it was quiet, and we were out and about most of the time. The room was a good size, eccentrically furnished, had a couple of stains on the carpet and a shower control that threatened to fall off at any time, but we expected that sort of quirkiness, so it didn’t detract from our stay. The included breakfast was more than adequate, with juices, coffee, cereals, and very good pastries and this is taken in the cosy and bright dining area at the front of the hotel and your proximity to the other guests makes it inevitable that you chat with them and exchange tips on places to visit and things to do in NYC. Eric, the owner also encourages you to use this area for eating your own food that you might have brought in or had delivered to the hotel and, if you’ve forgotten the wine or beer, you can get them from the honesty bar along with miscellaneous snacks. Eric is also a very good source of tourist information and gave us various tips on getting around and what local restaurants to try. The hotel is only a couple of mins. from subway stations and less than 15 mins. walk to The Highline, so very conveniently located. We had four days in NYC and staying at the Townhouse Inn made our stay that much more memorable and we wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lots of positives about the Townhouse Inn. The rooms were definitely bigger than typical NYC hotel rooms, and we heard very little street noise. Since this is an old townhouse it has a lot of charm to it--think of "shabby chic" furnishings and some interesting nooks and crannies. We had everything we needed for breakfast and the breakfast room itself was nicely furnished and relaxing to hang out in. The honor bar stocked a lot of items that were shockingly inexpensive. There weren't any real downsides other than while the sheets were clean the bedskirt was visibly dirty--the staff might want to change those more often. There isn't really a "front desk" with visible staff so you'll want to plan to call or text the innkeeper if you need something. A very nice alternative to a regular hotel in a great central Manhattan location.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would have had only nice things to say for the Townhouse Inn of Chelsea, had it not been for the lock failing on the front door on a Friday night at 1am that forced me to find another hotel.I spent the following 2.5 hours after getting locked out trying to call the manager, Eric, but got nothing but voicemail. A couple was also trying to get in at the same time, but their key, my key and the keys from the lockbox were all failing to let us in. After realizing that Eric would not pick up the phone, I went to a nearby hotel (the FourPoints around the corner offered me a decent deal) and got 4 hours of sleep before having to head back to the Townhouse Inn to pack up in time for 11am checkout. Upon arriving the following morning, the on-site staff noted that they would not be able to negotiate any compensation for the hardship and that they would reach out to Eric to see what could be done. The on-site manager later informed me that Eric stated I would get the night refunded and that I would get a call to organize the refund, but it has been 4 days without a call. Eric also seems to conveniently not be onsite when I call, so time will tell how this plays out.Aside from this experience and from what I'm reading in other reviews indicating a horrible experience based on management, the place was a decent deal in a good location with decent amenities... as long as you don't mind being unexpectedly homeless on a Friday night.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This inn is located quite centrally on 23rd St between 5th and 6th avenue. The 1 train that will take you South to Battery Park or North to Times Square and Central Park is at the end of the block - so that's just perfect.The hosts are very nice. They are welcoming and helpful. The breakfast is very good and is immediately restocked as things are eaten. There's lots to choose from too. The rooms are older and large. Our bed was large and decently comfortable. I'm not a fan of bedspreads so that was a bit of a negative. I don't like to think about who was on that bedspread last.Though right on a busy street it was reasonably quiet.The bathroom was a bit on the small side and the water pressure a bit low. It was also a bit wacky as far as holding temperature - it would wander a bit so you had to be cautious between too hot and too cold.All in all we really enjoyed our stay here and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to our friends.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights on a quick stop in NYC. From reservation to departure we enjoyed the pleasant personalized service of this unique Inn. Our room was very spacious with zero street noise (R53). Excellent access to the subway & busses, situated between 6th & 7th Aves. A lovely touch was the complimentary breakfast with quality food; proper cutlery & crockery served in a lovely old worlde library setting. A real refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Up until we checked in things appeared to be fine......I emailed Eric Ord (general manager) and asked if we could leave our luggage there, (we arrived early) until 3pm when we would be able to check in. Eric graciously said "no problem". When we arrived at 10:30 Eric met us, introduced his husband, and then excitedly told us that due to a cancellation they "upgraded" us to a suite! Sounded good......until we arrived at 3 to check-in at which point we walked into our "upgraded" room to find out it was NOT what we specifically requested! My reservations were for a "Deluxe King" room, which was confirmed, and the "suite" we were "upgraded" to only had a "queen size" bed that was not only NOT a deluxe but their website doesn't even include that bed in their "look at me" pictures! (Guess I wouldn't post that bed either if it was me) What Eric considers an "upgrade", even in the smallest sense of the word, doesn't comply with what is normal and reasonable. When I went to talk to whomever was in charge at that particular moment, she told me that the room we had reserved and paid for was already rented out. Thought it was interesting that it had been rented that fast but, still asked if she would call and ask those guests if they would mind exchanging rooms as they obviously had JUST checked in, afterall it would be an "upgrade"!....according to Eric! WRONG! Turns out those guests had rented the room the night before and then asked if they could stay an extra night. Eric said "yes" WITHOUT asking us if we had any objections! Apparently he felt that he could "upgrade" us to a smaller bed and we wouldn't notice! There is a reason I requested a Deluxe King, AND paid for it in advance! When someone who claims to be the General Manager, does something like this and then does not make any attempt to contact us to say "I'm sorry" or "please, is there anything I can do to make it up to you"........it says alot about his way of doing business! I find it interesting that the "The General Manager" Eric made himself scarce so that there was no face to face possibility (the young lady manning the front desk told us she talked to Eric and he explained that there was no "King" request) so I know he was aware of the situation!!! I cannot warn enough people to stay away from this so-called Inn/hotel/b&b. Room #51 was NOT what anyone who pays good money would call or accept as enjoyable. The A/C unit near the ceiling leaked and caused us to put a trash can under the leak so as to catch the water. The TV was a tube tv from the 1980's/1990's and was somewhere between a 19"-24" in an armoire......THAT was interesting.....not to mention the 2 remotes that it took to operate it. The bathroom towel bar fell off as soon as my wife reached for a washcloth. The tub leaves you standing in water as the tub DOES NOT drain properly. (There is another post that warns about that but we chose to ignore it)......THAT was a mistake on our part! The bed mattress was so well used, there was no way to escape the valley in the center. The bed frame was so loose it literally felt like it was going to fall apart. This was supposed to be a very special weekend for my wife and I.......the experience at this b&b is nothing I ever wish to remember. I've noticed that others who left less than stellar reviews may have done things that could have caused management to respond to their complaints by explaining what the guests did that created the problem. I'm interested to see what Eric says about this!....since we did nothing but follow the guidelines and policies set down from the beginning! What an unprofessional and disappointing experience.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I were in NYC for a concert and decided to stay overnight. I found this Gem in the heart of Chelsea. Small B&B, Clean, beautifully decorated, friendly staff and very good security. Beds were comfortable, continental breakfast was fresh and delicious. The best part was meeting Sophie and Max, the owners bulldogs who greeted us at breakfast. Truly a great establishment and run with the guest in mind. We’ll be back!
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have travelled to NYC before and stayed in larger hotels. This inn was a far better place for us to stay. Very quiet, immaculately clean and charming place. The owners are very helpful and friendly. Very good location as well. We highly recommend this inn.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy check in and out. Awesome location and easy access to every part of the city from here. Room was dated, but we think it added to the overall charm of the inn itself. Easy to keep to yourself or mingle with other guests at complimentary breakfast. Saw Wicked. It was awesome. Parking tough but recommend spot hero or other apps for a garage spot while you stay and then rely on cabs/uber/pub transport. Our garage was a block away and was less than $50 for 24 hours (seems steep, so worth it though)
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reasonably priced for NYC, near two subway stops and lots of restaurants, comfortable, delicious breakfast with juices, coffee, tea, milk, bagels, pastries, muffins, breads, fresh fruit, boiled eggs, oatmeal, cereals, granola and more gave a good start to the day.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t say enough positive things about my experience at the TIC. If you want a typical hotel stay then don’t book here. I would describe it as BnB meets New York Apartment meets staying with friends. Very quiet. In fact I didn’t see or hear anyone for 2 days. Checked myself in after hours but the process was made clear to me before I arrived via email from the owner Eric. I had a 2 room suite (51) with brick exposed walls, older furniture but very comfortable mattress. Easy walkable distance to theatre district, penn station, Rockefeller center etc. or just stay in Chelsea for the amazing cafes. I started out on a business trip (conference down the street) but then the rest of the trip was pleasure. Saturday night I had friends from Philly join me and Eric was more than happy to accommodate with rollaways in the spacious room. Continental Breakfast was elegantly served in the library/parlor. Great coffee in warmed mugs. Everything was fresh and delicious. Self serve snacks and drinks available 24hrs for small honor system price. My daughter lives in the City but if I ever need a hotel room again, I will definitely be back!
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is fantastic! I love that it is a small operation, lots of caring touches you won’t get at a hotel. I love the charm of the old building, the interior brick is amazing! I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to Eric for the welcome the directions, advice, the umbrella, the interest in our visit and for hailing us a taxi in the rain and carrying our bags. This place is what I would call 'shabby' chic.. Old world but a bit worn. Comfortable and clean, free wifi and drinks and snacks with an honesty box!!! Nice breakfast.. Great one night stay in a great location.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Peaceful and well run establishment.. Very roomy and spacious room and attached bathThe Inn is located at a great place, and was ideal for me to walk down to wherever I needed to get to...All the people responsible for running the inn are very friendly and helpful... So all in all a great experience...The one thing I'd flag is that this is obviously an 'old' property and so there's a lot of 'floorboard creaking' that happens... I personally thought it made the place more charming.. others might not :-)
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very cool lodgings, huge rooms, quality continental breakfast in a lovely library setting.We spent 6 nights at the Inn and would recommend the accommodation to all except those who want totally modern rooms in a sterile environment. Eric and his staff are very helpful with directions and suggestions. All in all great value and one of the best experiences we have had anywhere. G Whistler and Vancouver, B.C.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small B&B Inn has delightful personality and character. Having done extensive touring in Europe, we have dubbed this the Rick Steves hotel in Chelsea. It has wonderful access to the subway system and is located in a comfortable, safe neighborhood to walk in. Eric, the innkeeper, is very hospitable, coming around each morning at breakfast to talk with the guests. Having the library available 24 hours a day with coffee and tea and snacks available creates a very homelike atmosphere. The rooms are clean and quaint. In addition to being very quiet, it is also very affordable. If you plan to arrive after six, be sure to make arrangements in order to be able to get into the building as staff leaves. It is a serene gem in the bustling city.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Good:The hotel has a great location. Breakfast was very nice. Quaint furnishings.The Bad:Very noisy. The windows that face 23rd street need to be sound proofed. It was very difficult to sleep with so much noise. There was black mold in the bathroom grout and the carpet was dirty.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a gem of a find.Cancelled flight had us looking for another hotel for 3 night's. We managed to get in here for two of them. Very nice hotel, spacious, yes spacious room! Tastefully decorated. Communal breakfast area also very impressive. Bed comfort also gets a ten. Wished we had found sooner.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent four days in NYC to see a show, the 9-11 Memorial and what was new since our last visit. For a change we decided to stay in Chelsea; and based on excellent reviews, we booked a room at the Townhouse Inn of Chelsea. It was an excellent decision. Chelsea is half way between Times Square and the new World Trade Center development. On 23rd Street you are near the Flatiron Building, the wonderful High Line, and the Chelsea Market. It is a great location. The Inn is an old mansion that has been converted into about 10 rooms each with a private bath. Eric manages the Inn, and it is like staying in the home of an old friend. It has a great common room with self service beer, wine, soft drinks, snacks, a delicious continental breakfast and a wonderful view of the street below. The weather cancelled our flight home, and Eric made our stay for an extra night seamless. We highly recommend The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea to anyone visiting New York City.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great central location just down the street from two subway stops and so much to do nearby. I went for three nights with my two daughters and we really loved our clean and homey little room. We had no real view but I appreciated the quiet at night. It's a great street because it's not super busy so it is quiet at night. Lovely breakfast and I think we were the youngest people in the hotel but that was also nice as we aren't a rowdy bunch. They let us leave our bags when we arrived early and left late. Such a fun visit to the city. I will definitely seek them out again for future visits.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Townhouse Inn is a fine place to stay. Location is perfect for uptown or down, with all translation options close and accessible. Our spacious room on the W 23rd Street side had a very comfortable bed and Ann endlessly fascinating view at all hours. (You might find the back side rooms quieter if street noose is a problem. Full bath with good water pressure and hot water. Plentiful continental breakfast with excellent croissants. Disc and his staff were accommodating and professional, even managing to find us an extra chair when the room's period furniture want very sittable for us. It's a place we'll stay again. Try it: you'll like it.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This renovated townhouse offers a great deal in a convenient location. Spacious room with skylight, sofa, small desk, renovated bathroom. Great breakfast options in a cheery dining space included in price. Snacks and drinks available on the honor system. Manager, Eric treats you like a guest in his home. Convenient to subways, and a good selection of neighborhood restaurants. Only negative is spotty wi-fi.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good advance communication by manager Eric. Room was big, bed nice, heating worked just fine on a cold day. Breakfast was very good and plentiful. I enjoyed my stay so much I've booked it again. Also, was able to stay in the breakfast area if I wanted to do some computer work after checkout. Didn't need to, but it is a nice perk. Also, they will keep your bag for you the rest of the day after checkout if you like too.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 1 night with my husband. It is a cute boutique hotel in the heart of Chelsea. It was very reasonably price and overall we enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a room with a King bed and it was huge (for Manhattan). It was more of a suite with an area with a couch. This would be really nice if you have kids because it offers a lot of space to move about. The rooms and hotel and decorated sorta like your visiting your grandma (not in a good or bad way). The bed and pillows weren't as comfy as your more standard hotels. The TV was small and looked like it was from the 1990's, but we didn't plan on watching TV so it didn't really matter. The shower pressure could have been better. You can hear street noise from our spot on the 4th floor, but it didn't hinder our sleep too much. The windows didn't have black out curtains so if you plan on sleeping in really late with a hangover this may be a problem. The breakfast is a continental breakfast with assorted pastries (awesome croissants), bagels, spreads, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cold cereal, juice, coffee. It wasn't anything extravagant but it definitely got the job done and helps you save on food in NYC and offering a quick and convenient option to start your day. I would recommend this spot to friends.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We rented a suite for three of us (two queen beds) and were happy. Room was large and nicely decorated. Beds comfy. About as quiet as you can hope for in the city, which is pretty quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful.We went out for breakfast with family, so we can’t report on the Inn’s breakfast, but it looked good.Wifi didn’t work from our room (their web site says “in the library”, so can’t complain).One tip — let the hot water run a while to get really hot.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed from Saturday to Tuesday and my thanks to Eric and his staff for their helpfulness and friendliness. Nothing was a problem (other than the traffic to the airport, but they had arranged a car at a suitable time, so this didn't stress us). Greeted at the door by Eric and his two friendly bulldogs, we were then looked after at the reception desk by Fergie, who is just delightful and welcoming. Our room was a fair size and everything worked fine although the TV-cable system is a challenge. Bed and bathroom were ok and everything was spotless. We loved the breakfast which consisted of fresh bakery products, fruit and cereals, plus juices and beverages. An honour bar operates all day and night should anyone manage to go hungry in this fantastic area of NYC, which has numerous restaurants of all shapes and sizes. The hotel/inn/b&b (or whatever you wish to call it) is midway between two metro stations and bus stops, so everything is very close and we thoroughly enjoyed this buzzy neighbourhood.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea is sort of a New York City anachronism. It’s a 14 room inn that melds a hotel and an Airbnb experience. Those are hard to find in Manhattan especially considering its prime location. Any airport is a mere one or so hour distance via public transit (forget taxis – they will likely take longer). It’s quirky in a sort of fond but sometimes exasperating way. For instance, to get into the Inn you will need to get an email telling you about the key-code to get past the front door upon check-in. If you miss the email or have less than great dexterity (the key code is to a key lock box) you will be frustrated. Fortunately, my colleague went past that experience and just let me in when I arrived – you might not be so fortunate. Once inside you will be taken aback that the inn works on the honor system. If you take anything from the available snacks, beer, wine, etc; they only ask you note it down on a sticky note. Prices are beyond reasonable. That’s absolutely refreshing given today’s untrusting world. My room (#42) was spacious and the well appointed bathroom was very large. It took a bit of effort to prevent the shower curtain from enveloping my body (hint: wet it down first). The décor was definitely stuck in the 60’s. Even so, the bed was satisfying and nothing other than the décor could possibly offend you. Alternatively, you might be even excited about it! That said, the rooms are really up to today’s standards. The free Wi-Fi is adequate for Skype video calls. Normally, breakfast is included in the hotel rate and it’s about as good as you would get in Europe along with the period French classic music. Frankly, I found it quite enjoyable. Prices vary but if you book early enough you can get this little gem for much less than any other hotel in the area. Of course, whether you like it or not depends on what you are looking for. If you want a sure die hard frontal experience, then this is not it. If you want an eclectic, easy going, but ultimately satisfying experience then the Townhouse Inn of Chelsea is the place to stay.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is very well located, very close to 6th Ave and to the subway, which means, close to everywhere. Located exactly between Time Square and Greenwich Village. A lot of good restaurants nearby, including the famous Eataly.It is an old townhouse, comfortable room (no high tech, though) , good breakfast included and Eric, the owner, is a sweetheart. He allowed us to check in 2 hours before the time, with helped us a lot, since we were coming from Asia, and completely jet lagged. Besides, gave us all the info we needed about the surroundings.I would stay there again, for sure.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Early October we had the great pleasure of going to NYC on vacation. Usually, it can be a rather expensive and disappointing experience as hotels in the city can be overpriced and often low standard. But at this occasion we found an affordable place with charm and great location. Located on West 23rd Street between 6th and 7th Avenue in a neighborhood with lots of restaurants, stores and bars, in walking distance of a variety of attractions and with public transportation just outside the door, The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea is recommendable place to stay. The Inn itself is quite small, but has a lot of charm. The owner Eric and his staff (including 2 very nice dogs) are relaxed, service minded and helpful. In the cozy public area of the Inn a good continental breakfast is served daily. There is alway fresh brewed coffee ready for you. And on a we trust you pay basis it is possible to grab water, sodas, beer etc around the clock. Not at hotel rate, but at store rate. It is a place we will be sure to consider for our next visit to NYC. I can only recommend you give Eric a call to hear about vacancies for you next trip to the city.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I almost don't want to write this review because I don't want the word to get out. We stayed here for a bachelorette and we wanted the cozy feeling. The inn was perfect and shocking to even know this place existed in Manhattan. Eric was friendly and accommodating. Eric's devotion to this Inn makes it the place it is. The breakfast area with its original windows is stunning. The breakfast was perfect as well as the honor system for water and snacks is a rare find. I am already planning another trip. I would prefer staying at The Town House over any hotel in Manhattan. Thank You Eric!
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I go to New York, I like to be in Chelsea, it's a very central location for exploring the city.When I arrived, the "other Eric" came down and let me in, he was very friendly, and personable. After getting the information about the building, I went to room 42. The room was very large. Yes, the furniture is older but still comfortable and functional, but you do get mints on your day of check in! All day coffee and tea are nice. The morning cold breakfast was good, I would suggest that breakfast times be a little longer than 2 hours. The honor bar is a nice touch, without prices that felt like you were getting gouged.I will put this on my list of hotels to stay at again.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been there for 12 days.The rooms are large and well equipped and well maintainedThe breakfast is excellentBut most important, the atmosphere is very pleasant and worm as the owner, Eric Rod take care of everything and treat the guests personally Highly recommend this placeמאירה ויורם קרולMeira and Yoram KrollIsrael
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay at the Townhouse Inn just before Labor Day 2017. You can't beat the location, it is 2 blocks away from 4 subway lines and right near the Flatiron Building and Madison Square Park. There are lots of markets and shops in the area, the High Line and Chelsea Market are and easy walk. We liked Brooklyn Bagel on 8th Ave as the best bagels we had on this trip. We got in on the red eye from San Francisco and dropped our bags off at the Inn at 7am. We then did the same for our late flight upon check out, picking up our bags at 5pm on our way back to JFK. Staff was polite, but don't expect a homey B&B.Our room 42 was nice and roomy (as others have commented). We liked the ample shelves and storage throughout. You can tell the Inn was renovated in the last 10 years, however there were a few cosmetic issues that looked like they were in need of deferred maintenance. Housekeeping did a nice job each day as we returned to a made up room.The included breakfast was well done with great Croissants from Maison du Macaron across the street. New Yorkers hate half and half, so we made due with milk in our coffee. Their bagels were not boiled at breakfast, so again head to Brooklyn Bagel or Murray's nearby for those. The library was one of the most distinctive things about the Inn- we made nightly use of the ice machine and very fairly priced honor bar for water, beers, and snacks.All and all a great and fairly priced place to stay. Our 4 nights cost about $1,000. We would definitely return.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with our 2 teenage children. It's is really hard to please everyone and this place truly pleased everyone. We had the suite located in the front of the building. It is definitely bigger than most NYC apartments. We were on one of the top floors and barely could hear any traffic or noise from the outside. They offer tea and coffee free of charge throughout the day and small snacks and refreshments including beer and wine based on the honest system. The owner really takes pride in making everyone feel welcome and offers assistance in suggesting places to see and do. Breakfast is awesome!!!! This is an older building so of course the pipes are old and heating and water pressure could be an issue for some but everyone should take this into consideration before booking this type of hotel. The owner will give you extra blankets and space heaters upon request. This is definitely a place I will visit again. It's just not a place to "just sleep at" but this becomes part of your New York City trip experience.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a couple who looks for places to stay that are a bit out of the ordinary, have some character and are not the typical corporate box hotels where everything looks the same. If this is also you, then this is the place for you to stay in NYC. We loved the fact that we were arriving late, could get our key and could come and go as we wanted for the 3 nights and 4 days we were there. In fact we hardly saw a person except when we checked out. We had one of the bigger rooms which was great for spreading out and feeling at home. We didn't spend a lot of time taking in the other amenities such as the breakfast or honor bar but everything looked tip top. We had the room that faces 23rd street so there was quite a bit of street noise but after all, you don't come to NYC for peace and quiet. If you are a fussy sleeper ask for a quieter room. A couple small things that we forgot to mention at checkout; one of the bedside lamps was missing a bulb and the hair dryer only worked on low the last day so it may need replaced. We will be back again on a future visit to the Big Apple.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I went there last night for our anniversary. It is perfectly located in Chelsea/Flatiron area. The room we had was huge, 3 times bigger than most hotels in the area. Not only does the room have 10ft celings. But the walls are exposed brick. The rooms give you the feel of Victorian era, with antique furniture in the room. The king bed we had was comfortable and quiet, we slept like babies. What is also amazing is the room had a modern bathroom with nice sink and shower, along wit plenty of shampoo and conditioner for the guest. The reception desk is on the second floor where there is a common area with a beautiful seating area. This is where they serve a continental breakfast with coffee, 2 juices, bagels, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, even 2 kinds of marmalade. Also fresh fruit. I can't say enough about how wonderful and relaxing it is,even a library to sit and read while looking out beautiful windows onto 23rd st. The young man running the desk was very friendly and thoughtful. We ound this place to be charming yet secure, and looking forward to returning! We highly recommend it!
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Who wouldn't love to stay in a castle that has been converted into a charming boutique inn located in the middle of Manhattan? The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea is a very lovely and unique inn that is beautifully and tastefully decorated in which guests can enjoy a delightful selection of delicious breakfast items every morning (for free); snacks and drinks throughout the day (honor system!); and, evening wine and cheese. Guests need not worry about "modern" accommodations as they are plentiful including free WiFi, in-room hair dryers and satellite TV. Conveniently located, public transportation is available just steps away from the inn's front door. For those who dare to drive into NYC, a public access parking garage is located just up the street. You will definitely want to ask Eric Ord, General Manager, about where to eat as his recommendations were fantastic ... all within walking distance of the inn. And, you are in for a real treat if you're staying at the inn when Sophie and Max are around ... the inn's English Bulldogs. They are the raspberries on top of the trifle! I absolutely recommend The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea to those who have never visited NYC, to tri-state area locals who are looking for a weekend getaway as well as those -- like me -- who come into town for business. I will definitely stay here again - Former Jersey Girl Who Used to Work in Manhattan Who Now Lives in St. Petersburg, Florida
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to NYC for a friend's graduation from NYU. We were delighted by our fifth floor room shining northern light from the ceiling level window with a skylit effect. The room was very comfortable, with ample storage space and a large bathroom.Eric, the owner, was friendly and attentive, and responded immediately when we needed to be in contact.We were impressed by the great selection available for breakfast, including yogurt, fresh fruit, and boiled eggs in addition to the usual bread and pastries of continental breakfasts. It got our days off to a great start.If we had time in our schedule, we would have loved to have spent the whole day with a good book and cup of coffee in the delightful lounge/breakfast room.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great experience here over 2 days/nights. The staff was friendly and pleasant, and my room was nicely sized, clean, and the bed very comfortable. The location was perfect for me for my business meetings, and I enjoyed walking around the area. Lots of attractions and restaurants in walking distance. I didn't get to enjoy breakfast as I had to leave daily before 8am, but the common area and the inn in general were a nice change from cookie cutter hotels. I would stay here again on business or personal travel.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the inn. It was like staying at a friend's house. We got an spacious room, all clean and comfortable. The dinning room was nice and sunny in the morning where we enjoy a varied and nice breakfast. The location is amazing!!! We will certainly loved to be back.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great B&B with large rooms and nice room for continental breakfast. Centrally located and convenient to Sixth Seventh and Eighth Ave subways. Eric is a very helpful proprietor. Rooms are quiet and large for NYC
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lovely time staying with Eric at The Townhouse Inn, Chelsea. Ideally situated to explore both Downtown Manhattan and close to The Highline and The Hudson River. The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. The continental breakfast was good with tasty fresh bagels and croissants. Would definitely recommend. Good value for money.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Townhouse Inn for 5 nights while in NYC for a conference because it was convenient to the venue and I prefer smaller hotels.I was very pleasantly surprised with how spacious and quiet my room was (room 52 I think). I could have done a full yoga set in the spare room on the floor, and I heard no street noise except for ambulance/police sirens (which I don't think you could avoid hearing no matter where you stay). Only downsides to the space was that it had very high ceiling which made it hard to heat-up, it took me a couple days to figure out how to get it comfortable. I can't say much about breakfast other than it's hours are later than most place I'm used to - great if you're on vacation and sleeping in, not so great if you're keeping working hours.
