But the check-in sheet mentions there's a Doughnut Plant about a block away and that pretty much made up for it. :)
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The feel and operation of the Townhouse Inn is very pleasant; a little urban and a little cozy at the same time.Location is ideally situated to subway stations and a number of attractions in the area.Staff was very friendly and resolved any concerns as soon as they became aware of them.
hotelName:
29    The Townhouse Inn of Chelsea
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This facility did not reply to three emails requesting various travel information which caused us considerable stress. We only saw one employee the whole time we were there and he was sent to ask us for payment - in cash. It would have been nice to have met someone on our arrival as we had never been to New York before. (We didn’t arrive late). Requests for additional toiletries were promised and not delivered and we had to ask three times for a taxi to take us to the airport. The room was nice and well equipped. The location is fine, but a fair trek to the attractions of downtown Manhattan. We wouldn’t stay at this property again or recommend it.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved my stay here. Though travelling alone as a woman I felt safe in this neighborhood, despite the bad perception some people may have of Harlem. The guesthouse is lovely and the host is very attentive to your needs when she is around in the mornings. The rooms are spacious with large bathrooms as well, rather unusual for NYC. The house has a lovely charm and is furnished classically, making you feel like in the movies. The heater was a little noisy but thats what you get in such an older style building. Otherwise all very clean and well looked after. Comfortable bed. Would definitely visit again!If there is something we can do to make your stay better, please let us know.We look forward to your stay with us.Your home in New York,Soul Food Guesthouse (Mont Morris)" in the neighborhood.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week in September on the top floor. Two very good sized bedrooms, kitchen space, bathroom and separate toilet.The property is very nicely decorated and the bathroom and toilet was nice and modern.Very close to the subway and don't be put off by Harlem, we walked about late at night with no trouble. Easy access to the rest of New York, we went all over the place.Anything you want appears to be no trouble and I'd definitely recommend this as a place to stay.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Mont Morris House at the end of May. We were a party of three: my brother and our mother. We stayed on the first floor, where we had a big space with two bedrooms, a bathroom and a walk in closet. The hosts are two lovely gentlemen, they were always available to us with a smile on their face; they also provided us with yummy cookies and cakes for breakfast. At Mont Morris House you can use a kitchen and dining room to have your meals. Breakfast is provided. The House, a period building overlooking Mont Morris Park, is stunning, and very well connected to the city via metro or bus, and within walking distance from Central Park.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so impressed with this property, it was so beautifully decorated. We were very pleased with the detail throughout this building from the late 1800s, and the care put in to restoring it. Absolutely stunning aesthetics in every room. The beds were very comfortable and the entire house was very clean. The host was most pleasant, giving us great tips on where to go for dinner, etc. The location was great for what we wanted to see while in the city, Central Park and the museums. We will definitely stay here again when we return. Great price for the spacious room we booked.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are gorgeous, clean, and beautifully decorated. A perfect amount of luxury. The staff is kind and helpful, and its location is ideal for getting around all of NYC - public transit to all key MTA lines are nearby, and a quick bus ride or cab to the airport. My favorite neighborhood in the city.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loses 1 star only for the neighbourhood, we stayed around the corner in Soul Food. Staff are lovely, gave us a box of fresh homemade cookies on arrival. Clean, quirky rooms. Go to the ihop around the corner its great! Watch out for the crazy squirrels in Marcus Garvey park!
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's very difficult for me to review this B&B. On one hand the accommodation itself was great - the room was spacious and clean. Upon our arrival we found home made cookies on our bed that were so delicious. So cool idea! We had a room n. 4 on the second floor, it has its own bathroom which we really appreciated. If I'd reviewed only the accommodation, I'd give 5 stars. The neighborhood on the other hand deserves one star, maybe no star at all. It's Harlem and I should have probably known. But I didn't. The 125th street is a mess - there are people doing drugs on the corners, it stinks like urine - farther you go from Central Park the worse. I would strongly recommend to not walk there in the night, sometimes we had weird feeling walking there during the day. I can't understand why some people here say it is safe neighborhood. It's definitely not safe and I won't probably visit this place again, which I regret most, because the room was great and the staff was friendly, but we didn't feel safe.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ich war jetzt zweimal hier. Einmal eine Woche (vor 2 Jahren) und einmal jetzt nur einen Tag. Ich kann nur positives sagen. Alles sauber. Freundliche Gastgeberinnen. Individuelle Zimmer. Jedes hat ein anderes Motto. Einfach ein Traum. Kein Hotelflair sonder man denkt echt man wohnt hier in New York. Jederzeit gerne wieder. Ich finde es auch vom Preis echt in Ordnung.I been here twice. First time for a week (2 years ago) and second time now for only one day. I can only say positive things about this place. Everything is clean. Nice hosts. Individual rooms. Every room has a different theme. It is a dream. Nothing like a hotel you just think you live in New York. Anytime I would stay there again. Also the price is good.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic stay. The accommodation is stylish and traditional at the same time. Beds were comfy and decor was stunning. I loved the area. A peaceful respite from the noise and bustle of downtown Manhattan. Our host was incredibly helpful and even sourced a delicious cake to help my Mum celebrate her Birthday. For value for money, comfort, style and atmosphere you can't go wrong.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, easy to find, nice design of apartment, room has small kitchen equiped with coffee machine and refrigirator. We were travelling in winter time and it was a bit cold in room during the night.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice brownstones in the heart of Harlem, close to the subway and restaurants. Room was clean and tiny but I knew that. However the bathroom is really tiny and it was too cold inside. They only took cash as payment that is why I rate 3/5 for service. Otherwise very good.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the quaint, cozy and colorful home. We will stay here again. It was all we needed: clean room, comfortable bed and a television. Shared bathroom was not an issue. Be careful on the wood steps a little slippery.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: cozy well kept property. the decor and art work is amazing. This is my second time at this B&B and each time I am amazed at how different and beautiful the rooms are. Staff are very friendly and make you fell welcome.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very charming stay with what makes Harlem at hearth. Clean and well priced, also the staff ( THEY'RE LOVELY ) have their guests warnly welcomed. Fresh and clean bed sheets and the funky interior won't make you regret your choice. Gives you a different perspective of what is NYC! Perfect for the adventurous type who isn't looking for commercial luxury. Late arrivals, you might want to ask for a water bottle.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't normally leave reviews but I believe in giving credit where credit is due! This property was everything I could have hoped for and more, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was as advertised and perfectly clean.The information pack was a nice touch and highlighted some places to see, which I would not otherwise have thought to visit (also the homemade cookies that were on my bed upon arrival were possibly the best cookies I have ever eaten). Great location, great price for what you get and will definitely be staying here again should I come back to NY! Would definitely recommended to anyone thinking about travelling to Manhattan.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I arrived it took quite a while to get anyone to answer the door ,rang the mobile numbers but no reply.After ten minutes wait door was opened .Then found out my booking on trip advisor which said my payment had been taken off my credit card had not.They don't take credit cards and as they hadn't emailed me prior to my trip I had no cash to pay for the room.Having just arrived in New York this could have ruined the holiday but Georgia the person in charge was really apologetic and told me to pay once I returned to the UK.She has tried to get trip advisor to make it clear they don't take credit cards but to no avail.So after a stressful start I was then taken to the annex which is a few blocks away.The room I had was superb .Large with a double bed and two singles, there was also a seating area, bathroom, kitchen and outside garden.Homemade biscuits were in the room on my arrival a nice touch.There was also a really good information pack of places to see, eat etc.The decor is quirky,the room clean and the bed very comfortable .In the bathroom were a collection of shower gels.Wi fi in the room was fine.Georgia was very helpful and always keen to give tips on where to go.The area was very quiet, close to the metro and on my own I never felt unsafe walking around at night.The metro was regular and very easy to get down town .I would definitely stay again and can recommend it for anyone wanting to visit New York
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is on the great location. Metro station are close, what is the best possible way to travel in NY. Our room, #3 was beautiful and charming. Bed was comfortable and bathroom is movie star:) Shops are close, so you can buy anything you need. Park is across the street, so you can walk in the morning. Our host Gorgia was helpful, funny and cool. We are happy to stayed there and hope that we will come again asap :)
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a repeat visit, having stayed once before in May 2015. We were met on arrival by Paola, who helped us get our luggage inside. Since we were too early for check in she offered to watch our stuff while we went out and explored Harlem, and moved our stuff to our room when it was ready We had room 2, which has a private bath, is on the first floor as you come in to the building, and is quite roomy. There was also a refrigerator which was handy for my wife to store some of her meds that require refrigeration Two suggestions: it would be nice to have a dresser or armoire to put clothes in and a mirror above the desk, because the bathroom mirror is too small and lighting is not the best. There is a closet in the room but the shelves are up way too high to put much on them. Mont Morris at 3 W 123rd street is an old brownstone row house that is very clean, well maintained, and quiet. It's only 3 blocks from the subway line and an easy trip to midtown Manhattan to see all the sights. We also went to a free taping of Conan Obrien at the Apollo the day we arrived. Special thanks to Georgia for getting up at 5AM to help us walk our luggage to the M60 bus stop on 125th street for the half hour ride to La Guardia on the day of our departure. Above and beyond the call of duty. Thank you. The bus costs about $5 for 2 people and only takes a half hour to get there, compared to $50 for a taxi, so it is well worth it. We will most likely stay here on future visits because of the reasonable rates, the location, and the assistance of staff, particularly Paola and Georgia. Can't wait to come back again, maybe for Macy's Thanksgiving Parade, or at Christmas to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for three nights and felt like home. Excellent location and just 5 min from subway lines 2 and 3. Around 20 min to time square and 35 min to Wall St and even battery park for ferry to Statue of Liberty. Very nice and safe neighborhood.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a brief stay at Mont Morris, but it was a very pleasant one. The location is in a convenient and interesting part of NYC. My room looked like a converted living or dining room. The high ceilings and lighting made it a very interesting space. The bathroom was also clean, modern and the water pressure in the shower was great.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed a good and friendly and quiet stay, away from busy downtown Manhattan in interesting Harlem. Nice restaurants and cafés just around the corner. Wish I could have stayed longer! Really lovely and helpful staff!
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice room, I founded the location kind of far from the mid area it wasn't convenient for me and also i didn't felt much save there, the house is cute and has everything you need my issue was the location.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: WOW! We were so pleasantly surprised upon arrival. I had almost cancelled our reservation due to the area. I am SO glad I didn't. It was not only beautiful but clean. We walked around the area quite a bit and never felt unsafe. Very east to get to the subway too. On our next trip, we will book here for sure.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place Location isn't ideal but its close to subways and rooms were super clean and beds really comfyStaff are friendly and helpful. Price is great if u don't have funds to stay in manhattanWould stay again
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROS:Very clean room and premisesVery nice attention from owners/workersSafe place and neighbourhoodNext to several subway stations and places to eatPlace is beautiful, tidy and cleanBoth A/C and fan working perfectlyPayment clear (I don't understand some people complaining about taxes and stuff. Everything is detailed when booking online plus also in the paperwork they send you via email shortly before coming. People should take time and read things carefully. Also it is clearly stated payment is cash only. I'd rather keep prices low and paying straight to the hotel rather than paying extra for the Amex fees)CONS:Single rooms are VERY small but prices are small for these rooms also so okLack of light in room. Only a small lamp behind the TV opposite to your bed making impossible to read when there is no daylight. This should be improved.Pillows too thin.Sheets/Towels changed only once a week.All in all, a very good stay at Mt.Morris
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mont Morris is a lovely old Brownstone building in Harlem, close to 125th Street subway. Being able to come and go as I pleased was very convenient, especially with an unexpectedly late arrival at the airport! The room was full of character and the bathroom and bed felt luxurious. Although the location is quite far out from many of the sites I was visiting, it was easy to use the subway and it was a perfect base for my 3 days in New York, at a cost far more reasonable than other places I considered. The welcome notes left by the owners gave me lots of ideas for things to do and see both in Harlem and around NYC.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the 'black room' at the Mont Morris and loved our stay there. The place is impeccably clean and lovingly maintained and the rooms are spacious. The WiFi connection was good. The decor reminds me of the days of the Harlem Renaissance. The property is located in a very nice part of town with excellent restaurants nearby. This is not for people who like an ordinary boring B&B, but guests who appreciate the experience of an old time Harlem where the likes of Marcus Garvey and Langston Hughes lived.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A quiet place near Marcus Garvey park, subway is 10 min. Quiet room, sleeping area and bathroom, everything ok. Opportunity to know closely life in Harlem. I love NY, we stay here 4 days. We love to come back!
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good stay. We took the cheapest room and it's really small but convenient and charming. The building is stylish and the other rooms are very spacious and stylish in design (and all different). The staff is thoughtful and everything is done for us to feel welcome and "at home". Close to the metro station "125th Str".
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent and quirky accomodation, spotlessly clean. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely return. Great location. Harlem comes alive at night and easy access to midtown and downtown Manhattan.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Mont Morris B & B!! The room was exactly as described and shown online. It was also very clean, roomy, and our particular room included a bonus little kitchenette and private patio of which we took advantage of on a nightly basis!! It is also very close to the subway which takes you to almost every "touristy" spot you would want to check out. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance of which we took full advantage of!! Casasotto, an Italian eatery close by, was our first dinner in the city and was fabulous!! If I could say anything to anyone who is making their first trip to the city, it would be that parking is extremely difficult to find! There are parking garages nearby but if you are lucky enough to find a spot along the street, keep in mind that two times per week they sweep the streets so you will have to move your car. This isn't a poor reflection of the property or city, just a tidbit of info that you will want to keep in mind! Our stay was great! And the ladies who care for the property are very nice, extremely helpful, and hospitable. Would highly recommend this property if you're looking for a budget friendly as well as clean place to stay while visiting New York!!!
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: clean, close to subway, nice bed, updated bathroom, courteous service, one's own window air conditioner, really an exceptionally good value for NYC. Would definitely stay again, love the privacy on the part of staff, and a surprise from the owner. No bugs, cool antique, repurposing decor.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay 3 nights at Mount Morris and were definitely satisfied. The room was authentic, stylish and very clean The hosts were friendly and helpful. The house is 2 minutes away from 125th street subway station (lines 2 and 3). We didn't hang so much in the neighborhood as we had many things to visit in the center, but it seemed nice and safe (at least during day time).We'll definitely try to book a room again next time we're in nyc. Important tip: Remember to give your phone number and check your mails. They give you a code which you need to lock yourself in.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable bed, spacious room with all necessary amenities. Proximity to metro station, nice looking and safe neighbourhood, few markets nearby. Excellent home made welcome cookies, breakfasts where you can really enjoy talking with the hosts and other people. Great hospitality and help from hostel personnel.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not the nicest of places. So small the bed touched the both walls. Shower and toilet was shared and not very clean. I expected to stay in the Mont Morris but was in a annex 3 blocks away, No storage for clothes.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were convinced we had been given the wrong room, because the room was far more beautiful and luxurious than we expected for the (reasonable) price!Loved our stay here and loved how close it was to a subway stop. Felt really safe when on the road the property was on, but not as safe walking to and from the property and the subway station. We had no incidents so all was fine.Absolutely recommend this B&B for anyone on a budget and wanting to stay out of central NYC.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's clean, quiet and in easy commute of central New York. I'd stay there again if I was planning to go out sightseeing every day, which is what I did when I was there. If I was staying with children or a partner I might prefer a hotel with more facilities. There are places to eat for breakfast lunch and dinner in the immediate neighbourhood. Harlem is the new trendy plAce to stay and I felt safe there, even at night.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing stay, eveything is clean. Nearby places to go eat. Safe place. Everything is set to have a comfortable visit. Very nice place to stay, surely staying again in this location. Cleaning lady very nice and considerate.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've never stayed anywhere quite like this. Entry via a coded keypad, with no-one around at any time to receive you and a one hour window to pay and speak to a member of staff. Room adequate but tired and minimally equipped (sofa had no cushions and so impossibly uncomfortable to sit on). Bedroom JUST about big enough to fit a double bed, but only in such a way as to require plastic steps to get onto the bed.Conveniently located for metro line.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 4 days with my husband on a couples trip on May 2016, The place is excellent for the price and location. You will bearly see anyone arround the house In fact we only met a host the days we were leaving, and she was great help that day! I would definatly come back
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mont Morris is a great a place, with a great value for money. I spent a week here, in April and is very close to the subway and bus to the center. The room is very big, compare with hotels and has a fridge. Thank you for the surprises!
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean bedroom, unusual decoration, friendly attendance and near subway station... I strongly recommend this hotel for those who go to NYC and need a good place to rest after walking around the whole day.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Women (Marie, Georgia) were warm, kind and interesting for conversation. They left delicious homemade cakes twice at our room - ladies, thank you! Room was clean and nicely decorated, it felt like we were in a hotel. Neighbouring area is safe, lots of shops, restaurants, subway 1 minute away. My 10 y.o. son and me, we truly enjoyed there, and we would love to come here again in the future. 10/10 100% :-)
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very big and very well decorated the subway is about 5 min walk and me and my wife are under 30 and we had no problems with the people there it's safe the host was very chatty at the breakfast room she is very nice have fun .
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was great: the beautiful room (it was room 8), the location very close to the subway, the staff, the good information they give you... We had a very pleasant stay, and we'll definitely go back there!
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was really pleasent experience to stay at Mont Morris Guest House. Extremely nice people. I had a bit problem getting in the first night, as my code wasn´t working. But it took only few minutes after my text message that someone came to open the door for me.The area is calm, no noise at night, and it feels safe to return from subway after dark, even though I was alone (female).Good subway connection to the center isn´t far away.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good place to stay when visiting New York. Close to the subway, it takes around twenty minutes to the city centre. Nice room with a lot of space and well furnished. Clean and quite at night, overall satisfied.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Mont Morris on two occasions in September 2015. Both rooms were very well decorated, with plenty of space which i was not expecting in NY. The staff were extremely helpful when we need an early morning taxi or general things to do in NY.Th Hotel is only a 5 min walk from two Underground stations and the line is also an express line so takes around 15 mins to get to Central Square. there are also several restaurants near by and can recommend Ristorante Settepani on 120th for Happy hour drinks or a great meal with live Jazz musicI would thoroughly recommend staying here as found it value for money in a City where accommodation is expensive.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i was looking for some reasonbly priced but comfortable place for one night to sleep in nyc and this fit perfectly. small cosy room with really good bed, i slept like a baby. nice atmosphere there, several music clubs within 10-15min walking distance with live music every weekday. quiet surroundings, 5min walk to the subway that brings you downtown in little time. i'd definitely come back to mont morris.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with a friend for 5 days at the Mont Morris and was pleasantly suprised. Our room was exactly as seen on the internet, very colourful, original, and clean, the staff was incredible friendly and helpful, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The neigborhood is not best, but the next underground station is very close and getting around was no problem at all.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mont Morris is located by one of the best streets in Harlem (125th) and within a few hundred meters from the subway. The host are so nice and the atmosphere is cozy. When we arrived it was halloween, and the hosts and the dog was dressed as police officers, and the place was decorates with spiders etc. You are always met with a smile from the host and the other guests. The rooms are big, and the place is always clean and you feel really safe at Mont Morris. We had a room turning to the street, and there was a bit noise when trucks came buy and when the trash was picked up. Therefore we recommend ear plugs.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: B&B Mont Morris is a great budget option centrally located in Harlem, close to subways and busses. It is set in a beautiful Victorian house close to Central Park. Its decor is funky, artsy, bohemian and welcoming, albeit not luxurious. The beds are great. The staff are warm, hospitable, friendly and accomodating. And the place is affordable. I will definitely return! Highly remommended!
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my boyfriend booked to stay in Mont Morris for 4 nights in September during our New York and Florida trip. I could not fault the accommodation. 1 minute walk from subway station, beautifully decorated rooms (had a sneaky peek at other rooms when they were empty and open and the lower the floor the more modern and newer the rooms). They are decorated in a very eclectic taste. Our room had a fridge which was very handy as we like to enjoy a glass of G&T after a whole day of walking. I would definitely come back to this guesthouse next time Im in New York. As per the location, Harlem might seem unsafe and in places the streets smelt of urine- yes, of urine! But no one bothered us when we were out. You have to balance it all out and for the price you pay its a small compromise to make to stay in Harlem.
hotelName:
30    Soul Food Mont Morris
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: staying in the 255 west guesthouse brownstone while visiting new york was like a dream come true! the decor was lovely and james was a gracious host. i was attending a reading institute at columbia teachers college and it was a pleasant 25 minute walk to classes. the location is wonderful since it's close to public transportation and just a short walk to great live music, historical sights, and fantastic restaurants.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was a really fun place to stay. I booked the Lily room and enjoyed everything, especially the awesome shower. It was clean, comfortable, and a short walk to where I needed to go for work. I would book again.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice experience. We spent 3 nights in Calliope room on 2nd floor. Room was clean, nicely decorated and perfect for our needs. Nice change from hotel vibe. Had a small refrigerator. James the owner was available and responsive to us.Would stay again.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed a week with friends and shared the third floor rooms with the adjoining kitchen. Room was ok, but the air conditioner didn’t really cool the room well enough. However what spoilt the stay was the filthy condition of the kitchen. It was great being able to do our own breakfasts and a few dinners, but not before we gave the kitchen a thorough cleaning. The fridge hadn’t been cleaned, the microwave was splattered with food, the stove and hot plates greasy and dirty. It really spoilt the stay as we never felt entirely at ease in the dirty kitchen. Even after contacting the owner and letting him know of the conditions, he did not bother replying or even acknowledging our email. Maybe not really interested??
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guesthouse was centrally located in Harlem. We were travelling with another couple so had a room each, with private facilities and shared the private kitchen on the 3rd floor. The bedrooms & facilities were clean & comfortable. The kitchen was v dirty. We needed to wash any utensils & crockery before using them. The dishwasher wouldn’t pump out and the oven was covered in grease inside & out.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Make sure you coordinate your arrival as they have to let you in but once you are in if you are able to get the top floor it is an awesome spacious place :) The decor and style is very nice and the bathrooms are amazing.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to feel at home and not just a visitor, this is the place to stay when in NY. My guestroom was large and very comfortable. It faced the street and there were no issues with noise. The attention to detail from the decor to the french press coffee is wonderful. James, the owner is very relaxed and fun to chat with. He will meet you when you arrive and answer any questions you may have, from how to get around to where the best place to get food. You are provided a key and you're "home". Speaking of food, there is a grocery store at the end of the block and a mini-fridge in your room to store snacks, drinks, etc. Of course, there are many restaurants in the area, so you don't have to go to the grocery store. The subway is close by and will get you anywhere in the city. If I am in the NY area again, I will definitely stay here.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked the location a lot. It was easy to get downtown by subway and a half hour casual walk to the top of Central Park. The hotel is very special. Much thought and detail is apparent in the renovation of this lovely old place. So quiet too. Thank you James for a great stay.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really appreciated my stay at 255West - yes, it's not close to the sights so perhaps not the ideal location if you are in New York for the first time and focusing on sightseeing. However, for your next stay and all others after that - especially once you've figured out the subway and realise how easy it is to get downtown with the A - this is a perfect, affordable option. I loved the beautifully-preserved brownstone house, the decor of the room was impeccable, and in terms of cleanliness it was absolutely immaculate. The Calliope room I stayed in had buttery yellow walls and one exposed brick wall behind the bed, solid marble top bedsteads with turquoise ceramic lamps, an inset shelf lined with a few books and tasteful tchotchkes. I found it warm and pleasant and absolutely a place I could imagine myself living. The room was large and filled with natural light, the trees outside the two windows provided some privacy and birdsong in the morning, and everything was well laid out and well thought of. The bathroom was clean and also beautifully designed: a shower room with muted pastel tiles and polished fittings. The mattress and pillows were comfortable, the fridge was really nice-to-have, and the water bottles and chocolate as a welcome were a nice touch. The host was patient, friendly, and discreet... I could go on! I would not hesitate to return.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had never been to NYC before and was traveling out to see my second cousin, who lives in Harlem. The neighborhood doesn't offer too many options in terms of lodging and I was a little skeptical of going through AirBnB as you don't exactly know what you might get. The only brand name hotel that was fairly close by was aLoft in Harlem and that was around $210/nt for the weekend I was traveling. I found 255West for about $50/nt less and decided to go for it. I was so glad I did! Everything was very clean and James was very accommodating in making the check-in and check-out process seamless, even with a packed itinerary. The room was just as good as any hotel I could have found and everything was clean and fresh. There was very little noise and while the neighborhood isn't exactly the best in the city, I felt perfectly comfortable walking around on my own, even coming from a tiny town of just over 4,000 people in central California. All the major attractions of lower Manhattan are a short (less than 40 min) subway ride away and you can walk to Yankee Stadium in well under an hour, which was a huge plus for me! If I could improve on anything, I'd say they should modify booking through the website to just charge your card for the whole stay automatically at check-in, but James was able to email me an invoice to pay online for the difference, so I didn't have to make time to have him physically run my card. No harm, no foul. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone traveling to New York by themselves or with a companion!
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: James is a great, friendly host. The property is located in a very quiet side street in Harlem. We loved the area, our experience is it was very safe, we never felt unsafe day or night either walking from the subway, or on the subway itself.There is some great places to eat nearby (Harlem Renaissance and Sylvia's are two standouts)The room was comfortable and clean - the only issue we had was the pay tv stations stopped working the last couple of nights - not a biggie, and the wifi was at a glacial pace - I uploaded two photos to Facebook and it took hours.Overall, definitely would recommend.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I felt like I was at home during my stay here. The room was spacious, clean and in a quiet neighborhood. Short walk to local and express subways (30 minutes or less to Time Square), bus routes and near bars and restaurants. Though most of our time was spent in the mid and lower half of Manhattan, the distance from the "action" was no problem at all since we would be using the subway to get places anyway. Felt completely safe at all times even when walking from the subway late at night. James was there to greet us when we arrived and was very accessible throughout our stay with any requests we had. There is a full kitchen available to us which was a nice touch for storing and re-heating leftovers. Each room comes with a private bathroom but not all of them are attached to the rooms (some are in the hall) so make sure you check if that is a concern of yours. For the same price as closet sized run down hotels in the middle of the city, we were able to stay in a beautiful room with great hospitable hosts. This will be my go-to hotel whenever I return to the city.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely property and hosts. Very easily accessible to midtown Manhattan on the subway - can get to 59th street on an express train in under 10 mins. Would recommend - area is very safe so please do not be concerned about staying in Harlem.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother and I stayed here in June from the 14th-17th. We stayed in the Calliope room and we were relieved at how accurate the pictures online were. We were instantly impressed by how warm and welcoming James was to us from the first time we stepped out of the taxi. He waited for us outside and took our bags out of the car and showed us to our room. James is very knowledgeable about the area and was able to give us a few options of what restaurants to visit. James was a pleasure and gave us our privacy and he was a easy to reach by phone if we ever needed anything. It was walking distance from most of the places we visited and close to the bus stop and a few blocks away from the 125th subway station! We will definitely be returning.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful and tastefully decorated guest house in the heart of Harlem, Very friendly owner who was available whenever a question needed answering but not invasive and locals always friendly. plenty of eating establishments nearby and a great base for travelling on the subway doing the tourist thing.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely beautiful house that gives you a true New York experience. Our Lily room was gorgeous and James was really helpful for recommending local hotspots and how to navigate New York. The house is near the subway so you can easily get to and from all of the attractions. Would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Guillaume room for 10 days, and loved how the guesthouse felt more like an apartment than a hotel. The room was lovely and spacious and had everything we needed for an enjoyable relaxing stay, including tea and coffee downstairs which we started our days out with. I thought the art and styling of the place was amazing! There is also a fully equipped kitchen in the communal area where you can store food in the fridge/freezer or cook if you like!The hosts were great, very welcoming and kept out our way but were easily available if we needed them and gave loads of helpful tips when it came to airport transport and local restaurants.I was a bit apprehensive about the area since this was our first visit to New York, however I would say it is fine, it has an interesting local vibe and is perfectly safe during the day. Night time was fine too, but we stuck to the main roads just incase. There are lots of great brunch spots around the area, we would especially recommend Amy Ruths for the waffles and chicken, and Patisserie des Ambassades for delicious croissants.The nearby 125th street subway has great connections for lower Manhattan and Brooklyn as this has both the local and express subway, but you can also go to 135th street for just local (slower) trains.The only real negative about the guesthouse was the internet was quite slow, which made it difficult to watch movies.Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This renovated Harlem Brownstone was a beautiful space. Lots of care went into the property. Inn owner was friendly, reliable, and fleixible. Price was more than affordable. Only drawback was that we had planned on spending a lot of time in Manhattan and Brooklyn, and at times were too lazy or tired to take the train, so spent some cash on Ubers. Still, over all great experience and spent a little time getting to know Harlem!
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a week at 255West Guesthouse and it could have not been better! very warm welcome, great room, enough space, nice hosts, good location! Just amazing. We had a great time in New York. Thank you
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in love from the moment I stepped into the property! From the aesthetics with decor, the structural design of the property and even more so with the privacy of my booked room and nearby bath-- both of which has the amenity of locking. My room was the Lily on the top level and I couldn't have been more pleased. I love a good sleigh bed and I loOove wood flooring. Comfort is never something one wants to sacrifice especially when traveling-- James' and Frank's property in no way let me down. I literally came and went as I saw fit with no awkward encounters in between-- before I knew it it was time to go :( I was quite satisfied with the location of the property as well-- as I set forth on foot on a numbers of adventures which would have been highly unpleasant if not impossible had I opted for some place not central to The city of Manhattan's attractions. I came to reconnect with old friends and left with new ones! Such a gem this brownstone is-- one gets to step into the city life of NYC from an authentic vantage point of accommodations in the city that look and feel as personable as that which could be occupied by close friends or family extending an invite. My stay will not be my last!
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As soon as Frank opened the door to welcome us, we knew we made the right choice. When he took us up the one flight of stairs to our room and opened the door, it was exactly as it looked in the pictures. We stayed in the Gino room and it's very spacious. You had a view over the back gardens and could open a window, which was a bonus during the unseasonly warm weather NYC was experiencing during our stay. It was wonderful to come home at the end of a long day of walking to relax in a nice deep hot bath. There was also a hand held shower over the bath, so we would to suggest that if you particularly like a shower only, this room isn't for you. The room was equipped with a small fridge, cable TV and iron and ironing board. There was a small couch and coffee table. The room was very warm and although extra blankets and pillows are also provided, we didn't need them. If you're going during the summer months, I would enquire about cooling. Tea and coffee is available in the communal dining room downstairs.Frank and James are available for any of your needs, however if you want to be left alone, they will not disturb you. We asked all the basic questions first up, and we're set to hit Manhattan. The tip on the quick way to the subway on 125th, saved lots of time, as it's an easy walk a few blocks north. The ABCD lines all operate from this stop and we were able to access all the places we wanted to visit from this line, crossing to other lines at major stops. The area was very quiet and we always felt safe. There's a large laundromat at the end of the street on Frederick Douglas. All in all, if you want a comfortable, safe and spacious place to stay just out of Manhattan, we highly recommend 255West Guesthouse and hope your stay is as wonderful as ours was.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved staying here; spacious comfortable room, nice big bed, great TV options and lovely hostsGreat area too, easy to get to and plenty to eat locally. The availability of tea and coffee in the lobby area was very kind and there are many thoughtful touches throughout the place. Beautiful big handsome brownstone building too!
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Caliope room and it was the highlight of our American trip.. The hosts were friendly and helpful. The room was spotless and everything felt luxurious. Great coffee downstairs too! The guesthouse was also in a great location in Harlem and easy to get to the subway and downtown. We highly recommend this property for a New York vacation experience!
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My accommodation search was lengthy. I put real work into finding the perfect cost effective location, and this spot gets a total 10/10 thumbs up. You can't fault the facilities or James and Frank for their hospitality. The photos are accurate, comfortable, clean lodgings for a superb stay, with it's beautiful brown stone fronting. Harlem is a good location for transport into the city, where the subway is about 15 minutes to Times Square. I would highly recommend this spot for your stay.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just completed a fabulous week at 255W 132nd St. Frank and James are welcoming but unobtrusive hosts who provide the most wonderful place to stay. As other reviewers have noted, don't be put off by the past reputation of the area. It is not intimidating and many of the local folk are very friendly. The subway service to downtown is efficient and the subway station is an easy walk away. There are also some good places to eat nearby. A bonus for some guests will be the large laundromat just around the corner. We had the Lilly room, with a comfy bed and a marvellous bathroom, and a fully equipped kitchen if required. The rooms are spotlessly clean and neat, and the building itself has been carefully restored. It really did feel as though we spent a week living like the locals do, and we won't hesitate to stay at 255 in future.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely place to stay, the hosts, Frank and James are very accommodating and provided us with local info when we arrived. Other than that they stayed out of the way but were available via phone or a knock on their door. On our departure day we had a late flight out and we were able to leave our luggage downstairs. We were given a key to come and pick the luggage up at our time. There are some nice places to eat and drink around 132nd Street, Corner Social, red Rooster and many more. If you are staying more than 3-4 days and plan to travel to Downtown then get a 7 day metro pass. From the guesthouse there are a couple of metro stops no more than 10 mins away and downtown is about 25-30 min ride.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in New York for job interviews and had the opportunity to stay at 255Wesr guesthouse. The room was decorated in a lovely way, and was very clean. I would highly recommend staying here. It is locating near a subway station and so it is easy to get downtown. Will definitely stay here again
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a wonderful little place off the beaten path that had the feeling of home. The space was quiet, immaculate, and cozy. The pictures don't do it justice. You will feel at ease here. The rooms are as pictured, both modern and classic at the same time. The owner was very responsive and met you to give you a walk through personally! Staying on the third floor, I loved the access to the full kitchen. I was able to make my own breakfasts and dinner, saving me $$. This place is well worth a look, especially if you enjoy something different than the well-worn hotel experience.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Gino room was just like the picture. The finishes in the room are very nice and the room was clean. They provide coffee and tea in the morning with to-go cups if you need it. Easy to get to the trains. We would stay again.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great guesthouse! We loved our stay at 255West Guesthouse. James & Frank were most accommodating and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. We stayed in the Gino Room, which was most tastefully decorated. Bed was extremely comfortable, and lovely to have a fridge in the room. Coffee and tea always available in the reception area. great access to the New York Subway, and only a couple of stops away from Time Square! The neighbourhood also very quite, Without a doubt, we will stay at 255West Guesthouse again!
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we got off the subway I was intimidated by the neighborhood -it's rough on the edges. We got used to it to some degree and never truly felt in danger. We found a great restaurant as well as a Cafe (Hyacinth’s Haven & Double Dutch Brothers Coffee) and saw plenty of other places we would of loved to try if time allowed. The house and room were comfortable & stylish. Near subway, location was practical. We had warm weather and slept with the windows open so we heard all sorts of sounds throughout the night -horns, arguments, yelling, etc. This we also got used to but be aware if you're a light sleeper.
hotelName:
31    255West Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited NYC last June so i should have got around to writing this earlier (sorry Frank). While it's true that staying in Harlem would not be as central as some would like, consider that you will get to see a side of NYC that you might otherwise have overlooked. A walk through the neighbourhood offers an authentic slice of New York and despite the fact that it exposes you to the reality of social deprivation much more so than the glossy, touristy areas (like in any major city) I found the locals respectful and courteous and I did not feel unsafe. The guesthouse itself is stunning. Tastefully decorated with an air of vintage charm blended with the grandiose. There's none of the self-conscious, feeling like you're in someone's house thing that can sometimes happen in British guesthouses, New Yorkers tend to have the same privacy sensibilities as Londoners and I only really saw Frank if I needed something. I had a wonderful time and I thoroughly recommend this charming guesthouse.

review_body: We absolutely loved it here! The house is so beautifully designed. The location is perfect, close to the train and shops but tucked away on a quiet street. Thank you so much for making us feel at home. Frank and James are wonderful hosts and we can't wait to visit again!

review_body: We stayed 4 days. The room was very nice and clean, the bathroom big and confortable. The location is strategic, since it is very close to 4-5 metro strations and 2 stops away from time square (with the express lines). Only one lack: the small stairs up to the second floor (with the big luggage it has been really hard to climb it up).

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights during our stay in New York. The place is would seem far from downtown but it's merely 25 minutes away by subway. The queen room we chose was very nicely decorated with a beautiful bathroom with bathtub. The owners are very welcoming and there is free coffee downstairs.The only drawback is that there is not a very good choice of restaurants around.A very good option to stay in New York.

review_body: This guesthouse is perfekt for families, single travelers and couples. The beds are very comfortable, very nice bathroom and the interior is amazing! Very quiet! You have a 5-10 min walk to both the blue and the red subway and approx 15-20 min ride to Time Square. A supermarket around the corner. You can also find different places in the surroundings to eat breaky, lunch or dinner. I can really recommend this hotel!! We loved it and will absolutely stay there again!!

review_body: Stayed for four nights, hosts charming - room lovely and much bigger than the chains a bit further in. Fast wifi in the rooms with tea and coffee in the lounge area. If you have a look at the zip code and see Harlem - don't worry it is perfectly safe and about 20 mins walk from the top of Central Park or 7 mins from the metro. We would happily stay here again.
